text: Kameron just helped us tonight and he was rude and disrespectful to us. They got our order wrong when I ordered a ham and cheese sandwich but they put turkey so we pointed it out to him and he argued with us saying he read back the order to us but he didn't and didn't bother asking if there was anything else we would like to order when we wanted to add items to our order. When he gave the sandwich back to the girl making the food instead of remaking the sandwich we watched her just take the turkey off and put ham and cheese on the original sandwich she had made. I won't be coming back to this location because of the service we just revived. I will also be filing a formal complaint with corporate regarding the disrespect we recived. I have been in customer service for a very long time and would be fired on the spot if treated any clients the way we were treated tonight.
name: eegee's
categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Food

text:
I went to the restaurant when I was on a business trip in Tucson based on a recommendation of a local who said it was the "best" Mexican restaurant in town. In my opinion it is not. 

The exterior of the restaurant looks nice but the inside is pretty basic. The chips and salsa were average. The wait staff were nice enough and somewhat attentive, but slow. 

The main event of course was the food. I was in a rush and ordered a beef  taco and an enchilada (boring I know). Obviously, these are not the most complex dishes to do well. Unfortunately, they were not and fell into the mediocre category. Both tasted like pabulum and frankly it reminded me of Taco Bell.  There was no flavor in either dish. 

I was really disappointed, paid and rushed out. Would I go back? No.
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Owner tends to let the place get pretty warm inside before closing the front door and turning on the AC. I can't imagine how the folks working there must feel...  If ya pull up on a warm day and see the front door open, well, you know what to expect.
name: Sunrise Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Greek, Coffee & Tea

text: This review is for service only, not the food.  I love Blake's crushed ice...I know that's a strange thing to love, but it's true.  I am even willing to wait in the drive through line for just a soda!  And that's what I did yesterday, but wow, I wish I hadn't.  There was only one car in front of me, so it shouldn't have been that long of a wait.  Wrong!  After placing my order and then finally making it to the window (10 minutes), no one came to the window for another 5, and when they did, they had to ask me what I had ordered again.  When I told them, it took another 5 for them to make the soda and get it for me.  And another 3 to get my change.  Pretty ridiculous wait for a soda.  Get it together Blake's!
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text:
Yum! I'm so happy we stopped here. 
Made a quick stop from tour de America to have lunch. I got the vegetarian burro (which was a big burrito) and I asked for potatoes in it. Oh man, so good! They're tortillas are homemade and so delicious. 
I'm constantly eating mexican food.  I think burritos should be apart of the main food groups. This place has one of the best burritos I have ever had. Ever. 
I also tried the horchata which I also really enjoyed. Not too sweet, not too watered down. 
The woman behind the counter was very helpful and willing to answer questions. 
If I lived in the area I would be here all the time!
I would rate this a 5 star, but usually I leave that up to consistency.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Paradise is changing to Panera, and the changes I have seen make me not want to come back...not taking/giving points on the Paradise loyalty cards, not having the peach or mango tea anymore, changing to Pepsi products:(  and not even having Diet DR.Pepper.  I even tried to call the customer# on the receipt, and the store location #2870 Tucson, does not work.  I am very dissatisfied with the recent changes and I will not return.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: Absolutely love this place! I have the cast iron shrimp cocktail appetizer and mezquite seared ahi tostada and loved the food. Great atmosphere with local spirits available at the bar (there are two of them). The staff could not have been more attentive to my wife and I. We will be coming back for steak next time!
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Walked in and every customer was speaking Chinese and classic Chinese pop songs playing... I knew that I was going to find some food I could get excited about. We had some really amazing food that made me nostalgic for my years in China and Taiwan. The service was friendly.  My bf wasn't as impressed as I was, so I can't tell how clouded I was with joy for finding some favorites.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: Excellent oriental buffet includes food selected for grilling, a LARGE array of prepared dishes, chicken wings, sushi, edamame, salads, deserts, and more. We were in from Phoenix and we found a VERY favorite place to eat whenever we stay or drive through Tucson.  Well done New Town!!
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text: Went here for dinner on 10/9/2014 with a party of 6. Food was good and service was excellent. A great long standing place on 4th Ave in Tucson.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Would have given it a 5 but their prices are a bit steep-$8.50 for a red chile fry bread taco. Quality and taste are excellent! Love having this spot on the west side! Welcome to the neighborhood!
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: What makes this place are the team of employees that work there.  Debbie is the absolute best.  She makes you feel like family or a close friend.  Personable and efficient!  I'm a businessowner and I hope their corporate management values  her and the top notch service that she delivers.  Also, Laurie in the Liquor department, is great!  Very personable and knowledgable about their selections.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: They have the BEST cinnamon rolls. My mom and I used to go here for breakfast all the time when I was in high school and I still consider this to be one of the best bakeries in town. Their sourdough and ciabatta is amazing as well as the asiago black pepper bread! Also, whenever I get breakfast, I order a side of bacon, because it MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH. I do love some of the other bakeries in town but NO ONE has better cinnamon rolls...NO ONE.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Everyone talks about Eegee's so we saw one and popped in. The sandwiches were meh, the ice was meh, the place was dirty, and the staff was not friendly. I wouldn't stop at this Eegee's or another one ever again.
name: eegee's
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text:
We love this place!  The food is great, portion sizes are ample, and easily shareable if you don't want to overspend/overeat.  Top if off with their pastry, and mimosas and you've got a great breakfast joint!

You can expect to wait for at least 20 minutes on most weekends, however, and there isn't a lot of room to do that inside the restaurant.  That said, this place is worth the wait!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Street Taco & Beer Co was a more hip, upscale Qdoba (not to mention better prices). I got a street style Al Pastor Burrito (comes with rice, beans, onion & cilantro). It was huge, I actually wrapped up the other half to take home. You can choose between Gringo or Street Style. The staff was friendly and quick. They have amazing chips and salsas (for free!) up for grabs after you order. Overall, a fun and practical location for lunch in Downtown Tucson!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: The food had way to much salt but for the most part it was alright.The customer service was amazing our waiter was extremely nice and made sure we had everything we needed.
name: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill
categories: Buffets, Restaurants, American (New), American (Traditional)

text: Unique cuisine done with a contemporary feel. The restaurant is beautiful. I loved the roasted corn and poblano brûlée.
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text:
Why oh why do I keep stopping here?  Because it is almost  literally the only place around here!  

It doesn't matter if I go through the drive up or go in -  there is usually a line!  This McDonald's is in for big trouble if another business ever comes out here!  

Today we went inside because being the 4th of July, the Queen Donuts was closed.  We just wanted a quick breakfast. 

The food is standard McDonald's fare, usually the iced coffee is what I stop for.  It can be really good.  Today they put so much vanilla in it - it was white.  A bit (!) too sweet today.

Please note that fast food is not fast at this McDonald's.   I don't even know why.  There were 8 people working (that I could see).  Maybe there is a more efficient way they could do things?  Seems like 8 would be enough....but I have never worked in a restaurant,  so I don't know if 8 is enough!

It gets 1 star for being here when you are desperate!
name: McDonald's
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Burgers, Food, Coffee & Tea

text: Best Mexican food I have ever had. Hands down. I had the carne asada tacos two days in a row. Very friendly waitstaff. I highly recommend this place.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: I took my mom, sister, and niece here for dinner and we all enjoyed ourselves. The waiter chatted with us, gave menu recommendations, and was funny. I liked the atmosphere and local art they hung on the walls. I'd go back
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text:
We had taken our family here last night. I had been on a business trip and promised my toddler we would go.
We arrived at 7:45pm
Ordered a large wings platter to snack on.
Wings arrived at our table at 8:20pm and were ordered at 7:52pm
Purchased 80 tokens for $20.
The place was in good working order.
My 2 year olds birthday is this week , so although I was hoping for Chuck E Cheese, I knew there might be a chance that we didn't get to see him.
At 8:25pm they announced that Chuck E would be out in 5 minutes. 
I was thrilled.  Kids gathered around the place where he dances waiting for him.
He never came. 
The place had quite a few kids who would have really enjoyed the Chuck E dance.
Not sure why they wouldn't bring him out as scheduled.
name: Chuck E. Cheese
categories: Pizza, Arcades, American (Traditional), Arts & Entertainment, Restaurants, Indoor Playcentre, Active Life

text:
First time at this place and it didn't disappointed.
My kids brought me here for Father's Day as we wanted to try a different Authentic Mexican Restaurant.
Glad they did as all food we ordered was delicious and tasty. I loved the home made corn tortillas, made fresh from scratch. Salsa and chips were also very good.
I definitely recommend this place. 
I now have this restaurant in the top of my best Authentic Mexican Restaurants in Tucson and Phoenix!
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
Mae's just opened, and I hope they do well in this difficult spot. The last restaurant here didn't last a whole year. After noticing they had finally opened, I stopped into Mae's for lunch, and I'm glad I did. It's a cozy restaurant with an unusual choice of decor, but it's friendly and the menu is basically exactly what you'd expect from a Chinese restaurant -- complete with a $7-$8 lunch menu.

I ordered the Kung Pao Chicken lunch, which came with soup, egg roll, and fried rice. The hot and sour soup was mild but tasty (it could have used a little more bite, but my tastebuds are damaged and it might be hotter than I thought). The egg roll was huge, compared to the standard "lunch-side egg roll".

My entree was pretty large, with big chunks of chicken and no shortage of water chestnuts, peanuts, and peppers. Like the soup, I thought it could have been spicier. But I'm also a spicy food junkie. I was really pleased with the size of the lunch portion, and could easily have taken some home for later (but I overate instead).

The sole issue is that service was slightly slow, and I think that's just a new-restaurant issue. I'm looking forward to coming back here, as it's now the closest Chinese food to home, and is much better than the place across the intersection. It's nice to have another good option for lunch on the East side.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Had 3 tacos in flour tortillas. Went with Pastor, Carnitas, and Shredded Beef. It comes with cilantro and onion. I added sour cream and grilled jalepeno. The meat was delicious. Overall rally tasty. The whole place is like the chipotle model. I would gladly eat here again.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Excellent breakfast/brunch spot in Tucson. Menu consists of various pastries (croissants, Danishes, scones, etc.), pancakes, egg dishes, etc as well as an extensive drink list (specialty mimosas, teas, coffees). This morning I ordered the fruit granola parfait which consisted of a large serving of organic vanilla yogurt smothered in fruits (blackberries, apples, strawberries, raisins, cranberries) and nuts (pine nuts, almonds). I ordered a side of walnut bread which came with fresh whipped butter and fresh jam on the side. It was delicious. My sister ordered two eggs with homefries and toast which she enjoyed and finished the whole plate. Perhaps the best part of the meal was the freshly squeezed orange juice- the freshest and tastiest I have ever had. Coffees and waters were continually refreshed. They really aced it.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I go here for the iced coffee. Probably the best in town, great flavor and smooth!! Also their deli has some delicious food and oven fired pizza. Their deserts are also amazing. I wouldn't ever buy groceries here as they are EXTREMELY overpriced and owned by the same company as Albertsons and food city, so I'll go there. The staff is always friendly and they have great catering dishes.

categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: So upset. We decided to try Caruso's because they have a sign that says pizza pie. We asked the waitress if the pizza is a true pizza pie with thick crust like Chicago style. I even showed her with my hand how thick the crust should be( around 5 inches) she assured us that there pizza was like Chicago style, so we ordered one. Not only was it not thick crust it was like cracker thin hard like that of cardboard crust. I asked her about and all she said is it depends on the cook. The pizza was awful, she never apologized or offered something else. I will never be back.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: It's a very small restaurant with very friendly service. We came on a Sunday morning and it was packed with customers. Fortunately we didn't have to wait very long to get our table. text:
The food here is good, not great.  It is very busy during brunch, if you arrive around 1 pm you should have no problem getting a seat in short order.  I ordered the Monte Cristo sandwich, I did appreciate the french toast for the bread but the ham was a standard supermarket lunchmeat.  My dining partner had the breakfast sammy and was happy with his choice.
If you use the Yelp app to secure a place in line, you will check in with the hostess at the time requested and should still have another 20+ minute wait.  Not as reliable as an open table reservation but thankfully they have the option.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We came with the meetup.com group and the service for our table was fast, very professional and courteous - they were swift with the small plates entrees and removal- the food was so so good! Try the scallops or the frogs legs! Oh my they're lovely ! The French onion soup was lovely and flavorful and lots of cheese! Please come to this place! It's mid priced- parking is very tight- come early or drive a small car!
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text:
They moved out to Catalina and Tanque Verde. Eaten many times- from burger, broiled fish, to steak.
Consistently delicious ribeye! Fish (broiled) is delicious and the beer battered sandwich is great- a lot of food. Sides are good, except side salad is iceberg and tiny. My hubby loves the pineapple coleslaw!
Fair/ good service- in that department they have slipped some.
Prices are good for amount of food and comparable with other steak places. It's good for a family or friends dinner out.
Lunch specials are good.
name: Great American Steakburger
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Bars, Steakhouses, Burgers

text:
Street is an excellent build-your-own burrito/taco/etc bar that also serves a wide variety of alcoholic beverages, all great complements to their food options. Its already been said, but Street reminds me of the perfect Chipotle-style restaurant I always envision, but have never been able find.. until now. 

Street shines not only because of the fresh quality of the food, but also because the food is legitimately Sonoran-style Mexican. Refried beans, spanish fried rice, street corn, al pastor, and queso fresco, all ingredients I've longed for in burrito-babies and bowls of yesteryear. 

The price is literally no different than Chipotle (actually cheaper depending on your choice), yet the food feels real, it feels like Tucson. $7 will get you any burrito with your choice of meat, beans, and rice along with accompanying garnishes.

Some of their drinks may be a little steep, but in my experience $7 for a good Michelada is not unheard of. The margaritas are excellent, and who doesn't like a good variety of beer with their tacos. Chips and salsa are also complimentary, self-serve as a matter of fact. 

Overall:
If you're looking for high quality, fast/casual Mexican food in the downtown area, look no further. In my humble opinion, it's worth parking for. Don't pass up Street, you won't be disappointed.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Prep and Pastry is just okay... a lot of hype-- good food ( not great) We will have to give I a another try-- maybe picked the wrong day--noticed it was noisy to a fault

text:
0.5 stars. 

On a truly sad day, an Indian friend and I (both of whom are from Tucson) decided we had an Indian restaurant craving (which would thus not be satisfied by our Tucson Indian moms' cooking). We literally walked into Sher-E-Punjab, were given a table, walked up to the buffet, looked at each other with agreeing shakes of the head, and walked straight out. And this is despite our expectations being low to begin with, since I have eaten at Sher before and already know that it's a pretty underwhelming experience.

text:
I was impressed with the selection and fresh quality of the food choices.  The servers were very attentive and the staff were well trained in providing quality food and cleanliness to their guests.  Come hungry and enjoy a good quality meal at a reasonable price.  

For a buffet restaurant, I was very impressed.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text:
I'd heard good things about this place, but never eaten here, although my parents always stay in this Sheraton when they visit. I figured it would be an easy meal for us on their last night in town. 

Potentially one of the most underwhelming experiences I've ever had. The server gave the distinct impression that she'd rather be anywhere else in the world, and that we were sort of an annoying imposition on her time. The menu was short; there was very little to choose from, hardly anything for vegetarians. The enchiladas couldn't be be made vegetarian because they were "rolled in the morning." The children's menu was unavailable (although the server recited it for the kids), as was the pizza menu, because they were being reprinted. The server couldn't recite the available pizza toppings, but claimed they had "anything you'd put on a pizza." When my father asked for his favorite toppings, they were not available. 

I ordered the salmon which was middling, nothing special. It was a small piece of fish drowned in an overly sweet sauce. The rice was edible, but sort of looked like it had been sitting around. Neither of these foods gave the impression of being very fresh, although the grilled vegetables were. At $20, it felt WAY overpriced. 

My mother ordered sweet pototo rellenos and didn't like them at all. It was just chiles, cubed sweet potatoes, and a bit of cheese, not really a relleno at all. 

My father got the pizza, and if it wasn't the worst pizza I've ever tasted, it was pretty close. I've had better pizza at the bowling alley. The crust was like a piece of soft bread. The ingredients did not scream "high-quality." This pizza made me yearn for the frozen generic pizza in the grocery freezer case.

The kids liked their meals. My stepson had chicken fingers, which were pretty run-of-the-mill, and onion rings, which were probably the best item we ate that night. The onions were sliced to a good size and the breading was crispy, although it had a strange, bitter aftertaste. I'm guessing this food was frozen.

My stepdaughter loved her macaroni, which isn't saying much. It looked like last week's leftovers and when my stepson tasted it, he said it tasted like it had been in the microwave. She was told the fruit side would be watermelon and strawberries, but there wasn't much in the way of strawberries, and the whole dish had the taste and appearance of something that had been sitting in the back of the fridge all week with discolored watermelon chunks and tiny random bits of other fruit swimming in the juice at the bottom.

Basically, nothing looked or tasted fresh. This place isn't doing much for the reputation of southwestern cuisine.

Also, our waitress disappeared after checking in on us once. (She was most likely not busy with other tables, as we were the only people in the section, and possibly the restaurant by that time.) Ten minutes after we finished eating, my mother had to get up and hunt her down to ask her for the check. 

Might give the place another chance if/when they revamp their menu but at not running.
name: Fire + Spice Tucson
categories: Mexican, Tex-Mex, Restaurants

text: This is a place is great for take out. At work we tend to get it on paydays. Their Squid Salad is awesome and the specials are filling. Lunch time specials are at a great price most not more than $6. Sushi is a bit on the pricier side but to be able to bring it to work and eat it, it all hits the spot.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: This place is phenomenal.  The food quality is unparalleled and for the most part the service is awesome.  The pastries - quite simply incomparable!  Kudos to Vin who is, I believe, the manager.  He takes the meaning of customer service and satisfaction to heart in everything he does.  I cannot recommend this establishment strongly enough.  There will be a wait on occasion but anything this good is sooooo worth waiting for.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I heard about this place opening and finally got a chance to try it last night.  It's a lot bigger than I expected so at 7pm we were able to get seated right away.  The ambiance is cool.  They have a high top "bar" with a fire pit in the middle.  There are a couple couch seating areas and a lot of 4 tops.   

Started off with drinks.   I think the bar was slammed from a big party they had there so they took a wee bit to get them.  The rosemary honey cocktail and the pulpa margarita were sweet and tasty.

We wanted to try a good selection of authentic dishes so we went tapas style.  The dough god trio was wonderful especially the calabacitas.  Also had the Tostadas de Jaiba and that was the best thing I had.  Authentic crab in a killer cilantro aioli sauce.  If they made a bigger entree version of this it would be awesome.  Also tried the Potato nachos which were slices of potato fried covered with yummy cheese sauce.  Not the typical nachos and that was a pleasant surprise.

Had to try the fry bread dessert, I guess my expectation from street fairs etc was too much.  It was the only thing that was so so.  Otherwise I will for sure go back there and try other things on the menu.   Service was wonderful and attentive.

Nicely done guys.
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text: the food here was good has a nice entrance and plenty of parking. the place is pretty clean and most everyone was friendly big open area and way nice less ghetto than the other casino Desert Diamond near by. The bathrooms were super clean.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text:
Farm fresh food, friendly service.
This place wowed me from the moment I walked in. Cute industrial/farmhouse decor. We opted to sit inside, but their outdoor seating is nice as well. Especially since the weather is nice, and it is next door to a lovely antique shop. :)

My friend and I  both ordered the corned beef hash w/ gnocci and sweet potato puree. This definitely isn't the kind that comes from a can!  It was DELICIOUS! Soft and succulent corned beef accompanied by deep fried gnocci.  It also came mixed w/ Brussels Sprouts, and a perfectly cooked egg. The sweet potato puree perfectly balanced out the saltiness of the corned beef. I already dream about going back! Maybe tomorrow?! Haha. My other friend ordered the Pork Belly Beni. Beni, as in eggs Benedict. It came on a decadent cheese biscuit. I tasted it, and loved it as well. We will definitely be back soon! 

Service was friendly and helpful.  He was attentive, but not annoyingly so. My friend and I wanted to order some pastries to go, but were worried that they would sell out of the kind we wanted. Our server was nice enough to box up a croissant and coconut lime dossant (a.k.a. cronut) for us. Good thing he did, b/c when we left, we passed by the pastry counter, and they were sold out! :)
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: My cousin brought me and my family here. We are visiting from California.  Good food and excellent service. We will definitely be back next time we visit Arizona.
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text: I bought gift cards from Costco at a 20% discount.  Great right.  After two ridiculously terrible visits, including hard boiled eggs on our Benedict's (twice).  I gave the remaining gift cards away.   We did go on both Saturday and Sunday mornings, so you can read that either way.  Either my bad for picking a busy time or theirs for not being able to handle it.  No third strike for me, this place is way, way overrated.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I have only been there once and even though I really like the style, decor and everything, the food and choices offered definitely had some room for improvement. 
They did not have other options to whole milk and not many pastry options.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I love love love the small Italian cafe feel that this place radiates. Our waiter had an accent and was very generous, made us feel like family at the table. The food was even better than the service, both my husband and I devoured every thing - especially the garlic bread. So many delicious options from appetizers to entrees to wine!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
I returned to Paradise Bakery & Cafe to give them another shot and, boy, am I glad I did!

A colleague and I hopped on over to Paradise during our lunch break. We were greeted by an employee the moment we walked in the door, which made us feel quite welcomed! There were a few people in front of us in line, but the line moved very quickly! We placed our order and found a table (it was pretty crowed at lunch time, but there was still plenty of seating). 

We chatted while we waited for our lunch. When our food arrived, I was definitely impressed with it (which made up for the last not-so-stellar lunch order I placed)! 

I, again, tried the "Pick 2" combo, but this time, I order a half Chipotle Chicken Panini (chicken, applewood-smoked bacon, cheddar, tomatoes, & ancho chile spread) and a cup of French Onion Soup. The Panini was DELICIOUS!! It was warm and just gooey enough! The ancho chile spread was served in a small cup on the side and was so tasty--perfect for dipping! The French Onion soup was also delicious! They used small croutons, rather than one large slice of bread, which made the soup so much easier to eat! The flavor was rich, and the croutons were just crunchy enough after sitting in the soup for awhile! There wasn't a ton of cheese on the soup, but I wasn't missing it. Of course, their decadent chocolate chip cookies ended the meal, though mine was a little crispier than I would have liked! :)

I am glad that I gave Paradise another shot and will definitely return in the future!
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text:
Dope. Got three tacos. Asada, Pollo Asada, Carnits. They have two styles, "gringo" and "street". Um if you ordered your taco with a flower tortilla, you should get the gringo toppings because you've already ruined your taco. I got corn and street which is traditional.

Anyway, they were great! Between $2.50-$3 per taco.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Fantastic Tucson food truck!!...Pablo Diablo is one of the best sandwiches I've put in my mouth!..Patty melt on Texas toast grilled with America cheese, avocado, sautéed jalapeños & onion!..Add the hatch green chile sauce and this sandwich will blow your mind!!..Don't wait!..Find out where they are and go get some awesome food!!
name: Burgerrito
categories: Food, Restaurants, Mexican, Food Trucks

text: 6/14/2017 - The Campbell location is CLOSED for renovations. Wish I had know before we drove clear across town. Be nice if they put it on their website, but I guess I expect too much.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: A welcome addition to the growing number of excellent dining options on the east side of the city. This small neighborhood restaurant, located on the southwest corner of Speedway and Camino Seco, offers a limited but carefully selected menu consisting of a selection of appetizers, Asian-style salads, main dishes, noodles, and a variety of sushi and sashimi options. A number of combination plates are available Monday through Friday from 11 a.m. until 5 p.m. I had the salmon teriyaki with the chef's seaweed salad (try it, you'll like it) for $8.95 and it was absolutely delicious. Everything is obviously freshly prepared and the prices are reasonable. Well worth a visit if you live nearby - or even if you have to drive a few miles. Note that you have to enter the small complex housing the restaurant from the south side of Speedway.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: One of the best brunch spots in town. Amazing pancakes, skillets, and coffee. The grilled cheese with tomato soup is really amazing too. The only thing that kind of sucks about this place is it's usually really packed and a long wait. If you go early or late it's usually not too bad though. The servers are also really nice and attentive which is a plus. Highly recommend prep and pastry
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Refreshing atmosphere. Excellent food! Fresh, delicious, flavorful, and a good quantity. I selected a duck confit with eggs lunch dish. The duck was tender and flavorful and the dollop of cabernet goat cheese was the, "icing on top" of a very creative dish. It also included potatoes, dried fig, and spinach.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: My husband & I came here for dinner one evening.  The decor is nice & I like the blue Dolphins on the wall.  It's a new place on Golf links & we decided to give it a try.  We ordered the large egg drop soup, kung pao chicken, & barbecue lo mien.  The soup had hardly any taste to it.  It tasted like hot water seasoned with salt & pepper with bits of eggs & a few green peas thrown into it.  Kung pao chicken had too much oil in it & lots of peanuts, but only a few pieces of chicken & veggie.  Also, the barbecue lo mien was not good at all.  It was greasy & tasteless with a few pieces of barbecue meat & few strands of beansprouts.  The server was nice, but the food came out very quickly, which is not a good sign.  Food must have been precooked.   We are not sure if we want to give this another chance.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: I just moved here and have been a Chinese food lover for ever. I have had some bad chinese food, but these people messed up Wanton Soup, Egg Foo Young, Orange Chicken and they even messed up the crispy noodles. This is by far not even what I would call Chinese, maybe slop. I could make better food  and probably should have tried but my cookware was still packed. I just threw $60. out the window, please save your Money. Heed my warning and don't waste a dime here. Horrible. I threw it all out.
name: May Flower Chinese Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: The lunch buffet is a decent deal. It's about $9/$10 for a variety of food. Not the biggest variety tho, so don't expect to have a taste of India on your hands. The chicken curry is pretty good and is usually standard at the buffet. However, the samosas were AMAZING. Probably one of the best I've ever had. I had to stop myself at number *insert ridiculous amount here*. Stay away from the desserts though. Especially the doughnut hole looking thing. Trust me.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: You get what you pay for. Shrimp and vegetable tempura means you get 1 shrimp. Lol. Just FYI.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: Lamb curry was good, the medium heat had the perfect amount of spice for me. Vegetable samosa was delicious and crispy. Loved the rice
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Very cool little spot downtown that's easy to miss.  It's a great place to meet up with friends downtown, but can get packed in the evenings.  A variety of menu items are available similar to Chipotle.  Their street tacos are very good.  The bar is separate from the food so you can either come in for a quick bite or meet up at the bar.  Would recommend a visit, especially if you are in the area.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Pretty nice set up at this Casino. I like how they have different rooms with walk ways through each one. Different types of tables in multiple areas so you are not just stuck in the middle of a giant room with slot machines. They had a live band playing and the music was very good. The crowd around the band and bar was pretty filled up. Soda and water are comped for all people, alcohol is not. Smoking is allowed everywhere except bathrooms. It's very cool how the high roller room is separated with glass and a bit more quiet in their. Food and gift shops are sprinkled throughout the walk ways along with a buffet that I've heard is very good. Parking was a little hectic because they are redoing half their parking so we had to make a few loops around the parking lot until we found someone leaving to get their spot. I think this one is the best Casino in the Tucson area for gaming and tables. Was on a nice run on the Black Jack tables for over 2 hours until the infamous change up occurred and a different dealer came into the rotation and changed the vibes at the table. Still walked off with a nice stack of Casino money $$$. Will return here and check out the hotel along with the buffet next time.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: I love stopping by Street Tacos before and after shows at the Fox Theater. The meats are too yummy, all of them. I like that you get your choice of corn or flour tortillas. It does get busy but that's because it's so good.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I finally found great Chinese food in Tucson/Marana. I am extremely picky (that's what my husband says anyway) so it's pretty hard to please me. I got chicken and vegetables in a ginger garlic sauce. The vegetables were carrots, bok choy, broccoli, shitake mushrooms, yellow squash. The sticky rice was cooked perfectly. There was a lot of big chunks of white meat chicken in the dish. It lasted me about 3-4 meals.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: One word..... Awesome! Great ambiance &  fantastic food. It's a hidden gem. Tucked away off the college circle,  romantic and sweet.
name: Beer Garden At Reilly Craft Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Beer Gardens

text:
While visiting Tucson, I found myself in the mood for noodles (a common phenomenon in my case). I was pleasantly surprised to find Kung Fu Noodles highly rated by Yelpers. With the "Kung Fu" name,  I was fairly skeptical, expecting a generic takeout Chinese restaurant.  Well,  don't let the name fool you! This place is legit! The often recommended beef noodle soup ("Kung fu beef noodle") is solid.  Fairly spicy. Noodles are good and supposedly handmade, which I believe.  Also had the water boiled fish,  one of my go to spicy dishes,  and the rendition here is decent.  I've had better at dedicated szechuan restaurants,  but this one isn't bad.  Ditto for the dry cooked string beans.

Previous reviews described the poor service here,  though I didn't find that to be true. I found the staff to be attentive and prompt, though I was also here at 5pm on a Friday with most of the restaurant being empty. So your experience may vary.  

Will plan to patronize again when back in Tucson!
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: I was in Tucson so I figured I'd find a place with more traditional mexican foods than the americanized places all over town. They had quite an extensive menu but I was feeling like some tacos. There were a lot of choices, so I selected one of each. I got 2 hard tacos, chicken and beef, and 2 soft tacos, shrimp and fish. The fish was pretty lackluster. It was plain grilled fish with absolutely no flavor at all. Beef and chicken were good though the beef was a little dry, the chicken the better of the two being tender and juicy. The shrimp in my opinion was the best. Not sure what they did with it but it was fresh, yummy, and awesome. If you like it spicy there are tons of hot sauce bottles on the table.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: We've been to Growler's several times and enjoyed our visits, however, tonight's (11/8) service was atrocious. We waited to be sat at a table and one of the servers pointed at one for us to sit at. We sat at that table and waited for someone to stop by and at least bring us some waters. It was not too busy and there were several open tables and chairs around, but the the servers looked stressed out and unable to multitask. The servers walked by us several times making eye contact with us, but never spoke with us or even welcomed us. A large table next to us was a mess and never cleared after other guests left. We ended up waiting for 15 minutes and still, non of the servers stopped by to welcome us or take out order. So we decided to leave. I let one of the servers know that we were leaving because no one helped on us at all. They responded as if we just walked in and took a table but I explained what happened. They said they would send someone to help us. I told them it was too late and we left. I'm very disappointed as I like Growler's and tell my friends about what a great place it is. Tonight was anything but great. Had it not been for the previous visits, this would be a one star review.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: If I could give negative stars I would do so for this hotel. I read other reviews and thought it would be a nice spot to stay in Tucson. They were also offering a spa package, which was a plus. I booked 2 nights in order to get the spa package. When I arrived I was told my room wasn't ready, so I went to the casino and played some slots (which were so tight as to be almost comedic). I finally got up to the 7th floor where my room was, and when I opened the door thought I was walking into a giant ashtray. The hallways reeked, but I thought maybe the rooms would be better. They are not. You cannot open a window either, not even a crack, to emit fresh air. The AC itself was merrily blowing a nonstop stream of what appeared to be straight cigarette smoke. I shut it off completely. When I called down to the front desk I was treated rudely, and I informed them there was NO way I could stay 2 nights in the giant ashtray room. I'm now waiting to see if they charge me for the spa that I am also not going to be able to go to.  The room was also nasty and dirty. For your pleasure I snapped a couple of pictures. The beds smelled as though the previous occupants bathed in Drakkor Noir. The cherry on top was at 03:30 an impassioned Mexican couple in the room next to mine had sex for 2 hours. I learned Spanish words I had never even heard before. How this glorified Holiday Inn ever got "4 stars" is beyond me. It's reeks, is filthy and the staff is rude.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text:
We had a group of eleven and were told, that they would only honor two glasses of free wine "per table." We occupied five tables put together. Nope, two glasses only for the entire group. How much money did you make off that table, Le Rendez-vous?? Was it worth annoying half the group? Unfortunately for the server, the non-free glasses came out of her tip. 
Service was somewhat friendlier than during previous visits, but slow. The reservation for our group had been made weeks in advance, yet they seemed understaffed. 
Food, as before, was outstanding. I wish, they would fix their service.
If you want both in Tucson, Feast still wins, hands down.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: Two takeout dishes, chicken tikka and palak lamb, both ordered extra spicy.  Lamb dish was very nice, but the chicken dish had zero spiciness.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: My 8-year-old and I visited Street on a recent evening, having heard a ton of buzz about the high quality of the food.  We were not disappointed.  The presentation and choices were excellent.  My daughter chose carnitas tacos; quoting her, "this meat is so delicious and it's just falling apart in my mouth!"  I opted for one each of the pollo asado and carne asada.  The tortillas were super fresh, the portions generous, and the fixings more than adequate.  Bonus points for the salsa bar with a nice variety of options, from mild to nice and spicy.  Free chips?  BOOM.  The icing on the cake was the beer selection - being an obligate gluten-free diner (thanks a lot, celiac disease...), I usually have to skip beer in restaurants.  NOT AT STREET.  Omission Pilsener in the fridge.  There you have it.  Highly recommended.  Good for families.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Super cute new breakfast spot!  Interesting menu and great vibe inside.  I look forward to trying more of the menu.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: My friend bought an iced coffee and found gross gooey things in it. We will never buy another iced coffee from here again.
name: McDonald's
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Burgers, Food, Coffee & Tea

text: Stopped in with some friends and has a great meal.  Like most, I was a little surprised by the counter style ordering.  Over all the service was great and the food was fantastic.  I got a couple of Tacos with Al Pastor and a couple Carne Asada.  Both were really good.  Grabbed some chips from the salsa bar and some salsa.  They certainly have a wide variety of salsa options.  The chips and a few of the salsas I had were very tasty as well.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I stopped in at Sunrise Cafe this morning, went to the counter, and ordered coffee and a bagel. I was told it would be "just a minute" while they toasted the bagel. I stood and waited there while the counter person kept telling it would only be "just a couple minutes more". After what seemed forever, one of the kitchen personnel walked out. I politely excused myself for interrupting her, but said that I had waited almost half an hour for a toasted bagel. She replied that they were busy. I said that I could understand that, but that it should not take thirty minutes to toast a bagel. Instead of going intro the kitchen to check on my order, she went to the cash register, pulled out the tape, and told me that I had ordered at 9:12 and had only been waiting ten minutes! Since it was past 9:30, I suggested to her that her math was wrong. She replied that I should feel free not to return, walked into the kitchen and returned with the wrapped bagel. The delay was annoying, but her rudeness was unacceptable. I will never go back there.
name: Sunrise Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Greek, Coffee & Tea

text:
I am giving this awesome place four stars (opposed to my prior 5) but I do wish to provide some feedback. My husband and I are raving fans of this place and its owner. The staff has always been kind and accommodating and the restaurant itself serving awesome food and drink. 

We frequent this place at least twice a month if not more and in the last few months things have not been to the standard they usually are. Staff less attentive, sloppy even, it took almost 15 minutes for toast in a relatively slow atmosphere compared to the usual bustle that is Prep. And although the lox plate is out of this world, 2 oz of salmon seems very little for a "Lox" driven plate and when we asked for more of the fish (happy to pay more as well) it took an additional 15 minutes because (as our waiter informed us) it depended on the "chef's mood". 

Again, I want to say we LOVE this place and have a lot of respect for the owner and the staff and for the quality of food we get to eat but lately things have seemed "off" ... I hope this just serves as feedback not empty criticism. 

We'll be back for the lox (maybe a little more on the plate will help )
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Went here for brunch on a Sunday and it was delicious! We ordered mimosas, eggs Benedict, and S'mores french toast. Service was great and the food was amazing.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: My husband and I stayed there for the first time this past weekend. We had an amazing experience. David and I have stayed at several resorts but this was the first resort where we encountered the best customer service by everyone.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: High quality food and good service. The wait can be long, so be sure to arrive early.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Was passing through Tucson on my way to Texas and decided to stop here for brunch. The maple bacon doughssant is what made me want to stop by and have brunch here. Guess it's usually pretty busy for brunch and the wait can be up to an hour but it was just me and luckily when I got to the restaurant there was an open seat at the bar. 

I started off with a mimosa the madras which was amazing. Then went to order the beni with the pork belly. Finished off with more mimosas and jamies michelada and a maple bacon doughssant that was amazing. Would definitely recommend this place for brunch and on my way back home I will definitely be stopping by here again.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I've been to Caruso's and loved it. However the last time I went there was for my birthday last year and the service was horrible. I was expecting a larger group and some people were running late/canceled last minute and we were sitting outside. Our waiter, who was maybe 45, took FOREVER to even take our order. I asked him what was in the "meat" ravioli and he said, "Uh... meat." Yeah no shit. Food took forever, service was poor, food was mediocre. I usually like Caruso's but it just kinda sucked the last time I was there.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Went for my nieces birthday. I really enjoyed how it's spacious enough for the kids to run around in between the arcade. It would be nice if they had more variety, there was a dew machines that won't working that was the downfall. Other than that the pizza was really good a lot more flavorful than peter piper I just thought that the salad bar was a bit pricey and you could only take one trip to the salad bar. I really like how they check you in and out to make sure you're with your correct party.
name: Chuck E. Cheese
categories: Pizza, Arcades, American (Traditional), Arts & Entertainment, Restaurants, Indoor Playcentre, Active Life

text: I like the vibe here better than some of the other breakfast places I've reviewed.  The food was clean, fresh and fast at a very good price.  Only surprise was that they charged me a buck plus for a side of salsa for my eggs.  No problem I just won't order it next time.  Nothing fancy.  Nothing unusual.  Just good.
name: Jerry Bob's On Broadway
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners, Salad

text: Great service, very attentive even though they were busy. I love the Duck dish:)
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This place is amazing! Delicious mimosa's, food and pastries! Best place for breakfast in Tuscon, and you can join waitlist online! Try it, you won't be disappointed!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Had best meal in 10 years. Fantastic service by Chris with as promised best steak in Tucson.  Appetizers were phenomenal.  Definitely will be back, and forgot to mention live music!
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: We've eaten here four times and have really enjoyed the food, the service, the ambience, and the great French 75s!  It is really far for us, but good enough that we keep working on excuses to drive to this end of town, coming up with one right now.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
My Updated Review: I've gone back a few more times and their consistency for good food it on point. I have to say that their fried rice is the best I've ever had, I really can't say what it is about it, but the first bite I instantly knew. I tried their Sesame Beef which is a new favorite item, the sauce is good and the texture was like chicken, not chewy or fatty.

The staff is always nice and friendly, and the service is quick. The price is a little high compared to cheaper places, but you get what you pay for, plus the servings are big.

My First Review: Very good! I just had the Kung Poa Chicken and was the best I've had. I tell like there should have been more chicken, cause there was just enough for me. I used the pepper sauce that was given, it was too oily but added a great kick.  The crab puffs seemed a little to salty but were still good. I ordered takeout, and it was ready in less than 5 minutes; I don't know if that's a good thing. The interior was very clean and the staff was friendly. I can't wait to go back to try something else.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Great place in the neighborhood for a good family dinner. The menu is basic (which was nice for my elderly mother) and the red sauce was REALLY good (nice for the rest of us)! The service was lovely and accommodating of our party including my elderly mother and my toddler. I ordered the pork ricotta, and it was really yummy. Not fancy, but really tasty. The spumoni dessert was great. I thought the prices were just right, and we'll be back!
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: This was a really nice restaurant! I like the design. The lady who took our order was really nice and friendly, and offered me a better deal on the item I ordered. When they called my name, I got up to go to the counter, but the guy was already coming to me! That was a nice touch. Sadly, they forgot one of my items in the deal I chose, but I didn't realize until I long after I had eaten (on the way home, ha). I did dine-in, and it was a pleasant experience. The restaurant was clean and tidy, which is always a good thing, lol. I'll definitely come back sometime!
name: Taco Bell
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican, Tex-Mex, Tacos, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Best service! This traditional Tucson Mexican locally owned converted a long time age from an A & W Drive In can't be beat! Love ala carte plus breakfast lunch and dinner choices. Try it!
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: It's alot like a Chipotle, but with more selection on food and local beer.  Really enjoyed our meal staff is attentive to your needs.  Food is great through and through.  We will return and we live in Gilbert Az. We will make the drive again.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Great service but even better food! Great family environment. Their walnut shrimp is probably the best in Tucson, and there aren't that many places that carry it. Prices are reasonable and portions are huge!
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Best wings I have found in Tucson. Never dined in, I always had take out. Always been great! Habanero wings are the best if you like heat. If not try the sweet Asian.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Visiting from San Antonio and I had researched some places to try while in Tucson. This was THE place at the top of my list and we were not disappointed!  We visited on a Tuesday for breakfast and when we arrived it was busy. I ordered the Breakfast Sammi and it was delicious. The English muffin and eggs were perfect and the Preps potatoes are amazing!  The Smoked Salmon Beni was served perfectly. The service  was friendly an on point!  We wanted to try one of their pastries but they sold of them before we could.  This place is a 'MUST' try!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Good thing I bought a rubber cover for my key board, so as to keep the drool off.

Man, this place is a classic for breakfast.  My first impression is when it's filled with locals at 9am on Sunday that it had to be good.  I had the green corn waffles, and they don't need any syrup they are that good.  The chorizo was excellent as a side.

Very busy and rightfully so.  Service is quick and attentive.  Can't wait to return.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Chop Stix is like a mini PF Changs...similar food and quality, nice atmosphere, great servers, food comes out fast. The happy hour from 3-5pm is awesome, great appetizer prices and adult beverages. As of this review, local hotel guests receive a discount. The servers and cooks are very open about changing up the menu for your dish. The food is really good.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: Oh my goodness!  This broth was amazing!  It was flavorful and a good amount of spice that I was looking for!  If loving this broth is wrong, I don't want to be right!  I like the atmosphere, as it is simple and I met the owner Deanna who very nice!  Our waitress was very nice!  The only thing was that my water glass was not big enough!  I got the spicy miso and it was still good spicy but enough that I need the water once I got too much of a good slurp.  I loved how simple the menu was and the nice waitress hadn't a problem or haughtiness about answering my questions!  After all I've had ramen but am no pro!  The presentation was beautiful and everything in the soup was yummy!  My favorite part was the tender perfectly cooked piece of pork floating around in my soup!  So good I only broke off pieces of it as I ate as not to miss the tastiness!  Yum, yum, yum!  When we got there at about 5 we were in line but being that I consulted Google about the business for Friday, we only stood in line for maybe five minutes, which was enough time to greet my pal I was meeting there!  Listen to Google!  Lol
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Great wings, crunchy but not overcooked. They have a great selection of sauces and good pricing. The services was prompt and friendly. I'll definitely come back the next time I'm in Tucson
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Just tried Papa Murphy's for first time last night. Have to say this is the best pizza in the area. The Gourmet Veggie  is uniquely standout and the garlic sauce rocks. Wish I'd discovered this place before now.
name: Papa Murphy's
categories: Pizza, Restaurants

text:
Shopping at AJ's can feel like a trip to a beautiful museum.  And yes, you will pay for it.   
But what I did NOT expect and GOT was food poisoning from AJ's.   

We have now twice picked up food from AJ's fast food area--Pizza, salad, soup, to take home on the weekends.   
And both times we have been sick for days afterwards: stomach aches, diarrhea, gas, etc. 

We ate at the outside patio one day a month or so ago and I went to the ladies room in the back.   I noticed that an AJ's employee in the stall next to me put her APRON on the restroom floor while she was going.   That alarmed me, but I thought 'oh well'.  

Twice since then my husband and I have been sickened after grabbing a slice of pizza from AJ's.   

This Place is TOXIC: DO NOT EAT fresh food from there!   I will never eat their fast food again--how disgusting to be sick for days after eating at such a nice place!
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: I would give it half or no stars if I could. First when we walked in the line was to the door. There was another shorter line but I soon found out that it was a line for complaints and corrections to orders. I soon was in that line. Avoid this place.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Really was expecting more.  I usually go to the Wilmot location but thought I'd check this one out.  Huge mistake.  Went with a party of 6.  The only thing that looked close to what I ate growing up in Japan was the Tokyo ramen.  The curry rice was a joke.   I mean....broccoli?  Sushi was meh.  The 20 minute drive to speedway and Wilmot is worth not having the regret you'll have from eating here.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text:
I used to come to Biscuits awhile ago, when it was a few doors down from the where it is now. Apparently it has come under new ownership since then - and not for the better.

My friends and I had come in during the last week of June for the first time since the move/owner change. There was quite a bit of America decoration, but it didn't really phase us, as it was entirely seasonally appropriate. However, we knew there was something a little creepy going on when we came back at Christmas and it was all still there. The whole place screams "'MURRRICA!!!'" a little too loudly. Plus, they pepper the waiting area with Christian paraphernalia. I love that we have a free country where you can garishly display your religious preferences however you like,  but at the end of the day it can turn people off. 

That aside, it was a little overpriced for what you get, which is basic-ass breakfast food. Besides the Patriotism being shoved down your throat with every bite, the restaurant is housed in an old dance studio, so the atmosphere is a little off. The service is slow and forgettable. The owner's snotty replies to the criticism below honestly make me never want to go back.

2-stars for their awesome home fries and Elvis-themed bathroom, though!
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: Food tasted pretty good, atmosphere very good, but my bowl was half full and my friend's 3 tacos were tiny.  Four of us usually go there and will be there this weekend for an event at the Fox, and we are deciding on dinner options before, and none of them are Street Taco unfortunately.  Make sure you get filled up on beer, they will appreciate it because you won't get filled up on the food.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: The food here is delicious and the beer selection has something for everyone. I have been to this taphouse/restaurant about 4 times now and tried something different every time, all of it is amazing!
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text:
Amazing bakery and very reasonably priced!!! We first used them for my fiance's brother's rehearsal dinner. I was in charge of the dessert table so we ordered lemon bars, brownies and two 8inch round cakes with designs on them. Village bakehouse was so easy to work with. Everyone at the party raved about how great the cakes were. 

Fast forward a few months my fiance asked the head baker if they could make a vanilla rose water cake. My family is from Jamaica and we use a lot of rosewater in our desserts. They had never done this before but were willing to try. My fiance took over the rosewater he wanted to be used and left it in their hands. I was so surprised at how delicious it was. I think I must have had close to 10 pieces of cake that weekend. It was sooo delicious and extremely moist. The icing was vanilla buttercream and was to die for. Thank you Village Bakehouse
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Fabulous!! Inventive choices, well prepared options. Even some gluten free options.  Locally owned. Can't beat it!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Not very impressed  by the food, pretty standard. I ordered a tilapia with shrimp and I needed a knife to cut into my fish. It tasted like it was the prebreaded frozen kind, not very good. And our server was not very attentive, she forgot several things we asked for. For the prices they charge the food is substandard, don't think I'll go back anytime soon.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: While the atmosphere is nothing to speak of the pizza was fabulous! Had a Margherita pizza last night, and was delighted about the quality of the pizza. Fresh ingredients and superior crust made all the difference. The prices were very reasonable too. Will keep going back!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
We had Chicken Shawarma,  Lamb Kifta, and the veggie plate with baba ganoush, hummus, falafel, and dolmas. The food was very good and the service was prompt and helpful. Everything was made from scratch- no falafel mix here.
Good food and gluten free too. When  I asked Patrick, the new owner, if he could do gluten free for me he said most of the menu is gluten free. He also said that a lot of it is vegan as well, if that is important to you. Patrick said he is working on gluten free pitas. I hope he gets them soon. Now that I have tried it, I plan to eat there often.
name: Zayna Mediterranean Cafe
categories: Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Restaurants

text: Excellent hidden comfort food brunch spot. Great for a "first date," or meet up with friends.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Simply amazing. I LOVED this place so much. I had the carne asada tacos with refried beans, yellow rice and a side of guac. I even had a churro for dessert. I did try the watermelon cucumber drink but I didn't really care for it too much. I thought it was a little too sweet BUT I'm not a juice drinker. I just wanted to try something new. But as for the food, everything was great. My boyfriend had some tacos and a quesadilla. The quesadilla was very good also. If I'm ever in Tucson again, I will be returning to this wonderful taco place.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Had the chorizo/egg/potato burrito based on another yelp review. It was MONEY. The tortillas really made it. Killer salsa bar to go with it.

I'm moving to Marana in a month and planning on supporting this place! You should too. Not sayin, just sayin.
name: Angela's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Best place in town, can't go wrong with anything on the menu. My man Dago will hop you up, better then Chipotle hands down !!!!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Absolutely terrible service. Went through the drive thru and waited OVER 15 MINUTES for my food. Absolutely unacceptable. Will NOT be back!!
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text:
After my first couple years of college a friend and I noticed that the incoming freshmen had, well, little heads.  I'm not sure why, but they absolutely had little heads.  Maybe they had not begun to expand as a result of the absorption of knowledge or as a result of other "mind expanding" things that happen in college (allegedly).  Anyway, from then on, freshmen were dubbed "littleheads."  As in; "Hey, here comes some littleheads, lets eff with them!"

Anyway, when we stopped in here for a late dinner the place seemed to be populated with...littleheads.  Dining, serving, etc.  This impression was not helped by the fact that past of the lighting in this place is accented with blacklights.  Certainly an unusual choice.  It took me a moment to figure out why the couple in the back had such oddly glowing teeth.

So I opted for a small pizza, I think it was the "Caruso Supreme" or something.  It wasn't very good.  I tasted my wife's chicken parm and it was probably in the 3 star neighborhood.

Overall, Caruso's was a disappointment.  Interesting, but a disappointment.  Seems like the place where the local college kids go for a "nice dinner out."
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Was really disappointed when I received my tofu Provençale this last time.  Both the potatoes and tofu came out incredibly dry...no olive oil to be found on the plate.  Their Provençale had previously been a blend of olive oil, herbs, tomatoes and garlic sautéed to perfection.  I've always asked for this dish without onions.  Today the olive oil with Herbs de Provence, garlic etc. was completely missing.  The waitress told me she had no idea why they did that.  It was just dry fried tofu with a bit of tomato and herbs. I was so disappointed that this excellent dish had been botched.  She took it back and returned with what tasted like a lesser olive oil and nearly raw garlic added to my existing plate.  I guess I won't be returning, which is too bad because I adored that dish.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Tried this place during my lunch break after finishing my workout on a Thursday. The diner had a cozy, hidden feeling to it in the shopping plaza its attached to. Service was quick and friendly and the food came out in a timely manner. I ordered the chicken fried steak skillet; it was delicious especially the fried steak which had a generous portion. The gravy also tasted good, the potatoes/hash browns it came with we're kind of bland... nothing special but they weren't bad by any stretch.  Prices were fair for the quality/amount of food I received. Will be visiting in the future to try their other dishes out.
name: Jerry Bobs
categories: Restaurants, American (New)

text: Maybe it was just a bad day, but our recent experience and first time at the 29th street location was a disappointment.  Previous visits to the 22nd street location were always positive.  The waitress was pleasant.  The food, however, was not.  We were not offered the standard peppers and onions; the chips were stale and mostly small, small chips; my whole talapia was burned to a crisp; and the other meals were just passible and cold.  There were no other patrons in the restaurant.  Overall the quality did not match the prices.  "All good things must come to an end."
name: El Sur Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Yes, it's true, the best tacos in Tucson are here! The staff is also very friendly, I love that there's a chips and salsa bar, and the watermelon-cucumber juice is to DIE FOR. You definitely can't go wrong ordering three tacos with a side of the Mexican rice. I will definitely be back!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
I admit, I'm biased for this restaurant. But this is comfort food, people!

My husband and I stopped in on a very busy Saturday night... We walked by and I instantly craved the bread and sauce. We were seated within 15 minutes, and the service was very good all night. My salad was perfectly crisp and refreshing, especially after walking a few blocks in the heat and rain. I had ravioli and my husband had rigatoni; both were satisfying and just how we remembered.

We had room for dessert, a surprising occurrence, so we split the Tortoni - Wow! Other than the glob of canned whipped cream, it was awesome! The macaroon crust was flavorful without being overpowering. The almond ice cream complemented wonderfully.

If you are looking for the most authentic Italian or the latest thing, look elsewhere. But if you want a tried and true Tucson tradition, come to Carusos and sit on the patio.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
So chipotle is so amazing! I feel like everytime I think about going, gods killing kittens! Why? This addiction is evil!! Lol. Anyhow I love this place for all their organic meats, the chicken is amazing, the Barbados is even better, what mood will I be in next week when the carnitas is going to end up in my burro?

Decor is awesome, the place is well laid out, and they always have some good tunes playing. 

You ready for the bad part?
Ok, so my only gripe, is how these bastards don't mind a HUGE spoon of rice and beans but then they go in with the tongs and shake out half the meat!! WTF! don't skimp on the best part! 

P.S. I always tell them to add my sauce to a cup on the side!! And I slather my burro in it as I eat! Get the hot, it's insane good.

Nuff said.... K bye!
name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican

text: I was worried I was going to walk into a restaurant with a presumptuous staff but I could not have been more wrong. The waitress was able to make fabulous recommendations and our food came out amazing. I wish the prices weren't so high but this was the perfect romantic restaurant that I thought Tucson was lacking. I would recommend it to anyone wanting to have a nice night out and has a few bucks to spend.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: I loved this place! It's great for a quick, inexpensive, and tasty meal. I ordered a chicken street taco and a fish taco and loved both of them. This is one of the best places I've eaten at in Tucson. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. The only reason I wouldn't give it a 5 star review is because the space is small and it was very crowded so finding a seat was tough and it was loud.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Food was ok.  Service was bearable.  The location & decor are sub-par.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: nice little quiet place.  friendly staff, fast service.  broad menu too!  seafoid, soups,  all the regular stuff as well as few things you dont normally see.  shredded carne was delish.  and very reasonably priced.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: Best smoked meats ! The bar is cozy and there always seems to be friendly people to talk to. Great place, I recommend it.
name: Gary Ray's Texas BBQ
categories: Restaurants, Food, Barbeque, Burgers

text: I was planning on going to In N Out but something changed my mind and I came here instead. First let me tell you what made my experience 5 stars was not just the food but the service as well. Nick was very cheerful, enthusiastic and kind in both taking my order and delivering it to my table. The food, per usual, exceeded my expectations and the fries simply put all other fast food places to shame. When leaving my friend and I thanked Nick for wonderful service and he so humbly thanked us. Will be returning soon and frequently.
name: Whataburger
categories: Restaurants, American (Traditional), Fast Food, Burgers

text:
After coming here a few times, I now feel confident giving this review:

The food here is pretty good, but it depends on what you get. They have very tasty seafood, pho, shrimp, salmon, green beans, and chicken. Now the hot and sour soup is okay, but usually comes without much in it. They have "baked steak" as an option but seriously, who eats baked steak? 

The service here is great, but I wish they would correct some of their practices. For example, they leave finished food trays right next to trays people are still taking food from. It doesn't come off as trying to be sanitary with the place. If you do the Hibachi grill and can't manage to sprint to the counter the moment its ready, expect the bell to be rung by the chef until you do pick it up. He either has a obsession ringing the bell or doesn't have a lot of patience. Either way, it gets a little annoying. Besides these two pet peeves, they do a good job greeting you and the servers do take care of you with a smile. Just watch out for the workers who stock the food; they act as if no one is around them.

I know there is much to stay about the name, "U Like". It has been the subject of many easy puns depending on if the person actually enjoyed the place or not. The name itself does its purpose of garnering attention, but can suffer the drawback if the person does not like the place. Of course, what do you do when you thought the place was okay. Do I just say it is the "Kinda Like Buffet?"

Overall, I give this place 3/5 stars. It can quite noisy at this place, and there is a general tendency (with a lot of buffet places) that kids have have a lot of freedom running around the food areas. I wish some parents would do a better job with their kids, but I'm not a parent yet so maybe this is meant to be their free time. I am a sucker for cooked seafood and vegetables, and this place I can have as much as I want. I do plan on continue eating here because I am the buffet type of guy. As long as the food is not artificial and has enough healthy options, I will be at the buffet, regardless if the food isn't 5 star quality.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: When visiting my friend in Tucson, I needed to get my brunch on before exploring the city. She recommended Prep and Pastry as her favorite go-to spot, and girl, was she right! Being extra hungry, as one usually gets when on vacation, I ordered what I thought to be too much food, and basically ate it all 'cuz it was that good.
