You can get the chili French toast and you will be pleased with the salty sweetness combo, as other yelpers mention, you can try their take on the doughnut/croissant hybrid  the "dossant," which is pretty good, however, someone in your party HAS to order the grilled cheese - preferably YOU! Ordering this grilled cheese sandwich has been one of the best (top ten) decisions I've ever made! This buttery, crispy, and gooey asiago bread one-ups your childhood favorite with pesto smeared in between its slices and topped off with a warm little squishy tomato. The creaminess of the white cheddar mixed in with the smokiness of the tomato make this vegetarian sandwich taste as rich as if you're eating bacon! Dunk it in the tangy tomato bisque, and take a big bite of Prep's garlicky herby roasted potatoes, and just sit there taking all of the goodness in. Their website isn't kidding: "The Best Breakfast & Brunch in Tucson, AZ". Come hungry. Seriously.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Went here for the first time for the dinner buffet. The service was excellent, there was a great variety of food, and it was all tasty. Would come back again!
name: Kettle Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Amazing breakfast / brunch spot. Our family ordered omelet, bngs, and doughnut ...so tasty! Great service, friendly people, absolutely will go back next time we are in town.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: My family takes me here every year on my birthday. I love this vintage Tucson restaurant. I usually order the rigatoni parmesan - the portions are generous and I always need a takeaway box. The restaurant building is admittedly a little rough around the edges and the food is predictable but those aspects are part of the charm. The patio is so quaint... Love the lights strung throughout the seating area as well as the fish ponds. Caruso's embodies the the unique Tucson restaurant scene. Chain establishments can never capture the personality and quirky ambiance of places like Caruso's. I feel good about Supporting Caruso's and hope it will be a part of the 4th Avenue scene for many years to come.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Food was incredible. The atmosphere is a rustic cozy with a rather younger crowd of mostly millennials. Only issue is this place is busy!! Be prepared to wait an hour if you show up past noon! I must say though that the food was worth the wait and their Bloody Mary's and mimosas are  on point.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Caruso's isn't bad, and it's certainly better than chains like Olive Garden, but it's still only average.  They seem to try too hard to be stereotypically "Italian".  Their food is alright, but the food at Caffe Milano is better.  This restaurant is ok, but if you want good Italian food in this neighborhood, I recommend checking out Caffe Milano.  The quality is better there, and it isn't that much more expensive.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Absolutely fantastic menu. Fairly small menu, but all cooked to perfection. Service is speedy and friendly. One of my favorite spots!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
Food: 2 / 5 Stars

The Breakfast Poutine: (4 / 5 Stars) The real highlight of today's brunch was my friend's Breakfast Poutine - I stole a few bites. The Poutine had a rich flavor and was very satisfying. 

The Duck Confit: (? / 5 Stars) Did not try but was told that the dish tasted great. 

Smoked Salmon Beni: (0 / 5 Stars) Although I was looking forward to my dish, the Smoked Salmon Beni was a huge disappointment. Not only was the salmon in small supply, it tasted like over-cooked frozen salmon rather than smoked salmon as advertised (definitely not a deal with the $12.00 price tag that comes along with it). Even though the eggs, potatoes, and other fixings of the dish tasted great, the core aspect of the dish was severely lacking - especially compared to the other items ordered at the restaurant. I was able to use hot sauce to mask the flavor of the fish. 

------------------------------------------------

Location: (Not a factor in the rating)

Prep & Pastry is a very nice and aesthetic looking restaurant. There are a lot of places to park even if the lot is full and we only waited about 30 min on a Holiday Sunday at noon. 

------------------------------------------------

Service: 5 / 5 Stars

The servers were very nice and accommodating at the restaurant. Additionally, they were thorough on ensuring that the kitchen staff was notified of my allergy to nuts. 

------------------------------------------------

Overall: 3.5 / 5 Stars 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at Prep & Pastry and will most likely return to try some of their other food offerings; however, I will be avoiding their Smoked Salmon Beni.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I was here for my birthday party with 12 other guests. Karen was our waitress and she was just so wonderful. Carusos has never disappointed me. I love the ambiance, the lasagna al forno is the best, their salads are so delicious, their Italian dressing is unique. But this special time on this special day, Karen was on top of everything at my table. She was fast and caring and made sure everyone got their food. Nothing was wrong with anyone's order, she even set up my birthday cake really nice. I couldn't be thankful enough for her and for the background employees at Caruso's. I've been eating here since I was 5 years old. This is a true classic, delicious Italian restaurant and I will always recommend to friends and family.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Good stuff! It was a weird experience because they seemed to take a long time taking or order, but the food came really fast so that's fine. We had the chicken curry and one of the masalas. Excellent!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: I recently found out this place was right next to where I live so I had to try it. First impression: it has a cute out door area with heaters which is nice since it's chilly outside in the mornings. The inside is cozy and it kinda reminds me of a grandmas house. Me and my husband ordered iced lattes and a apple turnover to share. I didn't like the iced latte because it lacked sweetener and sugar packets don't do the trick with iced drinks. The apple turnover was good. We also ordered chorizo burritos and they were pretty good too. I got mine with a side of potatoes and my husband got a side of fruit. Overall it was a nice experience (:
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: This place serves American style breakfast. Do not expect patisserie here. Their cinnamon roles are very large and covered in icing. It's a sugar coma waiting to happen. The cheese/cherry danish was quite good. The coffee was mediocre and took a while to prepare. Avoid during rush breakfast hours on the weekend.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Very friendly staff and the food was great. Husband had a omelet that was huge. I had the gyro and fries. We will definitely be back.
name: Old Times Kafe
categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Diners, American (Traditional)

text: Beautiful setting, good service and delicious food!  I ordered cheese pizza and salad with homemade Italian dressing.  In fact, this salad dressing is so delicious, I purchased some extra to take home with me!  I look forward to visiting Caruso's again to enjoy salad and pizza.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: The WOW factor is here!!!!   A gem in the valley,  causal decor, love the recycled wood pallets, pastry is awesome, cheddar biscuit n duck gravy...wow!  coffee is one of the BEST in Tucson.  Service also a WOW!   One of the owners, Nathan,visits tables and asks about your dining experience, a very good touch!   Diffidently a 20% + tip here.  Restrooms clean, service staff most helpful and quick! Try it, you won't be disappointed, since I don't give out many 5 star reviews.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I almost don't want to write a review, I'm afraid it'll get too busy! Speaking of, it can...so get there early. 
Great food, great drinks, great menu, great staff...They've got it down. I'll be here everytime I'm in town.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I loved  visiting this west part of Tucson, near its birthplace. And I loved the colorful building of St. Mary's. The gentleman who took our orders was very polite and the food arrived quickly. 

Concrete floors, simple tables, food served in styrofoam containers with plastic forks. Basically grab it and serve yourself. No choices of salsas, which I missed.

The green tamale I ordered  came with the usual tasting rice and beans and a delicious tortilla. The tamale, sadly, was uninspired and cold. (El Parador, Tucson Tamale Co. and Poca Cosa still are the best for corn tamales IMHO).

My partner had the bean burrito veggie style and pronounced it "quite good." That's all: "quite good." hmmm.

I'm glad we ate here and I would certainly try them again if we're in that part of the Old Pueblo but I was less than amazed at the experience.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Was not impressed for such a long wait for food that was seasoned way off for breakfast food and for a bread place the muffins where dry. Might try again but not going out of my way. Some staff was rude and acted bothered to even fill the coffee, others where extremely nice and helpful.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Some friends and I stopped in here for dinner after hopping the bars down 4th street all day. The food was okay and the prices are pretty decent, but it wasn't something to rave about. The service was pretty slow as well. It's a nice little spot if you're feeling some quick cheap Italian food, but it's not the best I've had.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Super long line, friendly service, good Ramen ............................
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: I have been dying to go here since I learned of its existence. My son and I popped in one  Sunday morning before church. I knew we wouldn't have time to sit down, but wanted to grab some pastries to go. The doughsaunt was to die for! My son selected the chocolate raspberry croissant and that too was delicious. There were quite a few people there waiting for a table, so when I go back for a sit down I will plan on a wait. The place is adorable and the employees we interacted with were polite. Can't wait to go back!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Just a great place for a casual breakfast.  Wait staff is nice and attentive and the food is just delicious.  A lot of traditional breakfast foods that are just done right.  Perfect eggs, excellent bacon and delicious pancakes.  I haven't had a breakfast this good since I moved from San Francisco.  Highly recommend and looking forward to returning.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Wonderful find! Fantastic spinach salad and although a half is not on the menu- they added a half spinach alas to my meal !
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text:
Atmosphere - 5 Stars
Very clean environment with simple, yet elegant historic pieces. Very laid back staff. 

Food - 5 Stars
I had the Steak and Egg Sandwich. It was an interesting list of ingredients that all complimented each other well. Arugula folded eggs with jalapeño jam, shaved tri tip all on a cheesy croissant with a side of potatoes. I also had the pumpkin cronought (croissant crossed with a doughnut). 

Drinks - 5 Stars
I had a Maya Tea (Green Sencha Rose) from the beloved local tea favorite Maya Tea Company while my wife enjoyed the exceptional EXO roasters drip coffee. For a drip coffee, it was great!

Price - 4 Stars
It was very fairly priced with exception to the doughnut. $4 is a little stiff for a pastry.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This used to be one of my favorite restaurant chains to eat at. The last three experiences left something to be desired.  The first of the three, the manager decided to hold a meeting with the wait staff and left us sitting for 25 minutes waiting for our waitress to take our order. She was so upset and flustered by the time the manager released her to do her job.  The second and third time, there were problems with the food.  The sticky toffee dessert had PAPER still on it.  The skinny fries were so hard they were inedible and would break.  I think they have cut costs recently and it hasn't done the restaurant any favors. I don't think I'll be back.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: LOVE le rendezvous! Such a great little gem in Tucson. Best escargot around! Also! They have EXCELLENT beef Wellington. My favorite.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text:
Finally a casino in Arizona that appreciates Blackjack players!!! 

With a Player's Club that is second to none, there is, in my opinion, no other hotel/casino combo in Arizona that can match Casino del Sol.  

The property itself is beautiful.  The hotel lobby is a welcome retreat from the casino floor.  Guest rooms are spacious and well-appointed.

I rarely play slots but from I could see walking around, they seem to have better than average payouts.

I love Blackjack and if you're willing to bet at the higher limit tables ($25 minimum) you will be rewarded with 3-deck shoes; which narrows the casino edge.

Restaurants are good.  I like Abuelita's (quick & tasty Mexican options.  Festa Buffet is great option.  Ume was decent as well.

Even though I live in Phoenix, I'd rather make the drive to Tucson and play in a casino that appreciates and rewards me for my play.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: My best friend & I went to Mother Hubbard's for a bite. I got 2 eggs, shredded potatoes & toast. Well potatoes had funny taste, used old grease, uck! Toast had old grease, put on grill, I'm sure. Bread wasn't even brown! I received bill, told our server(man) about potatoes & toast, he had a disgusted look said it's free because you dontlike it! I said I was telling you to make it better. Bill was about $12.00. I gave him $10.00. Will never go there again.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
What a fabulous, cool place!!  Yelp reviews were spot on!  If you are in the mood for brunch type food, you have to try this place.  It has an eclectic vibe to decor and menu.  

I highly recommend the Thai Fighter cocktail...if you like the combo of sweet & a hint of spice.  The table next to us had the make it yourself mimosas and they looked good enough to try next time!  The grilled cheese looked fab, as did the Monte Christo but I opted for the pork belly breakfast sandwich.  It was beyond fantastic.  Their version of hash browns is small, chopped potatoes with onion and red peppers sautéed.  

They have a great outside patio, which is dog friendly!  There service is attentive and the wait staff was helpful in answering questions about the menu.  This will be a repeat place for food, for sure!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: After seeing such rave reviews, I admit I didn't believe the hype. BOY WAS I MISTAKEN! This place is a gem! We had the pork belly sandwich and lemon poppy french toast -- both delicious! Very reasonably priced too! If you are in Tucson, check this spot out...you won't be disappointed.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Ramen is good. It's expensive, $11-$14 a bowl. Tucson tends to be more expensive, but I'm from LA and I'm used to $6-9 a bowl. 
Service is eh. Waiting system is stupid you have to wait in line, not just write a name down. Super fun in the Tucson heat. There are also signs all around insisting that the waiting system isn't stupid. Which makes it feel even more so. I've eaten here several times, and getting a check is very hard as well. Every single time. So is getting change for your check. The waiting system would make more sense if they had quicker service, but considering I usually wait for my check about 10 minutes after I finish eating, they should let you write you name and sit around the corner. I hope they listen to the feedback insisting that the customers are wrong. The customers will keep you open! If there's a wait, I always leave. If there's no wait I consider eating here.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: This is my favorite breakfast spot in Tucson! Expect to probably wait for a table, but worth every minute! My favorite is the Beni or the Steak & Egg Sandwich. Everything is amazing!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
After driving by and seeing the line out the door the last week and a half or so, I figured it was time to try Raijin Ramen out. Finding a solid ramen option in town has been a bit of a challenge (aka I didn't previously have my spot yet). I ordered the red chile spicy ramen and it hit the spot (if I ever come back, I will surely order this). The egg was half-boiled (a good sign), and the broth was really flavorful.

Our particular server was friendly and accommodating, although when I initially called with a question, the manager (presumably) literally told me "I'm kind of busy right now, soooo..." Yikes. Not the best customer service on that end, but the server made up for honestly a bit of a rude exchange. The quality of the ramen itself is what earns this review--glad this place is here in Tucson.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
OThis place has completely gone down the tubes! First impression.... walked into a DISGUSTING stench of old dirty musky carpets! OMG! This carpet hasn't been cleaned in years! Stains cover the once colorful floors. Dirt and grime on every wall, entry way and door! 

We ordered 2 large pizzas, buffalo chicken breadsticks and 5 sodas... $78 WITH COUPONS! Holy crud! We could've got a feast at Peter Piper Pizza! Oh and the pizza.....it's awful! Frozen pizza blows this place out of the water! I'm waiting for my dad to regurgitate his salad from the salad bar. It's definitely been sitting out all day, all the toppings are mixed together and everything is shriveled up and dried out. 

This location is building a new location directly across the street. I really hope that it will come with a new manager and new cleaning crew! What a terrible experience for my daughter on her birthday! 

The only good thing about this place is the staff!  They take pride in their work. VERY friendly and upbeat!
name: Chuck E. Cheese
categories: Pizza, Arcades, American (Traditional), Arts & Entertainment, Restaurants, Indoor Playcentre, Active Life

text:
Been wanting to try burgerrito for a while now. The concept is clever burger patties in a burrito, taco salad, sandwich, etc.  Let me start by saying the amount of love and attention that they put into the hatch green chile sauce and their cajun sauce is noticeable and makes these sauces stellar. 
     Now the problem is that they don't pay as much love and attention to the other parts of the whole. I ordered a taco salad which comes with the green chile sauce, diced hamburger patty (beef or turkey), chopped tomato, chopped onion, all on top of a bed of lettuce and surrounded with tortilla chips. I had two problems with this dish: 
1. The hamburger was diced and not ground.
2. The hamburger was a frozen patty.
        I really feel like this food truck has potential to be outstanding if only they put the same amount of love into all items of each dish as they do their sauces. I would really like to see them make fresh or fresh frozen hamburger patties in the future maybe add some diced onion and hatch green chile's to the hamburger patty.
name: Burgerrito
categories: Food, Restaurants, Mexican, Food Trucks

text: MY GOODNESS this place is amazing! Every time I go it's always so great. Always consistence with the flavor & serving amount. My favorite are the shredded beef tacos. They are always so full of flavor and great with the Gringo Style condiments. Their salsa bar suits anybody's taste buds. It's like a Subway and Chipotle assembly. The workers there are just as great and welcoming. Their bar contains yummy adult beverages. It will always be a place I will go for as long as it is open!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
My favorite brunch spot in Tucson! The service is attentive and the food is very good. My favorite is the egg and chile relleno made with mole sauce sourced from Native Seeds/SEARCH next door. It's only available on weekends, however.

I've also had their omelettes du jour; biscuits with duck fat gravy; and pastries. The best part, of course, is their signature mimosas and bloody mary's. 

If you go on the weekend, be prepared to wait. But they have water and coffee available to make the time pass a little faster. Or visit their East side location on Grant near Tanque Verde. I've never had to wait at that location and the food and service are just as good.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I have heard so much about breakfast at Ghini's but not much on Tapas Tuesdays (yes, I know tapas is Spanish not French but ,whatever, just go with it), so I am here to talk about the wonderfulness that is Ghini's aperitifs.  Hubby and I LOVE appetizers, so a night like this was created for us.

I really only need one word to review my experience: YUM!  We were joined by another friend and, between the 3 of us, sampled pretty much the entire menu (except the soups; bread & oil; blackened salmon salad; and the mussels).  

I don't even know where to start because EVERYTHING was so delicious. The hot dishes were brought directly from the broiler, so they were warm and toasty.  The cold dishes were just that - cold.  Nothing was even remotely the wrong temperature.  Everything was so full of flavor.  But none of the flavors were overwhelming or excessive - each flavor was in just the right proportion to make a well rounded dish.  I have never tried pate before but if all pate is this good, I have a new favorite food.

My only complaint would be the portion size of some of the dishes.  The Mushroom, Basil & Brie Bruschetta consisted of only 2 slices of baguette w/ the toppings and we did run out of crostini for the Spinach-Artichoke dip (which they quickly rectified by bringing us more).  It did help, though, that many of the dishes were served with a side of greens - which were topped with a light vinaigrette and just as delicious as the main part of each dish.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
First time there, unbelievably disappointed. We tried their "Suicide" wings and they do NOT live up to their name. Suicide flavor tastes like straight red chile powder... Nothing more.
To make it worse, they charged us one dollar extra for this flavor and no where on their menu board with pricing does it say  you will have to pay that. 
Buffalo Bell you really need to give me my dollar back. Completely disappointed and dissatisfied.

Second big let down is the fact they do not offer lemon pepper. If i could give less than one star I would.
name: Buffalo Bell
categories: Chicken Wings, Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text: Came with my sister after a day spent at San Xavier Mission. We were greeted as we walked in the door, our waitress was very sweet and friendly. My sister says "the soup was so good and I like how they put the water pitcher on your table". I had two tacos and I would get them again. Very good.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text:
Our food was good but kitchen time was very slow. We tried calabacitas scramble, hamburger, and an eggs/sausage (cajun) plate. Cajun sausage was quite good with some kick. Eggs were fine along with potatoes and toast. Burger was good, as were refried beans. Other items were average.

The most notable thing about our 12:45 Sunday brunch was the cooking time, about 20 minutes. This seemed to be a factor of one cook doing all cooking with occasional waffle help from a server. 

I think the summary is: walk in, count the patrons, look into the kitchen. If two people are working the griddle or teaming up, or if there are fewer than 10-12 customers, sit down. If not, head elsewhere. There are plenty of good breakfasts in Tucson at similar or better prices and without long cooking delays.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: ahhh, I love this place(: I crave it as I write this review. I love love love their hot & sour soup, Hawaiian bbq chicken, stir fry & sushi!  mmmm, idk what was going on with those other reviews, but the food is great. the servers don't speak English, but it's a buffet so you don't need them anyway! who cares, I just love getting down on this place it's soooo good. :)
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text: I use to love this restaurant. It's close by to my house, has decent food and modest prices. But honestly these last two times I've visited I've come home to an upset stomach. Food tastes great so I'm guessing it's what in the food that's getting me sick? Staff are ok. Seem friendly and over worked. I won't be going back anytime soon. I'm not really a fan of running to the bathroom for 5 hours straight.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: I loved the food and drinks. I've had several dishes including their eggs Beni and duck confit. Both awesome. The misses however didn't like her donut, and the seating is uncomfortable noisy and a little to hipster for me. But overall, one of my favorite breakfast stops for Tucson. Be prepared to wait a while for a seat.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: In the mood for a pastry this morning so I had to stop by. The selection of baked goods is varied and delicious! I ordered the baked cherry fritter and an iced cappuccino. I have to say, it was way better than Starbucks (and better priced). I came here a few months ago and tried the heart healthy orange cookies and the Linzer cookies, they did not disappoint. Everything is fresh, the staff is nice and I prefer to frequent local establishments.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Very nice decor, super friendly service, but the food was sadly underwhelming. My monte cristo was soggy because of how buttery the bread was. I wished it was a tad crispier/toasted. The ham in it was delicious, the strawberry jam was divine. I'll come back for sure for more pastries next time!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Yummy baked goods and special order pies and cakes.  Pastry and cookies are slightly overpriced compared to Beyond Bread but less expensive than Frog.  They serve breakfast & lunch and it's a nice place to enjoy a tea and baked good especially if the weather is nice enough to sit outside.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: $25 medium pizza that took 35 minutes to get to the table? Sure why not. It was fucking delicious. Piping hot and garlicky!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Awesome tacos just like home. 15 for $15.00. Try a frybread with sugar for desert. Thanks I'll be back!!!!
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: Great spot for appetizers and beer, over 30 beers on tap. The newest menu items, Rueben and Patty Melt, were awesome. The dry rub ribs were tasty and spices were delicious without burn. Wednesday is live music night so check it out.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: My boyfriend ordered wings to go for us for the first time and they were delicious he also ordered us chicken tenders and fries. The mild Wings were finger lickin good, great sauce and the chicken tenders were delicious, fried and battered to perfection. Giving wings over Broadway 4 stars for their fries, they were big and hot but lacking some seasoning, they were a little bland and I was hoping they would be a little more tasty!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: I enjoyed my meal with the excellent customer service and a terrific attitude from Adrianna, I would definitely come back and have her as our server. Thank you so much!
name: Jerry Bobs
categories: Restaurants, American (New)

text: Came here for brunch with a friend of mine, we both didn't know what to expect as if was our first time. I was pleasantly surprised. I has the duck confit hash and she had french toast-both were superb. The wait staff were friendly and attentive. I'll definitely be back! This place knows what they are doing!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Best burger in town.  It's got short rib in it!  Great, friendly service and live music.  A new favorite spot.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: Came for lunch and was amazingly surprised how good the food was. In addition to their amazingly low prices, they have the best meaty wings in town and they cost less than anywhere else.  the staff was very friendly also. My friend also had a huge hamburger that looked like a gourmet chef made it. I was very impressed and will come back tomorrow
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: First time at this restaurant and was surprised with overall experience.  Staff were very helpful and experienced.  The cheeseburger was fabulous with a great mix of meats, done perfectly.  Great food, will return soon, like Cheers with more beer.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text:
If you are thinking to order a cake for your special occasion, this is the place. They are amazing in the quality of work that they deliver. I just gave them some general idea about what I want, and they created this beautiful cake for my wife's birthday.
The staff are very nice and the cake is delicious.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
Had it delivered to local hotel. By accident, went to wrong hotel (little language barrier) but quickly resolved and brought right over. 

Ordered the General Tso Chicken, egg rolls and wanton soup. All was very good but soup was not was I was expecting. Too many vegetable. Like my wanton with just soup and dumplings. 

Would recommend. Good presentation and tasted good.
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: Food was decent, if a bit pricey.   The home fries weren't fresh, but were the little frozen cubes.   The omelette was very good, but my "green" tea was some herbal concoction that was super strong.   If I was in the area again I would probably try something else.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: BEST MEXICAN FOOD EVER!!  The best service in town. Silvia is the nicest person in the world.  She writes our name on the wrapper ever time we go there.  You can't buy that kind of service.  I get the bacon breakfast burrito every time.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: After traveling all day we stopped in here for dinner and Lance, our server stepped in and made our meal very fun. He suggested we split a fish and chips dinner and that came with a delicious bowl of clam chowder. The fish was nicely battered and was enough for the two of us. Lance also suggested their flavored lemonade which was very good. We forgot how tired we were for the short time we were here.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: One of the nicer places in Tucson. If you like gambling obviously plenty of that but so much more. We have stayed there a and enjoyed greatly. Especially Thursdays and there free music night. Usually some pretty good cover bands and everyone has good time. Big pool and plenty of places to explore. Decent buffet if you like that. Would recommend you check it out.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: I went to Prep and Pastry about a week ago with my girlfriend. We were expecting a long line as other reviews said there would be on the weekend. When we arrived we were told that there would be a 30 minute wait. So we stood outside in the sun. After about 5 minutes, I asked one of the hostesses if there was a shorter wait time if we sat outside under the shaded patio. She promptly told me that the patio was closed due to a large party renting it out. Not 5 minutes later they seated a table of 3 at one of the 5 empty tables out there. Needless to say I was pretty upset about being blatantly lied to. After another 20 minutes of standing around we were finally seated. The building is visually appealing inside however it was so loud we couldn't even hear each other. My girlfriend ordered the A.M. Chile Relleno, and I ordered the tri tip sliders. We also ordered a french toast to split. The french toast was delicious, the tri tip sliders had no salt what so ever. And my girlfriends dish was absolutely cold. She ended up sending it back. They prepared a new one for her which also contained all but one morsel of salt. They did however take half off her dish for their incompetence. All in all Prep and Pastry is visited by people who want to be more hip than enjoy good food.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I have eaten breakfast, brunch & lunch here countless times. It is always busy, but why wouldn't it be?! It's so dang delicious! For there always being so many people, the service is always excellent! I am gluten free and there are some great options here for brunch and it never disappoints! I am borderline obsessed with P&P it's one of Tucson's best restraints!! I can't say anything about their pastries, but everyone who tries them LOVES THEM! They are always coming up with new menu items, new pastry flavor combinations...and I love that they added a bar! Everything I have tried: original orange, orange/guava, wine and sangria satisfy beyond expectation. I wholeheartedly recommend Prep and Pastry to those in Tucson for he first time, and those locals looking for a new restaurant to spice up your brunch life!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: One of my favorite places in town! Taco Tuesday is a must here. Let's not forget the salsa bar is well stocked and delicious! You definitely need to try this place if you haven't already
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: THIS PLACE!!!!  We are addicted to your love!  We go to Street Tacos at least twice a week, and when we don't go, we get withdrawal.  There is nowhere else we want to eat tacos!!!  Cool vibe, quick, accurate and friendly service, a wonderfully diverse menu, and the salsa bar ROCKS, compared to the competition.  Meats are tasty and tender, veg. options fresh and delightful.  Beers are great; bar service is on point.  Nothing not to love!! Please open a second location. We will never get tacos anywhere else in Tucson.  A true gem!!!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Great ambience to go along with the outstanding food, the French toast was my favorite!!! The pastries are deliciously sinful.  The wait can be a little long, but worth it... There are great stores less than 50 feet away in the area that complement the interval; you can leisurely shop at an antique store, or a woman's/young ladies boutique, and even a seed store selling plants, indigenous to Arizona... it is truly an experience... we will be back again!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The Chile relleno burro is great, the red Chile plate with rice and beans with a sobaquera tortilla Mmmm delicious also de pollo asado and carne asada burros are sooo very good.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Great place for some yummy and authentic food. Service was great and the place was clean!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Have been visiting Frescos for at least 5 years and have never had bad food. Used to live a couple miles away and yes delivery was slow needed to plan ahead. Most of the time we just picked it up. They have the best pepperoni and mushroom Pizza I've had in town, love the fresh mushrooms and the manicotti is wonderful. It's no longer on the menu but they still will make it up for you just ask. I ordered salad (chef) for the first time and it was excellent, very fresh! The only negative is they need one on the east side. You can't even compare to other franchise Pizza places they don't even come close to the freshness and taste.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: This place has some very good steak and pretty good sides to go along with it. But you're gonna pay for them as this is not an inexpensive place to eat. I'd consider this place to be more of a "special occasion restaurant" rather than somewhere you'd go on a consistent basis. The cheapest steak they have is a 10 oz. "Carne Asada" steak for $23. That's what me and my wife ordered and it was very delicious, tender,  and was cooked perfectly. I also ordered the "Estillo Charro", which was basically melted cheese with some chilis. This was a good choice as it added some very good flavors and some heat, although the steak does not need any assistance with flavor. I definitely recommend this place but just be ready to pay up.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
....meh....

 my husband and I are big sushi eaters, so we're always looking for awesome places in town. I saw all the wonderful reviews for this place - so we decided to go. 

Quaint little place- very clean. Got our drink orders and brought us some edamame. It was kinda slimy....

I had read the reviews about the self serve miso station, so I asked if I could get some. She said no, she would get it for me. I also saw her shew another patron away as he was attempting to serve himself.  So I'm not sure if that is still their policy.  

We ordered the 9 piece sashimi plate and a few rolls. Sashimi came out first. Salmon slimy, but tasted good, the tuna tasted a bit like a fish tank smells, and the 3rd fish.... (albacore?) Had no flavor. 

The rolls we got, however, were quite good. Solid flavor, and well put together rolls. We had the Fireball, Happy Roll, spicy tuna roll, and the Eskimo roll. The only complaint I had about them was they were pretty small for the price, and had the smallest amount of fish the could use. Best roll we got was the fireball.

Who knows... maybe we caught them on a bad night, but I don't think we'll be making a point to go again.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text:
Great little french cafe and breakfast spot.  I have ordered the Brouillade and the eggs provencale.  Both really good dishes.  You won't be disappointed with this choice in breakfast.

The pastries are excellent, and I suggest getting a croissant with your meal, as it is a bread choice instead of toast.

I only give this 4 stars, because the location is not the best.  I would like to see this restaurant move to a nicer location with a better outdoor seating option.  But the food is excellent.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: I love the French toast, white Sangria is so refreshing, bartender is awesome and grill cheese was amazing.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I came in and bought some flour tortillas. The gentlemen at the counter was very kind, and talkative which I appreciated. The tortillas were amazing! When I bought them they were still warm. I definitely want to come back and get a burrito. I've heard great things about them.
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text: So far not too bad of a wait for it being a Sunday. They do need maybe another cashier as I saw a family walk out on their check. It was Denny's for the food.
name: Denny's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners

text:
This was my first experience at a Golden Corral.  I was actually very surprised by the quality and variety of the food and at a very reasonable price!

The staff was pleasant and attentive, including the manager, who went table to table checking on diners and keeping an eye on things.

I won't make this one of my "regular" restaurants but if I am with a group who just can't decide where to go, I won't hesitate to suggest Golden Corral.
name: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill
categories: Buffets, Restaurants, American (New), American (Traditional)

text: The staff here is AMAZING. Michelle was fantastic and kind to a co-worker and me. I wish I remembered the cashier's name, because he was incredibly friendly, too. They both delivered world-class service. My favorite Panera ever.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: Their lunch buffet is the best!!!, I've never had their dinner so I can't say much about it, but I've been there for lunch a bunch of times, it's very very delicious!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: This is my 1st experience here at Kettle.  The staff was friendly. The most enjoyable part of our dining experience was Johnny, a prep cook.  While looking over the breakfast buffet he appeared & offered to serve eggs the special way my husband likes.  Needless to say,  he had seconds.  Lots of food choices at times it was hard picking.  Very satisfied with the food (buffets can be hit or miss) & the prices.  Will definitely come back.
name: Kettle Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Worst fried shrimp ever. The batter was so strange tasting. Almost like flour and water only was used to bread the shrimp. It was think, not crunchy and just tasted bad. The worst part was is that the manager new I disliked my meal and  just said sorry. Yuck I would never go back,
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text:
YUM! My introduction to fry bread was many many moons ago, at a Rendez-vous (which is basically a reenactment of trade gatherings between settlers and natives), where fry bread was cooked in oil over a campfire - and they were amazing.

This beat even the memory. I had an Indian taco with a bit of green chili added and it was seriously amazing. Their beans are so good. Their homemade salsa/hot sauce adds a nice, tart kick, and the fry bread? Yup. Manna from heaven is a good description. I will definitely be back, and next time will have to save room for a sweet fry bread.
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text:
If you are on a diet, this place is certainly your doom.

The pastries are just amazing, this is honestly the first scone I've ever eaten that I actually enjoyed, and do not get me started on the eclairs.

The food is actually very good as well, the potatos are amazing, as well as the toast they give as part of most breakfast sets.

They also have high chairs for the little ones and great coffee.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: The food is good. Wouldn't bother with the Menudo though. It taste like tripe with tomato sauce...weird taste. The staff is friendly but is not really SERVICE oriented. They don't always come around to refill you cup and you can wait a while before someone brings you menus or take your orders. Good thing we like their food because the service can use some tweaking.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: I've been there a couple times now. Pasta is very good, great servings and their pizzas are excellent. The guy at the counter, Dusty or Dustin, is very friendly.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: This restaurant is fantastic Paul is an excellent owner highly recommend this restaurant
name: Burgerrito
categories: Food, Restaurants, Mexican, Food Trucks

text:
My wife and I ate here yesterday (March 18) with an elderly friend who lives in the Tucson area. The friend loves this place for their chicken tortilla soup, and she was not disappointed. 

I had the Cobb salad, which was perfectly acceptable, and better than a much more expensive one I'd had the day before. In particular, the quality and quantity of the meat was impressive. 

This review is mostly to recognize the efforts of our server and (especially) one of the managers - bearded chap, John?? - who took great care of my wife, who has numerous food sensitivities. They answered her questions patiently, and at one point, John (as we shall call him) came out to discuss in detail the ingredients of the salad dressing. Collaboratively, a good solution was found - and my wife enjoyed her meal very much. 

I have one primary suggestion for improvement: turn the music down. At least for the Sunday lunch crowd, the music seemed far louder than most customers likely wanted. 

We will definitely return next time we're in Tucson.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: I went to Mother Hubbards on a weekday with my toddler daughter.  I was the only customer at the time I got seated.  Our waitress told us to sit anywhere we liked, so we did. We were both super hungry and looking forward to eating here as I had read a good review in the Tucson Weekly.  Boy was I disappointed.  I ordered the eggs benedict and a kid breakfast for my daughter (scrambled eggs, potatoes, toast. ) When my dish came, I was horrified.  Hollandaise sauce should be fluffy and uniform.  This was a runny, separated soup that engulfed not only both halves of the sandwich, but the entire plate, it was just a big plate drenched in melted butter.  The meat was flavorless and appeared to have been boiled.  The english muffin was dense and had an odd flavor.  I would have told the waitress, but she never did check on us.  Finally I went to the front and simply requested another plate, we were in a hurry and I wanted to get out of there, I did not have high hopes that ordering something else would make me any happier.  I took the extra plate, wiped off the eggs best i could and literally tried to wring out my muffins.  The coffee, rather expensive for plain brewed coffee ( 2.75 I think) was just average, and overpriced to my way of thinking.  The descriptions on the menu sound enticing but I do not have faith in the cook that day, perhaps another one does better, he just looked like a disinterested disheveled hippie type and prepared our food with zero panache.  I will not go back
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Some of the best tacos I've ever had. And believe me when I say I've had my fair share of tacos. Free salsa and chips bar. They have good happy hour specials. Treat yourself to a churro!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Love WOB. I've been coming here for several years and have been a regular customer every week. They have the best wings in town. My fav is the six wing special. Medium is not too hot and the flavor rocks.
Get some- you'll be glad that you did!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
Gave this place a second chance after my first experience was somewhat mediocre and very much tainted by a waiter with personal hygiene that would be frowned upon even in Parisian caffes.  
  The food was great, and I have frequented the bakery enough to say that most of the items there are very fresh and delicious.  Their signature tomato omelet is sublime.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
I wanted to like this place!!  I live less than a mile away, and for months I've watched the construction with anticipation. When I heard it was a Blake's, I researched them on the interwebs and got even more excited. I was *so* excited, in fact, that on opening day, I arrived before they opened and was the third person in drive-thru. (on a side note, the trash folks arrived right after me, and couldn't get to the dumpster, so we all had to move out of their way, let them do their job, then go back in place.)

For this "getting to know you" phase, I ordered a bacon breakfast burrito, a Southwest burrito with red sauce, and a Lotaburger with no add-ins. Despite being the third person in drive-thru, it took quite a bit to get my food, but I figured it was due to just opening. I took the food home and cut it in half so my teenager and I could try it all. The bacon burrito was...just okay. The hash browns were a big white mush and the green chiles were too hot for me. I had to pick them out. Teenager agreed, except the chiles were fine for him. I took one bite of the Southwest burrito and actually yelped. My mouth was instantly on fire! They should warn people about the red chile sauce because it was way WAY too hot. My lips and tongue were throbbing, and I couldn't eat any more of it. Teenager liked the burrito, except he said it was too small for the price. The Lotaburger (thankfully, I didn't put chiles on it!) was just okay. It was like a poor hybrid of a Whataburger and an In-N-Out burger, and neither of us were overly impressed.  So...overall, my impressions were "just okay, but the chiles were too hot" while teenager thought it was "just okay, but too many onions used."

A week later, we gave it another shot. We arrived late in the afternoon, and were smart enough to park in the adjoining church parking lot, right behind the bus stop. Interestingly, there weren't any people in line to order, but there were many people waiting for food.

This time, we ordered chicken strips, the grilled chicken sandwich, regular fries, seasoned fries and onion rings to go. It took FOREVER to get our food! For most of our wait, there were several other people waiting for their food, and one of the crew members kept telling us to move out of the way. (Here's a tip...if too many people are in the way..maybe get the food out faster?) The kitchen was full of people, so I don't know what the deal was with getting food out.

Anyway, our order FINALLY arrived and we took it home. Like before, we divided everything in half so we could sample it all.  Once again, the food was just okay. The chicken strips seemed small, and were nothing special. The bun on the grilled chicken sandwich was a sodden mess because of the mayo-like sauce they used. It fell apart quickly and both of us wound up just eating the grilled chicken and leaving the rest of the sandwich. The fries were  just okay...nothing special. The seasoned fries weren't very seasoned, and the onion rings were decent but too greasy.

So, to recap, in our two visits we tried:

a Lotaburger
a bacon breakfast burrito
a southwest breakfast burrito
a chicken sandwich
chicken strips
french fries
seasoned fries
onion rings

The overwhelming result: nothing outright sucked (except for that wet bun), but none of it was really good. It was just one big MEH. Add the intolerable wait, and this is one place we won't be revisiting anytime soon.

I'm so disappointed.

ps...my mom texted this morning, and said she was the second person in drive thru at 6:21am, and she didn't get her food until 6:39am. She, too, said the burrito was just okay, and she'd not planning to go back either.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Best breakfast I've ever had! Service, quality and ambiance are why people wait to get in. I get it now!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I decided to give this place a try because I drive by this establishment everyday. I had the shredded beef chimichanga to go. While I was waiting, I heard the microwave go off n thought ohh ooo (not a good sign). So I got my order in a timely matter. Got home n saw that they "shemered" what either was sour cream or mayo all over the top of my chimichanga n on top of the white condiment, a whole bunch of lettuce n tomato (id like to see what Im eating, not for it to be covered up like its hiding something). The entree came w two sides. There was a side of rice n beans. I'm not a bean person but the beans were pretty good. The flavor of the rice was good but it was not evenly cooked. The chimichanga it self was sub par, not a lot of meat compared to other places I've eaten at. The meat that i did get, was charred w burnt pieces. After scraping off the top of the chimichanga, you could see that there wasn't much wrapped inside. I probably won't be going back n I'll be sticking to my usual Mexican restaurant.
name: Angela's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Best tacos in Tucson.  Love going here.  They do a great job and have authentic food.  Seating is tight and it can get a bit crowded but worth the wait.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Crispy, Hot, Meaty Wings with a handful of outstanding sauces to choose from.  Best wings in Tucson, hands down.  The unassuming, well-worn, but very clean establishment has that most excellent quirky Tucson feel.  The sides are good too.  Hooray.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Friendly staff and excellent service.  The food is consistently prepared and served quickly.  On our list of regular visits.
name: Jerry Bob's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional)

text: Jerry Bob's is solid, and if you're military, it's exceptional.  They have a great military discount.  They have a great military discount.  It's worth repeating.  Besides that, it's as close to a rusty spoon as I've found in Tucson (except no smoking) and is my go to for breakfast.  Delicious omelets, breakfast burritos, and while that's all I get I hear the rest is great too.
name: Jerry Bob's On Broadway
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners, Salad

text:
Absolutely NOT A FOUR STAR HOTEL. I've stayed in many and this is service you get at a motel. 0 star service. Two elevators were broken, waited 30 minutes in line to check in they only had two people working, requested an item for an event they didn't deliver, and received a rude response from staff when asking a question. Also received rude service at restaurant and they were stingy charging me $1 for extra dressing. 

Rooms ground and casino are nice, but any real four star experience has the staff going above and beyond in every way.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: This place was delightful, Good food and a great space. Nice friendly service.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: If you want actual street style tacos this is the place. I tried chicken , steak , shredded beef and fish tacos and they were all amazing! Get the street style toppings on it. I also tried their watermelon juice which was amazing. They give free chips and they have a nice salsa bar. Great service overall!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I have been coming here for years with my grandparents. The atmosphere is small town like with friendly hard workers. If you sign up for their points reward system you get good coupons in the mail/email. The breakfast is good I have never had lunch here so I can't say much about that.
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: Chose this place over others with a higher star count because it was close and right on my way.  I'm glad I did.  The service was decently attentive and nice but not too much to make it uncomfortable.  I ordered the eggs Provençal and it was wonderful.  Eggs cooked perfectly and the mix of fresh garlic, thyme, and grilled tomatoes was exactly what I wanted but didn't know it.  The hash browns were exactly the way I like without having to describe it to them.  I'll go back.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Great service and impressive sushi selection & quality.  It was a quiet night and I was brought a free bowl of edamame since he thought it would go good with my Sapporo.  The ambiance could use a little spicing up -- if the lighting and so on were on par with the food and service, it would be a step in the right direction.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: I have been back several times and am still in love. The food is consistently delicious and well made. Service is better each time I go. Highly recommend this place to all!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Super fun experience. Don't be fooled by the exterior of the building. Lots of menu items to chose from. Tried the appetizer sampler that had 7 items $5.50. Loved the Samosas and batata. the paneer wasnt my favorite. We also ordered the cheese naan (bread stuffed with homemade cheese baked in the tandoor) $2.60, gobhi prantha (bread stuffed with cauliflower chili and spices) $2.60 and while both were very tasty there wasn't a huge difference between the two. For entrees my favorite was the Lamb mushrooms $9.75, but a close second was the Shrimp Vindaloo $11.25. Everything was wonderful. Would definitely recommend and can't wait to come back to Tucson again soon!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
So I'm writing this review for The Man...because personally I dislike Taco Bell food.  So yeah...

The Man gives this place 4 stars because:
- They're fast
- They're friendly
- They never get his order wrong
name: Taco Bell
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican, Tex-Mex, Tacos, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Very popular place....the wait was about 30 min on a Saturday morning at 8AM.  Kept it pretty simple, had the "simple breakfast"...eggs, toast and hashbrowns.  It was really good...the hashbrowns were the best! Then decided to try one of their pastries, had the boston cream pie dossant, loved it! Would definitely go back.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: everyone in this place was rude! It seems like everyone was in a rush even though it wasn't busy.  We didn't even get to finish ordering before they were trying to end the transaction and seemed annoyed when we tried to update our order to include more because apparently they had decided that was enough for us.  The food is always good so I'm not really worried about that, but I was definitely out off by the service.
name: eegee's
categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Food

text:
WOWEE!!! So fresh and clean is this new "clean" eating establishment !

I had the Acai styled bowl made with coconut water. The service was friendly and prompt. The food was tasty and healthy! 

What a great treat after spending all your pay on the Tasty goodies next door at the Asain Food Market!
name: Juice Envy
categories: Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Sandwiches, Food, Acai Bowls

text: I love Panera and I eat there regularly in Texas. But this was the worst experience I've ever had at any Panera. Took over 25 minutes to get two orders of oatmeal. After 20 minutes we went to ask what the status was and the employees laughed as they told us they forgot we were here and had ordered anything.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: 20 years ago this was a good venue. Now? Not even close. We've been here a number of times over the past few years, tapering off to nada. The food isn't very good. The service was meh.  The ambiance the same. There are far better places to spend your hard earned dollars.
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Went here with my daughter to show her posh food! She loved it!!! I loved it!!! Great food!!! But I don't think charging again for refills on  cups of tea is fair
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The food is not the "greasy-spoon" diner experience I was hoping for. Too many "unique" menu options and too centered around southwestern flavors for our tastes. Very "hipster" kind of atmosphere, which is also not really our thing. Should have just gone to Hungry Fox instead. 3 stars for decent tasting food.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
"Frenchness Guaranteed"? Well, this could mean anything from expensive food to rude service. 

What I might forgive sitting in a Parisian cafe is not so "ooh-la-la" in a cafe facing a supermarket parking lot in Tucson. Our cheap sidewalk table tipped. We moved. Someone parked and the windshield glare bored into my eyeballs. 

The much heralded Eggs Provencal were tasteless -- not at all worth the wait! My mom's coffee was lukewarm--first cup and refill. 

The wild divergence in reviews for Ghini's should have been my first clue. C'est la vie. (But never again.)
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Our bartender Alma was amazing!!! Our food was fantastic!!! Service couldn't be more outstanding. Definitely recommend this place in the future. Bloody Mary was on point, recommend all who love mimosas to try the detox mimosa.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Was just OK, I don't think its a tourist trap. I think a lot of regulars go there. For $10.99 you shouldn't expect to much for your basic Chinese Buffet. Other option is a McDonald's meal for $7. Four more dollars you can go back for 2nds, 3rds, and soft serve ice cream.  

Decor - 3 stars, was decent 
Taste - 3 stars, don't expect anything to wow you
Service - 3 stars, good service
Value - 3 stars, again not the best food, but again not the most expensive.
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text: The concept in this place follows the ever popular Snooz breakfast eatery ...Despite people saying you must get there early- we arrived at 8;30 on a Friday morning and sat immediately on move in weekend for U of A...Anyone who lives in the city and thinks having to wait 30 minutes must not get out much!! 30 - 45 min wait time for a great breakfast is worth the wait! This place is no exception- great customer service and the pastries were fabulous! If you are looking for ordinary- go somewhere else...This place puts flare on ordinary food ...We sat outside and found it to be very pleasant - though if temps were above 100 I wouldn't recommend it...There was a fan but no misters so it could get rather hot...The staff go above and beyond in customer service asking if I would like a coffee to go!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This place is really bad. Overpriced and over cooked steaks makes for a bad combo. Deep fried over cooked country fried steak disguised with wallpaper paste gravy and cold lumpy mashed potatoes along with a Hockey Puck biscuit at 15.99 is a ripoff. Will I go back,,, I think not !!  Sorry "Claim" go "Jumper" off the nearest cliff !
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: I used to do WingStop once a week. Now I frequent the other places in town which are superior only due to the fact that the cooks follow directions. Also about 1.5 years ago Wingstop shifted to some Frankenstein sized giant wings. The skin to meat ratio is completely off and the size is kind of disgusting tbh. But here is the real problem.... the staff is nice and perfectly decent but just dim. On repeated visits over the past year, I ask for well done wings, extremely well done. Really I just want the skin to be a little bit crispy. I even receive assurances at the register and told specifically they will be 23 minutes cook time. Then the fkn retards serve up my order less than 20 minutes later and insist they are well done. Soggy skins, chunks of fat that has not melted, etc. I even pointed this out and just received BS from the staff for the last time. Fk them. They didn't even offer to fix the order even though the staff had to clean the table and throw away a basket full of uneaten wings (8+3). Wingstop is disgusting now.... with their monstrous and undercooked wings.
name: Wingstop
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, American (New)

text: Ghini's is my latest go-to breakfast place. My boyfriend and I love their omelets (so dang fluffy) and other French style egg dishes like the Eggs Provençal and Florentine Croque Madame. I consistently order the Florentine Omelet because I'm very obsessed with both spinach and swiss cheese. It never disappoints and they certainly don't skimp on the fillings. There are super yummy bread options as well courtesy of their adjoined bakery. I like the multi-grain, my boyfriend prefers the French baguette. Look out for discounted mimosas or bloody marys in the mornings... it seems like there's usually some sort of special going on. The dining area is cute and quaint and there's also a nice outdoor patio, which is great when it's not a zillion degrees out. All in all, I always enjoy breakfast at Ghini's and I'll recommend it to anyone who values my opinion (probably a few people).
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
With 1200+ reviews, and 4.5 stars it's pretty obvious that PnP is a beloved Tucson spot. I can see why - I loved it too!

The space is small and simple with a generous patio (which wasn't open on our visit because it was "cold"). Prepare to have a hard time making a food decision as everything on the menu looks great. I opted for biscuits and gravy with eggs and a side of turkey sausage. 

Can we talk about those biscuits? They're huge, like the size of my face huge, and perfectly fluffy and topped with oh-so-good sausage gravy.

Can we talk about my eggs? PERFECTLY cooked. PERFECTLY. 

Can we talk about their housemade sausage? The turkey is a little spicy and the pork version is wonderfully seasoned. If you eat meat and don't order one of these, I am sad for you. 

Finally, can we talk about Matt? If Matt has your table you're going to have a good time because he's pretty great. 

Two thumbs up!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I have driven PAST Blake's in Deming, NM on my way out of Hatch so many times and always thought to myself, "Huh, I really should try them out." But I never do because I just want to get home to Tucson and to be honest, 9 times out of 10 I just put a Sparky's green chile cheeseburger in my belly so I wasn't hungry. When Blake's came to Tucson, I was really excited!!!

Don't believe the hype. The green chile cheeseburger at Blake's is a mediocre burger overall with the saving grace being the green chile. The green chile is delicious but not very hot, at least for my taste but that's not where I find fault with this burger. The actual burger is greasy and just a whatever burger. Mine was thrown together so sloppily that I had more onions and tomatoes off the bun than on it. I literally had to put my burger back together before I could eat it. And then the grease started dripping off my hands. Honestly, I would compare the "burger" part of my sandwich to any old fast food place but priced much higher. We also had seasoned fries which were good and onion rings which were not. The size of the order of onion rings for the price was NOT a bargain at all.

So I'm glad I finally tried Blake's but I really don't think I'll be back. Especially when the green chile double cheeseburger I had at Whataburger was actually better but then again, my judgement on that one may have been clouded by a hangover.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text:
Kung Fu Noodles, was a new and working out the kinks while, simultaneously, my lover and I were passing by on our way to an appointment, so we ordered quickly and indicated we were in a hurry.    

I received my lunch special in a reasonable time (7-10 minutes), however my lover ordered a noodle dish under the entree section and it took about 25 minutes to come out.  I had literally finished my entire lunch serving before her noodle dish arrived.  My lunch special vegetable assortment was tasty, but my wife's seafood noodles were bland and unremarkable.  Kung Fu Noodles did give us an extra portion of rice at no charge because of the long wait, but I am used to asian places giving unlimited amounts of rice, so it didn't quite compensate for the delay.  We made our appointment, but not comfortably. 

I would give this business 2 stars, except that they are new and working out the kinks, and I don't want to rain on their parade out of the gate, and I am their first reviewer, and I want new businesses to make it.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text:
I came here when this place was "hot and new," but apparently never got around to writing my review!
Even after being open for only a few weeks and with a line of customers out the door, Raijin Ramen has quick, speedy service. While I felt a little rushed eating my ramen, since they clearly wanted to turn over my table to get more customers inside, the service itself was still attentive and not overbearing.
Their vegetarian ramen was surprisingly different than the vegetarian miso broths I'm used to having at ramen shops, and was a nice change of pace. The bowl itself included some unusual and not-so-traditional ramen add-ons, like thinly sliced zucchini, but it still tasted good.
I would prefer for Raijin to have a miso vegetarian broth, since that is my preference, but I think it's nice that they have a vegetarian option at all, since many ramen places do not.
Seeing as how it's Tucson and ramen doesn't really exist here, Raijin's got a monopoly on the ramen market in town, and that's probably how they can get away with their prices. In the Bay Area where I live, this wouldn't fly because there are so many other ramen options to choose from. However, next time I'm in Tucson and craving ramen, I will gladly pay their rather high prices!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
We had dinner there on January 14th.  The Beet Salad was okay .....just okay. The portion was small for the price, and it looked as though it had been prepared earlier, perhaps wrapped in plastic wrap, and then unwrapped to be served...everything was sort of smashed together on the plate.  My friends steak was ordered Medium and served Med Rare and floating in butter. The fries were lukewarm. Service was pleasant and friendly and beverages were kept full.

Then we had breakfast on January 16th and 17th.  The staff were all smiling and friendly ....they seemed to want to help....but there also seemed to be a big gap in organization. On both mornings, the buffet ran out of plates and food. When the food was replenished, the portions put out were small ...even though the restaurant and the bar were packed with people. If you weren't standing at the buffet, waiting for more food to come out ....then by the time you got from your table to the buffet and waited in line ....the food was gone again.  On both mornings.....I ate my toast, scrambled eggs, and bacon at differing times because if there were eggs...there was no bacon, if there was bacon there were no eggs.....and the loaf of bread was over 30 minutes in appearing.  

There was also something else we encountered.  The tables had napkins, forks, and knifes .....but no spoons.  Coffee was offered to us on both mornings....and we asked for cream and Splenda ...which were quickly provided.  And when we said 'there are no spoons'....the waitress on each morning said 'yes, we don't roll them in the napkins anymore because people are stealing them'....so then we smiled and said ...'well can we have spoons please?' .... spoons never arrived, so we used our knives.  Now ....if you, as a waitress, know there are no spoons on the table, and you also know your customer wants cream and sweetener for their coffee.......wouldn't you bring a spoon when you deliver the cream?  

It was clean and the staff IS friendly ...they just need some good old fashioned direction.
name: Finnegan's Pub
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Restaurants, American (New), Bars, Irish

text:
This is a close grocery store to me and while convenient, it is incredibly pricy. Things may even be a $1 or 2 more than Frys. I only go when its easiest for me.

It is a nice place to grab some prepared food, breakfast or hard to find ethnic foods. 

Great wine selection.

Will go again... only when I need to. 

I usually buy all my birthday cakes (when needed/parties) here. They do a great job.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: I just went to the Panera at this location and had the best experience. When it comes to fast casual dining, it is easy for employees to be short with you or rush you. This was not the case. The cashier, Mariah, was fantastic. She was not only polite and sociable but very knowledgeable about the menu. She gave suggestions and assisted with any questions we had while order. She is an asset to your business and has a knack for hospitality. I would utilize her in any further growth within your establishment.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: I received a new member reward after staying at their hotel two different weekends and attending three different concerts within a few weeks just last month.  The mailer was for a $59 room rate which expired within a week after receiving it.  I called to see if I could extend it a few days to Friday which is my wife's birthday.  We stayed last month at regular rate and didn't even get to enjoy the pool because of the monsoons.  My regular rate with AAA is $107 so because of a mere $48 in savings that I couldn't be given,  I will never return and I would have spent hundreds of extra dollars between drinks and food at the pool, other meals, and gambling all evening to have more than made up for it.  In Vegas they completely comp me twice a year because they want my business!  To me its just the principle of bad vs good customer service!
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts
