text: Based on the exceptional reviews, my wife and I decided to try this restaurant.  The staff was very friendly and we  felt like were family.  We order two salads and four sushi rolls.  We were also given soup and edamame.  The salads were very good.  While the rolls were very good, our sushi restaurant in Las Vegas is much more flavorful.  However, we would visit this restaurant again on our next visit to Tucson.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: To clarify, I did not mean to imply (nor did I say) that the restaurant had no French influence or dishes.  The menu is fine, it's mainly the bread that I hope will be improved.  To me, good French baguette has a crusty, brown exterior, and an airy interior.  What I found at Ghinis, as typical in the US, was pale, without a significantly crusty exterior, and a uniform interior without the characteristic air pockets. There's really a big difference.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
Taco Tuesdays is my jam! The line type serving is a lot o like chipotle, but the tacos are better. I believe I got the tacos with all of the dressings on top. Highly recommend if you want to get a quick bite to eat downtown. There isn't a lot of seating when it gets super busy, however if you come at a non peak time you won't have any issues. 

Unlike a few other taco shops you can take a handful of chips from a heated machine, which is a nice touch. Choose your own salsa and refill your own drinks. You can also get beer here which is a nice touch when you're having a quick taco any day of the week. 

The atmosphere is pretty much expected for a taco place, and the price is great for what you get. I've only been here once, but recommend if you're in the area and need a quick bite to eat.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: We were really excited that this place has moved closer to us because I've had a couple of people tell me they were good. I'll deal with those people later. We got 24 wings and will be throwing away 20. The flavors are so bland and they are not at all crispy or cooked well. We got 4 flavors...tried one of each and are so disappointed. The "famous" fries were terrible. Bland and soggy.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
Who does love brunch?!

Communists, that's who.

We tried stopping here right when we got to Tucson on a Sunday morning which is an amateur move on our parts.....they had an hour wait for two people. But hearing that only validated that we must come back so we hit up Prep and Pastry again on a Tuesday morning right when they opened so we were guaranteed to get a table. Within 15 minutes, some other tables came in an the place was bumping. 

While I would love to be a sweets for breakfast kinda person, I just can't do it, I'm savory road all the way. I ordered the pork belly breakfast sandwich with country hash and it was good. I was expecting to have a mouthgasm but there was too little sriracha sauce and the slaw wasn't too flavorful. But the pork belly was seasoned and cooked to perfection so I can't complain about that. My boo got the biscuits and gravy with cheddar biscuits and it was heavenly, I would get that if I was to ever come back while in Tucson. We got some sweets to go since we couldn't leave without one, the pistachio/mascarpone croissant redeemed P&P for the pork belly sandwich.....it gave me a mouthgasm! Like multiple ones. Mmmmmm.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We were seated at 11:51am we made our drink order at 11:58 we received our drinks promptly but then the misery began. 45 minutes no contact from the waiter only he occasional refill finally 30 mins into our wait we asked what was going on with our food and he said I checked and you are next well 12 minutes later we walked out it shouldn't take 45 minutes for a pancake an order of bacon, a kids omelette and a chicken salad. I will not return. It's not the wait that bothered me it's the lack of contact and any good waiter knows if the wait is long you stop by with something to munch on. Especially with a hungry 4 year old
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: Fantastic cinnamon rolls according to my kid. I had the Denver omelet which was great. The coffee was good. I liked the patio seating.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Let me start with the bathrooms. Where my brother went to grab toilet paper and stuck his hand in a massive amount of shit. Where my wife and sister in law some poop smeared all over the toilets. Let me continue on with the food. The Mongolian bar had shrimp with the chicken, what about people with an allergy to shrimp? Or how about the noodles that smelled sour. Let's not forget to mention the chicken was either cold and gross and/or contained nothing but fat. OH! The chocolate pudding had big yellow chunks of food in it! What was left of the ice cream was slimy! Then not only did it already cost $40 just for my family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children) but they helped themselves to a pre tip of $4, something called a "gratituity" and then asked for an additional tip. Wouldn't have been a problem IF someone helped. Although they were quick to pick up my credit card, my table was piled with dishes. This place is disgusting and I'm half tempted to call someone to inspect their filth filled restaurant. Never going again
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: The only real complaint is that 4 and a highchair don't fit at a 4 top table. My 1 yr old son was on the corner. The bread that they bring out before the meal was delicious, as were the onion rings. The manager noticed that our order was taking a little long, so he brought Mandarin oranges for my son, which was greatly appreciated.  The calamari breading was too heavy, but my burger was good.  The waitress was very pleasant and personable.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text:
my son and I went 11.12.16 and the food I ordered was not good at all. for the price it was even worse. ordered the sam dunk $10.99 and the rib tips (1) was very cold the chicken tenders(2) were okay but old so they were tough(flavor was good) and the steak fingers (4) were hard and nasty.(means how many in the basket) the fries were very salty you had to blow the salt off before eating them.

 I order the coleslaw which was very good. we also had ordered zucchini and it was very good too.  my son had the mushroom burger was delicious he said and actually looked good.

 I have never had such bad food from a famous sams. will not go back or recommend this famous sams

text: The food was very good, I ordered this take away and it was ready on time and the order was correct and the food was tasty. I would go back there again next time I am in Tucson. I would also recommend this for anyone looking for quick food that tastes good.
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: My wife and I decide to try the new Friday's menu this week and was it awful.  I had the roasted marrow.  It was a mess, two large segments of bone one having a core that was smaller than my little finger with nothing to extract the marrow.  I finally got a small spoon but had to use the handle to dig out the grossly undercooked marrow.  The other piece of bone had a larger core but it too was undercooked.  I haven't had marrow before but my understanding is that it is supposed to slide out of the bone.  Not even close.  I had ordered escargot as an appetizer and they had a metallic taste with undercooked garlic in the butter.  My wife ordered the shrimp with grits and the shrimp (all four of them) were tasteless but the grits were terrific.  My dish came with a salad which was adequate but not tossed.  Anyway, I'll stick to breakfast which I have had before and is quite good.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Good tacos ! Tasty beer ! A bit pricey, but that's what you get for being downtown. Free chips and salsa with everything, so you're not gonna leave hungry.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.

text: My new favorite brunch spot!  Great place to eat, friendly staff and the food is delicious.  They amount of items on the menu I would like to try is really incredible.

text:
Well, as for me, there are no good Chinese restaurants on the east side of town. Once again, a high review at an Asian restaurant disappoints this Asian.

We ordered egg rolls, Kung Pao chicken and BBQ pork lo mein. The egg rolls were decently sized and were not bad. Not great, mind you, but not bad. The Kung Pao chicken was disappointing. The sauce was soy sauce based and the flavor was not wonderful. The chicken was a bit dry and fibrous. The lo mein had more bean sprouts than noodles. I really didn't taste any noodles nor did I have any noodle texture. Too much bean sprouts. The pork was decent, though.

The service was nice. She was polite, concerned and attentive. It is a nice restaurant.

Will not ever return.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text:
When I first moved to Tucson, I was told that St. Mary's was the place to go for best Mexican food in Tucson. I finally made the trek to the West side of 10 to see what the best Mexican food in Tucson tastes like.

After looking over the menu on the back wall, I decided I would get the carne seca burrito, side of chips and salsa, and a small coke. The food was good. The burrito was a good size, not "as big as your head", but big enough.

What I really liked about the place was it's local neighborhood feel. There were a lot of people comming and going at lunch time and most of them seemed to be regulars. If I lived in the neighborhood, this would be a place I go to a lot. If you have never been here and are not looking for something fancy, I would definitely give it a try.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: So surprised by the quality this food was delicious and so fresh. Not bad of a wait time either for delivery. So pleased.

text: My boyfriend and I try new places around town every week and have been to a lot of great places but none quite like this. text: I grew up in Chicago where i loved the local Gyro shops.  After leaving Chicago some ten or so years ago i have been on the look out for a Gyro that was even half as good!  Not until i walked into Sunrise Cafe and ordered one have I not been utterly disappointing.  TRULY AWESOME GYRO and for the love of all things that taste good do NOT forget the house made green hot sauce it is to DIE FOR !!!! i go through the stuff like its cold water.

text: The food was great, but everything else was lacking.  We arrived on time for our 715pm reservation for a requested. quiet table for for. Upon arrival, Frank told us our table would not be ready for a half hour and we should wait at the bar. After awhile, when no one took our drink orders, other tables emptied and walk-ins were seated, we asked for another table. Frank told us that customers should request, not demand and that the entire staff was aware of us. (!?!). Eventually we were seated  next to a table for eight that took up most of the dining room exit/entry area and was about 3 inches from our table. Result? Every guest entering or leaving the restaurant and/ or rest room bumped into my chair, put their hands on my shoulders to squeeze by or asked me to move. Unpleasant in so many ways, will not return.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: Amazing food with the best staff! This is always my go to spot!! Prices are great and the quality of service is fantastic. You would be crazy not to make old times your new breakfast destination! Thanks guys always a pleasure to come dine with you!

text:
Incredibly nice wait staff who serve well very.  They are the only reason for the two stars.  The food was unfortunately NOT properly or well  prepared.  Thin, long haired guy as short-order cook needs serious training.
:-( 
Breakfast time, it wasn't busy and I was in no rush.  Ordered and asked for eggs whites cooked completely and well done hash browns..... What I got was clear, runny egg whites, barely cooked hash browns, and semi-raw bacon.
My mistake was eating most of it.  For a healthy man with no bowel issues, to be forced to run to the bathroom before I even left the restaurant says something!  The rest of my day was spent in or near the latrine.
:-(
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:

text: Dam I was so happy with this food last night. Today is a different story.  I'm sicker than a dog. Working my ass off muscling my way through this.  The day is almost over that's what I'm pushing for.  The mana from heaven turned or to be the mana from hell.  Montezuma's reveng, Bubble guts like the volcanoe is active all day.  I would never eat there again.  Whoever runs the joint needs to manage the food better because the only thing you got running was my asshole. Thanks jas. Never again. text:
Loved this place. Super busy for the most, about a 20 minute wait but totally worth it.

I will say the waiters were very Nazi about getting our plates out. Had 4 come up in a 30 minute period asking if they could take our food that we very obviously weren't done with but that'd be the only negative thing about the place! The Ramen is amazing and loved the amount of options on sake!

text:
I went for lunch one day while in town for work. It's assembly line ordering, much like a Chipotle or Subway (only this place is much better). I ordered three tacos, each with different meats to try them out, and had them non-Gringo style (just some cilantro and diced onions). I also helped myself to some of the chips and salsa. And they have Mexican Coke (with the sugar instead of HFCS), so bonus!

The tacos were all incredibly tasty. The ingredients were clearly fresh and good and I highly recommend it for lunch. But it's clearly already known as a great lunch place, as a long line can form, but it moves pretty quick.

categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I was truly disappointed at the serving sizes and also the quality of the food for the price. Also you could see that there was some sort of black grime on the floor, the whole establishment was very unsanitary.

text: Delicious donuts. Management was helpful in taking an advance order for a large quantity of donuts for our event. Having used Dunkin Donuts the previous year, we will stick with Donut King from now on.

text: We ordered 2 calzones, Cajun bread and brownies. The food was good. Delivery was prompt and the employees were polite and nice. The 2 star review is based on a service error and missed opportunity to fix it. Our order was missing sauces for both calzones and the bread. I called the store to report the missing items. They were kind and said they would send out the missing items with the driver. They never delivered the missing sauces. You pay a delivery fee here. We picked this place because they deliver. I won't suggest this place to my friends and will avoid it next time my wife and I want delivery.

text: Can't wait to come back here... The menu was fascinating and what an array of mimosas! Service was just superb and very cool artsy vibe atmosphere although a little noisy - not the best acoustics I had the sweet potato hash which was one of the healthier items on the menu ... A friend had the special which look like acfrrnch dip and fries and I really wanted to take some of hers... Another had the French toast with berries and it looked incredible .  I wish  they offered more gluten free pastries and breads and also some cappuccino or lattes. I look forward to going for breakfast or brunch
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Sometimes during my work day, I have to take a drive to the Williams Centre on Broadway.  As I am headed to and from, I pass the most peculiar storefront that always seems to have a parking situation on a daily basis.  I mean you can't even see the front entrance on most days, the car park is that packed!  It's a place called Wings Over Broadway and I keep hearing positive things about it.  Today is Saturday: my bud/colleague are out of ideas for lunch, so we figure what the hell.

We phoned in a take away order; I ordered a dozen wings, medium flavoured, he orders a dozen, half mild and half lemon pepper.  I also ordered a batch of bacon cheese fries.  Order is ready in fifteen minutes, I get to the store, surprisingly I land a parking space right in front of the main entrance, and the cashier tells me my order had just come out.  Oh shklit, fresh hot wings!

Back at the office break room, we tear the shklit out of that plastic bag, we are both very hungry.  My medium wings are astounding; sauce is not too runny and not too thick; the taste is somewhat less then what I would consider to be medium- more like half mild- half true medium; but it doesn't reek of vinegar and doesn't drip too much so overall I am pleased.  Added bonus; these wings are fried to crispy perfection.  I appreciate a good crisp, as I have had many wings which absorbed too much sauce and rendered into limp mushy nuggets with bones in them; not these wings.  The meat is moist and steamy, no sign of dry to be found.  

I trade with my bud, one of my mediums for one of his lemon pepper.  It was acceptable, a tad dull perhaps because I'm still under the influence of the medium spice.  Its not fair to dismiss a flavour if I can't taste it properly.  I can never understand why anyone would eat an atomic flavoured wing; all you're tasting is the pain from the capsaicin and not the actual morsel.  

Bacon cheese fries are out of this world; homemade seasoned fries smothered with melted cheese and bacon.  Made me sad that I had six more hours to work instead of kicking back at this chicken wing shack with the giant telly showing the UofA Wildcat game with those fries and a nice cold beer.  C'est la vie...

The verdict?  Why on earth did it take me so bloody long to succumb to crispy sauced poultry Nirvana.  I must spread the news about Wings Over Broadway to my friends and family; they have to experience the goodness I had today. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

My sincerest appreciation to the six chickens who made my dining experience possible.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: When I specifically ask for extra ranch, and you don't give me extra ranch... You fail. I was also asked to pull around the front and wait for fries. I have been going to eegees all my life and that has never happened before, and I had to wait a long while.
name: eegee's
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text:
Came here after visiting the Tucson Museum of Art, my first thought when I walked in was oh no another Chipotle type of place but to my surprise they served different offerings. 
I don't eat meat so I had the calabacita tacos on flour gringo style, sooooo good !!!

Their watermelon cucumber juice is so refreshing
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
We ordered:
-tri tip sliders
-pork belly breakfast sandwich
-coffee
-scone
-Cronut (Tucsons version)

Positives:
-properly cooked
-properly seasoned
-friendly/knowledgeable/attentive staff
-serves specialty/locally roasted coffee from EXO.
-the space is comfortable and welcoming. You could stay there all day. 
-Sunday brunch is worth the wait. 

Negatives:
-the only complaint I have is for the Cronut. It's unfortunately dry and hard if not ordered from the oven. Ask how long it's been out of the oven before you order it, and or ask them to warm it up first. 

Business suggestions:
-you guys are excellent and a true Tucson gem. Keep doing what your doing. 

Will we return:
-absolutely. Every Sunday brunch! It's refreshing to have a place serve excellent breakfast with intentional flavors and attention to detail. Not to mention having a place serve quality coffee. Check it out, see you Sunday!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I bought a kids hotdog meal and the original Italian Grinder on wheat bread with a Eegee flavor of the month (Orange Dream, my favorite) for me and my daughter yesterday.  The food was good and fresh, the service friendly, prompt, and accurate, and the rest rooms and seating area very clean.  Keep up the great work!
name: eegee's
categories: Desserts, Sandwiches, Fast Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Food

text:
Located on the west side of Starr Pass Blvd, Kettle Restaurant has managed to stay open for many years. Their welcoming atmosphere features dozens of clocks with times from various cities all over the world. 

I would like to commend the exceptional service here. A lady server who has worked there for years was nice and attentive. The owner was extremely friendly and welcoming. He came by the table to have a conversation; a sign that he cares about his customers. He brought out extra food not even on the food from his native country of Jordan. If he converted his restaurant to Jordanian food, it could easily be one of the best in town.

Going off the last sentence above, I will say avoid the buffet. The soups and the hot food were cold, while the cold food wasn't cold enough. The Middle Eastern food he brought out saved the meal. They do have a regular American food menu so you are better off ordering from that. 

Here's to hoping that this restaurant soon becomes a restaurant specializing in Jordanian food. That would easily get this place more stars!
name: Kettle Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I love this casino!  The slot machines pay! I won a total of $1,150 in two days.  It is a lot of fun, clean and pretty. The dinning area has a sky effect on the ceiling.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Good food, polite and attentive servers and bartenders. Plenty of screens to enjoy a game. The place is clean. I do not like the bathroom stalls. The bathroom is clean, I just think they need to modify the stalls. The parking is not very good luckily a friend drove us. Overall, not to shabby. I will definitely go back and then I just read a post and saw pictures of roaches in a persons food. Yeah, "Good Food" ewwwwww yeah right.
name: Famous Sam's Restaurant & Bar
categories: Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text: Good food, great prices and esspecally awesome portions. The ambiance of good ol fashion is in the air and the staff is friendly with just the perfect amount of feistiness. I really do recommend this place if you want to walk away full and happy.
name: Old Times Kafe
categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Diners, American (Traditional)

text: The food and service is great. A suggestion for improvement: there should be a drink menu, it's uncomfortable to ask bar tenders about the margarita and wine choices and their prices. Help us out, have a menu!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Good burgers. We don't have Whataburger in California, so I decided to try one here. Was not disappointed. Good to try a different chain for once. Something different I noticed is that while I'm eating, the employees would regularly come ask for a refill or present to you any napkins or ketchup that you need. Good customer service!
name: Whataburger
categories: Restaurants, American (Traditional), Fast Food, Burgers

text: This is the tastiest ramen in Tucson. The broth is rich and filling. The egg preparation is the only thing lacking in this soup..overcooked, cold, and plopped in as afterthought, not seasoned. Chashu is very yummy. Way better than Oban. Karage-don is also very good. The service is busy but friendly. Go for weekday lunch to avoid the lines at this new and popular spot. I'll be back many times.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
A great place for fresh food and a neat little bakery. Breakfast is fantastic, the signature dish "eggs provencale" is great. Very fresh and satisfying. 

The earlier the better, highly recommend you check them out!
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
RAIDER NATION FOR LIFE ~~ RN4L

This location of Famous Sam's is the Die Hard Raiders Booster Club Tucson Chapter's home base and because of that simple fact, I get a tug in my heart, a tear in my eye...awww hell, I get all verklempt. Raider Nation, baby!!!

So yeah, I'm going with 4 stars because the owners basically hand this place over to Raiders fans on game day and their staff works EXTRA hard trying to keep the sea of silver and black happy and for the most part they truly do keep all the patrons happy. 

As for the food - it's fair, probably above fair. The wings are average - the "hot" isn't really hot at all. Chicken strips are fantastic - meaty, moist and BIG!! Steak fingers are just okay. The Jalapeno Bottle Caps are pretty good if you like spicy. Most places seem to use very mild jalapenos for a lot of their dishes like nachos so I was expecting to be bored with the bottle caps. WRONG. They're spicy little battered and fried sliced jalapenos. Delicious! And I've always been a fan of Famous Sam's pastrami sandwiches. It's been years since I had one and they're still as tasty as I remember them. Mmm, mmm, good. 

I must say that Famous Sam's fails in the French fry department. Despite numerous attempts, every time we order fries or they are included as part of our meal, they come to the table limp and undercooked. Recently we ordered fries with nacho cheese sauce and the fries were literally uncooked in the middle. Had to send them back after explaining the raw potato product and our server brought us a new plate. Excited to finally get the fries and dip them, L & I each took a bite and the look of disappointment appeared on our faces. They were just as bad as the first helping. We explained to our server that the fries were inedible but we did not wish to send them back again. She checked on us a few more times throughout the game for beer and water and even mentioned the uneaten fries and how she knew they were unacceptable. But when our bill came, guess what was still on there? That's right - the fries. A quick talk with the manager fixed remedied the situation and all was right with the world again. 

How could it not be? After all, the RAIDERS WON!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
name: Famous Sam's
categories: Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife, American (Traditional), Sports Bars

text:
We made a reservation a week ahead of time for a large group (12 people).  We all met in the lobby, and had to wait 25 minutes until after our reservation time because they didn't have the tables set up yet.  

Once we were seated, the server took our drink orders.  It took 25 minutes to get the drinks on the table!  Then the server took our food order.  Another 45 minutes for 1/2 of the food to arrive.  The rest of the food came about five minutes later.  I ordered lasagna and meat balls.  It was luke warm, and had a bland sauce.   My wife enjoyed her plate of chicken parm and shells.

When the server brought the check, he stood and waited while we counted out the cash and figured out the tip.  That was a little unnerving.

One of the biggest problems was finding parking.  We finally found a spot three blocks from the restaurant.

We may try it again with a smaller group to see if the poor service was just a fluke
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: This restaurant is consistent with good food, new kinds of dishes, excellent choices for vegetarians, the best coffee in town and servers who Are always friendly  and efficient. Super nice patio To bring your dog who also get excellent service. One of the best restaurants in town.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
First visit today. Super small lobby. Not enough seating. The seating they have is overly fancy and impractical. 

Prices were good. Simple menu.

Burger was mediocre. Pretty much Whataburger quality. Onion rings were good. Touchscreen soda machine is slow and annoying. They filled my cup 3/4 full of ice. No napkins or condiments in lobby, very bad design.

Tons of staff but they were more in the way than helpful. They mostly just goofed around. They were training employees and wasting the limited lobby seating.

Overall I think this place will be closed by the end of the year. This might of cut it in New Mexico but we have too many good burger options to settle.

TL, DR: Don't waste your time. Go to Five Guys.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Nothing to complain about. Good food, atmosphere, service, prices. It was nice to go somewhere that probided all of that without goudging you with prices. Clean restaurant. I liked there outside seating....it was covered and ventilated well. I ordered the Monte Cristo and it was yummy. The kids pancakes are 3 good sized pancakes with fresh fruit around it and my hubby got the breakfast sandwich. He said it was good but the bread was a little too dense for him. All in all it was good.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Delicious authentic Japanese food.  Generous portions and VERY reasonable prices. Clean. bright dining room and friendly prompt service.   Couldn't ask for more.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text:
This was our first time at Gusto's and we were very pleased.  Our waiter, Tim, was terrific.  He was attentive, got all of our order correct, and paid attention to all the details. 

My husband had the stuffed mushrooms and loved them. I had the beet salad.  Just the right amount of dressing. Basically a spinach salad with beets, orange sections, walnuts and goat cheese. Delicious.  For my entree I had the sea bass special that was served on vegetable rice. I love the rice!  Almost had a risotto texture that was great. The sea bass was perfectly cooked but a bit bland. 

For dessert we shared spumoni. I also had a cappuccino. 
All in all the atmosphere, the food, and the service were great. It was fairly quiet as it was a midweek night.  I would recommend this restaurant for a nice dinner at it with friends or a date night.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text:
Great little sushi place, especially for a novice. The rolls were great and the menu was informative enough that I felt comfortable with the ingredients. 

The service was amazing. They brought us multiple styles of glasses for our 3 types of alcohol and were cheerful about it.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: One of the top restaurants  in Tucson very nice atmosphere perfect for the special occasion with nice table settings as well.  The menu is excellent French but not over the top so that it limits dishes most Americans would enjoy.  We had something of everything in our two visits during the last several weeks. I love their pepper steak done as it would be in Paris with a rich and very flavorful green peppercorn sauce over a wonderful steak each complemented the other.  Others had fish which was excellent along with escargot, scalloped potato's, soufflés.  The second visit was a group of a 11 which they handled well the combination of wine, cocktails and food with good friends made it a really great visit.   The waiting staff is somewhat young and perhaps somewhat inexperience but very gracious so demonstrating a little patients is a good investment.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: 5 tacos and nachos missing tomatoes and sour cream. Must have ran out of food. Not good.
name: Taco Bell
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican, Tex-Mex, Tacos, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I ordered the Pima Melt Sandwich is my SO ordered the Unforgettable sandwich. I thought my food was fine but a bit too salty. I've eaten at the Baggins downtown location plenty of times and never had so much salt in a sandwich. My SO also thought his was extremely salty and he even had stomach problems afterwards that I will not go into details for the sake of grossing other people out. 

The service was pretty quick, but it could have been quicker if the drink machine was not located RIGHT next to the cashier in a corner. There was a line when I arrived and it was extremely difficult to access the drink machine with the huge line blocking access and limiting the space around the drink machine. 

I highly recommend forming a line to the side by using arrows on the ground or somehow signifying to customers to form a line in the opposite direction instead of a straight line close to the drink machine. 

I don't think I'll go back to this Baggins even though it's located so close to me.
name: Baggin's
categories: Salad, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Soup

text: This spot is so good if you go to ASU, you should transfer to U of A to be closer to this place. Had the special, Indian taco with beef + a soda or bottle H2O for $5.50. Outstanding. Definitely a 3 or 4 napkin joint, don't come here on a 1st date, wait until you can get a little messy at dinner and then come often. It will make your workouts worth it. Enjoy!
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: Best wings in Tucson by far!! My husband and I go there maybe once a week, he goes for spicy and I get "honey hot" (spicy BBQ). The wings are nice and meaty with just the right amount of sauce, and when you buy by the dozen, the prices are very reasonable.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Being an all you can eat buffet I didn't expect much; however, our server Carlos was exceptional he greeted us as we were seated. He checked on us constantly watched him clear a table that just left he made sure to clean the table and wipe every condiment and holder on the table he made sure the floors were clean also.  The fried chicken was so good and crispy and moist it was not soaked in lard. The steak was so soft and juicy it is better than any of the steak we have  eaten at High End Restaurants like Ruth Chris. Would definitely recommend this Golden Corral to all be sure to ask for Carlos as your server.
name: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill
categories: Buffets, Restaurants, American (New), American (Traditional)

text: Panera bread is reliably delicious. Use your owners card for discounts and free treats. I find the salads, even half a salad, to be a large portion. Some of the sandwiches are flat and sad, but the pasta is consistently good. I like how this Panera gives out numbers and personally delivers the food to your table. This location is a nice quiet spot for some along time or a business meeting.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text:
I grew up eating at this restaurant, and nothing has changed over the last 20 years.  Still great quality food and an authentic feel, something you don't get from the national Italian chains.

I love this place for Italian, because they are not the pricey Italian food you get in the foothills that barely fills your stomach, leaving you hungry for more.  They give you large portions that taste great too.

You get awesome garlic bread with your meal.  This is real garlic bread, and not bread sticks.  This is one of my favorite things about Caruso's.

I always get the antipasta for 2 or 3 people when dining with others, as this is a great Italian salad.  The dressing is amazing, and it comes with things like baby corns, olives, tomatoes, onion, artichokes, and peppers.  Its a great appetizer.

The spaghetti with meat sauce and meatballs is my go to dinner of choice.  The caruso sauce is great too, but I just prefer the meat sauce.  The lasagna is also amazing.  They have tons of choices, but I stick to the classics.

The pizza is another good choice if you are with a larger group.

The interior of the restaurant is dimly lit, and has murals and paintings throughout.  The back patio is great if it is not too hot or cold, and is a nice addition.

The service may be lacking at times, but they more than make up for it with the food they serve.  The management should take more care in the service though, because it does upset me at times.  But I can't stop going there as the food is way better than Olive Garden.

Hands down the best Italian in Tucson. Nothing beats this place.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Just had a delicious lunch of their "mixtas": my selection was the brussel sprouts, camote (Mexican purée of sweet potatoes) and steak. Everything was delicious, service was very good, decor is high quality and they were playing great Latin music. I recommend.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Great service and friendly staff. Highly mediocre food. Calamari undercooked and doughy. Spaghetti bolognese tasted like chef boyardi world there. needs improvement
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
The food is amazing, place is pretty, but the staff is unbelievably rude! I cant believe this type of customer service is even allowed. 
My suggestion is to order your food and leave becasue you dont want to miss out on their delicious pastry.. :)
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: The mushroom swiss burger was great, I added sauteed onions. The service was really good, our waitress checked on us several times and made sure we had everything we needed. Nice meal after a day hiking the tanque verde falls!
name: Great American Steakburger
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Bars, Steakhouses, Burgers

text: This is the place for biscuits and gravy. Yum. Takes alittle time once you order to get your food however its cooked to order.  If you get here early especially on the weekends there can be along wait.
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: I have only been here twice but I loved it each time. Both times I opted for dishes with the duck confit. It's nice to be able to get something normally served at fancier restaurants. The croughnuts or dossants...can't remember what they call them here, are sublime. Worthy of a cheat day, for sure!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I kept going back and forth on what to rate this place, If they had a 3.5 option I would probably pick that. The service was good, people were very friendly, may have helped that I got there right at opening and was one of the only people in the restaurant, your experience may be different if its during a busy time.

I ordered the two meat plate with ribs and brisket. The beans and Texas toast were good, nothing to rave about but I would eat them again. The ribs left a lot to be desired, they were dry and very tough, I had trouble cutting through the ribs with my knife, I would not order them again. 

I didn't have high expectations on the brisket after trying the ribs but much to my surprise the brisket was honestly the best I have had. In fact it was so good I added two orders of the brisket to go. My rating would probably be a one or two at most if it wasn't for the brisket.
name: Gary Ray's Texas BBQ
categories: Restaurants, Food, Barbeque, Burgers

text: Nice quaint place, but WAY overly priced. I filled my 64oz growler and it cost $28. Keep in mind prices vary on the beers so it can range. I definitely didn't pick anything fancy or rare. I tried this place because it was close to home; first time fill here. I would stick to the local breweries to fill, it is MUCH cheaper. Catalina brewery is $16, the barrio is $12, tap & bottle ranges around $18. Bartender was friendly enough,  but I won't be back to fill, which is unfortunate because it is called Growler and close to home. Bummer.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: FINALLY - someone that makes street tacos the way you are supposed to!  Great food and location
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Came here one Saturday morning without really knowing what to expect, was a little bit of a wait (20ish minutes?), but was absolutely worth it. Great atmosphere, excellent service, plus it's dog friendly, so our pooch was able to happily come along.

Food was great, we were in the mood for crepes so we had the ham, spinach, and cheese crepe as well as the strawberry crepe. Strawberry crepe was a little heavy on the whipped cream, but the ham, spinach and cheese crepe was outstanding. Overall great and light breakfast meal - we'll be back to try more things on the menu!

If you haven't been to Ghini's before, I would definitely take some time out of your morning to stop by!
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Prep and pasty is an amazing place for breakfast. I have not tried their lunch items but I can only assume they're amazing as well. All the food is excellent and it should go without saying that you have to try a pastry at least once! The manager is probably hands down the best one I've seen at a restaurant, very personal and friendly and always going above and beyond. Only downside is the wait, if you arrive anytime after 8:00 or so you'll be looking at a 15-30 minute wait, even more so on the weekends. Totally worth it to put your name on the waitlist here on yelp and come around the time it says your table will be ready. Otherwise totally amazing restaurant
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We had some great service here and really enjoyed the fresh food. Great place to take someone who has never had a fresh tortilla.
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text: Stopped in and had a nice Gyro. The help was friendly, you can taste the espresso in the iced mocha and they make their bakalava. I took some to go and haven't had it yet.  Lots of egg combinations for breakfast were offered.
name: Sunrise Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Greek, Coffee & Tea

text: Visited Friday November 28, 2014. This was the worst visit we have ever had to a Claim Jumper. It was only a 20 minute wait which is great for this Restuarant. We ordered and then were notified about 15 minutes later that they were out of the rotisserie chicken-3 people of the six ordered this. HOW THE HECK DOES THE CLAIM JUMPER KNOWN FOR THEIR ROTISSERIE CHICKEN RUN OUT OF CHICKEN??? HORRIBLE! Then it took about 25 minutes to get one of our appetizers! KITCHEN SERVICE SUCKS! Two managers (one female & the other male) came to our table to check on how things were- THEY SHOULD NOT DO THIS AS THEIR POOR EXCUSES FOR THE LACK OF CHICKEN & CRAPPY KITCHEN SERVICE WAS RIDICULOUS! The girl manager who visited our table stated, "we were not able to handle what was put on us today!" GET OUT OF THIS INDUSTRY THEN!! Goodness I would hate to see what would happen if they were REALLY busy! Many many many empty tables! Not usual for a Claim Jumper as we have experienced in the past!! Then to make matters worse the male manager visited our table- when I brought up the fact that they ran out of chicken he stated, "that was totally on me as we only had sold 2 chickens by lunch so we only made 4 more so we would not have leftovers?!?!?? What the hell? REALLY- so run out of food to spare a few bucks for a multi-million dollar chain restuarant. POOR DECISION! He also stated that it takes over 2 1/2 hours to cook one of the chicken. NOTOUR PROBLEM! HE IS A CRAPPY MANAGER & FULL OF NOTHING BUT STUPID EXCUSES!! HE SHOULD HAVE NOT COME AROUND TO ALL THE TABLES- HIS LACK OF MANAGERIAL SKILLS ADDED TO OUR NEGATIVE EXPERIENCE! WE FELT BADLY FOR OUR WAITER, DUSTIN. DID AS WELL AS HE COULD CONSIDERING THE CIRCUMSTANCE! After leaving this establishment we looked on YELP- this place only has 2.5 stars! We should have looked at YELP before going here! Lesson learned!
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: We loved our breakfast!  The service was great.  We had Kaylee and she was super nice.  The restaurant is clean and more open than the Thornydale location and the food was so MUCH better!  The home fries were actually cooked!  We will for sure be back to this location.
name: Jerry Bob's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional)

text: I just moved here from California and I  loved the store called Gelsons, Now I have found AJs this store is beautiful just like my store in California, will be visiting often. The meat is great and love the produce.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: I go here a lot, many 4 times a month. Every single time I'm impressed! There brunch is amazing and I love that everything is so fresh!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We had burritos, because you get a lot more than a couple tacos plus it's a lot cheaper and they're so filling. I had one, and felt comfortably full for the whole time we walked around the city after dinner. We didn't drink, but I heard from our uber that they have mango margaritas with a kick that are amazing. They have free chips with each 5 dollar purchase that you pick. They're nice and warm and their salsas are also great.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Foodie Heaven. If you like food, if you really like food, this is THE place to buy it.  The best of everything and many foods you won't find anywhere else. From fresh Lychees and fresh figs, to exotic cheeses from around the world (such as Lancashire Cheese and many more), Himalayan red rice and the highest quality meats, poultry and seafood you'll find. Bar none. So much more it will boggle your mind and your palate. In my first trip I stayed 3 hours in order to see it all.  I even ate freshly made food at their inside eateries and took home cheeses and hand-made truffles. This is a one of a kind experience. But as with all good things, there is a trade off: it is expensive to shop here. The secret to this place is to choose wisely and not visit too often. We shop for special occasions and as a special treat.  Cook at home with the $30 per lb. filets and it is still less expensive then a night in a high end restaurant.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: El Merendero is by far one of my favorite LUNCH Mexican food spots on the south/south west side of town!  When friends are in town - I take them here. All of their lunch specials are great but I enjoy the Thursday Chicken Flautas Special! Price is reasonable at a little over $7 for lunch! Only wish they had a liquor license, but it is what it is?!
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: Great new taproom!!   My dad and I have found a new home!!   Great food, great atmosphere, and beverage selection.   Owner made all of the tables and bar stools.  Very cool place
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: Delicious! Love the free chips and salsa bar. It's a great place for lunch downtown. You won't be disappointed!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Loved it. I am a huge fan of brunch, so any place that has a lot of booze options as well as a good variety of breakfast dishes, both savory and sweet, is somewhere I'd like to go. The food here is delicious. I had the eggs benedict. The cheddar biscuits and pork belly really made the dish a cut above other benedicts I've had. I also got a vanilla latte "dossant" (their version of a cronut) to go and it was also solid. I had a hard time deciding between all the delicious looking options, so I look forward to coming back the next time I'm in Tucson. Well worth the 30-40 minute wait on a Saturday morning.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Driest reuben sandwich ever.  Meat cooked well but sandwich overall lacked moisture.  They ran out of mayo and the cole slaw they gave us just tasted like it was soaked in vinegar.  Yuck.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Came in today and set a wait list reservation and they said it would be about 10-15 minutes. An hour later still no text back and brunch plans ruined...ended taking my girl to chipotle.  Disappointing experience.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We decided to try something new since we had just moved more central from northeast. I did peep Yelp to check out some reviews and figured it was worth a shot. The food was so bland! I ordered the spinach artichoke dip or whatever it was-HORRIBLE. Also we had two kinds of pizza, both sucked. We are big foodies and we didn't even finish half. Maybe I would consider giving this place a second chance, but honestly it isn't worth the money.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
It's a stellar environment, a fun menu, and friendly service coming together to make a good breakfast place. I love the duck confit hash. Super flavorful and addicting. But everything else I've tried has sorta fallen short. Nothing memorable. Tri tip sandwich didn't have a lot of flavor. Pork belly was kinda bland. The French toast was ok, didn't have enough butter in it I think.

It's pretty good but I'd rather go to Roberts or Bobos most days
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: They have some tasty burgers! Their burger burrito abomination is actually really good as well! I would have loved if they had fries as well, but that would be a bit hard. I even got a free meal when they found out it was my birthday!
name: Burgerrito
categories: Food, Restaurants, Mexican, Food Trucks

text:
This restaurant serves possibly the best crepe i've ever had.  The apple rum and chocolate crepe is so sweetly refined, and I haven't even tried the one with spinach which I hear is awesome.

This was my first and won't be my last visit to Ghini's.  I had the opportunity to try the Provencale Eggs which was a perfect meal for the morning.  Dressed in thyme and served with a delicious baguette, I felt so spoiled!  

As for the Baguette Bakery, I tried a few of the desserts- I am not too fond of the Princess.  The Parisbrest has a creme inside of it that is almost like ice cream.  The Almond truffle in which I split with a friend was a little bit of a let down, but was still good.

Come stop in for a warm meal, you won't be disappointed!
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: The waitress was friendly and efficient. The home made potato chips were the best part of the meal. My margarita was lacking in flavor, but my friend said hers was good. My sandwich was a disappointment as there was a lack of flavor. The pork was large chunks, not pulled, and the brisket dry. The sausage didn't look like it had been grilled. Kept putting bbq sauce on for flavor and moisture. The outdoor fire pit had a  layer of cigarette butts, but no appearance of a recent fire. The saguaro rib ceiling lent to the southwest interior.  There are dining tables outdoors that looked inviting. The aroma of mesquite for the bbq was expected but not there. My friend's pork sandwich lacked flavor also. She mentioned that the ladies room needed attention also.
name: Gary Ray's Texas BBQ
categories: Restaurants, Food, Barbeque, Burgers

text: Delicious dishes definitely aiming for the French cafe feel.  Plenty of healthy options to choose from as well as more decadent ones as well. If you are looking for some classic brunch alcoholic beverages they have options as well as a good selection of fancy coffee drinks.  Breads are fresh and closer to the European styles. Pleasant place for a leisurely morning with flavor.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
I will recommed this cafe, It is a small family own cafe. Owner and staff are very friendly. Owner came to every table and greeted us with a smile and asked us how are food was.
Excellent food, service, and decor. Kelly greeted us with a smile and seated us right away. Food was good and filling.
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: After frequenting Fresco Pizzeria for over three years, I consistently put up with the poor customer service, occasional long wait times, and undercooked pizza. Today was the final straw. After not being told the total on my order I was then overcharged for my large pizza. To top it off there was little to no tomato sauce on my pizza and I was left eating essentially cheesy bread. Poor experience
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: meh. this place isn't bad, but i mean i'm certainly not dying for more. its pretty mediocre indian food. the tandoori chicken was super dry, and lacked that awesome flavor i was looking forward to. also, if you're looking for something spicy, make it clear. We got our food medium, and it had zero spice to it. i also think it costs too much for what it is. i dont really recommend it.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: I absolutely loved this place. The outside looks like it's in shambles, maybe some old timey jail or something but the inside is quaint and had someone that reminds me of my grandmother as a waitress. While ordering, it was asked if we could have something added to the order and were told, you're paying for it you can have it any way you like. Now that's some service. The food was delicious and inexpensive too. Fair warning, this place only takes cash though. That should probably be updated in Yelp. I expected to pay with a card, and had to use an ATM at the circle K next door.
name: Ajo Cafe
categories: Diners, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

text:
Wowsa! So the bf and I had a random wing craving after seeing Wing Stop on Speedway but I didn't want to settle for any less. After Yelping it up I stumbled upon Wings Over Broadway, went to their website, and noticed 35 CENT WINGS ON TUESDAY! Sold.

We went there with two friends and it was absolutely awesome. Wait time was quick and the wings were delicious. Imo they were a little too crunchy but that was mostly because of the teriyaki flavor I got. I really liked the mild wings as well as the garlic parmesan as well. The price totally justifies this though and I think I want to make this Tuesday outing a regular occurrence. Yay wings!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
I've lived in Japan for 11 years and this is definitely the most authentic ramen I've had in the states! It's exactly why I've been missing/looking for. It's seriously so good. 

I've had the miso and black garlic tonkotsu l, as well as the karaage and gyoza, and all of it was super good. 

A little pricier than what I'm used to paying for this kind of food, but no real complaint because it is a gem to find in Tucson.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
I love this place .. if they put their price down a notch, they would compete
with another local indian food restaurant! The food is very good! love the buffet!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: My favorite place to go in Tucson to get tacos, no doubt.  I order flour tacos "street style" and usually get al pastor or carnitas - simple, yet so flavorful.  They also give you free chips which are homemade and kept warm along side the salsa bar where you can put as many kinds as you want on your plate (one of my favorite things as I very big on sauces/salsas).  There is usually never an issue finding seating, and even if the line is long it moves very quickly.  They also have a good Taco Tuesday special making it a very reasonably priced experience overall.  A must try!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: This place never disappoints.  A small place and the parking lot is usually crowded, especially on Tuesday wing night or any time there is a big game on.  A local eatery with that hole-in-the-wall feel.  The wings are great and you can order all drums if you want.  A wide selection of sauces for even the more timid that still want a great wing.   Breaded mushrooms are available, but I've switched to the fries with ranch and bacon on top.  Awesome.  You want good food, cold beer, and that nice neighborhood feel?  This is the place.  Seating can fill up (especially on Tuesdays or when there is a Wildcat game on but they won't seat you until everyone in your party arrives.  You've been warned.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Great place for breakfast or brunch. The atmosphere was really nice and the staff were very friendly. The grilled cheese and tomato soup was fantastic. I am not a huge tomato soup fan, but their's is DELICIOUS!! Highly recommended if you are in Tucson.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Good service, reasonable wine prices for a steakhouse, nice southwest flavors on some dishes.  Their best steak was a disappointment.

Dinner here the other night, first time, though we've been to the other El Charro places dozens of times.  Nice ambiance, but very noisy - the place was pretty empty when we were there, I shudder to think of how loud it must be when crowded.

Our server was very attentive, getting drinks ordered, appetizer going, etc.  Nice job splitting our Caprese app on separate plates without out us even asking.  Speaking of which, this was oddly one of my favorite tastes of the evening - the poblano and sauce were a nice touch and added a lot of flavor.

My second favorite taste was our side dish, the roasted Brussels sprouts.  They were perfectly charred, and a good portion for two to share.

We had the ribeye surf & turf special which came with a couple of very big shrimp.  The steak was perfectly cooked and tender, but just a little bit gristly which grass-fed beef often can be.  Our companions had the tomahawk steak, which was absolutely huge (see photo), but after the gristle was removed probably had no more usable meat than our more modestly-priced ribeye.  The price you pay for the "wow" factor of the bone-in cut I guess.

We opted out of desert, just too full.  The tab came in at a reasonable price compared to some of the other steakhouses in town considering we had a full bottle of wine.

Overall a very pleasant experience, but they might need to trim their steaks a little better.  Maybe some of the other cuts would be cleaner.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Karla wants everyone to ask for her.  5 min for the tator tote app, 13 minutes for a burger, fries and the salmon skillet.  First class eating here on a Saturday night bravo Dennys!
name: Denny's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners

text: Best grilled cheese ever!! Go early or be prepared to wait for a table especially on a weekend. We went there on Memorial Day weekend and waited 45min for a table for two. I had the duck confit hash and hubby had the grilled cheese. The had a new pastry chef who messed up the dough for their famous dossant that day so obviously they were terrible. We went back a few weeks later and had their strawberry and maple bacon dossant. I liked the strawberry one better. Parking is limited so you may have to park on the street. Oh and their scones and monkey bread are pretty good too.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: New juice bar on north west side of town.  Easy to get to and lots of parking.  Easy walking from the nearby northwest hospital if you need to get out for something.   We went on a Saturday morning and it was empty.  That may change as people learn of this locally owned business.  Clean and light music playing.  No outdoor seating yet and inside there are 3 or 4 tables for two.  So assume this is more of a to go place.   I got the Tropical Tai-ango.  Presentation was not as fancy as some high end juice bars and there was a lot of coconut shavings on it (more than I would have normally preferred) But the taste was good    Will need to try another bowl.  They offer smoothies, bowls and juices and in the morning some oatmeal offerings
name: Juice Envy
categories: Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Sandwiches, Food, Acai Bowls

text: Went there with my husband and a friend. We waited 15 minutes for our drinks. After we finally got them we ordered our food. It took them over an hour to serve us. The waitress never bothered to check in on us the whole time we where waiting. We got our food and my chicken salad had a long black hair in it. I had to wait 10 more minutes to flag down our waitress . Told her about the hair and showed her , her responds was ok. She took the salad and returned with a new one . Not once did she say sorry or let me tell her that I did want any salad at all. Ended up paying for a salad that I never ate. We will not be returning.
name: Hooters
categories: Sports Bars, Food, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Chicken Wings, Restaurants

text: Food is always good. Service is fast.   Love the location and owners are friendly. Come here weekly.
name: El Sur Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
No flavor... Far too expensive used the yelp checkin for their free breadsticks and I had to argue to 3 different kids before I paid for my 24 dollar pizza. 

The ingredients are higher quality than most but without any pizza sauce what do they expect me to taste. Better off getting takeout from scordatos
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Great burgers I love the green chili on the just enough to spice and the fries are also delicious.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Definitely a top 5 brunch spot in Tucson. Trendy decor. Only drawback is the guaranteed lengthy wait for a table. To be determined if newer spot to the east helps with that. A worthwhile wait regardless.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I was excited to try this new place out after reading all the postitive reviews.  The idea was to come here for brunch, but I should have figured it would be busy on a Sunday.  Not wanting to wait 45 minutes for a table (they were that busy), my friend and I decided to order some of the pastries to go instead.  OMG!!!  They were amazing.  We tried the mango glazed dossant, the original scone, and the raspberry chocolate croissant.  Everything was fan-freaking-tastic, but my hands-down favorite was the dossant.  Have croissant, halt donut, whoever thought this up should be given a medal.  So delicious!  One complaint I do have is I wish they would include the prices next to the pastries.  I'm disappointed I didn't get to eat here, but I'll try again when they're less busy.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Hands down my favorite restaurant. The atmosphere is wonderful, my husband and I always seem to make friends when we are waiting for our table. The food is amazing, and very reasonably priced for the amount you get! If you haven't eaten here yet I suggest you do! Especially if your a fan of italian food
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: These burgers aren't good. In n out is way better and cheaper. The fries are good tho
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Our first stop in Tucson. Everything was very good. I was a bit unsure of the neighborhood being new to the area but the food quickly overcame any doubts I had. Food was delicious.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: So I'm a huge fan of the food and Charro Steaks had become our go to place for visitors and fun nights out. Unfortunately they have decided  to be more of a concert venue then a restaurant. Its incredibly loud so much so the waiters can't hear you, your companions can't hear you and I needed to yell in peoples ears and we were as far away as we could get from the speakers. Although the music was nice and well done I didn't buy tickets to a show, I want to enjoy dinner and talk with my companions. I saw hardly anyone talking. As much as I love the food unless they decide to turn it down (and we did ask) we'll have to find another place.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: So Gluten Friendly! Who knew. I have been allergic to wheat my whole like so I drive by anything that says bakery or pizza. Anyway, a friend insisted I go and to my delight I had one of the best breakfasts I have ever had. I had the AM Relleno. It was unbelievably good and beautifully presented. My husband had the Eggs in the Basket. I was stealing his roasted potatoes which were to die for. The service was impeccable. Our waitress knew everything about the dishes and talked about them with such enthusiasm. They have a mind blowing mimosa menu which was fun. I had the blueberry lemon mimosa and my husband had a prickly pear. So much better than your standard OJ and champagne. Beautiful atmosphere to take some one special. Unbelievable food. I can't wait to go again!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Smallest parking lot ever! Long line, 20 minute wait so not horrible! Food was quick and hot! Portion was generous but didn't have the presentation of some other Ramen restaurants in town. Oyster balls are a pass, potstickers we're flavorable. Service was slow on drink refills even though reminded at least twice. All in all good but not a must return.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Stopped in with my mom and boyfriend on a whim. I had the street fries with asada, plus a taco with al pastor. Everything was delicious! Can't wait to come back!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Okay, I read there was a big problem with the service times. 

It took nearly 45 minutes for my wife and I to get our food. We didn't even order anything complicated. The people sitting next to us were also frustrated. 

My wife and I were excited to try it. The place was packed. There was a sign that said "best breakfast in Tucson" in the front window. 

Our server also looked very frustrated. She barely came by to check on us and ask if we needed anything or wanted a refill because she probably seemed embarrassed. 

The food was brought out and at least it was hot. The food was good, but not great. I brought the wait time up to the woman at the counter and she just said "yeah, it gets like that." She gave us a 10% discount though. 

Would I come back here? Nah. Would I recommend? No.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Awesome place clean friendly burritos are great definitely recommended A++++ will see u guys today.!!
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text:
K, I don't usually go for the janky Chinese buffets, but it wasn't my idea.  Let's do this.

First, it was way nicer on the inside than I was expecting, and much cleaner.  The staff was also quite nice.  Right there - best Chinese buffet I've ever been to!

The sushi was... what it needs to be to keep the operating cost down.  Most was meh.  The mixed tempura dumpling type thing was original, but not great.  The spicy tuna roll was... actually ok!  It had a big chunk of imitation crab (dat operating cost), and the rice was dry, but I think I snarfed down six of them and felt like I had a win for the day.

The rest of the stuff was pretty much to be expected.  There was the assortment of heavily-breaded meats in different sauces.  A non-breaded "spicy" chicken which wasn't bad at all.  Wonton soup (can't go wrong.)  Highlight of the day was when I stumbled upon the gyoza (pot-stickers, fried dumplings, etc) complete with good sauce.

I do feel like I cheated myself by not trying the Mongolian.  Next time.  Yes, I will be back, if only to try the Mongolian and have some more fried dumplings.
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text:
I've been going here regularly for several years and have been pretty satisfied with their service and food.

My order is ready when they say it'll be ready.  The staff there are usually pleasant to interact with, and the price is fine.  The food is good and has been consistent throughout the years.

A couple of times they've messed up my order (that's really not that bad since I've been going here for several years), but they always redeem themselves by fixing the mistake for me, which I really, really appreciate! They actually take care of me, their customer, which is wonderful (since so many other places don't). 

I'll keep going here unless they give me a reason not to.

I've had good experiences here and recommend this place.
name: Pizza Hut
categories: Restaurants, Chicken Wings, Pizza, Italian, Fast Food

text:
If I was only rating the food I might give this place five stars. We has the tikki masala, the lamb samosas, half a tandoori chicken, and some garlic naan and everything was fantastic. If you like flavorful Indian-Paki food, this place is a hit.

The wait staff wasn't all that great however. The young girl that was serving us was very disinterested and disengaged. Don't go in expecting classy service or anything. They have some liquor but don't expect them to know how to prepare your mixed drink of choice unless its as simple as adding ice.  They also have a small wine list; nothing to write home about. I also wouldn't really take advice on any of these wines from the wait staff as I'm not sure they'd be able to help.

To sun up, remember that the food is great. Just go in with the mindset that your service will be poor.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: outstanding food, even the buffet.  crappy service (read *mean*) but will endure for food quality.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Just ordered for the first time from Fresco's. Pizza was exellent! And very happy with the delivery time... arrived within the time they specified.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
I had gone to Native Seeds next door for seeds for my garden and wondered about Amelia Grey's next door. Then when I drove past a couple weeks ago and noticed it was now occupied by a new establishment called Prep & Pastry I checked out the menu online. Everything looked amazing!

I finally got down there on Monday this week and I asked the waiter/possible owner(?) to pick something for me. He picked the brioche French toast stuffed with a berry compote and freshly whipped cream. It was decadent, sweet but balanced, and served with real maple syrup. I also ordered a cup of chamomile tea and they brought it out in a personal size French press. So cute! I also got another to go, at no added cost! 

I also loved the interior. It has a farmhouse or old barn feel about it with chalkboard painted walls covered in cute drawings and quotes. The decor makes you feel good, with so much natural light coming in through the many windows in the building. 

I will definitely be back and next time I'm trying something savory!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I love that we have place as a nice take out Mexican stand-by (you can eat in too).  It's close to our house on the west side.  They keep their prices low, and they're so good!  It's a family run long time business.  It's always packed, you can be guaranteed to be full and happy.  The rice and beans and meat are flavorful and delicious.  I like how they wrap my fork in a tortilla too!  It's a little on the dirty side inside, but I don't mind, I usually take the food out, and we're always super satisfied!
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: We yelped a good italian restaurant in the area of Tuscon and we came up with Caruso's, which ranked pretty high. We were psyched! We entered and were seated immediately. The restaurant wasn't super busy and we were greeted by our server pretty quickly. We ordered a bottle of wine and received it right away and were poured a pretty healthy glass. He also served us some garlic bread that was a little more than toasted, meaning you bit into it and it disintegrated into dust. Oh well. It's only bread, right? No biggie. Our waiter returned and we placed our order. Garlic and Oil. Two Italian staples, right? Nope, not here. We placed your typical italian restaurant order.I got the eggplant parm and my husband got the veal parm. My husband ordered a side of aglio ed olio- garlic and oil spaghetti. The waiter was a bit confused, so my husband explained, "You know, garlic, oil and butter sauteed, spaghetti thrown in?" The waiter acted like he knew what we were talking about and then retreated to the kitchen. A few moments later, he came scurrying back to our table and told us that there would be a $.75 charge for the garlic and butter. Say what? We were a bit perplexed, but we took it in stride. A few minutes later he arrives back again with our dinner that did not in anyway resemble eggplant or veal parm or garlic and oil spaghetti. The eggplant was cut into spears, like pickles, unbreaded, and was thrown into sauce with cheese broiled over the top. The veal was a bit stranger- more of a scallopini sliced very thin, unbreaded with same cheese and sauce broiled over the top. The spaghetti arrived with a literal pat of butter on the top, sprinkled with garlic salt. Yup, no kidding, garlic salt. It was so salty that it was  unedible. My husband expressed his displeasure to the waiter, who scurried away yet again, never to return... Until it was time for the bill, of course. Hysterically enough, they removed the $.75 charge for the unedible spaghetti, but there was no other explanation or apology made for the really substandard food or the resulting lack of customer service. I don't know what these other folks are eating at Caruso's, but we did not enjoy our meal at all.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: I'm from Wisconsin, I visit my Snow Bird parents every Christmas and we go here for the Pack Game. Good wings, prices and service. I'm all a-boot it.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: The prickly pear glazed meatballs were awesome. The filet was super tender and perfectly seasoned. Get the mac and cheese, you won't regret it. My only suggestion to the restaurant would be to ditch the limp green onion on top of the steak.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Been there once,already my favorite breakfast place in town,me and my gf are already planning our next visit. Loved the set up and feel of the place,staff was helpful,upbeat and made the experience even better. The passion fruit tea woke up taste buds up and prepared me for my plate of Duck Confiet Hash which was amazing from the first bite to the last,I also ended up stealing half of my girlfriend's Tri-slidder do to the fact of how good the tri tip was,the amazing house made biscuits,and the jalapeno jam slightly adding some Sonoran to the mix. Looking forward to my next visit for sure.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Awesome food. Awesome beer. Awesome service. I had the meatball sandwich and slaw, both awesome. My favorite beer was the Prescott Achocholypse.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment
