text: I have to agree with Adam. Caruso's is terrible. Ketchup and 40 minute pasta would taste better. Being from NY, I was ushered there the first year we moved here after complaining about the local Italian. Everyone said you'll love this. They were wrong.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: The Crab Rangoon was very fishy tasting with a bad texture. The Sushi seemed fairly old and was falling apart,  The rest of the dishes were OKAY. Several things miss labeled. The fried banana was I think chicken? The chicken was squid or some other sea food. Diet soda tasted overwhelmingly of fake sweetener (beyond what is normal). On the plus side - it had the red bean sesame balls that I LOVE and the Mushrooms were REALLY good.  Not sure I'd go back just for those two things though
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: We had a number of the small plates. They were all very good. We showed up 30 minutes early before our reservation. Although there were a number of seats available, the issue is it is a very small kitchen and everything is made fresh at time of order.  We were very patient and I'm glad that we were. The meal was exceptional. In addition to the small plates that we shared we also shared a main entrée. It was way more food than we intended. Lovely atmosphere, exceptional food. I wish it was closer to where we lived.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text:
Thoroughly dissatisfied. I really wanted to love this place, I've been to the Jerry Bob's on Houghton and had a great experience every time. Jerry Bob's on Broadway is nowhere close in quality or service. I brought in a coupon, and they did not accept it. The stuffed French toast with strawberries and cream cheese was soggy and sickening, completely soaked with sad strawberry juice. A table near me complained about their food taking too long, and seconds later their food was brought out to them. At first I thought the people at that table were being jerks, but after the food was brought out so quickly after the complaint I started to wonder if it was coincidence or if their food was ready and just sitting there. 
I spent more money than I normally would on breakfast because I had a coupon, and they did not accept it. So I'm thoroughly dissatisfied.
name: Jerry Bob's On Broadway
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners, Salad

text: Love Love Love! The food is super fresh and delicious. Upbeat atmosphere and really knowledgeable, attentive and friendly staff. Loved trying the different Mimosas and took home some amazing pastries. I can't wait to go back.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I had eaten once at Blake's in New Mexico and it was pretty good so I was excited when the Tucson location opened. Severely disappointed. I was there on a recent Saturday in the drive though and waited not only for at least 10 minutes for the one car ahead of me to receive what looked like just a sauce packet, but personally for my own food for about 10 minutes. No one even came to the window until they collected my money and handed me the subpar chile cheeseburger combo. The burger was drenched in mustard and the patty tasted fresh off the hockey rink. It was semi cold and soggy rendering anything possibly positive, the cheese and the chilis, just a mess. The fries were ok, nothing special, and nothing about this experience would ever make me want to come back. I should have left while waiting forever in the drive-through as I contemplated multiple times.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: (November 17) I have been to Wings over Broadway a couple times. Recently, I have been dying to get back out to them and gorge on their wings. In my opinion, best wings there is in Tucson, although I haven't tried every wing place. Overall, the service is good, not excellent but just good. As much as I love this small community restaurant, I always get sick after eating there. It's not just sick and feeling off with a stomach ache, it is completely sick with food poisoning for a few days to a week long, sick. Although I love the food, I will not be returning due to getting sick all four times that I have been there. I don't know if it's just me, or if there are others who have got sick? Three stars because I loved this place and food is great, but I couldn't get over that I got food poisoning more then once here. It's very disappointing.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Yum! This place is delicious! We went on a Friday night just after happy hour so it was pretty busy and there was a shortage of seats but it was quick moving and everyone was speedy and helpful. The Al Pastor was super flavorful. There are free chips and salsa and the chips are always fresh. We had classic margaritas which were good but not memorable. The Frescas were also refreshing. Great place for a quick bite to eat and a laid back atmosphere.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: been on multiple occasions and its always as good as before. The wait can get a little long but its honestly worth the wait
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Been coming here for a while now and should have written my raves long ago.  It really is a nice quiet place for my business meetings where we can enjoy a nice wine (great selection since you get it at RR) and a bowl of shellfish.  Staff has always been very pleasant.  The corkage fee seems silly but its not a big deal.  I could see this being a nice romantic dinner...If I could get a date :P
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text: We had the spicy miso ramen. It was THE BEST RAMEN I've ever had. By far. I will be coming here every time I'm in Tucson.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Great sushi. Nice service. Long wait if it's a busy weekend. Store is a little small but oh well. The Sushi a little pricey but I assume most sushi is now a days. I would recommend this place.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: I seem to have an AJ's addiction go there almost everyday. Best meat and fish dept in Tucson. Staff are generally very helpful and friendly best check out staff ever!
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: We went for Sunday breakfast. We ordered the French Toast, Pork Belly Sandwich and Biscuits and Gravy and a dossant. My wife ordered loose leaf tea and I had coffee. I'll start with the service: top notch, really just amazing. You'll notice Phil from Jax Kitchen as a familiar face and he does an excellent job as does all of the other wait staff. Very, very attentive. The food is excellent overall. The biscuits were light and flaky (clearly handmade) and the gravy was amazing. Creamy, flavorful and just right. My pork belly sandwich was equally good. I could have done without the shredded apple and the pork belly didn't seem braised but it was still very good. The french toast was the best! Buttery, flavorful and well executed. We tried to have the original "Cronut" ala D. Ansel in New York, but it didn't work out. I think this would be a worthy substitute.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great place for brunch! The staff is amazing! Everyone greeted us as we walked in. Our waiter was great he filled us in on the menus & drinks.The food was delicious! I Definitely recommend this place.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
This place is always delicious (anything you get is going to be amazing), staff has always been friendly, never hesitant to make honest recommendations and they serve hot tea in one of those cool tea press things which makes me feel fancy. 
Yes, the wait can be long but trust me - it really is worth it to stand around all those smelly man-buns and loud sorority babes.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
My family swears by this place because of the wonderful food at great service. This is a family owned resaurant owned by two brothers and their wives.
A lot of the food is not your standard Szechuan/American hybrid. While they do have a few of the standard dishes that we think of as Chinese like beef with broccoli and Mongolian chicken, many of their dishes are Cantonese style. If you are a fan of Egg Foo Yong, this is the place to get it.
Their lunch buffet is very affordable, at six dollars for Monday through Friday and seven dollars on weekends. This includes drinks. The thing I love about it is it has several very popular standard dishes that are always on the buffet, but also has a few unusual dishes so that your experience at the buffet is never the same.
My dad took my sister and me there last week for a buffet. He doesn't like Hot and Sour soup and devoured it. He was amazed that they even had Chinese desserts, which he loved more than some Western desserts.
name: May Flower Chinese Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: Great ambiance and service! I got the biscuits and gravy with two poached eggs on top--which was pretty darn good. My only complaint would be that my food was a little cold when it got to me. Other than that, I thoroughly enjoyed it.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: So glad we finally made it last weekend, if your from Cali these are the kind of street tacos were used too... soooo yummy .and the torta was bomb
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Know going in, this is a strip mall order at a counter restaurant.
That being said, very interesting sandwich selection.  We had one panini, one cranberry bread with cream cheese, avocado, sprouts(fabulous), and a grilled chicken sandwich, and a fruit tart.  Only complaint is the chicken breast was minuscule, soooo small.  As others have noted, they are a bit unorganized, which slows them down a bit, otherwise, beautiful yummy food and baked goods.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: I can't afford buying groceries here but I enjoy the sushi at the bar especially during happy hour. I think they have the fresh sushi in Tucson.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text:
Literally the best dining experience I've had in Tucson.  
Beet carpaccio was delicious -- light and interesting.
Mussels were really good -- usually Tucson seafood freaks me out -- but no angst here.
Arctic char was perfect -- seriously just go.  Call make a reservation and stop eating subpar food.  Enjoy!
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text: The best authentic Mexican food in town. I always come here for tortillas that come on a variety of sizes.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: I am very picky with Chinese restaurant and Wei Asian café is a great neighborhood restaurant, I always buy to to go and the food is great everytime a must try there are the curry mussels if you like spicy and he Hong Kong beef soup an awesome service and very happy that we should 5 minutes away
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Oooooh weeeee. Went there yesterday and let me tell you brother, it was awesome. 6 of us dudes flew in late Monday night and they were more than welcoming to us. The service was prompt and the prices were very reasonable. The food was great too. *beware* if they come to the table with onions and green peppers.  I tried the green pepper and they didn't tell me it was hot. That thing darn near made my head explode right off. A couple of the muchachos got desert. The fried ice cream was worth it and so were the cinnamon bread things. I rathe this place 5 Phoenix Suns!
name: El Sur Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: I had a great time at Charro Steak. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. Friendly staff and I really liked the look and feel to the place. I had the salmon dish and it had perfect touch of spice with a light sweet sauce. This is a great place to stop in for a drink at the bar, date night, or just to have an enjoyable evening meal. I'll definitely be back and look forward to bringing my family here.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: We were craving good Italian and happened to be walking past here. Outside was cute and so was the inside (if you like dark, rusticky Italian style) and it was PACKED. Must be good right? No it wasn't even decent. First, our waitress took forever to bring our drinks and consistently kept us waiting as she flirted with the old man two tables over. The bread they bring tastes like the garlic bread you buy at the grocery store from the frozen section and heat up. We ordered the Chicken with Stuffed Shells and Shrimp Mediterranean. The chicken was inedible because it was so dry. The shrimp Mediterranean had an OKAY sauce (you could probably make better at home) but the shrimp was also inedible. It tasted like it had been simply boiled for WAY too long (super firm) and just thrown in without any kind of saute or seasoning. These meals were awful... Especially considering they were $14 and $13!!! And the portions were TINY TINY, not that we wanted more. We both ate the pasta portions and left the chicken and shrimp on the plate, but our server didn't notice. We will never be coming back. Please don't even bother you'd be better off going to Olive Garden for better food 100x and better prices/portions. ( I don't normally write bad reviews but this was by far the most disappointing "Italian" place I've ever been to)
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
I've been here more than ten times over the course of my time in Tucson as an undergrad - and it's been consistently phenomenal. The food is great and the atmosphere is always friendly. 

Granted it's not a 5-star restaurant - but it's less pretentious and better than that. If nothing else, the service is impeccable. The pasta is generally cooked to perfection and the Caruso's special sauce is OFF THE HOOK. Sitting outside is a must, as long as it's warm enough in Tucson :-)

Order the "Caruso's Special" with meat sauce and you won't regret it.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Went to Gusto last night after a two year gap to see if things had improved. Food was actually quite tasty and service was good. We had Ceasar salad, tasty but slightly wilted, pasta bolognese and eggplant parmigiana. The pasta was a pleasant surprise and the eggplant was tasty with a crispy crust. Overall a good experience, but wish they could do something to improve the dining ambience relative to the prices. They charge about 30% higher than the place appears it should. Personally I am ok with the prices but don't like the vibe.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text:
The food was very good. I got the "street" style fish tacos and they were delicious. My brother got a steak burrito and was unimpressed. 
My biggest issue was the customer service. The first person in the assembly line seemed annoyed and was short with us. The cashier didn't even ask us if we wanted a drink. I thought that was strange. 
They let you have complimentary chips and salsa which is awesome but half of there salsa choices were empty. 
Overall the food was good but I don't think I'll be coming back.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
First off the friendly and helpful crew epitomized what customer service should be like.
The restaurant was clean and the food was outstanding, and green Chile a New Mexican would be proud of.  Well done Blake's!  #LOVEaLOTA
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Absolutely love this El Sur location!! Always a friendly smile from the employees and amazing food. Prefer this location to their 22nd street location. Great Mexican food at a great price. And, love happy hour too.
name: El Sur Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: You have to go here! We literally were in Tucson for one day while driving cross country and this was the best place we ate all week! It's definitely got that hipster vibe and overall friendly service, delicious food and the wait wasn't bad. Plus there's a free coffee bar while your waiting for your table or you can order a mimosa--you know you want to! Anyways we ordered the smoked salmon eggs benie and pork belly benie (both to-die-for-amazing), a chocolate cinnamon roll (which again was heaven), a berry doughsant (honestly it was too greasy--they looked so pretty I had to have one but this would be a pass on my next visit) and finally a guava mimosa! Not too sweet, just the perfect mix of tropical and boozy for that desert weather!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Will not eat here again! I must admit I have had some very nice meals here in the past. Their basil chicken is very good, tasty and nice bit of spiciness. Last night we ordered basil chicken and kung pao chicken. Could not eat it! The kung pao was tasteless and the meat was absolutely horrible. Not one piece of chicken was edible. Grizzle and chewiness in every bite.
Basil chicken still tasted good but the chicken was the same as the other dish.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: The patio brings visions of the cute scene in "Lady and the Tramp" where they have a romantic moment eating spaghetti. The patio is full of "kitsch" with brightly colored lights hanging throughout, fountains, checkered tablecloths, and candlelight.  I've been going here since I was a kid, and its because their service is always friendly, great ambiance on the patio, and killer sauce. The meal starts with their garlic bread, flavorful to the max (no vampires here), but don't fill up! Their Caruso sauce is so addicting, I wish I could bottle it and take it home with me. I also love the eggplant parmesan, yum!!! The house wine comes in a carafe and is very tasty. I highly recommend this place for an evening out!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Alan was amazing. He's a great shift lead and deserves a raise. Good was also good. Wish napkins were kept in the dining room for guests. Good attempt at customer service but not efficient. More customers are upset they can't find any. Good experience otherwise.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text:
A fantastic surprising discovery! The last time I got takeout pizza a couple years ago, this place just had a counter. Now it's a beautiful dine in restaurant complete with large local draft beer menu, a varied menu, and...gluten free crust! So good!
Charming old b&w family photos on all the walls. Delightful. Service excellent. Pizza, great. We'll be back.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Smells SO good when you first walk into this cute little bakery! Seating outside, or inside (which get a little crowded). I ordered the Pulled Pork Sandwich YUM!! It was so delicious served on a Ciabatta bun. The window of pastries was overwhelming I couldn't pick just one thing to take home- I bought a box of things...Prices were reasonable. I also brought home a loaf of sourdough bread...It was gone the next day! Sliced up and smeared with some butter. Will be back for lunch, pastries & breads!
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: My girlfriend is from Tuscon so when we came in to town, Eegee's was on her list of places we had to go.  I didn't know what to order so our cashier, Luis, recommended his favorite, the pastrami with all the fixings. I would have never thought to order that but I was stoked I did! Thanks Luis! Also, one of the frozen drinks we ordered was to go and the woman that made it over heard me say that and offered to keep it in the freezer until we were ready to leave. Both people I encountered at eegees went out if their way to make our experience great.
name: eegee's
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text: We had a surprisingly nice dinner at Fresco, including some of the best customer service I've ever experienced. The woman that took our order took care of us, served us, and was so genuine and sweet that I tipped her double. There are things about the food at Fresco that are still in tact from when it was Picurro's, which made me happy. I loved that there was NO TV to distract the kids with so we could have a nice family meal. We will definitely go again.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
Ok so I RARLEY eat healthy stuff, but Wendy's Pecan Chicken Salad is my favorite thing ever! I always ask for extra dressing because let's be real I can't eat a salad without it! ( downside-you probably will have to as the cashier a few times for the extra dressing). Other than that the people at the drive thru are usually super friendly and patient as I order even when I have to wait a minute to get my fiancées order.
   Oh and their soft serve is on point! Chocolate milkshakes to die for.
name: Wendy's
categories: Fast Food, Burgers, Restaurants

text:
very cute

basic italian food

but sitting outside
with the fairy lights
is perfect
for a first date
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: I was so excited to try this new place! Even with a 20 minute wait (9 months pregnant) outside of the door, it was worth it! The vegetable ramen was creamy and packed with great vegetables! I can't wait to go back again.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: I wanted to write a review today because of Colin in the meat department. This guy knew his stuff! I was one of those annoying customers asking the difference between farm salmon, ocean salmon, organic etc ... And he patiently talked to me about all of the above plus more. Super helpful! He also helped instruct me on how to cook the fish on the grill vs oven. In regard to the rest of the store, it was clean and well stocked. Very nice grocery store.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: I had the wings from here for the first time a couple days ago. . . The chicken was really good, didn't get a true enjoyment from the sauces though. Being that I had never gone before, I asked the guy up front what his spiciness levels were relative to other wing places. He said "our medium is like the other places' hot." I opted to go with medium so I could get the heat and still taste the chicken, I made a bad choice. It seemed like there was no sauce on them at all. The other flavor was a garlic parmesan. It was okay. I really want to go back to give it another shot. Again, I did enjoy the chicken quite a bit. It was fried to a very nice level :]
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: The food will take care of your hunger, the price is right but not much more. If you don't mind mediocre but fresh food then give it a try.
name: Jerry Bob's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional)

text: This was the first ethnic restaurant I ate at in Tucson many years ago. I had heard that it was serving Kurdish food, and I was excited to try it as I have eaten very delicious Kurdish food (homemade meals) in Phoenix.  Kurdish food is actually more gourmet; the dishes can be very complicated, and the flavors are complex. I tried their Pillaw (a thin puff pastry type shell stuffed with cubes of beef, chicken, rice, and very delicious seasonings). When I told my friends (Kurdish) in Phoenix that I had tried Pillaw, they were very jealous, saying they had never made that particular dish. This was truly a gem of a restaurant (14  years ago). The most recent time I ate there, Pillaw, along with some of the other more ethnic Kurdish dishes, had been taken off the menu. Instead, it seemed to be more like a typical middle eastern type restaurant offering mainly gyros for the entree. Another disappointment was the change from authentic Kurdish music to heavy rock--a type of music played more for the enjoyment of the young servers, it seemed, than for customers seeking something unique or different. In essence, I wish them well, but it seems they have lost their way. If they were to go back to their roots, it could be a very delightful restaurant (again).
name: Sunrise Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Greek, Coffee & Tea

text:
The place was clean, the staff was very nice, my order came out fast, which is all very nice,.............. But.........
I just don't get it, it seems possibly a notch above subway, having been out east, I have no idea why people love this place so much, the sandwiches are not that good!!! Really, they're not, it is the other side of the coin of how people in a lot of eastern cities think chipotle and other such chains are good Mexican food, these sandwiches suck, sorry, also, got a lime "eegees" that was good, yum
name: eegee's
categories: Desserts, Sandwiches, Fast Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Food

text: Great all around. It's downtown so I was expecting a harder time to find close parking but it's in a good corner.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: The fiesta buffet is always really good! We typically go on Seafood Thursday it is really important to get their early or else you are standing in line for 30+ mins to get a seat.  However, when you get it the staff never make you feel rushed and allow you to get you $30 worth of food.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: This is our go to wing place. Been there 100 times and never had food that disappointed. Always fresh crispy saucy piping hot delicious wings and sides. Try the onion rings too! Don't let the divey style of the place deter you... It's just super casual they aren't focused on the building they are all about thier food and service.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: We enjoyed the shrimp fu young. Have had it a couple of times and it's been great every time. Not sure about the other items on menu but will try more of the food over time.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: The food is good but this experience had the worst service. Waited for basically 30 minutes to get our change/cards back from our waitress while we could literally see her just talking with other tables about her fanny pack pins. Super disappointed and a real waste of my time. .... update now it has been an hour
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I was in Tuscon for work for a couple days. I was craving pasta. I knew Claim Jumper served pasta so I went on in. The waitress was nice, the server, the host.. Everything was cool. That is, until I ate the pasta I ordered. I got the black tie pasta.

Bruh... This pasta was sooo overcooked! It was the bow tie pasta. They weren't bow ties anymore. They were blankets!!! They were so overcooked and soft that the middle of the pasta had detached. It was just a bunch of blanket pastas. 

Waitress walked on by and asked, "how's your food".. I said "Its good" because she was nice and I didn't wanna be a headache. (I should've said something lol. I'm paying for this)

Anyways, I finished my food because I was starving like hell. Won't be going back tho
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: We were so excited to find a dog friendly place for breakfast this morning! The staff was super friendly, and the owner brought out some water for my pup and even hung out to visit for a few. On top of all this, the food was phenomenal. Simple, but amazing. By far the best restaurant breakfast I've had in YEARS.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I'm going to start coming here every week I love the brunch menu! the sandwiches and pastries are all so good.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
So wife and I hit up this joint right after the new owners took over and they bent over backwards to see that we were happy with the food. So basically, there are my thoughts:

1.  They do RC Cola products, which is AWESOME!
2. Their gyro is strong, and their crinkle-cut fries hit the spot.
3. I tried the Sonoran Dog, and it was overcooked. I was sad kitty, but understand that mistakes happen.

To me, this is the type of place that will be hit or miss because it's still getting its feet underneath it, and yes, good help is hard to find.  They are open to suggetions, and are looking to make a name in the local east side community.  I wish them the best and plan on returning soon to try something new.
name: Super Gyros & More
categories: Greek, Restaurants, American (New), Hot Dogs

text: We wen't here yesterday for my birthday dinner and it was one of the best places I have ever eaten! The decor and ambiance of this place is outstanding. The service was exceptional along with our drinks and food. We ordered tapas to begin with and then our table of 8 also ordered individual entrees. The entire table was raving about how great the food was and to top it off the desert was phenomenal. The Chile con Carne dough God is amazing along with the Prickly Pear Ribs. I can't say a single bad thing and will absolutely be back!
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text: One of the best places in town to get authentic and delicious Mexican food at an affordable price. The chips and salsa are delicious, and you absolutely have to try the tortilla soup! It's the best I've ever personally had. The service is always attentive and I've never had any problems with any location. Don't listen to the low reviews, people are too hard on this place. All the locations are good, you cannot go wrong with any of them! Don't forget to try the tortilla soup!!
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: The food is always on point, very tasty, great portions, friendly staff.  It's location seems sketchy at first but the food exceeds your expectations.  We have never been disappointed, I hope neither will you!
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Great niche (breakfast/lunch) foodie place. Nice variety of dishes and a hip atmosphere. The mimosa menu is also very creative. Certainly the top brunch spot in the city
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: since day one I have been in love with this place. My first experience with friends was delightful. I had the duck confit......very salty but it was rich and satisfying. I absoultely fell in love with the dossaints. My only complaint is the past 2 times I stopped by just to pick up a dossaint they had ran out. I even called at 10a.m. to see if they had any and they ran out. Mind you it was 10 a.m. I highly suggest they  have their inventory checked out before they lose more business. The eclectic mannerism doesn't help either. Get with it People!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Excellent poker room, very well organized.

Tournaments run daily, and very tight play at $1 / $2 NL tables ($200 max buy-in, $500 pot cap due to gaming regulations)

I didn't play any traditional casino games, but definitely the 'prettiest' casino in Southern Arizona (nearing the Vegas Strip in terms of decor, but obviously not in size)
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text:
I never really cared for wings but then one day I had a great basket full one day and they were delicious. Sadly that was in Florida. Now I'm all about finding some good wings with delicious sauce. 
  
 The wing stop is not too bad, staff very very friendly. The wings were hot, fresh and crisp in all the right places.  the hot sauce was very plain, seemed outta the bottle, no butter or other spices added. It was ok though, the wings were good on there own. It's not like a sit down restaurant, you order at the counter. That's ok with me, it does save on the tip. Oh and the workers are fully dressed. ( I've noticed some wing places the girls wear really short shorts!)
name: Wingstop
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, American (New)

text: The restaurant confused us as we didn't know whether to wait to be seated or sit down so we just grabbed a table. The server was new but she did her best to answer our questions. Food was pretty average, not bad but not great. We didn't expect much from a hotel restaurant but it gets the job done.
name: Finnegan's Pub
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Restaurants, American (New), Bars, Irish

text:
Perhaps we have different tastes up here in Phx, but I thought these tacos were pretty standard. I ordered a fish and a carne taco on flour tortillas and street style, Both were beautiful, but both were so salty it was hard to eat them. David ordered pretty much the same thing, and but his second carne taco he agreed with the salt level (he was just so hungry, the first one didn't register). We also spilt a quesadilla, which was pretty good.

They were busy when we arrived in the late afternoon, and a continuous flow of patrons went through their doors. So, maybe we just got the batches that were over salted?
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Dough god tapas was great! Chili con carne was amazing! Just like home! Great ambiance! 

We also tried the chicken, fell a little flat ...completely redeemed by the dessert! 

Great to see an indigenous inspired / woman owned restaurant in the heart of downtown! 

We'll be back for sure!
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text:
Love the food! I have always had impeccable service when Bo is my server.

 Everything takes a while there to have your patient pants on and enjoy the scenery / conversations. 

For some reason this is the place people go when they feel like they need to sit and have a 3 hour conversation to catch up... Aka, walk in expecting to wait for a table. 

It is worth the wait
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Tons of food for the $.  Awesome happy hour prices! A must try!  The  best chicken fried steak on the planet!
name: Great American Steakburger
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Bars, Steakhouses, Burgers

text: Was there 3/5/2015  and it was my second time there first was invited by and the food was ok so i decided to give it another try and order take out for the family Order 100 piece and two orders of famous fries . I got home could wait to try as they smell sooo in the car. Tried the the Golden heat was on point fresh crispy juicy meat the garlic parmesan were as well. Next tried the Habenero heat oh man were they gross they tasted of raw garlic and raw Habeneros the wings were hard as well and just tasted awful ! That's when I noticed the wings were not cooked fresh they had been re cooked or re fried  25 wings down the drained never tasted wings so nasty it just ruin my n everyone's appetite to eat those we next got the honey BBQ nothing honey about they were over loaded with pepper to the point they were pepper spicy and were even more hard then the other ones a the sauce was ok but when the wing is not edible it just ruin it. The fries also were not fresh as well it may have been due to the oil needing to be changed as often  they were fresh but tasted burnt n of old oil. The fact that half the wings were fresh and the other half was not tells me this place is cutting corners or they are getting lazy and not doing the basic of running a restaurant like keeping  the food  fresh and keeping  the place tidy. Just remember also the carrot sticks and celery were not fresh as they tasted like refrigerator like a not so fresh refrigerator and did not have a crisp to them . Nasty as well. I would not recommend this place to anyone that likes fresh food but if you enjoy twice cook wings hard with black n burnt  chicken meat then you are the rarity and this is for you! Stay away. Eat there if you must try it as the dine in experience seem better for me than the take out but that just speaks of the inconsistent service.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
I've been here twice.  Once for my birthday and the other time was just on a whim.  The servers were great.  It's a little dark but just about perfect.

Their food was salty.  I tried the BBQ ribs twice.  I'm a huge BBQ ribs person.  This didn't hit the spot at all.  I'd rank their ribs as the worse or second worse in Tucson.  Their cornbread.  Definitely the best in Tucson.

Their coleslaw was delicious.  I'd get that and their cornbread every time.

The Chocolate Motherlode Cake was great.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Been waiting a very long time to visit this spot. One word "LOVE" . Fresh food, friendly and fast service. Atmosphere is fun.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Great place for brunch. I'm a college student here and breakfast was fantastic and fair prices. Highly recommend!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Ordered bone-in buffalo wings and a sort of "build your own" vegan pizza. My wife says her pizza was delicious and she loved the vegan mozzarella. I was worried about the wings due to other reviews and therefore, was sure to order them well-done. The Buffalo sauce is thin and I couldn't tell the wings had sauce. They were definitely cooked through, crispy skin and piping hot. Just be sure to order the wings well-done if you are worried about the other reviews. Attentive and kind service, I  plan on returning.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
I'm not a buffet girl. Food sitting out, people's hands on the tongs, the tongs in the food. Shiver. 

But my father-in-law is on a low carb diet and this place works for him. I was genuinely impressed by the inside - clean and cozy. The service was great - very friendly - the tables were cleared and the drinks were refilled immediately.

The food was on-par with your standard Chinese place, if not a little higher. I couldn't bring myself to try the sushi, but my hubs said it was fine. The overall variety was impressive. The desserts leave a little to be desired. 

If you're into Chinese, if you're into buffets, if you're into inexpensive Chinese buffets, this is your place.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: There's always a long wait, but it's for a reason. There are options for restricted diets such as vegan and gluten free. Definitely worth a try.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: First the wings were awesome huge wings . we sat near the bar  we had speedy service. We order some fries ,when the fries arrived we found one or too fries not actually cooked all the away the stuck out since the fries were a nice brown color and the uncooked fries were white, So I notice them right away. They also forgot my side of ranch Lame! but I didn't give up, before we were half way tru with the half order of fries our wings came out.I would have been happy with the fast service but the table was so small that all our food was jam packed together. It was very warm inside the have swamp coolers no actual air conditioning . the hostess was also the buss boy I guess since she picked up most of the baskets I ask  some one working there for a leftover box but the never brought it so when I saw the hostess  I ask her for a box and she finally brought me a box  then we walk up to pay for our order of 24 wings A half order of fries and 3 beers the server who took our order rang up our ticket and and it came up to 40$ even no taxes or change just 40$ i dint get a copy of my receipt I don't understand why was it and even number ?and how come I didn't get a copy of receipt lame!!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
I am big on customer service and the hostess was on her phone most of the time and didn't have one smile slide across her face while we were conversing. Quite honestly I felt like I was a burden coming into eat. Our waitress had the same sort of vibe... You could obviously tell she wasn't excited to be at her job and that my boyfriend and I were just CUSTOMERS to her and not GUESTS.

 As for the food I kind of lost my appetite while eating. I just didn't feel at ease about the cleanliness of the whole restaurant and the food was just questionable especially the orange chicken that was an odd type of squishy. To give them some credit their ice cream was pretty dang good but not worth the $20.00 spent for 2 people to eat lunch. MY ADVICE WOULD BE: IF YOU HAVE A CRAVING FOR CHINESE FOOD, JUST STICK WITH PANDA EXPRESS...
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: Loved loved the food! While visiting Tucson, I was looking for a local eatery and found the perfect spot. I would highly recommend.  Food was eclectic and yummy!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Friendly staff, quick service and delicious food. Just a little cramped inside other than that, would recommend!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: The rudest bar tenders in Tucson Mark is a giant stress mess every time I've been in and can't keep track of orders or paid tabs. JOJO is a real I can't even say the word on here..... After serving me an appetizer with uncooked bacon decided to pay to try something else tried to order sliders without the burger and she said " does this look like fucking Burger King?" I will never come back here worst staff of any establishment I have ever been to.....
name: Famous Sam's Restaurant & Bar
categories: Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text:
So, I want to start this review by saying I am not a fan of Chinese food very much.  So three stars from me is like a five star from anyone else.

The food here seems fresh, and I really liked the mushroom sautee thing they had going on.  The service was nice, and they kept our teas filled and the tables clean (at a buffet, that's really all there is to it)

Oh, dear God, the crab puffs.  They are SO good!  And you can just pile them onto your plate.  (Yes, that's what a buffet is, but they are so good I was so happy that I got to eat all I wanted).
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: The food is spectacular. Probably the best breakfast I ever had. Got the Monte Cristo sandwich and orange juice. Very good meal. I would rate it 5 stars if not for the hour wait and our less than friendly wait staff. He only came to the table twice and never brought the condiments I was waiting for.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I went to P&P on a Saturday about 20 minutes after it opened because I read reviews about long wait times. The wait actually wasn't horrible, only about 15 minutes.  

The decor is fresh and rustic. The service was great and the food was excellent! I ordered the duck confit hash which I highly recommend. The portions are large and pretty filling. PP ordered the french toast and fried chicken was freaking delicious! I know because I ate his leftovers the next day lol. 

I'll definitely be back!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Have made a few trips here over the last couple of months and both the food and the service is always excellent. On my last two visits I had the pleasure of being seated at a table in Charlotte's area. On previous occasions the waitresses were very efficient and knowledgeable about the various dishes, but Charlotte seems to bring that something 'extra' along with perfect service. A charming personality that makes you feel like she's happy you've chosen Caruso's for your dinner.

*Note to manager/owner : As a manager  myself for several years in the retail business, I want you to know she did everything the right way business-wise. When she arrived at my table with the glass of ice water she also asked if I would like a glass of wine to start things off, then throughout the meal stopped by several times to inquire if everything was OK and could she do anything else to make my visit even better, perhaps another glass of wine? 
 At the end of the meal she brought the dessert menu and was ready to make a suggestion if I had left any room after that fabulous meal of clam sauce and red marinara over angel hair pasta. All this in spite of it being a Friday night between 7 and 9 o'clock when the restaurant was busy busy busy. 

Is this the kind of service customers should expect at a restaurant? Of course. Is it the kind of service you get in most restaurants here in Tucson? No.
Her excellent service, individuality and personality have made each visit a pleasurable one. That's why Charlotte really stands out in the crowd. 
And the food? 5 stars.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Loved the customer service !!!great people . And very satisfied with our donuts. I love the bags such a great touch !!
name: Donut King
categories: Restaurants, Donuts, Food

text: First time I've been in eegee's in a couple of years I live within the mile. There were a lot of cars in the Drive-Thru so they must know something. We went in I ordered pastrami my husband ordered a meatball sandwich and I have to tell you it was great the pastrami was lean, it wasn't fatty. I'm glad I gave it another shot it is right in our neighborhood and we weren't going to go back because I got a fatty pastrami.  Today it was perfect
name: eegee's
categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Food

text:
My husband and I are HUGE fans of this place.  Kelsey (sp?) is wonderful and the food is really really good.  We'd been there once before for breakfast and I let one little thing turn me off - that the very good coffee served was served with those awful little creamer containers instead of milk.  Anyway I thought I wouldn't go back because of that and now am soooo glad I did.  Yes, they still served coffee with those horrid containers but I'm pretty sure if you ask for real milk they'll bring that to your table instead.  And....

the food, or at least what we had this time, was incredibly wonderful.  My husband had the best reuben sandwich he's ever eaten (and we're dreaded New Yorkers!) and I had the best cheese grits I've ever had.  We are definitely going back and back and back.

If you're reading this, Kelsey, thank you for such wonderful food and as I said, my only  wish would be serving real milk with that excellent coffee.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Machaca chicken burritos are incredible!!! Their tortillas are fantastic as well, and I'm pretty sure they double-wrap the burritos since their tortillas are pretty thin (I know you can pay extra on some things to have it double-wrapped, but I remember there being two tortillas on my burrito without my ordering it that way). The machaca beef is good, but definitely not as good as the machaca chicken, and you can get it take-out style in giant containers for a great price! 

This place is one of my must-hits when I'm in Tucson, and it's SUPER close to the freeway! And if you're in the mood for dessert, their tres leches cake is incredibly moist and perfectly sweet-worth taking a few Lactaid pills for. I recommend this place over all other quick-serve/fast food Mexican joints in Tucson!
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: I come here for family dinners maybe once or twice a month, and the server I had is so friendly and the food is always amazing. The Peking duck is my favorite dish, and recently they started serving boba! My favorite(:
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text:
I would like to preface my comments with this, I hope that the manager  / owner reads these comments.
I would rate my service and customer experience as poor. I made an online order at approximately 10 minutes after the hour. I arrived twenty minutes later at half past the hour.
Not only was my order not ready but it wasn't even started. 
So I took a seat and started the wait. While waiting I had the unique opportunity to listen as the two workers behind the counter discussed their pay in comparison with other Wingstop resturants in the area, even throwing in a few choice expletives.  
My order was ready at ten til the hour for a total of 40 minutes. That is poor service and I will not be stopping at this 
Wingstop again, and if I were the manager there would be some changes behind the counter.
name: Wingstop
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, American (New)

text: AWESOME BRUNCH! Favorite restaurant I've been to in Tucson! The service was spectacular and the food was artistically delicious! Our party of 6 all ordered something different and all were fully pleased!!! The food was fresh and paired with amazing flavors! The price fit the amazing quality of food we ordered. Lastly the service was above satisfactory- we had 4 different servers come to make sure we were all accommodated. Will definitely be back.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Prep and Pastry has great food and wonderful service.  I take all my SV friends there and it's my favorite brunch spot.  The only reason that I don't give them 5 stars is because they don't take reservations and the wait can be ridiculous, especially on the weekends and they only serve my favorite dish (Breakfast Poutine) on the weekends.  But I take my four year old there and they are so sweet to her.  I highly recommend it, unless it's a weekend and you are super hungry.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
We've gone there once a couple years ago during the Tucson Gem and Mineral show. The food was good, service was decent. 

We will try to go back if we are in the area again.
name: Kettle Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Clearly just about every girl in this hooters is new. That being said, it was nice to see Angel back at it!! I was a regular at Hooters when it was on Tanque Verde and this is the third time I've visited this location. With Angel back, I've found my new home again. Anyone looking for a good experience at this Hooters should ask for her. She is what Hooters service is all about! Oh, I also love all the new drinks. The bar looks amazing, the restaurant looks amazing, the food taste great. I'm looking forward to going back.
name: Hooters
categories: Sports Bars, Food, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Chicken Wings, Restaurants

text: Food was pretty good , nice setting. Very warm and welcoming atmosphere. This place is in my top 5 for Indian buffet in Tucson.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: This is one of the best authentic Mexican restaurants in Tucson. I was there with a friend who was visiting from out of state.The food was great! The green corn tamales never fail to amaze me. The waitress was attentive and friendly. My only complaint is when our third friend had come in trying to find us, the hostess was not very hospitable, She stated that there were no" 2 women here".
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Great hole-in-wall breakfast place.  Out of the way for me but worth the trip.  Southwestern/Native American styled foods, lots of corn and chile flavors, and a variety of great homemade sausage.  Day-of-the-Dead reminiscent artwork on the walls.  Good service generally, but management is a little sketchy - one trip across town resulted in finding out they were closed because they ran out of ingredients.   A unique restaurant in Tucson.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Ordered some take out with a large group and let me first say they do take out perfectly right. They have each person's order separated by check and in different bags so they are easy to find and you know what's in the bag without opening all the containers!

I ordered lamb korma with a veggie pakora and a plain naan.  We fought a little to get some rice (my co-eater had to pull out some language skills on the phone when ordering to get it for us complimentary).

It was pretty good lamb korma.  Very tender, great sauce that I just wanted to keep eating.  A little oily but that was the only downside.  The veggie pakora was good as well and still crispy despite the drive. I thought it was a bit heavy though with too much potato.  The naan was too dry or too thin for my taste.  Baked to the point that I couldn't use it to soak up anything and had to rely solely on the rice to get that yummy sauce onto my taste buds.

I would definitely eat here again though and I am looking forward to my leftovers (always a good sign)!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: I really should have read reviews before we stopped here. This place has gone down hill in food quality. We ordered zucchini as an appetizer and it was terrible. How lazy is the kitchen staff when they don't even bother to put bread coating on to stay on the zucchini?! For entree Hubbs ordered potato cheese soup and I ordered hickory burger without the bun with shoe string fries. I guess the soup was OK since he didn't complain. Hickory burger was very small but the flavor was fine. All the condiments were sad though. Wilted and brown lettuce, frozen, mushy tomatoes, off tasting pickle chips the bacon, cheese and BBQ sauce were the high point of the burger. The fries are described as salt and pepper shoe strings... Well they are about 50% correct. Hardly any salt or pepper but they were shoestring. I've had a better burger/fry combo at Freddy's steak burger. Our final bill came to 33.48!!!! For what?! These people have some nerve charging this kind of price for subpar food. Don't bother stopping in here for fine dining.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: The food was not good at all. Tacos were soggy, rice was hard tasted like yesterdays rice, ordered Chile verde chimi, was not told they don't make chile verde so the waitress decided on her own to serve me carne asada chimi with some green chili inside of it and green enchilada sauce on top.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text:
It is not often that I crave French cuisine...  Honestly, I just can't think of a time where I suddenly had a huge urge for frogs legs, but over the years I have heard so much about Le Rendez-vous I figured it was about time to give it a try.

We ate there shortly after the new Executive Chef took over this spring.  My dinner date and I went all out.  We had the escargot and the mushrooms in puff pastry.  I am not an escargot fan but my dinner date really liked them.  However the mushroom appetizer I ordered was to die for.  I think I would have poked him with my fork if he wanted to try a bite!  I am tempted to go back once a week just for that.  

After hors d'Oeuvres I was already filling up but went for the scallops which were melt in your mouth delicious.  My date had the Veal with caramelized apples.  He was very pleased and said it was a much better version of his favorite pedestrian pork chops and applesauce.  

For dessert, both now bursting at the seams, we shared the Crapes Suzette prepared tableside.  They were not on the menu but someone had recommended them and the staff was happy to make them for us.

Next time I go back I want to try the Happy Hour in the bistro which features small plates so that I can sample more before getting completely stuffed!

A note before you go - this restaurant is designed for dining.  Be prepared to spend an hour and a half or so if you decide on multiple courses.  For us that was no problem!
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: This is one of my husband's and my favorite restaurants to go for lunch or dinner, although it is kid-friendly as well.  Usually my husband and I split a soup and a salad, and we occasionally split an entree as well.  (The portions are very large).  My favorite entree is their fettuccine alfredo, (I am extremely picky about alfredo sauces that they not be too thick or too runny, but this is the best I have had in town).  I have also loved every other entree I've tried.  I also love their ceasar salad, but I noticed some reviews on here saying bad things about the salad.  Keep in mind that this is authentic ceasar salad (with sardines, etc.), so if you aren't used to the "real thing," you may be surprised with what you get!  This version is not your typical "out of the plastic bottle" salad dressing; they make it there from scratch.  I believe their soup changes each week and my favorite is their cream of mushroom soup, (but I've been pretty happy with most of their soups).  If you're looking for a nice, quiet meal of authentic Italian food with a great wait staff, this is a wonderful place!
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text:
I've enjoyed every visit to Ghini's, and this time I have to update with a 5 star review for one reason only:

The meatloaf sliders.

Mon Dieu!!!!

I finally got to go to Friday Night Bistro, which was busy but not so packed that we had to wait. Gas heaters on the patio were very handy as I didn't want to take my 6-year-old dinner date inside with the nice tablecloths. I very much enjoyed my house greens with delicious fresh tomato slices and the amazing mussels in a delectable broth, but the show stealer was the meatloaf. Nestled in each of three beautiful, gleaming, fluffy, perfectly crusty brioches, tucked in with fresh spinach, were three of the most delicious slices of meatloaf I have ever tasted. I want this recipe; I don't know what she put in there but you should go and try it. The meatloaf is a blend of meats and spices, probably pan-finished to crisp them to bliss. I think sautéed onions may have been involved too. My date didn't want to try them at first, but once he had a bite, he inhaled the rest. So much for Zen dining...but at least he was happy and well fed!
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
If I could describe this in two words, it would be amazing and affordable! The food here is absolutely delicious! I especially enjoy the Tikka Masala dishes, but the Vindaloo and Rogan Josh are also delightful! I usually enjoy my curry with a good deal of heat, but they will ask what spice level you prefer, so you can get anything from mild-extra spicy!
Along with your curry, you can enjoy rice and/or naan bread. The naan bread is solid, but the rice is incredible! It's super soft and really compliments the curry entrées!
Now, if you find the curry a tad spicy for your tastes, you can cool down with one of the most amazing drinks found in Tucson. Ladies and gentlemen, I am speaking of the legendary Mango Lassi. Now you can get one of these at any Indian restaurant, but there is no Mango Lassi out there like this one. It's fresh, sweet, and creamy and will quench any fire in your mouth from the curry.
TL;DR- order a Tilka Masala dish along with a Mango Lassi for an amazing and affordable meal!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: I've only had one experience with this place, and I want impressed, though my wife enjoyed her breakfast. She had the beni, eggs Benedict.  I think Beyond Bread has far superior pastries just across the street (kouing aman is amazing).  Cronut was sub par, and can't remember the other food I had because it wasn't very memorable.  I really wanted to like this place, baked goods are my favorite.  I do plan to give it another shot, and will update my review if my opinion changes.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Amazing biscuits and gravy!  They were HUGE!  If you are in the area stop in and try them.  You won't be let down
name: Old Times Kafe
categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Diners, American (Traditional)

text: This is hands down one of the best if not the best pizza I've had. And this was a GF, dairy free pizza! Usually with those requirements pizza tastes like garbage but even my husband said it was phenomenal. Better than his. The amount of toppings you can choose for only $8?!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Nice staff and clean little restaurant. Authentic and tasty. One of very few places that offers pozole.
name: Angela's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: This place is worth it for the tikka masala and nann alone. I've had several different dishes here, and they're great every time! I've never been to the lunch buffet everyone is talking about, but I'll have to try it out!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Awesome quality. The chicken fried rice was prepaired fresh and was the best I've had in town. Yhe spicey tuna roll was amazing. Prices were very fair and reasonable. Great place
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: This is the best chorizo breakfast burrito I have ever had. Tortillas are made right there daily. Can't wait to try everything else. My only complaint was no ready coffee and she didn't seem inclined to make any
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text: I love this place for lunch! I work across the street and everyday that I work, I always call for their bistro menu and soup of the day. Actually, all my coworkers do it too. They got a salad bar and a sushi bar, with a sushi chef! If I dont like anything from the bistro, I'll grab a sandwich. The Arizonian (salmon, cream cheese and capers) is my fave. The pizzas are huge and they're only 3 bucks! This is a fine food market so you know you're getting quality food. And their desserts... are so heavenly (angels ahh-ing).
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: This is one off my favorite brunch places in town. The pastries, the French toast, THE MIMOSAS. I've never had anything here that was not delicious. They even have healthy options too. But who can pass up on all the goodies and"French" brunch cuisine. If I could I'd come here and drink the cure with duck confit hash everyday!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Worked downtown for a few years. Nice lunch spot if you want something fast. The food isn't that great, but good if you're on the go. An it pricey in my opinion. I had the chicken tacos and they were dry.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Wait was long. Staff was completely lost and delivering the wrong orders. Food was cold and sauce had no flavor. We won't return.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Loved my authentic baklava and double espresso. Quick and friendly service with a smile. I shall return!
name: Sunrise Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Greek, Coffee & Tea

text: Best Native American I ate the Green chili with lettuce and tomatoes! It was awesome! Have been back a few times!!awesome!
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: Although it was crazy busy (brunch time Saturday morning), the food was fantastic. We tried the Monte Cristo and were not disappointed. The bread was rich, cheese creamy, jam delicious, and ham perfectly cooked. We also tried the dark chocolate strawberry danish, which was awesome and highly recommended.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great to have downtown. Like others said, it's like a local Chipotle except this a bar and more booze. Free chips and salsa is a nice touch. Their carnitas was okay but their Carne asada was really good, better than Chipotle's. The margaritas was expensive yet good, but it was with Patron, what do you expect. I would definitely recommend going here to watch a hang or hang out with friends. The open air environment is very welcoming.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Best lunch buffet in Tucson!  A great spot for Indian food, I've been coming here for years.  Never had anything here I didn't like.  Their aloo gobi is the best in town, and the naan is always fresh and tasty.  Dinner here is also great, although service can be a little slow at times.  When you pay make sure to grab some candied or sugared fennel seeds, they are the perfect ending to a delicious meal.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Wow!  Maybe the best breakfast in Tucson! Great service!  Best cup of strong, smooth coffee!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Probably my favorite pizza in Tucson. And the antipasto is good too. However, more often than not, the service is hectic and spotty. So I'd recommend getting take-out.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Delicious brunch food. Very good brunch food and drinks. I really liked the bloody mary. Service was excellent and the atmosphere/ambience was very clean and nice. I plan on going back soon.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I have been several times and recommended to visitors.  Everybody has been very pleased.  I am a foodie from the East and Europe and was quite surprised by the quality of the food and the freshness.  I very rarely eat fried food but was totally happy with the pakoras (spinach and vegetable).  It was apparent that they had just been made and the chickpea flour covering was a tasty combination of crunch and chewiness.  With our guests they were gone in a heartbeat.  We had several curries, mostly lamb and chicken as well as naan and papadam.  A nice assortment of well priced Indian and other beers to match.  Friendly, knowledgeable and efficient service.  I think they are seeing the success they well deserve.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: This is by far my favorite breakfast spot in all Tucson.  The food is fresh, local, and delicious!  I've never been disappointed by a dish.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Love this place! Changed up my usual from the Eggs Provencail to the Roasted Garlic and Brie Omelette with a side of bacon...Frickin' delicious! Probably the best bacon in the city! Consistently good food and coffee
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Amazing service and amazing food! I'm not a big fan of sushi but my boyfriend loves it. They do have other non-sushi items. I love their orange chicken! It's a million times better than Panda Express. My boyfriend normally gets the Las Vegas rolls and he absolutely loves them. The place is small (only like 10 tables) but the service is great.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: I Love this place, myself and my family(including 3 kids) come here all the time. All the servers are very nice and welcoming. They are very attentive. I love the bobba teas and if I ever have questions about the menu the girls are so kind and friendly. I love eveything I've tried so far. My favorite so far is the udon soup and peking beef. The bowl of udon soup is so big we shared it with 4 people and still had some to take home! I am constantly recommending this place. They do also do delivery, but my house is a ways away from the resturant so I havent tried it, but I am actually within the delivery area.
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: Pretty good food. We had the strangest and the pushiest waiter ever. He kept grabbing our drinks before we finished. Would of spoke to the owner but he spent the whole time talking to one other table. Overall a strange experience. Have to say it's really neat inside and overall the food was tasty.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: Awesome place! Food is great and service is amazing! They had no problem that my family took over more than half of the restaurant (big Mexican family) lol! So attentive and and welcoming!!!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: We liked this place. Tacos small but really good. Great free salsa bar & chips. Don't get the nachos. Margaritas fresh ingredients but need a bit more lime & tequila. Good service. Will be back!!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: One of the best Ramen we've had.  We travel extensively throughout the States, and this place is truly authentic.  They even speak Japanese!!!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: What a great place!! Tri-tip sandwich was amazing. My wife enjoyed the Monte Christo. The star of the show is the "Dossant."  Their take on the kronut. Service was stellar. Definitely a star of Tucson
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I usually try to give some spots a couple tries before I write a less than stellar review just in case they were having a bad day, but it seems like this place gets worse each time I go. I will say that the steaks looked delicious and my dad's was exactly as he ordered it - medium rare. However, avoiding red meat for the evening, my selection was limited to fried chicken, more fried chicken, and greasy (but moist and yummy, albeit salty) rotisserie chicken. It seemed like 75% of the selection available was fried or drowned in grease. The fried okra was over cooked and chewy. The "fresh grilled corn on the cob" was clearly boiled in water. The fresh vegetable selection was lacking and healthy meat options were non existent. What looked like a hockey puck seemed to be some burnt beef of some kind? All in all, I certainly don't feel as if I got $12 worth of food (and I prefer quality over quantity). I left feeling like the kitchen staff just gave up and threw everything in the deep fryer or pot of boiling water or microwave, but I'm not in the back to know what they did. Unfortunately, I think I'm done giving this place its chances.
name: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill
categories: Buffets, Restaurants, American (New), American (Traditional)

text: The location of this restaurant was super convenient for us since we were traveling. It is right off I-10 and is easy to find. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by staff and were seated quickly. Upon the first 5 minutes of arrival, we had 3 different people greet us and come and ask if anyone had taken care of us. They were all very friendly. They had a menu with lots of variety. We arrived during breakfast, and they also had a buffet style breakfast as well as ordering options. This restaurant had authentic Mexican food that reminded us of grandma style cooking! The only reason I did not give this restaurant a 5 star review was because I felt that the overall appearance of the restaurant did not give it justice. It has older decor inside and out, and had we not have heard about it from a friend, we would have never stopped. Still, based on food quality, location, and staff this restaurant was a great choice!
name: Kettle Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Wow!  I got mine to go. It was phenomenal. I don't remember exactly what I ordered by name but it was more than I expected !!!! I live close by and will be back Multiple times!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Road tripping for the Thanksgiving Holiday and found this little taco joint. Nice an simple, the name is what you get. The wife had the fish and asada and I had the carnitas and Al pastor. Our son had the churros and nachos. Did not disappoint. Wasn't a big place and not really any parking, but good none the less. The beer buzzers are a cool idea too.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: They make great cakes!  We use Village Bakehouse for all of our special occasions and they always knock it out of the park.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
Was super excited to take my husband here for lunch ... but what a disappointment. The ambiance, decor and service were as good as last time, but the food ... needed some work.

I had seen all the amazing photos of the grilled cheese, so I had to have it. Mine didn't look like the pictures though. The ratio of bread to filler wasn't great and the tomatoes had the hard cores you can't really eat. The soup had a skin on top and was really gelatinous. The sammie and the soup were both luke warm. Husband's meal (the dip) was about the same.

It was a sad, sad day. I'll give it one more go because I was so impressed by my first visit ... fingers crossed this was a fluke!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Really good food clean restaurant well-organized friendly staff I will be back even if I have to wait in line outside it's worth it. They have the goods plus they have some options for gluten-free, Seafood, Etc. One of the best ramen spots in town. Be ready till wait a couple minutes outside and don't expect to park right up front but it's worth it
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
Went there @ 9:30 ordered breakfast burrito,
Left @ 9:47 no burrito. After setting and waiting for 15 minutes the guy from behind the counter informed me it would be a little bit longer. I waited 2 minutes and left empty handed. I don't have the free time that they have I guess.
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text: One thing you have to do once you walk in the door, take a deep breath....and exhale. This place is awesome, the donuts are light and fresh. Fast and friendly service to boot. You also have to try their ham and cheese croissant with jalapenos...so good. I don't care what anyone says, this is the best donut shop in town.
name: Donut King
categories: Restaurants, Donuts, Food

text:
They are the authority for wings in Tucson, which says a lot because there are many places to get wings.

Yes, the place is a bit of a dive, but divey is in, right?  And the location is about as central as it gets, at Broadway and Rosemont.  So the place feels a little warm inside with lots of fans going to try to cool it down.  There are a lot of TVs in there so you can catch up on sports.  I like this because they aren't trying to be something they're not - they don't have flowers on the table or rolled up silverware like Sam-Witches and Such.  WOB is just trying to give you a place to sit, watch TV and eat the best wings in town.

The lemon pepper are perfectly seasoned - not a cheap lemon pepper that can resonate an almost chemical taste.  These are top notch.
