The medium has just the perfect amount of heat and the sauce is divine (I'm a big sauce guy).  The barbecue sauce is also perfect - not too sweet, not too hot, and immensely flavorful.  The teriyaki is wonderful too.

All of the wings have an amazing seasoning on the skin that just sets it off.  And the price is incredibly fair at 8.99 per dozen.  A nice touch is that they automatically serve it with carrots, celery and ranch dressing - some places make you add these on at a small cost.

Give these wings a try - you will thank yourself for it. A+++
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Standard greasy spoon place. Nothing on the menu really stands out to set it apart from others. Price is nice and cheap and they fill up coffee right when you need it. Solid greasy spoon place.
name: Jerry Bob's On Broadway
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners, Salad

text:
We have two kids attending college in Tucson and have tried breakfast spots all over town. This is our clear favorite. 

First, excellent breakfast cocktails. The mimosa menu alone makes this worth a visit. Second, the food is excellent. My husband loves the Return of the Mac. I prefer the French toast- any of their versions is excellent.  I also love the house made yogurt and granola.

Don't forget to look at the pastry selection!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Came here for Sunday breakfast with the family this morning.  We got there and we only had to wait about 10 minutes which I think is pretty decent since usually on Sunday's it takes forever!  Let's be honest this place is run down.  I think I should try another location and compare.  My son got the cinnamon roll and hash browns.  The cinnamon roll was splendid however the hash browns were bland and undercooked.  My daughter and I had the waffles mine came with scrambled eggs which were bland as well.  My waffle was really good though and the syrup wasn't too heavy.  My fiancé god the square meal I believe it's what it is called or the square breakfast.  Again his was bland as well.
We decided we would most likely not come again unless we were coming for cinnamon rolls.
The service was pretty good and we were pleased by how attentive the server was.
In my opinion this is not the breakfast place to go to in Tucson.
name: Jerry Bob's On Broadway
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners, Salad

text:
This was one of my first meals as a resident of Tucson, and I'm so glad because now I don't have look for another place like it. Coming from a big city, I was skeptical of the Chinese food in the area so asked one of my local friends who had also spent some time in China, and he recommended Kung Fu Noodle. "Silly name, great food", he said. Since my dad was in town, I took him here.

Kung Fu Noodle offers ~10 dishes on a hand-written menu all price around $8, and I imagine they do them all really well. They offer noodle soups, dry noodles, and an assortment of dumplings and bao (Chinese buns often filled with stuff). I shared the chef's special sauce noodles and bao with my dad. The noodles were in a brown sauce, tossed with ground meat, scallions, and chili sauce. They were perfectly cooked and had that unique flavor of home-made noodles. The bao were crispy on the outside and had juicy pork on the inside. Plus, one order came with 6 huge bao for only $8. These dishes really transported me back to the time I was in Beijing. My dad, who grew up in China, was equally impressed.

The table next to us got soup noodles and the servings were HUGE. I will definitely come back in winter time when I need something hot.

Service was great. We waited a bit for the bao since they make them in-house and ready to order, but the waitress kept coming to update us and ask if we needed anything. Place was very clean and nicely decorated.

This will definitely become one of my regular spots. And if any of my relatives or Chinese food-loving friends come to visit me in Tucson, I will definitely take them here.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: Great coffee and food. The wait staff is nice enough for a hipster joint- the owner is actually a pretty nice young guy and this is his baby so he's usually there. Also, the atmosphere is appealing, the patio is shady, and I believe they are setting up a garden on the roof and want to use green energy for their space. Either way, eco-friendly or not, this place is delicious so make a reservation or risk waiting a while in line.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
This place is a joke... specifically their "policies".

Let me elaborate... a few coworkers and I decided to go to this place to have a good time after work... a few of us had to take care of some businesses at work and arrived 30 minutes after the rest of our party.

We were ready to order some wings and beer... and THEY DID NOT ALLOW US TO SIT! According to their "policy" if every member of your party is not there by the time they assign you a table they will not give you a table and if someone comes late THEY WILL NOT ALLOW HIM/HER TO SIT WITH YOU. 

The owner mentioned that this policy makes sense when the place is packed (which, although I don't see why, I can barely believe). BUT THE PLACE WAS NOT PACKED, THERE WERE PLENTY OF TABLES EMPTY...

This kind of treatment towards your customer is NOT ACCEPTABLE. The place is trashy and I don't know what the big deal is about $0.30 wings. There are waaay better places to have better wings.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
If you like New China buffet at Speedway and Wilmot, give this buffet a pass. The sushi isn't nearly as good here. It was confusing that one side of a table had stuff for the hibachi while the other side had desserts. The staff was friendly and responsive.

I don't know which buffet has more choices, but I'll choose New China over U Like every time.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: What a gem. I love this place. Wonderful, simple, fresh French food. Have you ever eaten a truly fresh baguette? It's heaven, soft and delicious. Usually when restaurants serve a sandwich on a baguette it's already stale and chewy, but not here. That's the beauty of the attached bakery, which I think is the most varied and yummy in Tucson. I hope Ghini stays in Tucson always!
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
I finally went to Ghini's and now will be a repeat customer!  My friend MB suggested we have lunch at Ghini's and I was totally down with the idea. For quite some time, I have been hearing good things about this little cafe from a mass amount of fellow foodie friends and simply hadn't gotten around to trying it.  
Ghini's is a darling little cafe with quaint indoor seating and a large patio in front.  Since the weather was nice, we debated indoors or outdoors but eventually decided indoors. They have a phenomenal drink menu.  It is one of those menus that I have to narrow it down to 4-5 drinks and then decide. So many yummy coffee drinks on their menu!  I was in the mood for something refreshing and so I went with an Orangina.  Next trip, I will be trying the chocolate hazelnut mocha. 
Lots of deliciousness is on their lunch menu and again comes the hard part of making a decision. MB has been to Ghini's on many occasions and raved about their Croque Madame.   Eventually, we both decided on soup and salad.  I had the  baby field greens, which were lovely and they had the perfect amount of dressing. We each had the French onion soup, which was so flavorful and pretty much perfection.  
La Baguette Bakery is inside and we made a quick stop there on our way out to admire all the pastries, breads, tarts and cookies!  MB bought chocolate croissants and I purchased a big sugar cookie loaded with sprinkles as a treat for my favorite kid.  He shared a bite with me and it may have been the BEST sugar cookie I've encountered.  
I love it when you leave a restaurant feeling totally and completely blissed out by the experience, which is exactly how I left Ghini's.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
I have seen that a lot of yelpers compare this to Vegas. Let's just say there is no comparison to the glitz and glamour of Vegas, so let's just stop doing that, ok?

For a Tucson, AZ casino, this is where it's at. They have a nicer new hotel and several restaurants. Their pool could stand to be kid-free, but it is still nice. As for gambling, they do have a nice selection of new slots and a bunch of tables. I have never had to wait to play.

I have been to this casino several times, most recent being last night. A few friends and I have gone there to play bingo for their Thursday night Club Sol appreciation night. Thursday nights you get 20% off bingo with your Club Sol Card. To get a Club Sol card you just go to card services, show them your id, and you get a free card. Each time you go to the casino, you can enter into contests by just sliding your card at the kiosks, and you get rewards points and discounts. When I signed up, I also got $10.00 in free play. yay!

Bingo is fun, there are always a lot of people, be sure to sit in the non-smoking section if you don't care to get lung cancer. This plays fills up, so get there early. There are complimentary soft drinks, and also a snack bar with some baseball-like concessions.

I have stayed at the hotel before, our Ad2 Tucson organization held our ADstravaganza event there a couple of years ago. The event staff did an outstanding job and we loved the space by the pool. We stayed over night, it was nice, but probably not the nicest place in Tucson if you are looking to relax. It was pretty loud, and if I hadn't have passed out from drinking, I might have had a problem.

I have also eaten at the PY Steakhouse, which I will review separately.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Was told this was an "Italian" eatery. The metal plate had more taste the the Egg Plant Parm. It was more like "Sauce from a can" heated up together in the oven. Taco Bell has better Italian food!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Breakfast options were great. Server was very knowledgeable and also a vegetarian, which helped us a lot. If I lived in the area, I would recommend.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Really impressed by this little place. They need to put their menu on the site. The bratwurst was to die for. My group also ordered the black bean burger, grilled cheese and the Stool Pigeon chicken. No complaints. Choice of beers was very impressive. And our favorite musician was playing, Corey. We will definitely be back.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: COCKROACHES IN THE FOOD! Had some nachos last night during karaoke. About halfway through, we discovered, what we thought, due to the very low lighting, was a dead cricket in the jalapeños (I am now convinced it was actually a cockroach, as I witnessed one crawling across the server station a bit later). I brought this to the attention of the cook. His response was, "So what?" I said, "You served me a dead cricket!" And he replied, "I didn't serve it to you. It crawled there and died after the food went to your table." I asked the server, who was horribly embarrassed, for the manager and was told there wasn't one (who doesn't have a manager on staff in a bar on a Friday night? Apparently a place that is crawling with cockroaches, and a limited customer base. Aside from my daughter's friends gathered there for a special occasion, there were about 12 others in the bar). The bartender was "in charge," and both she and the server were shocked that the cook had spoken to me in such a way, apologized for his behavior and removed the nachos from my bill. I did see cockroach activity in the restaurant and was told that when they spray, it brings the vermin out, and that this is an ongoing problem, and the owner is aware of it. Eat and drink here at your own risk, as you have been warned. The same karaoke company hosts nights in better locations around town.
name: Famous Sam's Restaurant & Bar
categories: Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text:
This review is for breakfast.

Jerry Bob's is a basic diner with a standard diner menu, standard diner service, and pretty much average food.  On the down side, the building itself is a bit worn and the coffee, as usual for diners, no better than hot water.  On the upside, the tables were well spaced, the wait staff efficient but over-rushed, and most of the food was tasty.  I call out the scrambed eggs and sausage particularly.  Forget the home fries - cold and uninspired.

They did serve us totally burnt toast, which they replaced upon request, but how could the cook and the waitress both fail to see the blackened bread or smell the charred odor?

Actually, I might come back if I stayed at a nearby hotel and didn't feel like driving.  Jerry Bob's wasn't bad -- it just wasn't good.
name: Jerry Bob's On Broadway
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners, Salad

text: At 1pm I expect food to be fresher...not dry. As I remember iced tea refills should be free but we were informed with the bill each refill was $1.95 after it was too late. Server should tell up front.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: Adorable little country cafe gem. We're in town just for the day and needed some breakfast. We both got great portions for great prices. Great service too. Food came out fast and the waitress was sweet. 10/10
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text:
We went to Prep & Pastry again this week for a lunch meeting (this was probably our 5th visit), and had more excellent food! Sadly, I can't seem to get away from the French toast, so I'm not one to ask about the sandwiches, but my fiance had the Cubano on this visit and LOVED it, and our dining companions had the dip and a sandwich with egg and brisket on it (I think) and they were very happy with their food. My French toast was not the best I've had there (apple strudel), I wish I had gone with the pineapple upside down cake French toast. Oh, well, this gives me a reason to go back soon - I'm only giving them 4 stars instead of 5 because of less than stellar service on multiple occasions. Not bad, just not good, a lot of running out of liquids and it taking way too long to have them replenished. Still the best place in town to fulfill my need for excellent French toast!!!
*Editing - the cocktails look GOOD, I really wish I were more of a day drinker, because I'd really like to try a couple of them :)
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Sigh.  My kingdom for an experience that doesn't degrade over time like a bad drug habit.

I have gotten burned out with my normal venues and in a frantic mental search for where I hadn't been that was relatively close and might be ok, I remembered Amelia Grey's - I keep passing by at times when it's closed or for some reason can't go, and then I forget about it when I'm going...in any case, I'd been meaning to go, and hadn't.  The Native Cafe used to be a favorite and that location has since had trouble keeping an anchor. 

When I arrived on this weekday morning, it was no longer AG's, but Prep & Pastry.  Therefore, part of the imagery which had drawn me - ie, bakery case and cafe feel - was gone.  Instead, it was a nicely appointed restaurant in the ubiquitous chunks of wood and lofty ceiling all the places in Tucson now must do.  Maybe you can't even get a build-out permit in Tucson if you don't use that aesthetic, it's that pervasive.

The first thing I noticed was that the hostess stand is in the wrong place.  It needs to be further to the left so that a table or two can be put in front of the fire place without congesting the entry.  Now that space looks oddly empty and the flow through is wrong.  The second thing I noticed is that this place is heavy on the young men.  A woman may likely greet you and cook, but most of the servers I've seen are men.  That's interesting and definitely creates a vibe which I'm not sure if I like or don't.  

The first day, I was delighted to see that breakfast in some form can be had in the afternoons.  As we know, breakfast is best had at any time of day and should be always on offer, but rarely is.  I had the simple breakfast, which was indeed simple, but for a restaurant of a certain genre, not badly priced at $6.  Except, you know, they scrimp on the toast...artisan toast.  Eye roll.  My biggest complaints were that the eggs were heavy on the salt, the bread was too hard and the bacon too soft.  The coffee was very good, even if my server was too busy talking football and whatnot to refill it timely.  I did feel that I would be getting better service if I was cuter, which is not what you want.  All in all, though, my experience was good and I was sure to come back.

So, I did.  Sadly, it was a downhill experience.  This time I made sure to come in the hours of a full breakfast menu, only to find that it wasn't appreciably more varied.  I ordered the omelette after the waiter had fawned on its inclusion of steak, 5-yr cheddar, mushrooms, tomatoes.  Yum.  It arrived, again oversalted and without a trace of steak.  My toast also arrived hard and completely dry, with no butter or jam.  Sigh.  Coffee was still good.

But, here's what kinda altered my good feelings.  Hey, you know, they're new and I'm well willing to let some bugs get worked out while everyone is figuring out what works. Tweaking is inevitable. So, when I pointed out the lack of a major ingredient in my dish, I wasn't mad.  Just, you know, fix it.  However, the answer I got was that the waiter had made a mistake and read the "beefsteak" tomatoes as steak and tomatoes.  Ok, again, these amusing foibles take place.  And?

And nothing.  Though I would not have ordered the dish as it was and although the waiter was clearly in error, no one seemed to feel that warranted any attention.  Not a comped danish or coffee or jack.  So, what had been a good time by all was now a source of irritation at dumb customer service, which, if I am being frank about my bias, I think may relate to having so many boys in the house.  There's so often just a....lack of social finesse and empathic awareness when boys are in charge (Tony @ MakerHouse is a huge exception to this generality).

It all reminded me of the book, 5 Apology Languages.  I am, most decidedly, in the Accepting Responsibility and Restitution camps.  I am not interested in your flowery debasement, nor is mere acknowledgment enough.  I want to know how you're going to make it right.  Because, otherwise, an apology without making it right just tells me that you're paying lip service and really don't give a shit if I'm happy.  

So, yes, I'll probably go back for limited wants, but it is unlikely to be my go-to.  And guys:  cut it out with the salt, for christ sake.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: First time here, and it was excellent.  Long wait, so we learned from others to call ahead.  Look forward to coming back!
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
My friends and I were excited to try Mother Hubbard's. I had the green corn waffle with apple sausage and scrambled eggs. I was a bit disappointed by the portion size, especially for the price, which was $11.84. 

I tend to favor savory foods over sweet, so I knew I wanted something with eggs. I was thinking about an omelette but ultimately chose the green corn waffle because I was told the cafe was known for this dish. I thought the apple sausage had a nice flavor and it was definitely unique to have a savory waffle. Even though it was topped with a bit of salsa in its middle, the waffle overall was a bit dry and needed some kind of sauce. I tried putting syrup on it but the combination of flavors didn't taste right to me. 

Overall, the servers were friendly and the food had some nice flavors. I just felt it was a bit too pricey for what I was given.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: I frequent AJ's for a quick lunch - either takeout or sit-down.  If I'm in a hurry, I'll grab a slice of pizza or a pre-packaged spicy sushi roll.  Neither is very expensive and the quality is excellent.  With AJ's, the one thing you can count on is superb customer service.  The lines at the food counter can get a little lengthy so I usually take my order up front where one of several cash registers is open to ring me up.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: Really fancy breakfast food. That's all it really is, eggs and bacon can only be made so nice. The real gem is their bakery right next door (they are not even separated by a wall). They have dozens of types of baked goods, from cookies to cakes. Those are worth buying in dozens.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: I liked the blueberry scone, but a little disappointed in the cookies and cream donut. Their food is better! I had the french toast, which had some amazingly fresh jam. Eggs and bacon was standard.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I have had their food before and I do like it but I would not order delivery from them again. We were told it would be 40-45 minutes, not a big deal...right?

Maybe it was just a busy Saturday night or the delivery guy but it took over an hour and a phone call to the restaurant (which we found out that the delivery guy had already left a while ago with 2 orders and ours was supposed to be the first of the two to be delivered) before we received our food. I live less than a mile from them.

When we did finally have our food delivered, the delivery guy forgot the drink we had ordered. He had to go back to the restaurant and then came back with the drink.

After all that it would have been nice to at least get something free thrown in there or something knocked off the bill.

If I do order from them again I will just drive over and pick up my food.
name: May Flower Chinese Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
Small, packed parking lot, you may have to park down the side street (Im sure the neighbors love that). There is usually a wait, but there is a table up front with coffee for you!

Up front here is a bar area for small parties with a giant pastry display to temp you. They also have a lovely looking patio. 

Classic options on the menu for egg-lovers, and those with a sweet tooth. Recently learned you can order a half portion of their french toasts! Thank goodness! The slices are super thick and fluffy and amazing but its best for my waistline if I don't order a huge portion, because I WILL finish it.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Both the lunch buffet and the dinner menu is excellent.  I brought some friends here who had recently dined at a very expensive Indian restaurant in NY, NY.  They said that this place was much better at a  fraction of the cost.  

JUST NOTICED THAT YELP HAS TWO SEPARATE LISTINGS FOR THIS RESTAURANT:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/sher-e-punjab-tucson#hrid:P0rMwN7ugEoTFrPOIZ8Uxw

and

http://www.yelp.com/biz/shere-punjab-homestyle-cuisine-of-india-tucson#hrid:xSC1Z87AtwBVhGWkfphDtA
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Great food, fast service, busy place, great prices - far better than IHOP and chains! They have many options at a great price! Great family breakfast! It is affordable. Please don't raise those prices
name: Brawley's Restaurant
categories: Food, Do-It-Yourself Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

text:
Service: 5/5 friendly, prompt. 

Food: 4/5 I had the Biscuit and Gravy with two eggs over easy. The biscuits were a little dry and dense, from a pastry place I was a little (emphasizing on "little") disappointed in this fact.  However the biscuits did have a great flavor. As did the duck gravy which had a good sausage to gravy ratio. The portion of my meal was small but filling and fair for the price. My hot date had the French toast. I must say I was jealous. The bread was fantastic and the banana cream cheese topping was complimenting. 

Ambiance: 5/5. This is not important to me but I know to others it is. The dining room is very open and naturally lit. It is chic and fitting to Tucson's rising scene of fresh local inspired restaurant scene.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: First time coming here tonight. It was very nice. It's a small place but kept clean and friendly workers. The food was excellent also was pretty quick. Just a tip, be patient with the waitress their is only 1 working and she is awesome!
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: We returned to Charro Steak about 2 weeks ago and four of us had an excellent experience.  Service (Wendell, I believe) was great, knowledgeable, prompt, friendly and made us want to return. But the real reason for returning was the far better food experience we enjoyed on this visit. The steaks were very flavorful, perfectly rare- medium and delicious. Sides were properly cooked and very good.  Wine was good as were desserts.  It met our expectations and I will happily recommend it to friends.  I wish there was a way to give it 4 1/2 stars.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
Very good, different, cheap -

It is a shame that so many good little places are so hidden. We found Angela's, like many other great places, while reading reviews on other places to eat. Angela's was very clean & low scale - like Nico's. They were very friendly, had a great stocked salsa bar & the food was terrific. At first we were a little leery since the menu selections were not like other places we had tried. But we ordered the Adobado plate & Angela's nachos..both were fantastic. Very fresh, very generous with the sour cream, & the nachos had fresh avocado on top. These are the types of places no one knows about..if people don't start grabbing a burrito..we are going to lose another great "dive."
name: Angela's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
Great service and better food. 
I don't get up to Marana much, but I will go there more often now.
 The food was fresh and the best tasting in town.
I like the Buffet styles as I can eat a little to see what I like best. But, it all tasted good so I could hardly walk out.
The cost was more than reasonable and the staff was wonderful.
I would certainly refer it to everyone I know.
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text:
I only had a bagel and it was delicious. I also had one of their smoothies. Amazing!!! 

Hubby eats there all the time and he loves it. Gotta tell you they have one of the best cookies I have ever had.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: The food and service were good but not great.  Thought the farfelle bolognese was too oily and salty.  I would have liked it lighter and more cheese.  The waiters are cool and you feel like you are where the Sopranos eat out.  Lacking in desserts like tiramisu and zabs but overall I like this place and plan to come back again.  Ambience is first class.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: I have been going here for years and solely for their Gyros unfortunately it seems like the quality has gone downhill. You used to get an overstuffed overflowing pile of meat inside your pita bread and now it seems like there was only about three or four slices in there a small amount of Tzatziki and it seemed like the lettuce was slightly a bit bitter. I understand that the economy is crunching everybody and thank goodness this business is still alive but portions have gone down and quality has gone down
name: Sunrise Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Greek, Coffee & Tea

text:
Firstly, this is most definitely the place to go currently. Parking lot gets full, signage asking patrons not to park in front of neighborhood houses, and the certainty of waiting for a table. Be warned! 
As for the food and service. Hands down I loved meal which for me was Miso Spicy. I was very impressed. I will make another trip to try the other items on the menu. Oh and the servings were quite excellent, as well. Bravo to this establishment on a meal very exquisitely made. 
The staff were very enthusiastic and attentive. Attempting to meet people's needs are always challenging and so I commend them all on aiming high but due to how popular Raijin Ramen is, each day will bring its own challenges. One anecdote as an example, a lady came in while I was there to express her frustration at attempting to patron the establishment. She said it was her last day in Tucson and she has tried numerous times to eat there but to no avail. She asked the staff to please get a bigger location with a bigger parking lot because she was just never able to get in :(.  She then left...in less than a minute a few of the staff chased her down to appease her with a meal on the go. As I said, I love their enthusiasm very much. Bravo to everything Raijin Ramen!!!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Been going here since I was child.  Love the breakfast burritos, the flour tortillas...all of it!  I haven't been back in 2 years, but I hope it's the same.  I cannot wait to go back.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: My company just hosted an event and had chosen  AJ's to cater. The food was delicious, the service was awesome, and the catering staff went above and beyond to make sure everything go smoothly. Their professional set up was second to none. We will continue to use AJ's for our future events.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: Had the teriyaki salmon and it was very good. The grilled onions asparagus and broccoli made it all feel so healthy.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text:
I will not pretend to know much about indian food but I will say that I feel comfortable giving 5 stars because this place is the favorite indian spot of my friend who is indian. 

Chicken tiki masala is great but surprisingly not my favorite. The Dal took the cake and was wonderful with a mango lassi. I will be back with or without my friend to enjoy a wonderful Indian meal.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Beyond great!  Wish we'd have tried this place out SOONER.  Great menu, service, and portions.  My Kung Pow Chicken was superb...and enough for two people.  This is a real cozy place.  They had a live band on our night there that was plain fantastic!  Service was quick and our waitress very attentive.  We did meet the manager, Kai.  Great guy and it was obvious that he cared about our experience.  Happy Hour is KILLER!  KILLER...though get there early as it ends at 5.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: Good authentic indian food. Good location and parking, only problem is the resteraunt get to crowded because it's small, but yes I will be back
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: They don't have a huge menu, but what they have is done well and quickly.  The restaurant doesn't have a lot of atmosphere though and I got the distinct impressions they wanted us fed and out of there as fast as possible- which in our circumstance was ok because we had somewhere to go but if you are hoping to linger over your meal this is not the place.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
K, I've noticed a trend when in seating for new or remodeled restaurants, and that is the uncomfortable seating.  I have a feeling that the hard seating surfaces are easier to keep clean or something, which is important, but sheesh.  That said, the interior (right down to the hard seating) is freaking awesome.  Look at those high-chairs made out of pipe and wood.  Neat prohibition theme!

Nice selection of beers, and I'd never heard of mules before, but they have 'em and they're tasty!

Had the Wiseguy Fries as an appetizer.  Fries, nacho cheese, BBQ pulled pork (if I remember right), sour creme, and some green onion.  Served in a great big bucket.  Yummy.

I had the bucket burger with the chipotle sauce.  Amazing!  Came with fries... now these are the same fries used in the awesome appetizer, right?  Now I'm a bit of a fry nazi... I want mine more... turgid.  These were... flaccid.  Tasted good, though.  Just not my thing.

We also got a chicken wrap that looked good.  I didn't try it, but it came with chips and salsa.  The salsa is better than the salsa at the Mexican place down the street, and also had a bit of kick.  I expected something more bland from a brewhouse, I guess.  Nice job!

Will totally eat here whenever I want a beer and some yummy stuff to go with  it!
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: Street taco was very good! I was very impressed by the service, my Asada tacos were good. The complimentary chips & salsa were fresh and delicious, not to mention the music was great.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: First of all the suicide wings were a $1 extra ( not stated on menu) 2nd of all they were not hot. Not even a little bit. The wings were good though. Well cooked. Stop charging people extra for nothing. You owe me a dollar!
name: Buffalo Bell
categories: Chicken Wings, Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text: Normally, I love Denny's but this visit was different. It was about 8pm on a Friday night didn't happen to be very busy and we were seated in a reasonable manner. Ounce we were seated we were never ounce again attended to... We happened to have patients for at least 20 min and decided to leave they didn't even ask us what we wanted to drink or anything. Worst service.
name: Denny's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners

text: UPDATE: I come here at least once a week, and always have an awesome experience. Today's was different, as we met Nathan, the owner, and he gave us a free s'mores doughnut for being regulars! (It was really good, by the way!) I highly recommend this place!!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Fantastic high quality bakes and great food, bacon is not as crispy as I personally like but it's quality. Croissants are beautiful and though it was a bit loud and crowded I was impressed by the wait staff and one even helped me put on my wrist brace with clean washed hands before and after. Overall I'd say the potatoes were amazing, fluffy and crisp and you'll always find new flavors you wouldn't in other establishments.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Dirty, loud, crowded, terrible service and the food is awful. Why does this place have good reviews?  It's in a horrible strip mall and is in desperate need of a makeover inside. The coffee was bad, the orange juice was concentrate and my waffle was so cold the butter didn't melt on it. Yes, they have gluten free options, but I'd rather suffer eating gluten than eat there again.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Awesome natural inventive food with Native American and Southwest roots

Good price, friendly staff

You should definitely try it
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Selection is eclectic but sort of contains misfits from each category. Prices are more consistent with LA or Vegas than Tucson. I love the ambience and the decoration, and I wanted to like this place, but the beer list didn't match my tastes so someone else may love it.
name: Beer Garden At Reilly Craft Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Beer Gardens

text: The food here is fine but nothing great.  (The one exception is the melted cheese appetizer, which is actually pretty tasty).  It's not terrible, but there's absolutely no reason to eat mediocre Mexican food in Tucson.
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: This was one of my boyfriend's favorite places to get breakfast. It obviously is nothing fancy, and that's the appeal. They usher patrons in and out quickly, and your coffee is never empty. The service is quick and efficient; they are friendly but don't waste time with pleasantries. We always order the four-item breakfast. When we first started coming, it was under $4. We could get out the door with a decent breakfast for both of us for about $10, including tip. The prices have increased significantly. This last visit, the bill was $16+. That doesn't break our bank, but we also observed the service was quite a bit slower, and our food was very greasy compared to previous visits. We won't return.
name: Brawley's Restaurant
categories: Food, Do-It-Yourself Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

text:
We had just driven in to Tucson from out-of-town and this restaurant was next to our hotel.  Thinking we could get a quick meal we walked in and were seated right next to the kitchen.  We ordered our dinner and waited and waited and waited.

Our server finally arrived with fish and macaroni dinners -- we had ordered a salad and a burger.  We told her of the mixup, she walked back to the kitchen and returned 5 minutes later to say "the computer ate your order" and asked us to repeat the order to her so she could get started on our dinner.

I regret not reading the other one star reviews about this location before we went in for dinner.  I really haven't encountered service this bad at any other Denny's restaurant.
name: Denny's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners

text: It has been over 7 years and I am not 100% sure it is the resteraunt I used to dine in. I love their chirashi bowls and soft shell crab. Every time I  travel to Tucson in 2007, I went there once or twice.  And always amazed sushi in Tucson is not bad at all, compared to sushi restaurant in DC and NYC.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: We loved it. I can't speak for everything on the menu but chips and salsa were awesome, tableside  guacamole with cheese was amazing, mini chimis were very flavorful, I liked the red enchilada sauce better than green. My husband's Carne Asada was delicious with cheese and peppers on top. Sangria was large and tasty and beer options were great. Everything just had great flavor.  Our waitress was super busy as we sat at the bar because there was a 2 hour wait without reservations but she was attentive and gave us a military discount just from talking with us and finding out that's what we did.  We are already planning our return.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: You can't find better food than this.  Quality food and great service.  Lord have mercy on my waistline....we had the pumpkin cream cannoli pastry with pecans for starters.  We also had breakfast there.  Good size portion on the omelet with great ingredients.  Next time we'll try the French toast.  There was a large crowd ahead of us so the owner sent over a few nibbles to apologize in advance.  He understood that the large group might impact our food.  That's service.  They have good coffee as well.  They have inside and outside dining as well as seating at the bar.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I really enjoyed my BBQ pork chow mein. The service was good and everyone in my party enjoyed their meal.
name: China Dragon Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
Great all around!!! The food was phenomenal and the service was second to none.  When we first showed up I instantly thought there was no way we were going to get seated right away and would have at least a hour wait because the parking lot was packed.  

This place isn't cheap so if you are trying to go out for a quick bite to eat with the family this is not your place.  If you are going out for a special day with your family this is a great place to go.  They have a decent sized kids menu and the kids food is great.  We went for a later dinner and I think the waitress could tell our kids were ready for their food.  As a result of that the kids food came out in less that 10 minutes and was delicious.  

To top it all off this place has the best military discount I have ever seen.  If you are in the military and show your ID card you get 15% off.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: A great mixture of veggies, fruit, meats, cheese and all the extras. The floral department is one of the best in town. I wish they always had a lighter evening meal option like they do in the Phoenix Valley stores. More often than not the hot dinner options are all very heavy foods. Instead of heavy plus an option of fish or chicken, etc.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: The food was great! The breakfast was fantastic, the waiters were all very nice. The owner was also very accommodating. The eggs, hash browns, and turkey bacon meal was delightful and the establishment was very clean.
name: Kettle Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: My wife and I decided to try it out and probably will not be going again. The server Monique was extremley rude. My wife ordered boneless wings with extra buffalo sauce, manager brings out our food and my wife gets bone-in wings she tells the manager that she ordered the bonless wings not bone-in, we know mistakes happen no big deal. Our server turns around and glares at us. When we got done with our meal we get the check. On the check is bone-in wings my wife lets the server know so she can adjust the check. The server then tells her in a very rude tone "Oh its because you changed the order in front of the manager" My wife tells her that she never ordered bone-in wings and the server is practically arguing with us on what WE ordered. That behavior and attitude doesnt belong in customer service.
name: Hooters
categories: Sports Bars, Food, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Chicken Wings, Restaurants

text:
The burgers are good,  and the green chile's are great.  The worst thing I can say is there was too much mustard.  :)

Got done chili on the side fire the burgers and fries.  Yummy.

Nice change of pace from regular fast food.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Just ordered our first pizza from these guys and we are hooked.  Happy they deliver to our place!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Ordered the carne asada & loved it. It was perfect, although I do wish they gave 3 small tortillas instead of one large one. I liked that it was skirt steak instead of the cube steak. Since I've been in AZ, every time I order carne asada, they give me cube steak. LOL, I can cut mt own steak in little squares.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: We went there on a late Friday night; I was pleased that it was open late. The tacos were good! salsas were unimpressive, and the actual restaurant was not great, we tried sitting outside but there was a horrible sewer smell that we could not deal with. I general the tacos were ok, I've had better in South Tucson for the price they're charging, The flavors of the taco fillings were on point tho.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Had lunch here today and it was good. Fair price and nice sized portions. Place is very clean and appears to be well managed.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text:
Sher e Punjab isn't just a restaurant, it's a way of life.  Look, I've been to all the Indian restaurants in Tucson, and none of them come close to Sher e Punjab.

The food is outstanding and the family that runs it is a class act.  The enforcer (a gentlemanly old Sikh man who is 55-60) keeps things running smoothly.  His sons will make you feel welcome, even if you are a sociopath or otherwise rejected by society.

While it is true that the shopping center is a haven for those down on their luck, I think they are all panhandling for the $7 they need to eat like kings and queens at Sher e Punjab.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
An unimpressive breakfast establishment with mediocre service and food.

My friends and I wanted to find a sit-down breakfast joint that opened early enough for us to chow down on good food before my friend had to go to work. After browsing through Yelp, it seemed like Ghini's was the only candidate nearby. Although their door and website state that they opened at 6:30am, they seemed to be running late and didn't open until 6:45am. We had to seat ourselves and waited on a server for a few minutes. Eventually, our waiter came and, being slightly flustered, took our orders quickly. I was surprised to find that you can't order every single pastry from the bakery display on the other end of the cafe (apparently, they're separate businesses?) For example, you can only order plain croissants if you sit at a table, but you can choose from a variety of croissants if you walk yourself over to the pastry counter (strange). Anyway, I ordered the Egg Provençal with scrambled eggs and whole wheat toast. It really did seem like I had an overcooked order of 6 eggs - just a huge portion off rubbery sadness! (You might be better off ordering the eggs over easy).  The toast was overly buttered as well, which is fine if you like it that way. The only good thing I had was their cafe au lait, which was served in a huge mug. My friend had the breakfast sandwich, and she thought it was decent. With just a few tweaks, Ghini's can be great, but I'm afraid I'd go elsewhere for breakfast or brunch.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
I've never eaten here before, so the review is for the gambling portion only.

The inside of this place is beautiful!  Blue skies, columns, it feels open and inviting.  They obviously spent a lot of money figuring out how to decorate this place to make people want to stay for long periods of time and spend money.  The blackjack tables have a sidebet called 'straight jack' which is fun to play (though I wouldn't recommend putting more than one dollar on the side bet for every five on the main bet, it isn't cost efficient).  The poker room is spacious and clean and has interesting promotions running most of the time.  Almost every employee that I've met there has been friendly and helpful.

If you're determined to lose your money, lose it here!  At least you'll have a good time!
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Good pizza with fresh ingredients. The crust is average. We mostly do take out, I think we've eaten at the restaurant once. I see it more of a lunch atmosphere for dinning in, but they have added beer and wine to improve this I believe. The staff has their highs and lows in terms of customer service, but we keep coming back for the consistency of the pizza.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: A huge fan of the El Charro family! I was so excited to try this new hip downtown venue. Awesome decor, amazing smells, food and margaritas superb!!! Waiter, Derek, is the only reason it got 2 stars. Wished I had had a friendly attentive waiter as that is what I expect when I dine out and spend in excess of a hundred dollars. He was in a mood of some sort that kept him distracted and unfriendly. We might go back but I would definitely ask for different wait staff. Loved everything else! We would love to  see the owners pick helpful friendly wait staff. BTW, everyone else, hostess,busboy, etc. seemed awesome. One bad seed may have ruined it for us though.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: If you're looking for delicious food, great service, and chill vibes then this is the brunch spot for you. Will be coming here more often.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Street Taco is my go to place for tacos in all of Tucson. The atmosphere is very relaxed and the inside reminds me of chipotle but the food is 100000x better then chipotle. Their carne Asada, al pastor, and fish tacos are my favorite. Get them "Street style" with onions and cilantro. Love their $1 side of Mexican rice and their guac is pretty good too! Free help ur self chips and salsa!!! The best. Their green avocado based medium salsa is sooooo good, I want to steal their recipe.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. The sushi is not worth the money, too fishy so it's obviously not fresh. And no this is not the first time I've felt this way about this place. I have given Sushi Nara many tries, and they are always mediocre or horrible. The experience, service, and food are lackluster. Don't waste your time or money.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: This place definitely feeds into that overhype for a restaurant in which the ambiance is cute but the seating is limited the food is pretty but only good and not deserving for the price you pay. The service is pretty decent and the ingredients seems pretty fresh. If you're going for a cute place to brunch I'd pick other locations that come up when you search. If it's a weekday and this is convenient than I probably would be okay going here. But I definitely would not recommend it to be worth the trip on the weekends.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Love their food... taste just like a home cook meal.. taco Tuesday n Friday, the best ..... thank you guys at this restaurant,  you make the best tacos, n very friendly people that work their
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text:
Mother Hubbard's is in a tired looking strip mall, and the interior is clean, not fancy. 

We've been twice now and are very impressed by the service and the food. The service is friendly and with a smile. The food features local ingredients and flavors. 

I should add that the restroom is basic but adequate.

Go for the food, it's worth it.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Fabulous breakfast. Great service & delicious food. YUM!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Pretty good food food & price. They have lunch specials that are awesome for dinning in. I always order a boba tea while here. I ordered spicy broccoli chicken, small egg drop soup, a Thai tea, and crab puffs to go. Included with my broccoli chicken was white rice. I paid 20$.
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
Claim Jumper fills a definite, profitable niche. While serving well-made delicious food is not the function here, it still manages to provide the trappings of a fine restaurant for those who would not have a good time were they provided authentic food. 

As mentioned in several reviews, the service is excellent. The dark cavernous interior transports patrons to a ski lodge of yesteryear. The furniture is oversized and comfortable. You get the feeling you're somewhere special when you walk in.

The menu is American, designed to be non-threatening and fun. The target demographic has breakfast at McDonald's, lunch at Applebee's, girls night out at the TGIFridays, and now, for a little splurge, must choose between Olive Garden, Red Lobster, or this place. 

Dinner was  $83 including tip -- that's for 3 entrees (1 BBQ ribs, 1 Black Tie pasta, Hill Country salad), 2 beers, and 2 iced teas. Hefty.

For some entertaining reading on sodium levels, check out the nutrition stats on their website: http://www.claimjumper.com/menu_nutritional_information.aspx
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Amazing place, the food is a dream and this can only be describe by visiting and experiencing this place, customer service, food and atmosphere where excellent.  Mike our waiter was very helpful we will comeback soon.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Did my research before my last visit to Tucson and I saw this place had lots of reviews for having opened so recently. Prep & Pastry is kind of how I would want my home to be--warm, modern but not pretentious and totally about the pastries. I sat at the counter. So, I got to enjoy how they have a big window into the kitchen and you can see the pastry chef hard at work. Unfortunately, it's too noisy and too far to talk to her, not that I would want to disrupt her baking alchemy. I love the wooden floating shelves by the window where the have everything from plants to an egg beater.

I ordered the duck confit hash, which was solid. I think for my own preference, it could have used more salt but the duck part was very tender. The other ingredients seemed very fresh. One of the owners, Nate, started chatting with me. He was super-friendly and I think because I was by myself and watched the pastry chef bring out a tray of fresh cronut-knockoffs, he offered me one gratis. So I had the maple-glazed with crumbled, real bacon which was very yummy. I tried to ration it off but I finished the other half that same day despite swearing I'd at least wait til the next morning. The pastry chef is also a really friendly gal. She said she was looking for ideas for other cronut flavors and I just randomly made suggestions. 

This place used to be some kind of tea room so they've kept up the tradition by offering afternoon tea. I don't live in Tucson so next time I come, I will for sure make time to go there and perhaps try the tea.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
BFF and I had been dying to try this place, and this was our first visit.
Got there at 9:00, just before the rush and were seated on the patio right away by the friendly hostesses (hostii?). Promptly greeted with water and menus. For drinks, a fuzzy navel mimosa and a meinkes mayor - both delicious and a good value at $5 and $6, respectively. For breakfast I ordered the monte cristo, while my friend ordered the sweet potato hash. We were unimpressed with each menu item; both were bland and it seemed everything was undercooked from the potatoes in the country hash to the brioche in the monte cristo.
Consensus: I'll give it another chance, as some other entrees passing by our table looked enviable, and the service is super duper. Look out, A.M. Relleno, you're on my list!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Great food! Large vegan/vegetarian menu (even custom made a vegan curry dish for me.)
The seafood eater with me ordered the Shrimp and vegetables and said it was wonderful. Large portions. The vegetable  soup (small order) was enough for 2 people. Wish this place was in Phoenix! Friendly staff! Great price! Will definitely eat here again on my next trip through.
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
Sorry to do a 2 star review here as this was one of my favorite places years ago. I have been a couple of times in the last few months and its just not the way it used to be. 
We were there for dinner a week ago, 5 of us, we got seated pretty quickly then we were just sat and waited. The server was really busy, I'm assuming they were understaffed that night. She was friendly when she got to us but honestly it was a little annoying as we were hungry and didn't want to be there too late.
 
It was a pretty good wait  to get our food, my sons plate came out even a few minutes after the rest of us had ours. We could have still been been fine here as we were not looking for things to pick on, hey i know we don't live in a perfect world but  once we started eating nobody's food was hot. I'm pretty sure it had been sitting for a while waiting for the server to grab it.

Btw, the Mariachis were pretty good at first. The music was not overbearing, they were not too close and they did sound good! The girl with the fiddle was a real treat!
Then they got closer and louder and you know the deal, no more talking as you cant hear unless you shout, oh well.

Sorry i forgot to specify this, it was the Oracle rd. location.

Update: I was back in this location a few months ago as it is convenient for me and as I mentioned in my previous review the La Parilla locations were always at the top of my list for a tasty dinner . The staff was friendly, we got seated and waited on quickly, the food however was disappointing. I really hate to slam the place again but I really think the owners should spend time trying to figure out whats going on here. There is fantastic Mexican food in Tucson as we all know and these guys should be as good as anyone else, especially given the amount of years they have been around.
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Really, really liked the crust! A little bit of bite without being chewy and a nice crispsness that lasted until the end of the meal. We had the Margherita Fresco and added pepperoni.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
Their own bacon and sausage .. Both yummy .. Chorizo was excellent 

But the winner hands down was the lemon poppy seed waffle was out of this world .. Not heavy like I thought was gonna be...
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: This was the worst experience I have ever had. The wings were nothing special, the service is horrible, it is so hot due to the lack of air conditioning, and the restaurant is very dirty. I do not recommend this place to anyone..
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Fast and friendly service. Great breakfast burritos. Clean place. The tortillas were fresh. The salsa was good to average. Nice place with an open kitchen and small eating area. Located in the corner of the strip mall.
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text: So far we've had no one nice. The nicest ppl were in Mobys restaurant. This really saddens me
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Dry shrimp pot - don't  like the spices and flavor at all.  Dumplings - bland.  Chinese burrito - poor quality gristly beef tho the bread part was nice  Eggplant - again don't  like the spices.  Friendly and  popular with Chinese students but I just don't  care for this place.  1 1/2 rounded up to 2.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: Home cooked Mexican fare at a price you can't beat!  The menu is simple, and the food is served fast. They have a great selection of beer, raspados, and soft drinks.  Now with their Park Place location, I can get their awesome food closer to home.  Get some!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Hands down, one of my favorite place to have brunch around town! 

My last visit I had "The chef omelet with a side of country hash" - which changes daily.
The mint leaves was a great touch to my delicious omelet.  

My favorite dish would be the "Biscuits and Gravy". Cheddar biscuit, sausage, smothered with duck fat gravy and two over easy egg on top. Need I say more?

Of course, you can't come to P&P and not have one of their famous Bloody Mary's! The Bloody Mary is loaded with ingredients: tomato juice, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce, fresh lemon or lime juice, horseradish, black pepper, and celery salt -- each contributing to "a blend of hundreds of flavor compounds that act on the taste senses". Well P&P sure knows how to hit all taste senses with their version of "The Bloody Mary"

The wait staff here is on point, always so friendly and always make sure our glasses are never empty. 

Looking forward to the next visit!

KCYE
Don V.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
A large group of us (7) celebrated my mom's birthday dinner there. We ordered the antipasto which was nicely varied and plenty for all of us. They also served a soft   focaccia bread and delicious herbed dipping oil as a starter.

We didn't have soup or salad so I can't comment on that. I was a little disappointed with my entree which was the Pork Ricotta. It tasted like the meat had hit a hot cast iron pan and it left some of the iron flavor on the meat. Not my favorite flavor. But otherwise it was okay.

The Seafood Soup looked good and the Roasted Beet Salad was well received.

I was very favorably impressed by our waiter. It's nice to see a truly professional server in action. The staff could not have been more accommodating. 

When we made the reservation they agreed to let us bring a small cake which after dinner,  they brought to our table, with our supplied candles lit. They also cut and served it at no extra charge. This is something that, of course, increased the tip, as it should.

My sisters declared that the wine list was good and we had three bottles of a tasty Chardonnay.

The coffee was flavorful and strong but not overpowering. 

All in all, it was a delightful evening which my mother seemed to enjoy. We're just happy that we have this locally owned restaurant, charging reasonable prices on the east side of Tucson.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: They were invited to join our school event with 15% of their proceeds benefiting the school. They were the busiest truck and never donated the amount they agreed too. Total bummer!
name: Burgerrito
categories: Food, Restaurants, Mexican, Food Trucks

text: I now know why there's so many cars parked outside this place!  Both food and service were much better than I expected.  The wings were not small and dry like some places where you get them with your pizza.  They are large and come with many choices of sauces.  Our server suggested ordering a combination of the parmesan garlic with the black pepper lemon, and they were probably the most flavorful wings I've ever had.  The small order of the beer batter fries were yummy and probably enough for three people.  They were delivered hot and crunchy.  Some local beer on tap in the small bar area off the dining room which is also home to several TVs for the sports fans.  A few of the servers took time to chat with us, which really made us feel welcomed. They also serve burgers and chicken sandwiches but did not try either this time.  No, it's not fancy, but it is clean and both food and service again was above expectation. Will definitely be returning.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: This is a great sushi place! Their prices are very affordable and you get a free bowl of miso soup and a side of edamame beans. Love the Christian music too! This is our new go-to sushi place whenever we crave a California roll!
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: Ok, I have now been to "U-Like" on 3 separate occasions. I went a week or so after they first opened with my wife. I later went by myself last Saturday afternoon for lunch and today, on a Sunday night, I was there for dinner with my father-inlaw. It has gotten better and better each time.  I can say that "I do-like, U-Like Buffet. Very friendly and attentive staff (especially for a buffet restaurant). I spent time at the grill, buffet stations and had a little dessert and it was all delicious. For me and my Dad; 2 dinners and two drinks cost exactly $25.05 before tip. A good price for good food and full belly's. Keep up the good work "U-Like"!!!
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: From the typical yellowish orange stucco building with dark reddish trim exterior and the plain interior and furnishings of El Merendero Mexican Restaurant you would be expecting the same with their cuisine.  That's hardly the case.  The food and service is exceptional!  My co-workers and I visit this place for lunch virtually every other Friday.  No better way to start your weekend off than a great lunch at El Merendero for under $9 bucks.  I ALWAYS get the Red Chili Chimichanga prepared "Enchilada Style" with the beans and rice.  It is 8-inches of mouth watering chunks of tender beef in red chili sauce rolled in a flour tortilla like a burrito that is then deep fried and then dipped in Enchilada Sauce, topped with cheese and served.  My co-workers have tried various other dishes (green chili, tamales, tacos, etc.) and they have had nothing but great things to say of their meal choice.  The staff is always attentive and they bring you two types of salsa (red chili and pico de gallo) and fried tortilla chips and cut limes in a bowl too.  Don't be afraid to ask for more when you run out as they are more than happy to provide you more.  This isn't your fancy schmancy restaurant, but for great Mexican food, excellent service, and incredible prices, you won't find better in Tucson!  Enjoy!!!
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text:
My hubby and I ate here for lunch since we had a gift card to use.  We read all the reviews and still decided to try it.  We arrived at 11 am when they opened and were promptly seated.  

Our waitress Penelope came to our table pretty promptly too, to take our drink orders.  She was very patient with me while I was trying to decide what I wanted to order.

While waiting for our soups, Penelope brought their cheese bread, which was quite yummy!  I ordered the cocoMojito (I think that's the name) which was quite yummy too.  A bit too much ice for the price we paid but still delicious.

Hubby and I shared the creamy chicken tortilla soup and the New England clam chowder.  Both were very good.  

Penelope gave us another serving of bread because we devoured the first (I was hungry, lol) and our water was always refilled.  She even apologized for accidentally putting too much ice in hubby's glass.  That was sweet, though he didn't mind at all.  

Our entrees arrived and the potions were a good amount.  Since I did not know what I wanted, I ordered the Widow Maker, because that was one of the sandwiches Hubby was debating.  That thing was HUGE!!!  I took out the two onion rings and gave them to my hubby.  The negative I will say about the burger is that we ordered it to be cooked well done.  Part of it still had pink, which was the part we did not eat.  

Hubby ordered the tri tip and that was quite yummy!  Penelope knew we were sharing our entrees, so she brought an extra bowl of the au jous.  She didn't have to do it but she did.  And we greatly appreciated that.

Hubby told her it was my birthday and she brought out a red velvet cupcake with a candle on it for me!  She even brought two forks for me to share....so sweet!  

The manager on duty checked on us and chatted for a bit.

The decor was nice and the place was clean.

We spent less than $50 for an alcoholic drink, two bowls of soup and two entrees.  A bit pricey, maybe.  But the food was good.  I think, though, we would come back on special occasions.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text:
Yummy!
Very nice selection. The customer service is super friendly and nice! Not too expensive! 50$ for 3 adults two kids. I will return !
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: The wings here are delicious but I do not come here for the hot wings. Definetly dont think that their buffalo sauce is anything spectacular. I do absolutely LOVE their golden hot wings, must try if you havent! The other array of flavors that they offer are good too,typical garlic parm, lemon pepper & some ohers. Their WOB michelada is different and yummy too. If you are a tater tot fan I would recommend trying their wobbed up tots, even drenched in ranch they were still crispy and delicious!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: A friend told me that they had a sushi bar here so I wanted to try it. It actually wasn't great at all. The rest of the buffet was much better but still a typical buffet. I noticed on the way out that there was a Hibachi Bar which would definitely try next time. I like to be able to make up a dish with fresh ingredients and then have them cooked before me. Maybe that will make my next experience better and therefore my next review!
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text:
I made it to WOB during a business trip out to Tucson.  It had he vibe and feel of a dive (that's a good thing), good customer service, good selection of beers, and good food. I went on a Tuesday nite, so it was crowded, but the wait wasn't too bad...but I was alone. With the .40cent wing special, my meal was cheap; I think 10 wings, a basket of fries, and a 25oz beer was less than $12...but maybe the beer got to my head.  

The food and drink was good.  I had the Asian and hot honey wings.  It tasted very similar to those served at Buffalo Wild Wings.  I preferred the hot honey, which the waitress said they won awards for. The staff was very friendly, and the waitress gave me many beer samples to try, before and after I ordered my beer. I will definitely go back on my next trip out there.  It's good for groups, but its great if you're alone as well... with several TVs and lots of people to watch.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Everything on the menu is absolutely amazing. Many of the recipes are unique twists on classic breakfast dishes, and they are all fantastic. Tri-tip sandwiches on homemade biscuits, duck confit hash, pork belly benedict, and duck fat in EVERYTHING. The pastries, which are made fresh in house, are also fantastic. I got a taste of a bacon crowned cronut on my first visit, and now I dream of these delicious pastries. Even the coffee exceeds expectations. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great food, wonderful service and worth the wait! Quite an interesting menu offering something for everyone. So glad I found this wonderful place it's really unique!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great place for dinner the food was excellent my steak was cooked to perfection. Our server Lance took great care and made sure everything was done to are liking. John the manager even stop and check to see if everything was to are satisfaction you do not get that service anymore.i will be back to eat here again Lance went far and beyond to me date night great
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text:
After walking all around downtown Tucson of course we ended up here.
Hotel referred another Mexican place, but it was expensive and pretentious.
Good food, decent prices, cold beer
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Ong Plastic Surgery Recently spoke with  Paulette which was able to help us make our Breast Cancer Girls Night Out event possible and we could not have been more happier to have done so. All of our patients enjoyed tasting the delicious cupcakes and could not wait to have seconds. 
Thank you so much for being so generous and helpful we really appreciate all of your help as well as your staffs.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
Great inexpensive Mexican food!   Menudo is fantastic and my family loves it for take out dishes.   Tortas will make you think you are south of the border!    

Staff is busy,  if you want conversations go to a bigger restaurant this place is about food.   It is our default local fast great Mexican food!
name: Angela's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
I don't understand why the earlier reviews were negative. Yes they are very patriotic and display an abundance of American-patriotic decor items, but so what? Over the top for me, but the food is great. . I like that the place has it's own personality. I'm a flaming liberal and I was not offended by the decor. The owners are allowed to decorate however they please and patrons can choose not to eat there if it's offensive. (BTW I'm a flaming liberal.)

 They make the best potato pancakes I've had in Tucson. I'm glad they give a military discount; the military don't make much money. The ownership has not changed and the food is as good as ever. Yeah sometimes service is a bit slow. Today they had one huge group in the back room and evidence that another large group had just left from the main room. They only had two or three wait persons that I could see, but they seemed to handle the job pretty well. I gave my waiter a 30% tip because he was polite and attentive and alerted me that since the potato pancakes are made from scratch they would take longer than other breakfast foods. I actually knew that, but he's a new waiter to me. The owner came to talk to a winter visitor who was leaving for the summer and wished him a safe trip. The owner was cordial when I paid and I made a point of complimenting the cook, who is his wife. I have no complaints about Biscuits; the food is well made American. The food is made at the time it's ordered and is not pre-made like chain restaurants
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: The only good thing about Casino Del Sol is Ume. Rooms are ok , but could be cleaner. Definitely not worth the price. The award winning steak house is ok again not worth the price. Slots are pretty much the same theme. Desert Diamond has a lot more slot machines. The pool water was a light shade of green. Forget having someone bring you drinks. We were there 2 hrs before someone offered. We were so unsatisfied we checked out the same day we checked in. Management is worthless they don't care if you are unhappy.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text:
The antipasto salad was good (8/10)
The garlic bread was good (8/10)
The meatballs were good (7/10)
The lasagna was not good (3/10), the lasagna was unlike any I have had before. There was a meat, cheese and sauce paste between each layer. It reminded me a bit of a frozen dinner.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: There are not too many good Indian restaurants in Tucson, and from the outside I wasn't expecting much since it's in a little strip mall next to a 99Cent store.  I went for dinner on 09-11-14.  Once inside i was pleasantly surprised as it was very clean and a nice atmosphere.  I ordered Chicken Vindaloo with Basmati Rice and Naan.  The Rice was cooked perfectly and the Naan was also great, with a nice charred texture from the Tandoori oven. The chicken Vindaloo was prepared nicely with fresh cilantro and a flavorful sauce.  The Vindaloo was made with dark meat which i do like, but i would prefer some white meat from the chicken as well.  The prices were reasonable for dinner, but also is a la carte, so the rice and Naan were not included in the meal price.  Either way the prices are very good here and nice size portions.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife
