text: Very first place I ever tried sushi. This place is awesome. Superstar roll is always a must here. Very fresh fish and patient servers who are always happy to answer any questions. Quirky place as it's connected to a Los betos burrito shop but still one of my favorites
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: Literally one of the best breakfast/brunch places in Tucson. The atmosphere, the food and the people are always awesome and consistent in quality. The owner is often here which gives the place a comfort. He continuously shows how much he cares for his guests while simultaneously working along side his staff. Love it all around!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Spent last week in Tucson and tried this place out on my last night.  The food, service, and friendly staff were awesome.  I'll definitely plan on going back next time I'm in the area.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Everything we had was so delicious! Obviously a little pricey, but it's a steakhouse, so that's to be expected. Good for celebrating semi-special occasions, and you can get a tasty (and strong) beverage to help you celebrate! Great ambiance, and excellent wait staff. Get your steak estilo charro (with melted manchego cheese and sauteed bell peppers on top). You won't regret it.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
Best Indian food in Tucson, bar none. Great for vegetarians and meat lovers too. I'd say try anything with lamb in it because there aren't many places around here that even serve lamb. And of course you should always wash your meal down with their amazing mango lassi, such a guilty pleasure. 
It doesn't help that I'm writing this review on an empty stomach, but trust me when I say that Punjab will go above and beyond the call of duty to fill your gut with goodness. I think the overall thing that I like best about this place is the sheer feeling of comfort that comes from everything. Modest atmosphere and comfort food served with gingerly kindness. It's like what momma used to make, if she had originally immigrated from India. The pricing is fair, not too expensive, and well worth the portions you'd be receiving. 
So yeah, go take a friend here and enjoy the food, or help yourself to some takeout. In the end, you'll be plenty satisfied.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
had brunch and i must say that the website sold me in coming here.... been awhiles since i had a hearty frenchy type of meal and it was definitely tempting... but i dunno ...  prices were fairly appropriate. um, from the ghini delights, for those who are watchin their weight... kudos! their provencale? must say their hash browns were mighty yummy, a lil overboard with butter, but it was oh, so damn yummy!! and their bread! was excellent! mmm ... awesome bread!!! 

another downer? uncomfy chairs...

anyhoo, overall, it would be an average of a 2 star but i will say that the bathroom made me give ghini an extra star ... 

ladies! 
don't fret! a handy tampon tray that always* come in handy ... excellent! for those who are being punished with mother nature...

you on a date?
scope mouth wash with cute lil cups to rinse your mouth and more... did i ever tell you i carry around a bottle of mouth wash in my car too? :) yes, my ex was a dentist so i'd be super paranoid in having my breath stink even though i truly believe mouth wash is for cheaters... but doesn't hurt to have an eatery with mouthwash... 

now, for the bathroom downers... this is just  my own personal preference ... what's UP with having the toilet paper roll across from you? i don't know about you all, but i sure don't like getting up and having my cheekies smooch one another... bleh ...

text:
4 stars. The Dish is a small restaurant tucked away inside a modern wine and cheese shop called the Rum Runner. Although we had the address, it took us a while because we were looking for a big sign that read "The Dish".

The setting is modern, intimate and may even feel a bit pretentious. Patron dress ranged from casual to dressy, but all pretty tidy. The ambience is best for couples, the tables are small, much like round bar tables where one might stand, although there are high stools available. The largest table I spotted could accommodate a party of four, rubbing elbows. Since we had kids in tow after a long day out, we decided that it would be more comfortable for us to buy take-out.

The food was very tasty, but the portions were not huge. We ordered a chicken dish, a pork dish, but our hands-down favorite were the steamed mussels, which not only tasted heavenly, but were also a phenomenal value, compared to other menu items. What puzzled me was that our waiter was a bit tentative about our take-out order, not being sure if our mussels could be made for take-out since it would be "brothy". Made me wonder if no one else had ordered take-out before. ("Things that make you go "hmm...") Bottom line was that they did have good take-out containers and none of the savory broth was spilled. Just didn't expect "take-out" that to be an issue at an establishment like this.

The prices were on the high side, but may be rationalized by the quality of the food. The "jumbo shrimp with serrano ham" was tasty but the size of the portion (and the shrimp) was a bit disappointing. Other than that, everything qualifies for "thumbs up". The complimentary bread was also very good.

The wine and cheese section carried a wide variety of wines and spirits. Dining patrons may order wine from the restaurant or pick a bottle from the wine shop but pay corkage. The cheese deli was also very diverse. We bought some very special and delicious fig tapenade, which was a new recipe from one of their chefs.

Verdict: best for a romantic night on the town and if money were no object. Wasn't looking for oysters, but the mussels are a must-have.
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text:
Barrio Cusine is a good concept--given the huge O'odham and Yaqui populations living in and around Tucson, it's embarrassing that more restaurants don't draw from their culinary traditions. Barrio Cuisine does this rhetorically but it's hard to leave the restaurant without wishing they'd push native ingredients into more prominence on their menu.

There's nothing inherently wrong with this, but Barrio Cuisine's menu appears to be aiming for a demographic of people who like the idea of O'odham and Yaqui food without actually wanting to try scary new flavors. So there's a cholla bud pico de gallo that features scarcely a cholla bud and a nopales salad with almost no cactus in it. There's fry bread, which is safe for even the most timid Midwestern palette, but the only bean on the menu is in the tepary bean hummus. Squash is represented a little better, but it's not too prevalent other than in side dishes. There is a lot of meat (burgers, steaks, ribs, chicken) and a few Mexican restaurant staples (enchiladas, tacos), but the tweaks to those dishes don't make them stand out as unique.

If you are a food nerd and have spent time flipping through an O'odham cookbook like "From I'itoi's Garden" and wishing someone would start a restaurant that served those recipes, you'll have to keep waiting. Barrio Cuisine is not that place.

But if you accept Barrio Cuisine for what it is, it's okay. Most of the dishes were very well prepared--the folks in the kitchen can execute a recipe well and know how to present a dish. The calabacitas enchiladas were better than most restaurants and the Chilean crab and aioli tostadas were excellent, though it's hard to know how they relate to traditional O'odham or Yaqui food. Is it the word "tostada"? The salad was unimpressive, but that was an issue of design rather than execution. The pico should advertise cholla buds when they're in season and leave them off the menu when they're not--the rehydrated ones are flavorless. The tepary bean hummus was rich and tasty, but nothing you couldn't do at home. Overall, the quality of the ingredients was quite high.

Barrio Cuisine positions itself as a casual, yet slightly higher end restaurant and the prices and atmosphere reflect other restaurants in that category. The interior is nice, the portions aren't gluttonous, and it's a bit too expensive. A meal there certainly won't disappoint but, as of this writing, it doesn't yet live up to its full potential. Here's hoping.
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text: Nice place. Cute hotel and casino.  Very close the AVA. The rooms are very nice, we lucked out and got a great view of the pool and valley area. Staff was friendly. We didn't try any of the food, but I would when I go back. This would be a good staycation spot if you just want to get away for the weekend.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: One of my favorite resturaunts downtown, and hands down my favorite place to get tacos! Tuesdays are the best because from 3pm to close they have $1.99 tacos, so it's a nice deal. I've always had good custmoer service when I come in. My favorite tacos are the pollo asada and my favorite drink has to be their horchata! It's the right amount of sweet. I wish I could say more about their bar but I haven't had an opportunity to have anything because I'm usually here on my lunch break.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: This place was a hidden gem! I read the reviews and was concerned, I can't stand terrible service! However, I was so pleased with my experience.  Not only is the food delicious but there was a live jazz band playing out by the pool.  They had fire pits outside by the band and pool as well.  We sat and listened to the band and were offered blankets to use and could even purchase "make your own smores" and roast marshmellows by the fire while listening to the band.  Oh and the service being slow, what a bunch of bologna. I was trying to send a text and in that small amount of time the server came by twice wondering if we were ready to order.  Our food came out very fast as well.  Overall fantastic experience and will for sure go back
name: Fire + Spice Tucson
categories: Mexican, Tex-Mex, Restaurants

text: We have been visiting this restaurant off and on for years.  Sam, the owner, is extremely accommodating.  He goes out of his way to visit with all patrons and is extremely sensitive to requests.  He is in the process of getting bids for upgrades to this "well used" location.  We have not had a bad meal at this Kettle and really appreciate the extra attention from Khadija and others.  This is an old time family restaurant which has tons of local regulars (just check it on Sunday mornings after church!).  In spite of the negative reviews, go in with a positive, upbeat attitude.  Ask for Sam, the owner.  He'll make it right for you.
name: Kettle Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I would like to share with my friends the delicious zuchinni soup ordered from this restaurant! It was a little crowded and a rather long wait but when my soup came, I didn't care and understood why it was a little crowded with a long wait! I like a good source for good soup and this is why I am telling you about Village Bakehouse. The prices were very reasonable.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
Love this place for take-out/delivery! There are so many pizza places in Tucson - the places with hoity-toity toppings seem to be multiplying like crazy (although I can't complain since I love any kind of pizza). I would describe Fresco's as a cross between Domino's and the hoity-toity places.

The crust is similar in thickness to your standard Domino's - relatively thick and bready. But the toppings are fresh and the combinations are unique. Their fresh 'n fantastic is my new favorite - sliced tomatoes, mozz, big scoops of fresh ricotta, and probably a bunch of other delicious things I'm forgetting. Their pesto is also wonderful although as other reviews have noted, a little salty, so it's good to also order something else to balance it out. The one we weren't crazy about was their version of Hawaiian, which added onions, peppers, and shrimp to the typical Canadian bacon and pineapple. It was way too much on a slice.

They are not particularly cheap but often have coupons in the papers or in the U of A student discount book that are abundant on campus at the beginning of the semester. Great place to order from and watch a movie at home on a lazy cooking night!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: We have been there twice.  There is usually only one other customer or couple there. The staff is friendly and polite, but the food is about as good as you would get in the frozen section of your grocer. And more expensive. No thanks.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Brunch on a Sunday entailed a 1.5 hour wait for a table since they don't take reservations (we went to the Botanical Gardens about 10 min away to kill some time), then an additional 30 minute wait for the food to arrive after we ordered. This seems to be a common theme in Tucson for our dining experiences, which is unfortunate. Grilled cheese was awesome - hits the spot if you're looking for some smokey-gooey-goodness. The chicken and french toast were ok. Pretty much an entire chicken breast is presented, along with rosemary brioche french toast. The french toast was super doughy - yummy, but really filling. I wished they had let the bread soak in more of the egg. The fried chicken was not to my liking, as I didn't prefer the outer crust flavors (and would have preferred chicken thighs and dark meat rather than chicken breast to give it a more complex flavor.)
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I don't want to say that the last thing this town needs is another chain pizza place...but if it does...it sure as heck had better be fantastic.   Not the case here. 
After a painful 20 mins of trying to navigate their "on line ordering" I just gave up.  The pics looked so great and there were some pretty good reviews here on trusty old Yelp, so I called in.  
It was a Saturday night and they were busy.  Even ordering over the phone was kind of a pain...but we got though it.  The food came in less time than they estimated, the delivery guy was very nice and seemed to have his act together.  But then we tried to eat the pizza, and that is where we made our mistake.  
The pizza was very thin and had nearly no crust!  Normally, this wouldn't upset me too much....but the whole idea behind this place's gimmick is that they offer so many flavored crusts!!!!  The pizza was slightly worse than the $1 Titinos ya buy at the super market, and roughly the same size.  And it was $16.  
There were wings too.  Not nearly as disappointing as the pizza but most definitely from frozen, pre-seasoned and just bad.  
The only reason I gave Howies two stars was because of the sandwich.  Thank goodness my far better half had a craving for an Italian sub or our meal would've been a complete waste of time and money.  The sandwich was a little different.  It seemed to be made out of a folded pizza crust. It was pretty tasty and fairly large considering the very low price!!! I would even consider returning if only for the Italian Sub.  I think it was priced under $5 and fed us both.  (Though we did have some bites of awful pizza and substandard wings to help get us through). 
Anyway, if cheap food is what you're after...have at it.  If quality is your thing, skip this place.  It is an embodiment of what is wrong with chain restaurants.
name: Hungry Howie's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Food Delivery Services, Food, Pizza

text: If you don't want to wait for seating (good places are popular) then go to a place that isn't so popular.  Every cafe has their busy times and slow times.  The prices here are very reasonable and the food is good and fresh.  Not many little places to get a cup of coffee and breakfast that is good.  I have been to a few places in town and some places want you to just eat and go.  Not this place.  Relax and enjoy your food.
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: Easily the best restaurant I have been to in Tucson.  Elegant space, good service by knowledgeable people, delicious food (on the hearty side), and great wine list.
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text:
Anyone who walks into an AJ's should know they aren't walking out without taking a significant hit to the wallet, but even with that said, I think there is a bit of "buyer beware" to be mindful of here.  My wife and I stopped here to check out their specialty selections and found it to be a very mixed bag.  The sushi bar was an excellent find (love the dragon roll) but the Bistro was a total disappointment.  Their website said "five-star quality" and while of course that was a bit of an exaggeration, the selection of hot entrees we found didn't even approach two-star quality level.  

On the plus side though, the dessert and coffee bar was outstanding.  The selection is simply amazing... from chocolates, to pastries, to fruits, coffee, tea, hot cocoa, you name it.  We should have just stuck to sushi and dessert.  Those were definitely the highlights.

As a grocery store, I would only see myself shopping here to take advantage of their butcher and seafood selections.  There were some cuts and items here that you simply can't find at your typical grocery store.  But outside of that, you're just paying for marked up Cheerios.  

So if you stick to those specialties AJ's does well, you will feel like you got your money's worth.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: Worst Wingstop ever! DIRTY, small, and slow service. The biggest issue is how DIRTY this restaurant is! There where tables with food, sauce and bones left on them. It's a small restaurant so they have limited seating and at least 3 tables were covered in trash. There was no trash can anywhere available for customers dispose of the food/trash and staff never came out to clear and clean the tables. The restaurant was filled with flies and nats . I'm sure the dirty conditions added to the amount of flying pests. They have windows into the kitchen...and you could clearly see them use sauce bowls and the put them back on the shelves dirty with sauce dripping down the sides...attracting flies. Floors were dirty. Overall a very poor experience. I will never go back and urge everyone avoid this location of Wingstop.
name: Wingstop
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, American (New)

text: BEST cake in town...hands down.  They are not cheap but it is worth every penny! We get all our birthday cake their and some times just a "I need a VBH fix" cake and I am never disappointed.  The lunch and breakfasts are good as well but pretty spendy. I would eat lunch some where close and stop in for desert!
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Woohoo. Green corn waffle w eggs and apple bacon. Sounds weird tastes great. Very Tucson like meal. Loved it.

text: Woo! Awesome food and fun atmosphere! Sooo glad we tried this place. Everything we had was great (be sure to try their Bloody Mary)

text: Its a bit of a wait if you go at normal brunch times, but its worth it.  The creative bloody mary's and mimosa's are perfect to hold you over while waiting for whatever delicious dish you chose.  My favorites are the duck confit hash and the brioche french toast. Every time my friend comes to visit me in AZ he asks to go back to Prep & Pastry.
name: Prep & Pastry

text: Went here for the first time today and thought the chicken taco and decried beans were delicious. The salsa bar had a good number of choices but the chips were a little hard-although they were free. Great prices and left satisfied! The staff was very friendly
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Not your run of the mill Chinese restaurant.   Fresh house made noodles and unique dishes make this place different....in a good way.  The potstickers were awesome as was the Chef's Sauce noodles and the Kung Fu Beef Noodle soup.  There were lots of other interesting dishes being brought to neighboring tables that looked equally tempting.   Stop in for a nice change of pace from the ordinary.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: Visited Panera for dinner tonight and had amazing customer service courtesy of Bill. He greeted us as soon as we walked in with a smile. But what made it even better was his incredible personality. I will visit Panera just in hopes of being able to talk to Bill. Great Job!!
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: Wings here are delicious! The service may be a bit slow, but I say it is worth the wait. Just be prepared. Don't mind the flies...they may bother you but they won't eat much...there is a bright green neon paper plastered on the front door stating that this business is currently operating without a permit...
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
A rare highly recommend!

Amazing tacos, fresh chips and agua fresca. I've only tried the asada and the carnitas and both were moist and flavorful. The tortillas hold up to the assault of things that go on top.

Service is friendly and fast. Can get crowded at weekday lunch.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: This was a first visit for me at Ohana Cafe on the Byte tasting tour in LaJolla. We were served Kailua Pork with Jasmine Rice, coconut oil, green onions, and coconut. I loved the ambiance and art in the restaurant. The food was lovely.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: You guys....soooo good!  The Vegan chickpea scramble is delicious, as are the potatoes and the plain pancakes!  Yum!!!!!!  We will definitely be back!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We saw Village Bakeshop's reviews on Yelp so we thought we'd try it out. Awesome breakfast for a decent price. We both had an omelet fluffy and loved it. And we splurged  on something sweet - chocolate croissant & pecan sticky bun. Best ever.  Staff was friendly & helpful. You place the order at the counter & they bring your food. We sat outside on the patio and really enjoyed it. Will return when in the area.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: This is a restaurant that reminds me of little cafes I used to go to growing up. They offer a wide variety of food, generous portions, and are very reasonably priced. We are there for lunch, but I'd like to go back and try breakfast next time.
name: Brawley's Restaurant
categories: Food, Do-It-Yourself Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

text:
Great spot for casual/upscale steal\k in DT Tucson!  Food is fresh and locally sourced kif you are into such things).  Service (Warren) was attentive, friendly. and super efficient.  Draft beer included both the major brands and also local brews.

We started with the tableside guac.  Good stuff!  Warren asked to make sure we had just the right mix of heat and flavor.  It was perfect.  

Chips and salsa were also complimentary - both green and red salsa had solid flavor without turning our mouths into raging infernos.

Menu is, as you would expect "meat-centric."  I had the carne asada, and it was a full 10 oz.  It came with two four (could have had corn) tortillas, and I am sure if I had asked Warren would have run right out with more.

My wife had the meatloaf, and when it arrived she rolled her eyes at the huge portion!  Most of it went home in a box and was just as good the day after.  She also commented the accompanying gravy was spot-on.

Sides are not included with the meal.  We had the green chili mac & cheese.  It was tasty, and plenty for two people to share.  They also provided beans, which were...beans.  

Overall Charro gets it right.  The menu is varied enough to allow everyone a choice - from burgers to meatloaf to carne.  We didn't try the dessert menu because we sere just too stuffed with the main meal.  

We will be back.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
Must try the chicken Alfredo! It is my favorite, and somehow Caruso's makes theirs taste different from any other restaurant I've been to. I usually call to place my order, and no matter what day or time it is they take around 15 min before they call back to let me know it is ready. This is convenient since I live 15 minutes away and can start driving as soon as I place my order. That order will come with a bag of garlic bread too! And if you like cannolis my friend praises them and always orders one when we come here.

I have sat in the restaurant several times before, and I never had any awful experiences. The waiters may take a while to get around and back to your table, but this only happens when they're understandably busy.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: This is nice hidden gem. We have never been disappointed. The staff is very friendly and willing to please. The food is very tasty and something a little outside the box from you normal restaurant.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
This chain restaurant keeps up its reputation of offering delicious, fatty food in huge portions in Tucson. 

From appetizer to dessert, everything on the menu can be shared because the portions are SO big. Definitely come with a friend and plan on splitting everything unless you have a large waistline. 

Service is prompt and friendly, and plates are priced accordingly with their size. If you're in the mood for some down-home cooking in a pleasant environment - and you feel you could eat a buffalo - come to Claim Jumper.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Visiting Tucson, and came back to Sachiko on Valencia where we used to frequent. Excellent ad always, good service, extended hours.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text:
This is the kind of place you go for certain dishes, and if you get the wrong dish, you might be disappointed.

So what to get at a place called Kung Fu Noodle? Well, being a Taiwanese style noodle restaurant, you can't go wrong with the beef noodle soup. Flavor wise, it's as good as beef noodle soup I've had in Los Angeles, although I will say that I wish they had more beef. Noodles are nicely done, and the broth is just wonderfully spicy with just a little hint of sweetness from the star anise/cinnamon and whatever other spices they put in there. It's awesome.

In addition, it's the only place in Tucson where you can get Taiwanese street food, like the "Chinese burrito" and various buns. I wasn't a huge fan of their "hamburger", but the Chinese burrito and the green onion pancake are awesome. Probably the only complaint is that they're pretty expensive, especially compared to other cities, but I guess when you're the only show in town you can charge what you like. Not a huge complaint; after all, I'm happy this place exists in Tucson.

Service is actually not bad considering it's a pretty authentic Chinese place (back in LA, if you go to a Chinese restaurant with good service, you can pretty much guarantee that it's either overpriced or caters to Americanized tastes). 

So overall, go and get the beef noodle soup, the green onion pancake, and the Chinese burrito and you most likely won't be disappointed!
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: I was really hoping to love this place, but it failed to do sol!! I am a true meat lover and always craving a good steak. I have visited Charro Steak a few times but just for beers since they have a selection of draft beer. Two nights ago, my boyfriend and I decided to try the food and we were not impressed at all. He had the ribeye and ordered medium-rare, well it was cooked almost well done and very plain in flavor. It came with charro beans and tortillas. I ordered the pork chop with prickly pear glaze which was way too thick and hard to chew. The glaze was very tasty though. We also ordered two side (chile relleno and corn tamale). The chile relleno was good and flavorful. The corn tamale was a bit dry. Even though the sides are supposed to be shareable, they are definitely not (at least not the ones we ordered). Lastly, I decided to try a margarita and ordered the one with strawberries for $12, it was a complete rip off, it tasted like lime water. The service and atmosphere are good, no complaints there.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Arrived at 6:30 to an almost empty restaurant. A sports bar, a craft beer bar, second game of the World Series, and there were five people at the bar. Attempted to order the specialty of the house which is pulled pork only to be told that they had no more pulled pork available. That took at least three items off the already very small menu. Bar height table and chairs are very uncomfortable and extremely difficult to get in and out of. Prices are very high. Our bill was almost $50 for two sandwiches and three cocktails. It's just too bad the northwest side needs something like this only better.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text:
I made a terrible decision to come here one day.  Terrible because now all I can think of is when will I be eating their tacos again.  I want Street everyday.

I was reluctant when I walked in my first time and see that it was like a Chipotle in that you build your own taco down the line.  But as a picky eater, I was ecstatic because it meant ordering would be simpler.

Once I took a bite of their carne asada tacos, I knew I finally found MY taco place.  Since moving to Tucson 3 years ago, I've been having a surprising amount of difficulty finding a taco place that reminded me of what I ate in Chicago.  I finally found it.

I would give them a 4 stars because it's downtown and Jesus H Christ parking is a pain in the ass.  They need a more central location.  But I love them so much, I'm not going to bring their rating down.

PLEASE open a location out of the downtown area.  Or get some parking!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
I have lived in Tucson for almost 10 years and have been a devoted patron of Casino Del Sol, especially their poker room.  I am a Ruby card holder, one level short of elite, so I do play here a lot.  Over the past few years there has been one specific player in this room (about whom I have complained numerous times in person and in writing in the past, to absolutely no avail) who has been banned due to boorish behavior from playing at the other main poker room in town.  He pounds on the table so hard that it literally vibrates.  He slurps served food like a hog at a trough. 
 Until recently he used to engage in lascivious behavior with his girlfriend during hands, but this has pretty much stopped.  He has continually bullied me and the dealers have said nothing.  He has put his hand on my chips in the past and moved them in and out -- for those who play poker, you know this is a cardinal sin.  I cursed at him in Spanish and the dealer admonished ME for raising my voice.  Last night, however, was the last straw.  He picked at me nonstop for three hours and finally I told him to "chill out;" he told me to Shut Up and the dealer just laughed at me.  This has been my favorite poker room for years.  The dealers are very good for the most part and the supervision is acceptable, but for some reason this "person" has been continually allowed to disrupt and dominate play in the poker room despite a number of complaints.  I am not the only person who feels this way.  Last night I let management know that if this person was not banned I would no longer be playing here.  The last time I wrote a complaint I received a form letter saying that the "situation would be investigated" but of course nothing has happened.  I have spoken personally with the new manager of the poker room and nothing has happened.  I have been trying to arrange a women's tournament at this poker room, but am putting my plans on hold because if this person is in the room his continual scatalogical language would make me as a sponsor look very bad among all the other female players.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Delicious! a great place to get breakfast near the U of A since there aren't many places like that around. Had to give it four stars because service was kinda slow and had to ask repeatedly to get hot water before we actually received any. Otherwise it was really good, definitely would go back! :)
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: First, we LOVE the wings here and visit this place pretty regularly HOWEVER, the service seems to have declined to a level that has made us seek out another wing place to give our business to.   A couple of months ago I called to place a call in order and was told to hold.  The person who answered put the phone down and I waited for 10 minutes before giving up.   Last Friday, I went in to pick my order up and the person who rang me up couldn't be bothered to interrupt his conversation with another employee so he had to run my card twice because the first time it was done incorrectly. Finally, last night  I called to place an order and AGAIN was left on hold for over 11 minutes.  I ended up ordering from a place that is 5 minutes out of my way but seemed to be worth the drive since that establishment picked up on the second ring and took my order immediately.   Again, great food but not good enough to deal with the inconsistent service.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: I stopped in on Thursday night for pasta night.  Loved it!  It was $7.99 for no meat, and $8.99 with a choice of meatballs, sausage, or chicken. You get to choose from about 10 different pasta's - angel's hair, tortellini, whole wheat penne, spaghetti, and more... then choose your veggies - any that you want from about a dozen veggies - they grill them for you!  Kalamata olives, broccoli, onions, spinach, bell peppers and more... it's huge! The half portion is enough for two, and it all comes with a breadstick and a salad!!  AWESOME!!
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text:
We stopped by for lunch while running errands in Tucson. The place looks great, very Colorado. The service was fast and friendly. I had the ribeye and it was great. Cooked just right and full of flavor.
My wife had the salmon and loved it. The portions were a good size but prices were a little high,  $62 for lunch without liquor .

All said and done I would return.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Good food overall. For people not from the area it's kind of just a nicer, fresher Chipotle with a bar. The meats were good and the fillings were nice but you don't really have a lot of options and the guy making our burritos barely gave us the chance to say if we didn't want something. I don't like raw tomatoes and if I hadn't immediately said something I would have been stuck with them.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Charro Steak was a fantastic restaurant. Highly recommend a reservation for a spot because it does get slammed. I started off with a delicious Margarita that had jalapeño, it was spicy but not overwhelming spicy to the point where I couldn't handle it.  For starters I ordered a Ahi Salad, it was very good, just wish it had more salad dressing. 

Main meal was Tomahawk steak and lobster with Charro beams and roasted corn. 
It was amazing! The steak was so delicious it was like cutting Into butter. It wasn't overly seasoned which made you really appreciate the flavors of the meat & mesquite flavor. 
Lobster was mesquite grilled , which was new to me , and it was fantastic! 
The only thing I didn't like were the chips , they were soggy . And it was a shame cause the Salas that went with it was very authentic and tasted home made!!!
Our server was very nice!
I will definitely be returning and trying other items on the menu. I can't stop talking about my experience here!
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Al pastor was kick ass. The spanish rice was ok but every thing else was top notch. Especially the salsa bar. Will be going back to try more tacos!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Great food and great service! We tried the chefs noodles and egg and tomato noodles -- both were awesome! Highly recommend it!
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: This was by far the worst dining experience I've had in Tucson. Food was terrible, the service was uninformed, disorganized and unprofessional, and they got the order wrong three times.They were totally out of menus with descriptions, and our cashier was sure that they had items that they actually don't offer. Overall the staff had a weird off-putting false cheeriness without really trying to fix their mistakes.The salads we were ultimately served didn't taste good or feel healthy.  The lettuce was wilted, and the dressing was full of corn syrup, even though they claimed it was low sugar. They may say the food is healthy but it's not. I wouldn't return to this restaurant if you paid me. I would give them negative points if they were available --one star seems like too much.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: I ordered the Sweet Potato Hash with 2 eggs. The eggs were too well done, but the hash was good. I also had a biscuit, which was soggy. My husband had French Toast Monte Cristo. The bread was still doughy and not cooked enough. The only reason I have it two stars instead of one star is because they did refund our money for the Monte Cristo and the waiter was great. But, we won't be returning to this restaurant.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I'm from Phoenix and always must stop here when we come to town. I was surprised to see only a 2.5 star average, so reading through the reviews, I'm sad to see such low stars for things like drive thru being busy or them keeping napkins behind the counter. Come on. I'm eating inside right now and they did not make me ask for ketchup like someone said- they actually came by halfway through my meal and asked if we needed anything else. I'm always here on a weekday around lunchtime and have always had great service. The food is great too. Give it a try for yourself! I hope they can stay in business so we don't have to go to NM to get these delicious burgers.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: The breakfast burritos are the best, and you can't go wrong with some Hatch green chili.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Great place to eat with fresh ingredients! Especially for a place that delivers quickly and with a smile! You can't go wrong with Fresco!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Small selection, cold food and the nasty after taste stayed in my mouth from lunch until I went to sleep.
name: May Flower Chinese Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: This place is pretty good but nothing too special. There's always a long wait because it's a hip spot, but you could go down the street for the same meal without the wait.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I had the chicken enchiladas eduardo combo plate.  It was pretty meh.  Very creamy sauce, no flavor to it.  Salsa with the chips was bland as well?  Service was nice.  I might try it again someday, I just had a totally different idea of what "chipotle" sauce enchiladas were.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: I probably been here 3 times here and nothing really sticks out from other Japanese restaurants besides the self serve Miso soup area. Also they allow you to bring your own alcohol drinks which is nice. There is no physical "sushi bar" here. The sushi is made in the back and served to you at your table. It does taste fresh. Unfortunately for far east Tucson residents, this place and Ichiban are the two closest Japanese restaurants. And I think Ichiban is overpriced. Sushi Nara serves the Korean spicy ramen type and honestly tastes exactly like the Hongshim Shin Black instant ramen found in packages. However, they do add some mixed onions, minced pork, egg, and a slice of kamaboko. The ramen is a couple dollars cheaper than other Japanese restaurants that serve the ramen made with the authentic Japanese broths.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text:
I work in the shopping center that Gusto is located, but it took me more than a month to finally visit. It won't be long before i'm back!

I went at lunch and had a glass of pinot and the canelloni. I could not stop "mmm-ing" audibly throughout the entire meal. My sister asked, "Do you two want to be alone?" She had the manicotti and was also impressed. We were provided with ample bread and olive oil for snacking, and our water glasses were never empty. Our server was kind and courteous. For two people at lunch, plus one glass of wine, our total before tip was $25. The quality of food was worth every penny.

We were one of two tables. I understand though--my work is pretty slow usually because of the strange location. I hope more people hear about how yummy this place is, because it makes me sad to see such a delicious restaurant near-empty on a Saturday at lunch.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: I love ramen and have tried multiple ramen places in Tucson. I heard a new ramen shop opened and decided to try it out! I went with a group of 5 friends  (6 total) on a Friday night so it was a pretty long wait (40min). However, the wait was worth it. I ordered the spicy miso ramen and it came in less than 10min. The noodles were cooked well, broth was delicious, and the meat was amazing! Not to mention our server John (with an H!) was the best server ever. He made this experience even better. He had a great sense of humor not to mention brought us water 3 times (we love H2O). I wish I could come here every week!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
Brunch... Most of the time you can't mess it up so most places get exceptional reviews for bacon, eggs and mimosas. 

Not to hype it up but this place transcends brunch. We sat at the bar and chatted with the keep for recommendations and had such a hard time choosing because everything looked a-MAZ-ing. We ended up with pork belly Benedict and a monte cristo sipping on what I would call the best Bloody Mary I ever had. Yes they use a zing zang base but have a specially made secret mix added to it. I wish I had more room in my stomach for the freshly made cronuts (yes, half croissant half donut) but thank cod for next weekend :) 

Really cool atmosphere, if bloody Mary's aren't your thing they have twists on classic breakfast cocktails... This place is a must try!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Ambiance to die for. Sitting outside. Birds chirping, grapefruit blossom smell & after sunset dinner by candlelight. 
Lasagna so yummy. Chicken Parmasana awesome. Loved the Italian dressing  (I don't usually like Italian drressing.)
Bri is an awesome waitress.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: love this place love the salt and pepper spare ribs. this place is never busy but the food is by far the best ive tried in tucson
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Came to Angela's pre-lunchtime. So great. Friendly service. We even had a few laughs. The salsa bar was fresh, fresh. Nice.  I ordered both asada and adobada. Meat and spices were spot on, and the portions were good size, matching the price. The corn tortillas are good, the flower were outstanding. Oh, and maybe the best part...they do not over-salt any part of the meal (rice, beans, meat...).  The spices and salsa did the talking. Angela's is a new favorite on a short list.
name: Angela's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: This was my second time to eat at this restaurant and I was not as impressed this time as I was 4 years ago. For it to have such a strong patriotic emphasis, I was disappointed to read on the door that they no longer offer a military discount. Also, the breakfast potatoes and biscuits appeared to be of the frozen variety. My omelet was loaded with bacon, and I do mean loaded. It tasted ok, but I couldn't eat all of the bacon. The coffee was good as was the service. This was the first place I ate on my first visit to Tucson and it was my last; it would not be on my "must see/eat there" list if I visited again.
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: Fun, fun, fun.  So popular, you may have to wait--but who wants to eat at a restaurant that has no patrons??  Plus, there's plenty to do in the little shopping center: a phenomenal antique store, Zoe, a great dress shop and a native seed store.  Love the avocado and eggs dish--very innovative and topped with interesting herbs.  Very lively with a hip atmosphere missing in so many Tucson dining spots.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
This is probably my favorite brunch spot. Great atmosphere, service, and always clean inside and out. The weekend dishes are what my friends and I literally drag ourselves out of bed for - in particular, the "breakfast poutine". It's amazing! I can't say enough about that dish. 
The drink (cocktail) menu has changed a bit since P&P opened. We were sad about that, but quickly got over it and now have new favorite brunch cocktails. 
We visit at least every other weekend. There is usually a wait if you show up after 10:00am, but they provide complimentary coffee to enjoy. Check P&P out!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
First date.
Horrible suggestion by the person I went out with. Smoky, weird draft, gross people. Ugh.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: What an amazing find.  I flew in to Tucson too late to catch breakfast here so we settled on lunch.  Some of the best food I've ever had!  Fresh, delicious, great prices and the best service!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: True story.... I'm sitting here at prep and pastry.,  and I can not wait to go home and write this review.. it had to be said now On The Spot .. this place is amazing!! Starting with all the mimosa flavors .  But, now moving on to the Food.. if you like absolutely flavorful, delicious. And very beautifully served food.. thus is the place!! delicious!! Our server was Nate.. and yes Nate was Great!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
This place has been here forever, well, over a decade. So special lady friend came back from her business trip to TX and she was telling about this place she ate at. Which made me think I could do that. So I pulled out  my panini press and gave it a once over and then thought, next step bread. The next day we went to lunch at sushi on oracle where special lady friend reminded me we should get some bread. My first thought was Byond Bread is just up the road... then I thought NO lets see what the Village Bakehouse is making these days. I will confess I used to come there in high school because a friend worked there and well you know how that goes. Sadly I must say I kind of stopped going regularly. But they are every bit as good as I remember. I got a mini ciabatta which was big enough for two big sized sandwiches for $1.2 and it was good and paninied up real nice. I think when I need bread and I am on that side of town I will pop in.

 Also if you buy bread at sprouts, walmart, or trader joes (all with in walking distance) you should be a shamed of yourselves. You are doing your self a great disservice. better tasting, fresher, more varieties, and locally owned... seriously, There is no reason to buy from the other places, spend 5 min to get the good stuff.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Probably the most authentic Chinese type food in Tucson. The place is nice and very clean. The food is great! Try the Kung fu beef noodles, yes it is in on the oily side, but that's from the chili oil that they use ( which is awesome). Also definitely try their version of the beef burrito, I used to eat these a lot when I was child. Then top it off with nice milk tea!
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: holy cow! this is by far one of the best breakfast places I have EVER been to! Try the smokes french toast or the eggs benedict and go directly to heaven because its that good!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Very cool branching spot and some really good food. I had the biscuits and gravy with a side of bacon and it was all amazing, especially the bacon. The bacon was unlike any I've had before and I'll definitely go back to get more.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This is the nicest Eegees I have been to in Tucson. Everyone who lives in Tucson knows that a cold Eegee slush is what they are famous for and helps locals get through the hellish summers. Their fries are touted as the best in town. I have had many of the subs off their menu and they are all fantastic. Last, the employees are always friendly and personable.
name: eegee's
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text:
Mother Hubbard's has become sort of a Saturday morning ritual for me - I meet a friend to hike Tumamoc and then we indulge in specialty waffles, maple syrup and house made sausage. The food is delicious and the service is always fast and friendly.

I'd stay away from the biscuits and gravy - have tried both kinds and wasn't very impressed. Instead, try the green corn waffle or the potato waffle. Yeah, I said potato waffle - with chives and balsamic sauce. Yummmmm.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
All I can say is what happened? We used to go to this place when it was located on Harrison and 22nd. They moved and we were really bummed. We have been dining here since they moved and it seems to have gone down hill. We thought it was just growing pains so we have over looked some things but last night was it for us. 

We ordered two appetizers ( Sw Potato Fries and Fried Zucchini) 
Grilled Chicken platter with side salad
Steak platter for husband
Hot tea and Iced tea

Appetizers never came out
Salads were served but were the very basic for 2.99 Iceberg Lettuce, a sliver or two of onion, tomato slice and a small little thing of ranch dressing. 
barely through my small dinner salad the plates with dinner came out and were delivered by our waitress as if they were coming in for a landing as she put them on the table without waiting for anyone to move a single plate that they were eating from. 
ice tea was not refilled, my hot tea was not refilled nor was i asked if I would like more hot water. 

I didn't eat much of my dinner but out waitress would not have noticed.We saw her plenty when we were between the salad and dinner but  we did not see her after plates were served. We waited and waited for a ticket , she looked our direction and could not tell we were ready to leave i guess so I flagged another waitress who noticed the uneaten meal and asked if I wanted a box. I told her no, the chicken was dry, veggies were drowned in butter and mushy. Just a check please. I also pointed out the appetizers were not delivered. Our waitress did come by with the check at last and offered free desert and did remove charges for my meal and appetizers which was fabulous. I would say I would give it another go but previous experiences combined with other reviews and our experience last night make this a NO GO for future outings. Off we go to find another favorite.  

Kickers was it wasn't that busy!!! hmmm....
name: Great American Steakburger
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Bars, Steakhouses, Burgers

text: We are not Arizona native, but this food was very tasty. This is not a fancy restaurant, however the wait staff was friendly, happy to explain and give it vice, and the food was good. I was happy with our experience.
name: El Sur Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: I have been here twice for Brunch both times and have not been disappointed yet. I had the Chef's omelette the first time and a great bloody Mary. The next time I had the duck confetti it was really good different but good.  We always leave with a pastry and they are amazing. Love Love Love this place I think I am heading there for lunch tomorrow.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We used to get pizza from her every couple of months. It was decent and we liked the flavored crust options. However, after our last visit we will not return. I ordered a pizza for pick up, picked it up and went in to work. (This is a job where my kids come with me) After my kids took their first bite they were complaining of the pizza being too spicy. The crust was red, which was really weird because I ordered the garlic crust. So I called to tell them that we didn't get what we ordered. The guy seemed to remember my pizza and said it was their sriracha crust. They offered to make me another pizza but I was at work and couldn't leave to go get it. The guy told me not to order that pizza if it was too hot for my kids and I explained to him I didn't order it and they messed up. After talking to the manager they said there was nothing they could do. Really? You guys didn't give me what I ordered. We won't return here for pizza again.
name: Hungry Howie's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Food Delivery Services, Food, Pizza

text: I just love this place, every time we are in Tucson we stop at this place even if we have to wait hours. Saturday nights wait can be up to an hour but it's so worth waiting for it.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: The food is decent. Not great, not bad. Fairly priced. I also think they might be rationing napkins. The dining area and parking lot are not very fun. The drive thru line goes right through the middle of the parking lot. Waited 5 minutes to back out and leave. Seating is scarce and the lines to order and pick up might as well be sitting on your lap. I won't tell you not to go. You might like it. It just wasn't for me.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Breakfast is okay, their kombucha is really good. The Mr and I had brunch here after spending the weekend at a nice resort. Found this place on Yelp after doing a search for, "best breakfast The place looks like a whole in the wall in a modest shopping center. We both ordered the good green kombucha which was really good. It was refreshing and bubbly with a hint of sweetness that was satisfying. The service was great despite it being super busy. We both ordered the green corn waffles (about $6) and ordered them Pueblo Style (w/ 2 eggs and a meat) for an extra $6. The waffles tasted like corn bread and are pretty big. I gave it 3 stars because the food you get isn't worth the price. With so many places to try in Tucson, I'd go somewhere else next time.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Food was great very friendly staff, I celebrated my birthday with brunch there and I accidently left my birthday present there and when I called to see if they found it "No one had seen it". I thought that was a bit shady.  But other than that visit was great!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Had dinner there I got a chicken tikka masala, naan, and raita everything was awesome! Would definitely recommend!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: My husband and I were here for the second time this morning.  We have been impressed with the excellent service - attentive and pleasant, constant coffee refills.  The food is diner fare, so don't expect gourmet.  That said, the pancakes are very good, and my bacon omelette was chock-full of bacon, yum.  So nice to have Brawleys in our Tucson neighborhood.
name: Brawley's Restaurant
categories: Food, Do-It-Yourself Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

text: When we travel from Phoenix, this is one of our first stops in Tucson. The tacos and burritos are delicious. The chips and salsa bar is a bonus. Love the atmosphere in the Tucson downtown area.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I called in an order for pickup and for $30 got a lot of food. Order was accurate and ready right away. It wasn't the best Chinese food ever, but it wasn't bad. I'd definitely order again.
name: China Dragon Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: This place is possibly the cutest brunch location that I have been to. I come specifically for their pastries (try their scones!) and tea. The wait is a bit of overkill, but sometimes it's well worth it. We had the steak breakfast sandwich and sweet potato hash. Both were extremely delicious! Note that the breakfast sandwich does come on a biscuit so it's a fork and knife dish. My only small confusion comes from the lack of uniform, which makes me weary about who is a server and who's not.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Well I hate to knock off one star, but the last few times we've been here the service hasn't been that great.  Service was never that good to begin with but the last few times we've visited it's been even worse... so knocking off a star for that.

Otherwise the food, ambiance, and prices are still great.

We'll still keep eating here and do recommend the place-- just know that the service is probably going to be kind of bad.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
The sushi is good and I have no complaints!
But, I tried the Beef Teriyaki and it made me SO SICK!!!!!! You've been warned.......
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: Thank you, Yelp for recommending this gem for Valenrine's Bloody Mary's. We tried it out on Saturday for lunch. Waited an hour to get a table on a beautiful day and the wait was worth every minute   Looked at the menu and knew, before tasting, it would be a new favorite. Read all the reviews for descriptions of the various amazing dishes.  The f is fun and helpful and obviously  proud to work there.   Imaginative and creative and delicious.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Good food and good prices. I like the Carne Asada tacos. The endless chips and salsa bar was my favorite part. Oh! And if you like margaritas, you must try the hibiscus margarita! It's amazing!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
1) Plan ahead.  Get reservations, and don't invite more than three people to come with you.  Calling The Dish "intimate" is a stretch.  The place seats very few people.

2) Save yourself for what is some of the best bistro cuisine you've ever eaten in a wine store...or anywhere else for that matter.

This place has sentimental value for me, dating back to the old location.  In law school, when fine dining was a luxury, my friend and I would call ahead, sit at the bar on a Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursday to get the mussel deal.  Expertly steamed mussels and a glass of wine for $10.  It's now $12.50, but, hey, it's still a good deal.

Now I go there with my mother.  We always get the same thing, because if it's not broke, don't fix it.  We split the artichoke appetizer (artichokes stuffed with mushrooms on a bed of truffle oil infused polenta) and the roasted chicken with cippolini onions and mashed potatoes.  The restaurant always accommodates this request and we make up for splitting the meal by ordering wine.  And they have great wine.

Make sure you try the bread and compound butter.  It's a wonderful treat.

Dessert, whether on a plate or in a glass, is a great way to round out the evening.

This is the kind of place where you can sit long into the night, listen to great music, drink wine, and enjoy your company as much as the food...if your company is really really good.
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text:
Had the biryani, tandoori chicken, and the chana masala + naan while visiting a friend down here. All was standard and fine. The food wasn't remarkable, but it wasn't inedible either. I'd probably go back again if I was down there and someone asked me to (after I try Cafe Poca Cosa first, though).

In any case, Sher Punjab seems like a good, safe bet for Indian in Tucson (I'll have to visit Tucson more often before I can compare it to other Indian joints).
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Waitress was rude when explaining that something didn't come with what we ordered because it's a different special, TWICE then askeddif we needed a box . We said thanks and that we would not return. She says, "What?". We then just asked for tbe check. The person on the computer sitting at the back came up to us and rudely "explains" our misunderstanding, AGAIN. Waited another five minutes for a box, then I stated that she asked me if I wanted one and she never brought it. Computer person yells from her seat if we want a box, and brings us one... NEVER GOING BACK. Food was amazing, the help was not. I worked in the food and customer service industry for 16 years. Never have I managed employees to treat their PAYING guests this way. Also, maybe rethink the unprofessional dress code. Tank top, short shorts hair all over the place? Fast food, maybe... But in a dine-in establishment? I bope the owners read this. Ill be posting on yelp and online...
name: China Dragon Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: The wife and I ate here years and years ago, and hadnt been back due to it just not being that great... fast forward to today, and it had not changed. It is still overpriced and mediocre. Especially when there is a similar resturaunt in the same mall parking lot, which is priced much more reasonably for similar food. I gave it 3 stars cause at the very least the server was good.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: While it may not be saying much, this is the best ramen in Tucson, it's workers food through and through. No true ramen is high class and this place simulates the blue collar restaurant experience well. The food is all good and one should always get extra chashu pork no matter what ramen you order. Service is fast and to the point and I cannot blame the servers for being tired as this place is always packed.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
Perhaps I need to give Prep and Pastry a second shot, because my first visit was not as amazing as the reviews would suggest.  I must give them a lot of credit for their unique menu, impressive bakery and extensive array of brunch cocktails.  I also loved the rustic venue, with its high ceilings and wood floors.  Our waiter was a delight, he really made our experience a pleasant one.  

My only criticism is the food.  I was told that I have to order the french toast because it's their specialty.  I ending up getting the french toast of the day, which had whipped cream, blueberries, sweet cream cheese and brioche bread.  To begin with, the portion was way too big.  They gave me four huge slices and I'm the type of person who prefers less food, so that I can enjoy my meal without feeling engorged.  The texture of the french toast was too dry, it seems like they didn't soak it in the custard long enough.  There were very few blueberries and the combo of whipped cream and cream cheese was just too rich.  Maybe I ordered the wrong item!

My mom had the a.m. relleno which was the perfect portion size and very tasty, but a little too spicy.  My brother ordered the monte cristo with a side of biscuits and gravy.  Again, the portion was out of control!  Two giant sandwiches that were impossible to eat, with a ton of potatoes.  Altogether, just too heavy.  As for the drinks, my coffee and peach/orange mimosa was delicious, but the red sangria was far too sweet.

To top it off, this place is crazy busy on the weekend.  My family and I got there at 9am, so we only had to wait about 20 minutes.  After 10am, it was a zoo.

I'm probably in the minority here, but I think Prep and Pastry is trying too hard to impress their customers with lots of flavors and huge portions.  They should scale back and simplify.  I know it's brunch and it's supposed to be decadent, but you have to strike a balance.  I think I'll stick with B-line for breakfast.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Traditional Japanese ramen shop, with 10 varieties of ramen on the menu including tonkotsu, shoyu, miso and spicy ramen starting around $9 with optional extra toppings. A full-service restaurant friendly and fast service. Great place to stop for lunch. They get busy but don't plan on waiting long.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Food is good and priced ok. Slightly lacking in flavor with the Ramen so I'll probably have to ask them to make it spicy next time. As a comparison, the pho at Miss Saigon is more flavorful than the chicken ramen I had. That said, the ramen itself was cooked well and the proportions were good. My only major complaint is how the servers want to rush you through your meal. My server literally asked me if I wanted the check when I was mid sentence with my dining companion.... I mean, I guess ?  I wasn't even fully finished with my meal and they were asking if they could clear plates. We were not even dining that long (probably there for a total of an hour, maybe hour and fifteen). I'll probably only get takeout from this place, as dining there is not a positive experience.  They are more focused on turning tables than providing service.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
This is my kind of breakfast. Simple, cheap, fast.

On your average day, I don't even eat breakfast. But when I do, I like a proper breakfast full of protein and I have relatively simple tastes. Eggs of some sort, maybe an omelet with some veggies inside. Toast, preferably sourdough. Maybe some sort of hot sauce for the omelet. And finally, a nice tall glass of Orange juice. This place does it right, in that old-fashioned greasy spoon kinda way. The service is friendly and fast. The atmosphere is simple and practical. Jerry Bob's is great for all ages, and despite the fact that its a chain, maintains its family-owned feel with treats like homemade pies. Everything about it is exactly what I want for breakfast.

P.S. If you can't eat in a place like this, then you're officially a stuck-up snob and I don't like you. 

The End.
name: Jerry Bob's On Broadway
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners, Salad

text: The only reason I'm giving one star is because this app allows me to rate this place with one star if I had my choice I'd put no stars .Yesterday we had a reservation at 4:30. When we arrived we were informed that we would have to wait a short time because they were quite busy and unable to seat us at the time that we had set for a reservation. We were finally seated at 5:22 almost an hour past original time. It took the waiter almost 25 minutes to come to the table and start to take our order. When he did bring us our food part of it was cold my steak was horrible my wifes salad a hamburger and a drink was over $30 not even worth it. Other people in our party complained about the taste of the food. Also it took us five or six times asking the waiter to fill our water glasses before he would even fill our glass very unprofessional period poor customer service. If you have a reservation I think you should be seated at the time of your reservation. Overall extremely disappointed with the quality and the lack of customer service.  In good conscience I could not recommend this place to anyone my recommendation is to stay away and go someplace else that appreciate your business period and knows how to treat its customers with respect that they deserve. Also when I went to wash my hands the soap container was filled with some kind of liquid other than soap it actually burn my hands. When I brought it up to the ladies attention she went and check and she said oh we're so sorry someone filled it with the wrong liquid period just proof that they don't know what they're doing just
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
I've said it before and ill say it again, I don't like going out for Mexican food!! 
Everytime my husband suggest a Mexican restaurant I try really hard to steer him away from mexican. 
Sadly, this time I gave in and we ended up at La Parilla Suiza. We walked in and the hostess took us to our table, our waiter came and brought us salsa and chips and took our drink orders. The salsa was really good.
I ordered a combo of tacos de alambre and chilaquiles and my husband ordered the enchiladas. Im sorry to say that those tacos were the worst I have ever tasted. They consisted of beef meat with sauteed onions,tomatoes and chile. The meat was very tough and dry, as if it had been previously made and left there. Now for the chilaquiles, it was tortillas chips in bland tomato sauce. I don't know if restaurants are aware that they are supposed to be spicy, I mean common, its in the name "CHILAquiles". If your not going to make them spicy, then atleast add some flavor to the tomato sauce. I had to add some of the salsa to make them taste better. My husband thought the enchiladas were ok but nothing to come back for.
I have to say that the service was good, but I do not LOVE the food here so I doubt we will be coming back.
Once again, another mexican restaurant I don't love.
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: We made reservations a month in advance for our anniversary on Jan 1st.  I even called the restaurant to make sure they would be open that day.  We received two emails and a text message the day before confirming our reservations.  We drove 25 miles to get to the restaurant, only to find they were closed.  If that wasn't bad enough, they didn't have the decency to reply to my phone message or the three emails I sent them afterwards.  One reason we were planning on dining there was because we had received a gift card from one of the many people we had referred to Charro.  Never again!  What a complete letdown.  I wouldn't eat here just because they've shown what type of establishment they are when they won't even respond to what is obviously a legitimate complaint and 100 percent their fault.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
Moderately satisfied with this place. I have eaten in the dining room a couple of times, it's always been very empty with weird decor. The servers informed us they do almost all of their business via delivery. 
I had my first delivery order last night, and was not disappointed. The garlic shrimp and vegetable eggs rolls were average. The garlic shrimp was certainly the better of the two, and was unlike any Chinese food I've ever had with the majority of the dish consisting of large water chestnut pieces.  The vegetable eggs rolls were so-so. 
I'll probably end up ordering from here again as it certainly beats essentially all of the Chinese I've had in Tucson.
name: May Flower Chinese Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: We just went to breakfast at Mother Hubbard's and it was absolutely awful. First, as a party of two, we get told that there was a 15 minute wait. Which isn't the problem, because we understand that it's busy and we could clearly see the restaurant was full. So we wait about the fifteen and then a party who was after us on the list gets sat before us. But easy mistake, didn't bother me too much. Once seated, our server was kinda friendly and we place our order in. Though friendly, she often forgot about us. About 30 minutes pass and we still didn't have our food. The real kicker is that SEVERAL tables got their food before us when they were seated AFTER us. At the 45 minute mark, we get our food and my order was wrong. Then having to wait another 5-10 minutes to get the correct food, when I finally ate it, it was mediocre at best. I always take home leftovers, but this definitely wasn't the case for this restaurant. Once we got our bill, which was about $30 for two people, we left as soon as we paid. At this price, we could have received much better service and MUCH better food elsewhere. Needless to say we will not be back and I will not be recommending this place to absolutely anyone.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Wonderful place but the hours aren't that great. I wish they were open earlier on the weekends and later, as well. I think this would really increase their business!
name: Angela's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
Always a favorite spot for birthdays.

The Chocolate Motherlode Cake is a must!  2lbs of decedence!

The portions are huge, the prices are OK, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting.  Staff is friendly.  Can't wait til I go back to have the Goldrush Cicken!
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Big portions of wonderful food. I feel it's a bit pricey, but the atmosphere, food and drinks were very good.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Upgraded to a 3 rating because the food is really good.  this place can easily be a 4. Chicken is always really good.  customers and staff are fun and prices are spot on. But what do they have against bartenders?  They have a bar with 8 stools and 4 high top tables in the bar area. 11  cold beers on tap and 8 sodas. Yet for some reason they don't have a bartender. If you sit at the bar, you have to flag down someone to get a beer. Take care of your bar patrons and this place will be Tremendous.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
I inquired about there only being three pieces of meat on my $7.95 gyro sandwich and was told that's how it is. The manager had no desire to improve that situation. In fact he told me they used to put four pieces on. It tastes great but the value is not there. I'll be going else where for gyros.

Most of the other items are fine, just disappointed on the gyro.

The place at the Park Place Mall gives enough meat for two gyros for $6.95. Ask for another pita and you can feed two people.
name: Zayna Mediterranean Cafe
categories: Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Restaurants

text: Delicious dishes definitely aiming for the French cafe feel.  Plenty of healthy options to choose from as well as more decadent ones as well.
