If you are looking for some classic brunch alcoholic beverages they have options as well as a good selection of fancy coffee drinks.  Breads are fresh and closer to the European styles. Pleasant place for a leisurely morning with flavor.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: I do not know what it was maybe it was shift change but the service today was awful we are ask them to take out order they dropped off the food and we didn't see a waitress again I had to get up and asked boxes and what bother me the most was the manager tried to fix everything with I'm sorry typical. their wings are good but if you want to put up with bad service thats your place.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Great drinks and great food. Had a barrio chelada and had to order another one it was so good. The Pineapple Serrano hit the spot after...I don't know what kind of tequila they used but it was super smooth and then had the potato nachos and some queso and chips. Apparently they have salsa night too. Definitely coming back. Nick was our server too and made some excellent recommendation along with perfect service
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text:
I think this place has a new name, I'm just not sure what it is.  I had dinner there last week and it was pretty decent!  You never know what to expect with these little dive-y places, but you hope you are finding a gem.

I got a tamale combo meal with one meat and one veggie tamale.  They didn't blow me away, but were very good with tasty sides.  I also got a small chicken taco that was great and I'll probably go that route next time.  My boyfriend got some kind of shredded beef chimi and this was the best of the night.  The tortilla was amazing - warm, full of flavor, and delicious!  The shredded beef was good too.  

The waitress was young and a bit flustered from their credit card machine not working.  Unfortunately they double charged our card and we're trying to work that out.  But overall it was a good, fairly inexpensive meal and I wouldn't mind stopping by again.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
If I to choose a word to describe this restaurant, it's " old "

The menu is dated, unoriginal and uninventive. The ambiance is dated, the bar area looks dismal and uninviting.   Take a look at the floor, it is really time for a face lift. The main dining area is dim but not like you would expect in a nicer fine dining restaurant.   I'm not expecting a Michelin quality dining experience, but I am in awe of how Tucson is raving about the food here. Again, I guess in Tucson expectations are generally low as there is nothing better to compare to, in food, and in the arts.  The french onion soup had onions that were inedible (the skin part) and the flavor was not rich and full, too watery. The mussel dish was not fresh and overcooked. The scallops had a slight ammonia smell to it and it was chewy. The potatoes were covered and smothered in oil. I think the food here might be best suited in a retirement community, which it seems like it is given the fact that everyone in the restaurant seems to be well over their 60s.  The service however was excellent. I almost feel the vibe that the waiters feel bad about the quality of food (and the price for which they are set at ) they are serving and hopefully their tables are unsuspecting customers who do not have a (semi-)sophisticated palate.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: Amazing service from the moment we walked in to to when we walked out.... loved the food... we will be back soon super friendly staff...
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Adrianna was so awesome! She never left us waiting and was amazing at servings us, I'd request her again at Jerry Bobs!!
name: Jerry Bobs
categories: Restaurants, American (New)

text: Delicious food and Justin was great. Best breakfast I had in Tucson. Long wait but you can put your name on the list through yelp.  Thank you.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Roasted beet salad with goat cheese, walnuts, spinach, roasted chicken with cranberry-orange vinaigrette. Fresh bread basket and pesto oil available upon request. Iced tea.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: I enjoyed the lamb curry.  The rice doesn't come with the food so you might want to order it as a side.  They are generous with it though.  I ordered medium and could still taste the spice so be careful with that.  The service was good and the food came out really quick.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: No alcohol...wtf?  I wanted a draft beer and the server said they don't have draft beer.  I then said no problem, I will just have a vodka tonic...."we don't have alcohol either"...lol.  So I just had an iced tea which was fine.  The food, however, was terrible.  The restaurant looks like it hasn't been updated in 50 years and was just a dump inside.  Being from New Jersey and being a chef I have had great Italian food in NY, NJ, and many other states. This was very poor quality Italian...the red sauce had no flavor and tasted like they just opened a can of sauce.  The cheese was a cheap mozzarella also with no flavor.  The menu was very limited and it was hard to order anything because everything sounded so basic.  I had the chicken parm,  the serving size was small, it was overpriced, it didn't come with any pasta under it or on the side...just chicken on plate.  Very poor presentation as well.  I had a side salad with the meal and McDonald's makes a better salad than his place.  If you want good Italian food...don't go here:
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
Met here for a first date for brunch, and it just so happened to be the Friday before UA graduation weekend, so the wait was a little long, but not horrible considering the crowd. 
Our food came out quickly once we ordered it, the host and waiter were both very attentive, in fact, everyone who walked by was at least giving us a visual check, which was nice because we weren't being interrupted a lot, but knew we weren't forgotten either. 
The biscuits and gravy was heavenly. The biscuits were outstanding, the gravy light yet flavorful and I had eggs over-easy to top things off. It was really very good. The coffee was on par as well. 
I will def. come back :D

The date liked it too (which was good, because it was her idea)
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Fantastic steak, margaritas, and dessert! I came here for my birthday dinner and I had the best time! The side portions are huge and great for sharing! I was so full from dinner, yet the server gave me dessert to-go on the house. I really appreciated that and will not be waiting until my next birthday to go return! I highly recommend  Charro Steak.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
I have driven down Campbell Rd for years and didn't bat an eye at this joint. After anguishing over the lack of available ramen (I KNOW they aren't the same, cool your jets) joints on a Monday night due to business hours, I thought I'd give this place a try after perusing YELP. 
What. a. surprise. 
This place is a gem hiding behind a corny name. I notably know very little about Chinese food and was settled on the Kung Fu Beef Noodle dish as recommended by fellow reviewers. The establishment emphasized well-earned pride in their home-made noodles and complemented it nicely with a spicy soup base full of beef slices and vegetables. I loved it. Although a bit intimidated by the modest price, I should note that my serving was enough for dinner and leftovers.  I was absolutely delighted with this choice and am interested in trying some of their other options. Great place and worth many visits. Staff was pleasant and were delightful hosts despite my request for takeout.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: Came in on a Friday night after having drinks downtown. We were looking for something quick and that would sober us up...what we found was heaven! Everything from the salsas to our entrees were first class, I had no idea steak could be that good. Didn't plan on such an extravagant meal so I was a little shocked when the bill was 220. for four people but we all laughed it off deciding it was well worth it for the fantastic dinner. Great atmosphere, great staff. We will be back!
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: What is not to love.  The location is fun an attractive being in the artsy section of downtown Tucson.  The building and interior is just cool with brick, wood and high ceilings.  The wait staff again were cool, friendly and very accommodating.  My steak which you can see in the photo was as good as anywhere.  We had the tableside quac which was perfect.  The wine list was good and not expensive.  We listened to live music.  This is just a great night out with wonderful food.  You can't go wrong here.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Truly lovely, although noisy.  Great steak & service.  Porkchop was delish as was the grilled romaine lettuce salad.  The blue cheese dressing tasty more mayonnaise-y but had bits of blue cheese.  And if you like pork fat, aka pork belly, it made it perfect.  The accompanying pinto beans, & a side order of scalloped potatoes made it a waist-changer of tastiness.  Get the wine & not the martinis' though.  Will take out-of town guests to impress!
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: I give this restaurant 4 stars only due to the fact that I have never had better service from a server before.  This lady was awesome.  She was the only server and the place was full. The only thing that took long was the kitchen.  If you have a chance go in and ask for Faith to be your server.  You won't regret it.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Best. Italian. Food. In. Tucson.

Seriously though, it's amazing. I never wait long, even in a large party, the staff is always friendly, occasional screw up aside, they always fix it and fix it fast. The chicken parmigiana is my favorite with a side of spaghetti., and as a kid I loved the pizza. Try it if you don't believe me. The garlic bread is always fast and tasty, and I even eat the salad here (I hate veggies but here they're good). Everything is homemade. A Tucson staple for sure and it always has a bunch of regulars, so you can tell the place is great. It's always kept clean, both inside and out on the patio. Although, I wish they would fix the bathroom stall doors though already, only 1 shuts and the other you have to attempt to hold while going or pray that someone doesn't walk in on you. But thankfully as a girl we always go to the restroom in pairs so we got this covered lol, but that's really my only complaint. Well that and that the portion sizes have gone down a bit, but you still get a lot of food for your money so I'm fine with it. Whether it's just for lunch, a special occasion or even for a date, you can't go wrong eating here.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Great place in downtown Tucson. I had the carne asada street tacos, gringo style. Some of the best carne asada I have eaten. Flour tortilla was very good and flavorful. They also offer free chips and salsa, so I took advantage of that.  Good location and nice, casual vibe inside. I went on a Thursday evening and while not slammed, they were steadily busy the entire time I was there. Definitely recommend this place when you are in downtown Tucson.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: This was a unexpectedly wonderful place to enjoy brunch!  It's busy but with plenty of seating and minimal wait times.  When we were there, there were $5 bloody marys and mimosas.  There is a noteworthy French coffee shop within the restaurant and a bakery with exceptional pastries and breads.  The price was great and the servers were very friendly.  Can't wait to try dinner here as the breakfast experiences have been so great.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Fast, fun, delicious, and easy! Great margaritas (hit the happy hour if you can) and free chips and salsa is always a plus.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Okay the food is amazing!! Love their vegetarian lasagna!! It is a bit over priced honestly especially for their portions but that's just me! Their biggest problem is honestly the lack of air in that place! They need ACs or like windows or something! It gets super stuffy
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Great breakfast spot! Found it on Yelp when we were driving into Tucson and it definitely lived up to its expectations! We joined the waitlist online, checked in on time, and were seating within 10 minutes of arriving. Menu was expansive so there are many options depending on what you're in the mood for. Our server was very kind and the food arrived promptly even though it was 10:30am on a busy Saturday morning! Would definitely recommend this spot to others!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Amazing atmosphere, amazing bus boy, great staff. My only draw back on this is that the service was a tad slow.

But great food. The patio was fun and on a dark beautiful night it would make a great date night.

Cheers
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
DO NOT ORDER FROM HOOTERS VIA GRUBHUB!  I made that mistake, spending about $60 total.  My order was completely screwed up -- breaded wings instead of naked, cheesecake placed on top of hot food so was melted/mushy, a mysterious order of mozzarella cheese sticks that I did not order -- without any marina or anything to dip them in. 

In addition, wings were SWIMMING IN GREASE!  They use "cheese sauce" which is NASTY; there is no REAL CHEESE ON ANYTHING (on tots and in sauce for pretzels), etc. 

Just NOT!  NEVER again!
name: Hooters
categories: Sports Bars, Food, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Chicken Wings, Restaurants

text: Amazing. I love this place. The ramen was delicious and the service was fast and friendly.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
I've been here twice now. I prefer this location than the grant one. The Grant loc has an Ihop feel to it. The Campbell location has a great patio and more of a comfy feeling. 

My first time, I had ordered the salmon beni. It was fab. This time, I had the Beni. So the main ingredient to differ this one from the other beni is the pork belly. I expected it to be great. I didn't expect it to be a very thinly sliced over cooked pork chop. I had to pull it out and eat it like beef jerky.  it could have been wonderful. The idea is wonderful. The outcome was not. And because it was so overcooked (or old. It seems it sat for a while) it had shrinkage. Major shrinkage.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Had delivery brought to my hotel room. Was delivered in under 20 minutes - awesome! Had sesame chicken and hot and sour soup, not bad. Might try something else next time. Give them a try. Food some three stars, added an extra star for delivery time alone.
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
Ambiance - 5/5.  Both sections of this restaurant are charming and elegant, and quite spacious despite appearing small from the outside.

Location - 4.5/5.  They can't help that a Circle K popped up next door, but it's conveniently located at Fort Lowell and Alvernon, relatively central.

Service - 4.5/5.  They are all very pleasant and very accommodating, and smiley.  Though sometimes a couple of minutes off on delivering the check, they are a pleasure.

Food - 5/5.  The mussels, Beef Wellington, Sweetbreads, Salmon, and ESPECIALLY the Crepes Suzette tableside - all perfectly prepared, time and time again.

Price - 5/5.  You can enjoy tastes for just $5.50 per plate in the red domed room, but even the rest of the menu PERFECTLY prices the exquisite food at and average of $23 per entrée - worth every cent.

You must try this restaurant.  Be forgiving if you happen to get slow service in the light of how precise and cheerful they are.  Every dish on the menu is mouth watering, perfect, and don't leave without ordering the Crepes Suzette - ask for Daniel the manager, he has the best technique for these.

(I have eaten at just about every restaurant in Tucson, from Sullivans and Flemings to Guero and BK - I don't hand out 5 stars often - and I weigh 265lbs.  I know food.)
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text:
I really enjoy this place. Its fancy enough for a nice date, but it isn't so fancy that you feel like you have to dress up. They have an interesting island in the middle of the restaurant that seats quite a few people and has a fire lit in the middle. They only light the fire on the weekends

The service was prompt and our server was very attentive which I appreciate. We stopped by because we had a guest in town and it was their birthday. We chose Barrio because they have Native American dishes that you can't find anywhere else.

I got the tacos which are like a hamburger patty inside a taco. They tasted pretty good, but I probably wouldn't order them again. The kalbacitas were very good as a side. The chorizo and queso was super good because the chorizo isn't over-powering. Lastly, I have to recommend the fry bread. It doesn't have much flavor but it is light and fluffy and isn't super greasy. 

The only downside to Barrio Cuisine is that it gets a bit pricey.
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text: Tacos were delicious and priced right...they reminded me of the tacos you get at the street carts in Nogales....they have lots of beers to pick from and very yummy margaritas....salsa bar was also good....my only complaint is sitting is hard to find and of course parking sucks other then that everyone should try this place
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
I love Chinese food and as a newbie to Tucson, it was recommended that I give this place a whirl. It's close to where I live so I thought, why the heck not?! 

To start, I would not call this "traditional" Asian or Chinese cuisine but it's not Panda Express style either. You have a great fusion of Asian/American cooking that is just oh so tasty. 

I have eaten here about 4 times (take out only) and each time I have managed to sneak in an order of Walnut Shrimp. I keep telling my self to try new things, but I swear those guys just end up in my bag!! The Orange Peel Chicken gets a repeat appearance in my house also. My husband and I can make dinner and lunch out of the portion you are served....ok sometimes just dinner, but again, it's just that good. 

My only complaint and I mean ONLY complaint would be their presentation.  It kills me how much cabbage and orange slices go into the padding of the take out box BUT it's all fresh, and I do mean fresh, and edible. So it's more of a personal preference than a restaurant error. It's also easily taken care of, so if you're like me, just request less. 

As far as customer service goes these guys are pretty epic. I have not managed to get in for a sit down yet, but every time I have ordered out I have always gotten great phone service and personal service. These guys really do look and act happy to see me. Dave is one of the managers (or the manager?) and he will greet you just like you're old friends. It's a nice and the icing on the cake of a great place to eat if you're in the area.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: Worst customer service ever.  We were sitting on a table that was shaking and we're refused to sit down in a booth. The other reason was the AC was blowing on our face and was freezing cold. Don't care about the food but attitude of the server was the worst as well. "I don't care" as our best. Never coming back again.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: My family was pleasantly surprised with this place. Very good food and great customer service! All the food was delicious but the nachos were amazing!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Family owned business that makes great wings!  I come here once a week and they treat me like family.  Just replaced tables so its much nicer
name: Buffalo Bell
categories: Chicken Wings, Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text: The manager and wait staff kick ass. I work in this industry and I love to see people who are knowledgeable and caring about their line of work. Drink were great, food was great, servings were huge. If I lived here I would be a regular, thank you for the wonderful dinner experience!
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Great food, awesome service. Also have local beers on menu. Nice place.  Tried the pizza, salad, wings, and cheese bread. Food was delicious.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: A real surprise!  Wonderful find!  Fresh ingredients, amazing tacos: fish, chicken & beef (tasted like steak!). Great salsa & chips.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: What can I say? It was a buffet. BUT, But...they have a make your own Hibachi station and a Pho option. Cooked right before your eyes. My friend really enjoyed their sushi and mentioned that their selection was much wider than your normal buffet. The service was good and consistent. I enjoyed their sesame chicken and orange chicken, small cut pieces and crispy. If in the mood for a buffet with good options, I reccommend this one.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text:
Went again recently as I wanted to introduce some friends to this place. Was somewhat disappointed. 

1. One of us ordered a egg omelette and the inside came runny.  When you have spinach and runny eggs not the best combination. 
2. They were out of sausages so the Hubbard newbie was trying to pick something else out.  Went around and took all other orders and said they'd be right back. They went and served another table and forgot to come back. The order did not get put in as the ticket was incomplete.  I chalk that up to being super busy and maybe a bad day for the wait staff. 
3. The beans that came with the food was dry

Something was off that day and and I sure hope it's a one time thing. I will try again maybe when it's not so close to noon.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: We were craving cheesecake and I went online and googled Who has the best cheesecake ... we really didn't want to go towards the mall so we went to AJ's, I went to the bakery and everybody was super sweet and initially I only saw 1 slice she went in back and came out with a whole new cheesecake. It was amazing and the crust was perfect. I would highly recommend AJ's.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: OMG!!! The food was nasty. Flavors were horrible and almost everything was over cooked. Meat is not supposed to be crunchy!! I could barely choke down the one plate I had. When I left the girl actually made mention that I wasn't leaving a tip! Are you serious?!?! I said the only tip I was giving was to fire all of your cooks! Horrible and I will not be returning.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: Delicious sesame chicken! Great lunch specials! I'm so glad I found this place! Service is great. There are a lot of regulars. I think it's a hidden gem. I will come back over and over. Some of the best Chinese food in Tucson.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Little Indian spot in a strip mall. The food was authentic and I appreciated being able to request different spicy levels. The chicken tikka (requested to be spicy) was very good. Meat was tender and the sauce was super tasty. Beef curry was also very good. Garlic naan to go with everything. Portions are good and the price is right. Service was meh. I'll be going back.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: I found this restaurant from yelp. I tried their fresh oysters and super Vegas roll. I was surprising pleased with the service and food.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: I was at the hotel for a work conference and ate there a few times. I had the enchiladas, the Chorizo Nachos and the AZ Cheesesteak. The nachos were outstanding, the enchiladas very good and the Cheesesteak was good. They have a happy hour from 4 to 7 pm with some good specials and some $3 draws. The service was a little slow, I think they were just short handed.
name: Fire + Spice Tucson
categories: Mexican, Tex-Mex, Restaurants

text: Lights out! I'm a big breakfast person and travel (i.e. eat out) a lot, partially in search for the perfect breakfast spot. This place comes pretty close! Good atmosphere, very friendly and attentive service, nice interior and most importantly fantastic food! The quality is consistent...I came back almost every day of my stay in Tucson.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Yum! This was exactly what we needed to end our night. My daughter and I came in to get some dessert before we headed to our room. Unlike some hotel restaurants that are littered with surly staff members we were greeted with smiles and had a nicely packaged dessert and were ready to call it a night in a matter of minutes! The server had our food prepared in a very timely fashion which really helps when you have a child with you. We will definitely head downstairs for breakfast!
name: Finnegan's Pub
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Restaurants, American (New), Bars, Irish

text: This was our first time trying this restaurant and we were initially excited. BUT, we were seated with other patrons in one crowded section, while there were other ones available.  The table was dirty and sticky and I can't believe that the server actually sat us there and gave us silverware.  Being that it was our first time, we sat there for a bit due to the server assuming that we knew that we could just go to the buffet.  I asked to be moved due to the condition of the table and although the server did so she gave us a very puzzling look.  Now to the food...definitely lots of options and all of our food was lukewarm to cold.  We tried another plate and it was mediocre at best.  The beef and pork for the hibachi was browning and we decided to try the chicken instead, which actually made us sick.  I hate to write bad news about a local business but I will never go or recommend anyone to go here.  Hopefully it was just a bad day....my two cents.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text:
Honestly, very disappointing. A lot of people really seem to like Caruso's, but I think it's not really that they genuinely like the food or the service so much as they like the convenience (location) and the fact that everyone in town seems to know the name. 

We went with a big party a while back and while the whole thing was bad, here's a few highlights:

- Despite having a reservation for close to 20 people, we had to wait outside in the rain for up to 30 minutes for them to have our table ready. There wasn't enough room in the lobby for us all.

- One of our party ordered a special: seasoned chicken. It was served as just that, literally. No veggies, no sides, no condiments even. Just a chunk of chicken rolling around on an empty plate. 

- The service was unacceptably slow and food was served in waves instead of all at once. 

- The birthday girl was given one of those little complimentary sundaes which turned out NOT to be sundae, but a pile of whipped cream with a candle stuck in it. What? Who does this? Why not just NOT offer the free sundae. Way to say 'thanks for your business, but we have more important things to do than worry about making money'.

- Towards the end of the night, one of the other guests in our 'room' (the dinning areas are divided up into smaller, more intimate rooms) got extraordinarily drunk and started arguing with another guest at a neighboring table. The one-sided argument escalated into the drunk woman screaming obscenities and vulgarities about the shocked guest's vagina (yes, her vagina) while the waitstaff and manager looked on. No one did anything. No one asked the drunk woman to leave. Instead, our entire table and the victim and her date left, shocked. 

We will never, ever return to this restaurant. There are plenty of other sub-par Italian places in Tucson to eat and even some very, very good ones.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Delicious brunch food :)  We came on a Monday afternoon and enjoyed the green Chile French toast! Everything tasted great and the drinks were very tasty as well :) will be coming back!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great find in the downtown district we tried the chicken and steak tacos with a hot dog kicker and it was great.  Lots of meat and flavor I each bite.  We will be back soon
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: If you already like Taco Bell, you'll like this one. They always get the order right and the staff is great.
name: Taco Bell
categories: Food, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Fast Food, Tex-Mex, Mexican, Tacos

text:
Casino del Sol is the nicest casino in Tucson, hands down.  The way they have it set up, you can tell they're trying to make it feel as much like a Vegas casino as they can.  

The entire casino is very clean.  The reason I don't like going to casinos very much is because of the cigarette smoke.  In Casino del Sol, though, they have enough air blasting through the place that the smoke isn't very prominent at all unless you're sitting right next to someone actively smoking.  Huge plus for non-smokers!

There are lots of bathrooms, and it seems like they're always clean, even though I don't ever recall seeing any cleaning crew.  It's like magic here or something.  

The layout flows really nicely.  It's not just a giant room full of slot machines.  There are hallways and different rooms and sections that really give the space a nice charm to it.  The ceiling is a color changing sky, which also makes the space unique and fun.  I think that's my favorite part!

There are plenty of restaurants to choose from (and there's no tax to pay on the reservation!).  They cover most price ranges, from a simple deli, to a fancy steakhouse.  There's also places for snacks, like FrozAN.  There's even two Starbucks!

You can definitely go to Casino del Sol and feel like you're in a different little world, which is the charm of Vegas for many people.  So they're doing a good job trying to replicate it!  I just wish it wasn't so far from my house!
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: From some of the reviews I had high hopes for this pizza but I guess Tucson just doesn't know what good pizza is.  We ordered the large veggie and it was undercooked, over onioned, and had almost no sauce (or flavor for that matter).  Do yourself a favor and get some Mexican food this town just doesn't do Italian.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
This is a GREAT Jommy John's- QUICK service, clean tables, fresh food.  It doesn't get much better than this!

The parking lot can be annoying to get out of, since it's right off of (busy) Oracle, but that's not really their fault.
name: Jimmy John's
categories: Fast Food, Food, Sandwiches, Food Delivery Services, Delis, Restaurants

text:
Full Disclosure: We've been going to Ghini's for years, almost every Sunday AM up until a year ago when our dining companion passed. 

They're usually crammed, so the servers do deserve some patience.

The food is better and more creative than what you might expect from a small modest place, just exactly what Ghini's is. It's good too to support a 'locally owned' business.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Great new juice and smoothies place, spotless and fast friendly service. Menu has raw juice selection, various smoothies, bowls and until 11am steel cut oatmeal bowls with an array of toppings and you can customize all of it. You can call ahead for orders and then pickup. Dedicated parking in the front .Give this place a try.
name: Juice Envy
categories: Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Sandwiches, Food, Acai Bowls

text: The wife and I wanted to get sushi, so we tried this place which is closer to our house than other sushi restaurants.  My first impression was that the place was small and it was a mom-and-pop place, which can be better than the larger chain restaurants.  Unfortunately, this sushi restaurant was sub-par.  The majority of the filling in the sushi rolls were cucumbers, and there was very little actual fish/seafood.  The portions and size of the rolls were underwhelming as well, and we were not impressed with the taste.  Needless to say, we wouldn't recommend this place for sushi.  However, we didn't try any of the main entrees, so we have no opinion on that.  Oh, and you need to bring your own beer and/or wine.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: Might be my new favorite taco joint, the only b caribe is the parking, but it's downtown! Who the heck am I to complain?! Is there ever parking downtown??? No! So just ignore that comment and eat some tacos
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: So it's been about 2 years now where I have been a loyal customer of Sachiko. Why well in just a short period of time every time I would call they would recognize my voice and even my Order. They are always friendly and professional. This place is always packed for lunch and you get in and out in a timely fashion. I would highly recommend this place
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: It was really, really good. The country potatoes could have been a little hotter, but over all, everything else was really very good. I'll definitely go back!
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Very pleased with She re Punjab! We planned to eat at the Curry Leaf down the street but the CL was not open on Sundays! Boo! 

Broke out the iPhone and found the next closest Indian restaurant...Shere Punjab! Unassuming in a musty strip mall, we walked and were pleasantly surprised to find a cute little restaurant  bustling on a Sunday afternoon! 

We were seated right away and informed about the buffet. We checked it out before we decided and were pleased to find Chicken Marsala, White Rice, Aloo Gobi (my fave), Tandoori Chicken, Saag Paneer, Curry beef, Naan, vegetable samosas, fruit, salad and a few other things I don't recall. 

We tried a little bit of everything and it truly was all delicious. The samosas were crispy with PERFECT vegetable filling. The Aloo Gobi was fantastic, the Tandoori chicken was excellent.

The decor wasn't anything out of the ordinary. Beautiful Indian paintings and shiny, glittery animals. Lots of mirrors. Not for the faint of ego. 

The service was good...our water glasses never went dry. Though, we never got a check. I had to go up to the counter and she didn't know how to ring up the check. She learned. No worries. I'm all for educating. :) 

Two lunch buffets, two drinks, plus tip - $23.00. Not too shabby. 

Can't wait to come back and sample more of the regular menu!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Flavorful, authentic Japanese food. Good quality sushi for a reasonable price. Staff was sweet and attentive. We'll be back!
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: Divey place... Wings are good though. Bad experience with eating a carrot stick that had cleaning fluid on it. Yuk!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Sinfully tasty breakfast for lunch to be had here.  Biscuits, gravy, and eggs made it impossible to order just a salad.  Cocktail and wine list was intriguing (it was a work lunch!) and service was great.  I just wish they were open later!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We came to this breakfast place at the recommendation of a local friend. The server was wonderful--efficient and friendly and genuinely interested in making us happy. The kitchen was a bit slow but it was definitely worth the wait. The variety available was incredible-- 6 or 7 different types of waffles from green corn to buckwheat, many gluten free options. I had the Pueblo--green corn waffles with some heat in them, eggs, red chili and house made sausage. The sausages we had were too heavy on the sage to appeal to me, but the waffles were wonderful. My husband had the Cajetas--banana pecan pancakes with salted caramel sauce. WOW! These sound super sweet but weren't, they even had a bit of a lemon flavor to them. Fantastic. I even loved the art on the walls.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Who would have thought that the best meal I had in Tucson was in a wine/liquor store! The Confit Duck thigh was easily one of the best duck dishes I have ever eaten! Try the Basil Ice Cream!
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text: I implore everyone to try Mae's Chinese across the street on Harrison behind the Circle K. Mae's environment is much more welcoming, cleaner, not musty, and more light. Their food taste so much fresher and not greasy or oily. Plus Mae's prices are much more reasonable. The owners at Wei's are so rude when something goes wrong. Everyone else's fault but theirs. We tried Mae's, my family and I love it! Been going there for months now and have yet to be disappointed. if you make the change to Mae's,  you will not be sorry.
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Stopped in for a lunch/work meeting around 1pm. The service is very hospitable, friendly, and attentive. As you walk in your senses are delighted by the scent and sight of delicious pastries! We ordered the salmon, egg sandwich, and meatloaf sandwich. They were all amazing! The salmon had a sweet glaze and was cooked to perfection. The grilled veggies had a great char and were seasoned just right! We ordered a dozen pastries to bring back to the rest of the crew and they were super excited and loved every bite. Can't wait to go back and try some more...
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This is my favorite spot to stop by after work to eat a small breakfast! I find it very affordable and the atmosphere is so nice, they have chairs outside to sit. Aside from breakfast meals, coffee drinks/drinks they have quite a variety in baked goods, my friend LOVES their muffins. It's definitely a place you should check out. The staff are super friendly :)
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: I was so excited about Blake's Lotaburger opening on River and Craycroft by my house. I went through the drive through and couldn't wait to get home. I was so disappointed by the dry burger on a stale bun. I couldn't even eat it. The only sauce it had was mustard, and way too much. I ended up throwing most of it away. The fries were ok at best. My favorite part was the soda.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: We drove 2 hours just to come eat here, we used to drive from Phoenix to Albuquerque to eat these amazing breakfast burritos! The 2 employees that were working Saturday morning (March 24th) had amazing customer service!!!! It was so amazing that my husband and I will be back very soon made our 2 hour drive totally worth it! Unfortunately we didn't get the employees names :( BUT YOU GUYS ROCKED!!!! Thank you! I hope these employees get the recognition, I will be coming back soon and hopefully get their names :)
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: This place has the BEST Chicken Tikka Masala I've had after coming to the US. The NAAN is also SOOOO good! I ordered food from here twice during my 5 day visit to Tucson. Love this place!!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: One of my favorite pizza places! Been going to this one for 1 1/2 years. Always have had excellent and quick service. My order has been right 100% of the time which is quite impressive given the fact ive been going there as long as i have. I highly recommend the steak and cheese calzone and the bacon cheeseburger pizza with garlic crust! One of the few places were ive actually gotin to know a couple of the managers because they take the time to talk to and get to know their regulars. Grade A food and Grade A staff! Lastly i would download their App and always look under deals, they have alot of good deals in there like any regular calzone and a soda for only five dollars.
name: Hungry Howie's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Food Delivery Services, Food, Pizza

text: I would have given this five stars because I think the food is wonderful, but the service was lacking.  Our server was snobby and acted like it was a big problem to wait on us.  And since it's a pricy place, I think the service should be as good as the food. There were lots of little things, like  I had to ask for my water glass to be refilled. Really, if you are going to charge those prices, which I don't mind paying, then the service should be impeccable and you should be treated like they want you there.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: On a whim, my two boys, my wife, and I decided to stop by Claim Jumpers for lunch.  My wife ordered the half turkey sandwich with a Caesar salad while I had the Tri Tip which came with grilled vegetables and mashed potatoes.  The boys ate their customary mac and cheese.  We were comfortable while the food was prepared and presented with care.  The food was full of flavor as is expected, and the portions were perfect as we all left full.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: This place is exceptional for pastries and cakes and "decent" for lunch foods. We've ordered cakes from them before and they do an incredible job on the artwork and flavor is spot on. I've also picked up pastries from them on multiple occasions and always been blown away. Recently my hubs and I dined in for lunch and both felt it a little lackluster. Our sandwiches (Reuben for him, roasted turkey & Brie for me) were both "just ok". We do t get to do lunch dates very often & at first I felt the unexciting food kinda wasted the experience. But then we opted to try a pumpkin cookie on our way out & it totally transformed the experience. The cookie was INCREDIBLE. Truly amazing. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Will I be back for lunch? Probably not. But those cakes & pastries are where it's at!!!
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Excellent pizza! Perfect crust.  Locally owned.  woo hoo!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Had the cactus pad salad and the bread pudding.  All of our food tasted very good.
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text: Christian was so helpful, funny, polite, and an all around great employee! made our experience phenomenal and definitely will encourage us to choose eegees more often! give this man a raise !!!!!
name: eegee's
categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Food

text:
Pretty crowded for a Saturday morning, but that isn't unexpected. We waited 15 minutes for a table, which is probably more than most places you try to find without a reservation.

This isn't a place you go for the decor, it is pretty sparse and old time dinery (not without its charm).

I ordered the blue corn waffle, which was fluffy and melted in my mouth (think of cornbread with more texture that works well with syrupy things), and apple sausage. The choices of condiments were also great, agave nectar,  homemade green salsa (just a few I remember). 

The sausage wasn't greatest, but they won me over with the variety of ingredients they offered which you are highly unlikely to find elsewhere. Blue corn waffles, green corn waffles, coconut pancakes, and buckwheat are just a few of the novelties they offer.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: We've been eating here for a long time and it's consistently good. Our favorite is the Rasta. Jerk chicken, basil, red onion & pineapple=delicious pizza. My daughters love a 1/2 cheese, 1/2 bacon combo. Unlike many places, the bacon is always crispy. I remember laughing about their slogan "still free delivery" a few years ago. Everyone had free delivery then. Now, they are the only place in town that does still have it. Very prophetic of Fresco. My reason for 4 stars, not 5, is that the toppings can be sloppily and unevenly placed sometimes. The pizza is always delicious though, uneven or not.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: I went to Barrio Cuisine for dessert and had the fry bread and bread pudding. It was fantastic! The atmosphere and service was great! Two thumbs up.
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text: Consistent great quality made while you wait. Service is always friendly, food is fantastic. Try the Sesame beef made extra spicy. For those that can't eat seeds, you can ask for no seeds. The sauce is still awesome. Overall, house lo mein is to die for. Soups are good with the favorite being won ton. Do not let the empty restaurant sway you, most customers do take out. This actually makes dining in quaint, and comfortable.  Overall, the best Chinese food in Tucson and we try them all.
name: May Flower Chinese Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: Just had breakfast at Mother Hubbards. We shared green chili waffle and lemon poppy waffle. Delicious! A little heat and then some sweetness. Ordered the maple syrup which made everything taste even better. Also ordered home made chorizo sausage. Nice flavor also with a little kick. Out waitress Faith was attentive and engaging. This is a keeper! Thank you yelpers for the recommendation. You were right!
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Gak! My 4 yr old daughter says this is her favorite restaurant so on occasion I break down and we go to eat there and regret it every time. I figured why she enjoys it so much. She only easts the rice and beans! 
The guacamole is very expensive and not that good. The Burritos are huge but it is made up of mostly filler.
name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican

text: Great coffee, competitive pricing, relaxed atmosphere, free wifi, indoor smoking and plenty of patio seating. Awesome place to just hang out and relax.
name: Safehouse
categories: Coffee & Tea, Nightlife, Restaurants, Pool Halls, Food

text: Tuesday night is "Wing Night" so there's great specials. However, these specials come at a price. Apparently, there's a whole page of rules that each customer must abide by. And one of them is that no one is allowed to join your table once you're seated. I was not aware of any of these rules, and while I was driving there, I invited a friend to join myself and three others. When l arrived, the four of us were seated. My friend then responded and said that she would join us. However, I was then informed on the rule that no one could join once we were seated. My friend arrived 20 minutes later, and the waitress immediately walked over and told her that she could have her own table by herself. This was ridiculous----we asked for the manager, and told him that it was our first time, and asked if they could be understanding and make an exception.  After a few minutes of discussion, they then said that they would make things right and that she could join our table, but the wings would be full-price. Full-price?? Really?? What a slap in the face!! It felt like we were on the "Soup Nazi" episode of Seinfeld!!  "No soup for you!!!"  Perplexed, my friend ended up leaving, and I felt horrible that I had invited her, and everyone at the table felt awkward and uncomfortable. The restaurant wasn't even that busy, so there were plenty of empty seats. Don't come here unless you can abide by their harsh/useless rules! I'm so disturbed by this experience and I never plan on coming back! And I'm actually Yelping from my phone at the dinner table in the restaurant right now because I'm so upset!!! What horrible customer service!!! :((
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
The building itself was renovated from a hometown buffet, which makes the layout and style look a little strange. The booths are cramped and rickety so I would recommend sitting at a table. 

The food was pretty good but some of it has been sitting out for a while. That's pretty standard for a buffet though. There were a lot more choices than I expected, including seafood and ten or so different types of sushi. The only complaint about the food is that the sushi rice was a little bit dry and too sticky.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: At the risk of boring the Yelp community, this is my second review of Le Rendez-Vous.  We keep going back because it's just that good.  The food is pure ambrosia.  Last night we had an hors d'oeuvres smorgasbord of foie gras (heaven on a plate), escargots and the champignons in puff pastry (the latter two are the best use of gastropods and fungi ever prepared), and we topped that off with their magnificent Grand Marnier soufflé (I have dreams about this dessert).  As delicious as the food was, however, the crowning glory of Le Rendez-Vous is the excellent service consistently provided by Raymond (think of Mr. Carson in "Downton Abbey").  Raymond seems to wear many hats in the restaurant, acting as bartender (he makes divine Cosmos), waiter and busboy when the need arises.  He's in constant motion but never seems rushed.  Raymond always has time to chat and makes each guest feel that they're his only one, even when the dining room is packed.  Did I mention his encyclopedic memory?  This young man remembers your favorite dishes and beverages even if you haven't been to the restaurant in months.  A wonderful server, a great personality, he could truly have a career in this industry ... but Raymond could have a grand career in virtually any industry.  For a delightful evening, make a reservation at Le Rendez-Vous and do yourself a favor -- ask for Raymond!
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text:
Very pleased with this place. We ordered all small plates and were so glad we did. The Beef Wellington was wonderful and we also really enjoyed the Brie. The waitress recommend the Brie and we weren't sure but happy we did. The mussels and escargot were good but not on par with above. Our least favorite was the salmon. 
For dessert try the chocolate lava cake with vanilla goat's cheese ice cream. 

Our waitress was very knowledgeable and helpful. I would definitely recommend coming here.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: The food was plain, the meat appeared to be old, the Sushi was flat out gross, and most of the offered food tasted microwaved. Nothing was fresh. The server was rude, pushy, impatient, and rolled her eyes on more than one occasion when she couldn't understand our order due to the noise some kids at a neighboring table made. We won't go back there.
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text:
I wouldn't be the person I am today, without St. Mary's. For some reason, growing up I knew this place as "Chili Bowl". Well, whatever. It wasn't until recently that I realized the tortillas were actually from St. Mary's!!

I have had tortillas from all types of restaurants, tried to make my own, using lard and crisco, and I CANNOT figure out their secret, delicious recipe! When I visit Tuscon, I always make sure to get at least 5 dozen to bring them back to Chicago. In fact, last time I was there, I almost missed my flight stopping here. 

For around five dollars, you can get delicious red chili or green chili burritos. The beans are SOO good, too! Everything here is heaven in the mouth. 

With perfection, you must also know that you might slightly be unimpressed by the accommodations there. For me, it's worth dining in hotter than hell conditions to eat a heavenly burrito on a bench on a dirty table. Somethings are worth waiting for, and St. Mary's Chili Bowl is one of them!
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: This is our second time here.  I love the ambiance, the artwork on the walls.  The food is amazing, so is the service.  Reasonably priced for all the deliciousness!
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: Thank you Yelp!!!! Decided to grab some breakfast while passing through town and I always try to look for hole in the wall places. I'm so glad I picked here. I got the sausage, egg, potato, and cheese burrito, and all I have to say is YUM!! Where has this deliciousness been my whole life?! The customer service was superb just as the food. I will be back next time I'm in town without a doubt.
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text: My favorite Taco Bell. Food quality is OK. Amount of meat in the tacos is light. Fast service. The counter clerk asked for a charitable donation. I don't really mind this too much. But don't act like I'm not charitable when I say no. I give lots to charities of my choosing. I don't know what TBs is, but I vet all charities before I give my money away. Smiles would help a lot too. Friendly service gets customers back. Understand you don't make much but I didn't either when I was young, but I smiled and chatted with the customers.
name: Taco Bell
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican, Tex-Mex, Tacos, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Visiting from California and this place was great! The service was good, they were extremely attentive. The food was delicious. Ordered a cheese burger with bacon and green chili, WOW super yummy! Husband had the chili which had just the right amount of heat. They'll even make it into a Frito pie for $.49 extra! The onion rings were tasty. Sucks a lot of people had a negative experience here ours was the complete opposite. The staff was super friendly. I would recommend for those of you that enjoy hatch chilies.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Always good tacos everytime i go. Very quick in getting your food love the chil bar and the salsas
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Yum! I grew up in Tucson and love this place. Now live in Phoenix and when visiting Tucson I'll swing by for some quarts and tortillas to go. Delicious...love the red chili, green chili and the beans and salsa. Oh and the tortillas are the best!
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: This was my first time after reading excellent reviews on here. Food was Ah-mazing! Portions are huge. Restaurant was super clean. David was an awesome server.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text:
Tasty, filling, nice atmosphere.
The food is very heavy and rich.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Really good indian food. 
Try their chicken masala and butter chicken. 
I wish the buffet has more variety of dishes and similar flavor of the regular menu dishes
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: I usually go to AJ's for their pastries in the morning. They have so many different options, and you really can't go wrong with their selections. Ask them for samples if you're unsure of trying new pastries. For shopping, I would say that it is pricy, but for pastries, the price is cheaper than Starbucks. Definitely worth the visit.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text:
$9 for buffet. 4 items I can eat as a veg. Buffet looked bland. Did not stay.

The reviews seem to agree to the mediocre nature of the food here, but I can't say for sure. Today I just did not want to risk eating what could be bad food, and then regret it later.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: We used to come here once a week for breakfast and I'm thinking that we need to find a new place. The cinnamon rolls used to be the high point of the visit... They used to be so moist and full of cinnamon goodness. Now the outside of the rolls are so hard you could break a window with them, have hardly any icing on the top and the inside doesn't have the beautiful swirl of cinnamon. It's almost like the cinnamon rolls were made without butter or the cinnamon/sugar mixture. My other favorite here used to be the pumpkin crumb muffins. Boy when they get a new baker maybe we will come back...
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Incredibly slow service. Took about 20 minutes to order. The place is so hot, swamp cooler?? And fans going on the lowest setting. Very little seating and the table can be cleaned more often. There was two women with a baby crawling all over the table drooling all over it, ewww! Ordered our food, a breakfast burrito and a birria.... another 20 minutes to get the burritos. Hubby was missing some ingredients he had ordered. Bacon was more like a shredded style bacon. I actually got a red chili burrito (not what I ordered). Instead of complaining we ate them because they weren't all that bad. Giving the 3 stars because of that, the food was great. Tortillas were also very good, homemade.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Employees always friendly and store is kept up very well. The outside grill makes excellent burgers, but the inside deli is average. Overall always a nice experience.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: So disappointed! This is probably the worst food I've had in a very long time.  I'd give it no stars, but it won't post without one. I ordered the house potatoes and they were so hard I could not eat them.  The eggs were tasteless and the portions were small. The plate I ordered was suppose to have avocado and I finally did find "some" a tiny sliver on the side.  I came with a group of 4 people none of who liked their food.  We had 4 normal meals with coffee & 2 sides the bill came up to $74!!!  We've ordered similar meals at other restaurants and not paid that much.  The customer service was ok. But we all agreed we are NEVER  going back again.  On the bright side a small portions was a plus because less food was wasted- yuck!
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: I eat here about once a week. The soups are awesome as are the lunch entrees. I've had the Sizzling Rice Soup multiple times in the last year just because it is so good.
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
Ye Ha!

I have to say my wife and i were very nervous going to Claim Jumper for dinner w/ some friends for a birthday party being wierd vegans and all.

Suprise!

Not only did they have things to eat, well OK just a couple, but they were very tasty. I had the Thai coleslaw and some fries $8 cause i wasn't all that hugry. and my wife had the Mediteranean Citrus Salad $9 and with a huge tip cause i work for tips and I give huge tips it was $26. Yes a little pricey but well worth it to be w/ friends and have  a great time.

The only bad things were the super long wait to eat, but it was sunday @ 6 so that is to be expected, and no vegan desert. Sigh:( Oh well I've been trying to lose some LBage so i'm doubting I would have wanted one of those gargantuan things anyway. They did look amazing though.

Great job CJ, we r pleasantly suprised and will return in the future for a partay!

Maybe I will start a new list, Best Vegan in unexpected places!

Till the farts start at the campfire! LATE
Gordo
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Saturday and I decided to try Kung Fu Noodle. Large, modern well lit space. Stark white tables contrasting again colored walls.  Empty except for me. Greeted immediately. Fast friendly service. Ordered vegetable "salad" starter. More like pickled vegetables but great flavor. Followed by noodle soup with tomatoes and egg in chicken broth. Huge serving. Good flavor balance with sweetness of stewed tomatoes and broth melding together. Noodles have good bite and flavor. I think great value and very good food.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: I'm completely addicted. I am from Texas and know a good taco when I see it... These are incredible, best tacos in Tucson for sure and the best tacos I have had in all of Arizona. I love it because the meat is not fatty and is seasoned just right. The margaritas are wonderful too, not too sweet with the perfect amount of tequila.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Granted, this was my first visit to this establishment, but it was the best Asian food we have eaten in Tucson. The atmosphere was small and quiet. We were there @ about 1:30 PM on a Sunday.  There were several other patrons but it was non-intrusive.  My husband and I were able to hold a conversation without issue.  We had a pleasant and helpful young man take our order. He was our waiter and was very attentive. 
 As an appetizer, we had the amazing sizzling rice soup which was a meal in itself. We were expecting a little broth with maybe a scallion or two. It far surpassed that, it was full of many yummy vegetables and even had meat in it (beef and chicken I believe). It was more than two people could eat and still eat your entree.  Portions here are very generous.
For my entree, I ordered the Pho which was listed as beef and I was able to get chicken.  My husband ordered combination lo mein. My husband has a large appetite but was not able to finish his either.  We left with a box full of leftovers that will cover me for 2 more meals, and possibly him as well.   The food was served hot (temperature) and very fresh. They do have spicy options, but this is what we ordered. 
They do deliver to the surrounding area. We will be moving to the area next month and were just trying it out, and we were not disappointed. For my husband and myself we spent $33 without tip. I think that is quite a bargain considering how many more meals we will still get out of it.  If you don't want leftovers, I recommend splitting entrees. The only thing was they do not have to go drink cups.  But who cares??!! I love this place!!
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: I came here for lunch, because I was craving some Japanese food.  I was planning to get one of their lunch specials, but noticed they serve ramen.  I decided to try the spicy ramen with California rolls.  The waitress was friendly and attentive, so I feel the service is good.  However,  when the ramen came out, the broth was kind of watery.  It lacked depth and kind of tastes like water with some spices added to it.  The noodles were decent.  The California rolls were adequate, but nothing to write home about.  My rating is not based on the service, which deserves 4 stars, but on the food, which I give 2 stars.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: Great, fast and friendly service. Wonderful food as well. My wife and I came for brunch and would definitely come back.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Homemade! So good! I ordered the avocado toast and it was perfect portion and light! So good! 
My son had the steak sandwich which is a favorite on the menu and he loved it! Definitely a must try!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This place isn't much to look forward to, in my opinion. I came here in hopes to get a good sandwich and a quiet atmosphere to read my book. The prices were a little steep, kind of the same compared to other sandwich places around town. Their service wasn't too great, much the same as fast food, especially Carl's Jr. and - sorry for repeating myself - other sandwich places in the area. Atmosphere needs to be worked on. It didn't feel as homely, and there's someone screaming "Need a runner please!" twice a minute, which could drive you crazy. To me, it would serve them better to have a smaller place and more of a to-go service so that this would be acceptable.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text:
Old school wings, just like Buffalo NY and I should know!
You will not go wrong here.

Great service and prices.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: I've experienced much better at their location on Speedway. I had the enchiladas and the sauce was very watery and hardly any on the plate. One of the enchiladas was practically dry tortilla. The chips and salsa are divine, I should of just filled up on those. Was very surprised at how empty the restaurant was on a Saturday night.
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: The food here is amazing, and the service is friendly and efficient. A big thanks to our server, Marybeth, and the manager who offered our bachelorette party free pastries for waiting. However, it was totally worth the wait!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I've gone twice now with my daughter (2.5 y/o) on Saturday mornings. While I've waited an hour both times, we've enjoyed our brunch both times. I'm still  rocking pregnancy, but am certain their mimosas and cocktails are great (will try post-baby)! My daughter loves their pancakes; they are seriously the best with a perfect sprinkle of cinnamon sugar on top. Five stars right there. I've gone with both the omelette and French toast and have loved them both. I plan on working down the menu over the course of this year while I'm working in the area.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
We live across the street from Jerry Bob's so it is convenient to us .
Like not driving to find decent food, especially breakfast which is fast and good
they have plenty of sitting, but gets real busy on Sunday mornings, but we've never waited long.Coffee good and lots of refills They have lunch menu also. Plenty of waitresses to go around .
Early bird special for 2.99 2eggs (any style) hash browns and coffee. 6 am to 7am only! Lynn and the girls will take care of you with a smile no matter how busy they are. Clean and bright also little noisy ,but it's open space with booths and tables Starting Apr 14 they are going to have fish fry Friday,cnot sure of time ,think 5pm to 8 pm?
name: Jerry Bobs
categories: Restaurants, American (New)

text:
Finally!!!! A breakfast place I can really get in to!!!
First of all- this is all my Pinterest dreams come true. So cute, but tastefully done. 
The food is amazing. We had the pork belly blt and the duck confit. I'm usually a little nervous about ordering duck confit because it's so rich and can be overwhelmingly salty. This was done perfectly. We got our eggs scrambled instead of over easy and it didn't compromise the quality of the dish at all. Yum. 
Let me tell you about the creme brûlée tea. It's been almost a week since I went to prep and pastry but I am still thinking about that tea!!!!! Oh my gosh. It was heaven. 
The service was awesome. Everyone was really friendly and helpful, even if they weren't our server. Our waters were always full and we always had everything we needed. 
I would highly recommend trying this place out. 
I can't wait to see what they do when they have a liquor license!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Awesome food, large portions and good prompt service! I've been coming here since it's opened and I always leave glad that I came. The veal is my favorite dish.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: Delicious and fresh. Recommend for a party or lazy cooking day. Love, love love. Definitely come back
name: Papa Murphy's
categories: Pizza, Restaurants

text: I met a friend for lunch-we chose a weekday, but it was still extremely loud, which is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars. I got the grilled cheese and tomato soup, which sounds kind of boring, but the description of the 3 cheeses on special bread and the homemade soup got my attention. The best tomato soup ever-especially with the grilled cheese dunked in. My friend ordered the Vietnamese pork sandwich and fries, and that sandwich was full of 3 delicious meats and was really good. The coffee was great, service was excellent.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
After weekly breakfasts for 7years we are cutting this umbilical cord.  Drawn by their strong coffee and tasty dishes we loved it.  Now the portions have gotten so small and the bread rolls so tiny that we always leave feeling ripped off after waiting 1 hr for a table.

The service is hit and miss but what I really love is the authentic "je mon feu" attitude of the owner.  I don't think she has thanked us for our patronage in all this time.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
Caruso's has been a favorite of mine since I moved to Tucson so, when the time came to plan our wedding reception for about 20 guests I put them on my list. I should have called them first!!

Andee was incredible to work with. Yes, you can bring your own wedding cake in. Yes, you can bring in your sparkling cider. Guests with a hard time walking? Just come up the alley (Hoff) and drop them off at our back gate. Trust me - the last point came in extremely handy with all of the construction on 4th Ave and surrounding streets. 

I'd given my guests 5 dinner choices with the invitations and, after talking with Andee, we decided that have the server come around and ask would be much easier on them...so we didn't have to do the dinner auction! (Who had the lasagna??) They printed up a small menu with our choices for our guests so they could change their mind from what they'd originally chosen.

Our servers were amazing - the food came at a good pace, drinks were taken care of quickly, they presented our cake beautifully and helped make the evening so stress free for us.

I can't say enough about having our event at Caruso's. They were incredibly accommodating and welcoming. I felt so good about choosing them and being able to support a wonderful, local business!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: I kinda don't want to review this place because I'm afraid Mr An will show up and ruin it! Great food!!! We had Rainbow Roll, Crunch Roll, Orange Chicken and Miso soup. Everything was terrific and the price was more than fair! We will be going back soon!!! Ohhhhhh wait the only complaint was that I couldn't find a menu online. I will take a picture and post it here. :)
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text:
After reading the very mixed reviews here I decided to roll the dice and try Ghini's for breakfast. They have a very elegant website and that was part of my decision to go. I was underwhelmed. The ambiance was that of a mini-mall diner. Plastic menus are not appealing to me but these were even dirty, as was the table and several other tables in the indoor section I took a table in. There was noticeable crumbs and stuff on the floor as well. After watching my waitress cart a huge tray of food out to the patio (the patio dining area fronts right on the parking lot for the mall, and so did not appeal to me) I decided the place was understaffed, which may also explain the slowness and lack of coordination in the kitchen. I ordered there Provencal special with added hash browns and a side of bacon. The hash browns were outstanding and well worth the $1.75 additional - if I had a normal portion! As it was I received what seemed to be a half order or a child's portion of the most enjoyable item on my plate.

The first thing I received was my coffee. I ordered my coffee black expecting to receive a french roast but the coffee was bland and disappointing. It came with  plastic creamers another disappointment in a "french" cafe. The mini baguettes that came with my breakfast were embarrassing they were similar to frozen diner rolls from the supermarket. Really absurd when a so-called "french bakery" is sharing the same space with your "french caffe". On the way out I bought a Peach Turnover on the bakery, the crust was pretty good but there were only 3 tiny slices of peach inside. Overall the food was "OK", overpriced, and over hyped. I ordered the side of bacon because the website declared that Ghini's serves "thick sliced maple cured bacon". Instead I received 3 slices of thin-sliced Oscar Mayer or equivalent bacon for $4.50.

Worst of all my breakfast arrived but no bacon, I went ahead and started on my breakfast and by the time the bacon arrived I was almost finished - I should have sent it back and saved the $4.50 but the waitress was nice and I just let it go. Ghini's suffers from poor management, excessive pricing, poor decor and a slow kitchen. I was glad I checked it out but would not go there again, hope this has been helpful.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
Stop by this place once a week for lunch. Large menu with many seafood dishes, daily lunch specials, daily seafood specials. The sweet tea is the way to go as far as drinks go here. Chips, 2 types of salsa and limes are placed on the table after you sit down. Each day they have a different special which comes with beans & rice: tacos (ground beef or chicken, the beef is very moist), enchiladas (cheese or chicken), flautas, red chili, there's one more I'm forgetting.  The seafood specials are in Spanish, seafood cocktails, soups, fish. Usually I go with a lunch special (tacos or enchiladas), ceviche tostada, soup (cocido or menudo), or go all out and get the fried red snapper. The red snapper needs to be split between 2 to 3 people, it's huge! Comes with beans, rice, tortillas, lettuce, tomatoes, cukes and limes. 

Dining room can accommodate large groups, booths are more comfortable than tables. Large array of hot sauces are kept at the end of the table. When it gets busy, service can become slow.  Just get the server's attention if you need something. Dining area and restrooms are kept clean. Parking lot is small but never had a problem getting a spot.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text:
We really enjoyed the food here.  The service was excellent too!  My g/f had the Kashmiri Shrimp (medium) and I had the Fish Shahi Korma (spicy)  She and I loved both as well as the fresh Garlic Naan.
...wishing it was closer to the house.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
