categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
Eating our way through Tucson!

This place was incredible.  Not only was the food excellent but the service was maybe even better.  They work as a team and every employee that was on the patton helped at every table.  Service was very unique and every employee acted like the loved their job and loved the food they serve.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Like their wings, not too big therefore very flavorful! The price is less competitive though. New location is further east than the old one but much bigger.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Went here for an early New Year's dinner with my wife, her sister and husband. Pretty much as good as it gets. Friendly 'greeters' and seated quickly and efficiently; the wine selection is very good (as was the bottle of wine we had). My wife and I split the steak and crab legs dinner, which was excellent. The steak was perfectly cooked and tender. The crab plentiful. The wedge salad was also excellent...cold and plenty of bacon and blue cheese dressing. We'll definitely go there again. We're thinking it will be our go to place when we have guests visiting from out of town.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: Best Native American I ate the Green chili with lettuce and tomatoes! It was awesome! Have been back a few times!!awesome!

categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
The server looked miserable as she seated us, and it was soon apparent why: she'd be the one delivering the bad news - dinner.

It's rare and uncomfortable to me to dole out one star reviews, so I hope to save them for where they are merited. To put it simply: halving portion size and doubling price does not alone a fine dining experience make.  

I ordered the vegetable enchilada dinner plate and was served two dry, flavorless flautas (think of a tortilla wrapped around a sliver of zucchini and oven baked) and a half cup of rice. For five bucks, it would have been a mediocre appetizer. For a fourteen dollar entree, it was a joke.  My husband forked over all the fries that accompanied his burger in attempt to supply me any substance. 

Other reviews mention fresh bread and butter - none was offered to us.  The restaurant website notes live music and outdoor seating around fire pits - also, not this evening.  The place was empty in peak hour, save some folks at the bar at the hotel for a convention. 

If the service was warm, or the food heartier, or flavorful, or the prices more practical, or the atmosphere less a downer,  I could be forgiving. Instead I went back up to my room at the adjacent Sheraton and drank a far more satisfying $9 bottle of wine.
name: Fire + Spice Tucson
categories: Mexican, Tex-Mex, Restaurants

text: I love this place. Expensive, but my kind of food is often expensive. I was surprised to find vanilla cream to add to my tea at the cofee counter. Also, they have tons of good beer including Stone brewery. Free samples everywhere and quality ingredients to make quality food.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: Great location Down Town Tucson. My wife and I went there and loved the atmosphere. The staff were great the restaurant was really clean. The food very delicious. I definitely love the location. Because we both work around that area.

text: I came here and almost all the tables are highly top,l. It's difficult when you have a short wife or even if you're drinking you could easily stumble. The food is over priced, pretzel are frozen from a box, lemon for my water had mold residue, and my glass was cracked. Not only that I can see how terrible the management is to the severs. I asked a server how much they had to tip out to bartenders and it's nearly ridiculous. It doesn't seem like a great place to work or eat. Way to over priced and terrible management.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: I used to love Fresco and ordered there all the time when I worked down the street.  Well I moved around and kinda forgot about it but now that I am back in their delivery area I recently started ordering again and it's delicious!  So far we have just stuck with delivery and have never had a problem.  Our go-to is the Totally Topped pizza without green peppers.  Always arrives fresh and gooey with a nice chewy crust, similar to Magpies.  They have a large variety of salads and those are always very fresh and they have a good chunky bleu cheese too.  Wings are oven baked and while we prefer fried we still have to order some when we call.  Overall we really enjoy Fresco and hope they keep up the good work!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Great customer service. Food was REALLY yummy and fresh. We will definitely be coming back.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text:
the last time I was at Ghini's was in 2009 - it was a weekday, so less busy and the service was quick. I remember being blown away by the food. 

just went back this past weekend to celebrate my brother and his new fiancee's engagement. i ordered the provencial - which is pretty much two thick slices of tomato and two eggs. I paid $8.25 for that.... well 2 buttermilk biscuits too. it was a nice, fresh, healthy breakfast, but... not worth the price tag.

the bro and husband both got the corned beef hash. they were starving, so I didn't try it as I didn't want to lose a finger. they seemed satisfied, but neither was raving. new sis-in-law-to-be had the italian omelette, which was just ok. 

the service was.... pretty atrocious. it took FOREVER to get our food. they mixed up part of our order. and in general it seemed as if the two servers were confused and forgetful as they scurried around. they were nice, just not on their A-game, I suppose.

and the restroom??? is a strange large room. they have one of those helper toilet seat things, that you can roll on top of the toilet for those that need assistance sitting down and standing up.... which is nice for those that need it, but gross for everyone else, as that is the FIRST thing you see when you open the bathroom door.

plus: they are dog friendly - we had our two pups with us on the patio, and they brought out water and some dog treats for them, which was sweet.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
It's been years since I've been to Caruso's.  I remembered loving it and I wasn't disappointed today.  Honestly, the only that keeps me away if the parking on 4th.  If you aren't afraid to parallel park and you want good Italian food that been in Tucson swing on down.

We went for lunch and were seated promptly .  Drinks and garlic which both smelled and tasted great arrived quickly.

Had the vegetarian lasagna lunch special with a salad (an extra $4 for those watching their budgets).  I was stuffed as it was a good sized portion for a lunch special.  My buddy's order was brought out  incorrectly, but fixed with no hastle in very little time.  (So yeah, they can make a mistake but they don't let it stay a mistake for long, besides...his order gets messed up in 9 out of 10 places anyhow..so don't blame Caruso's for the fate's treatment of my buddy)

All in all  - enjoyable lunch!  Time  for a return with the husband soon.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Carne asada tacos are excellent. The wife loves the chicken nachos. We've been a few times and we haven't been disappointed. Also, the watermelon cucumber drink is fantastic. Staff is friendly and helpful.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
I was very excited when my brother and his family took me here, as I always love to compare Southern California Mexican food, to Arizona, as it's a close competition. This rating leans more to 3.5 than 3, but had to round down because the food was more dissapointing than the absolute, amazing service.

Don't get me wrong... The food isn't bad, and to find a spot that does Menudo on a weekday, almost unheard of, but here El Sur does, with a blanco and a regular version. Where this was dissapointing, was there were was waaaaaaay more hominy (garbanzo beans) than actual tripe. This is sad, because the flavor was good, just an excessive amount of hominy. So if you're ok with that kind of ratio, please try, because MaMa in the back makes it right.

I also got a cabeza quesadilla. The meat was flavored wrll, but a little on the  dry side, which is awkward for such a fatty piece of meat. I did really enjoy it though.

The service was AMAAAAZING though. The waitress and waiter we're heavily attentive. Super nice. It really doesn't get much better than that. 

Maybe it's my comparison to SoCal spots that makes this place 3 stars instead of 4, but unfortunately that's the truth of things, and El Sur was put at that disadvantage.

Would I return? You bet. I want to check out the rest of their Caldos and dinner plates. My brother said the Asada plate was delicious, I may want to try a flauta or something.

Hopefully next time they change my mind, especially with Pozole ONLY on Wednesday!!!
name: El Sur Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: This place has awful service . All the employees looked like they hated their job even managers, non of them had any sense of urgency to get customers taken care of. We waited a good 10 15 minutes just to order because the guy running the register couldn't handle more then order at a time. When will this location get a drink station in lobby so u don't have to wait forever for a refill.

text: I tried this place based on the yelp reviews, and was underwhelmed by the experience. By no means horrible, it was a rather rote, predicable and very mediocre to decent american style Chinese take out. The service was very pleasant and the restaurant itself is kept very clean, but the food itself lacks any distinctive flavors or presentation, relying more on tried and true simple dishes not unlike you've probably had a hundred times before. Not bad in a pinch but not something I would seek out otherwise.

categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
Caruso's is a great place to go when you're dining alone, you know those days that you ditch everyone at work but still want a decent meal or want to get away from the kids and sneak away for an hour. 

I totally love their bread did they serve before all meals. I appreciate their salad as it isn't anything like Olive Garden's and instead it's truly authentic. My absolute favorite is the chicken parmesan it's most appropriately grilled seasoned with melted cheese, garlic, and sauce. 

You can choose from sitting in any of the dining areas including outside. If you find an evening where it's not too hot and not too chilly you're definitely set to enjoy the backyard dining experience.

It is right on 4th Avenue so you can walk and either direction after you're done indulging so you can work off those carbs you just ate. Or you can continue and stop by any of the  sweet shops and indulge in any super rich dessert. Perhaps you're feeling more on the low-key side of stuff and you can stop for a hookah somewhere or maybe you're feeling like a daredevil and you can stop for a tattoo or piercing. Whatever you may fancy after dinner at Caruso's it's pretty much all there within walking distance.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Under staffed is being kind. Received 2 checks that were both wrong. Waitress was very nice but overwelmed  by having a lot of tables. Food was fine but my wife never got her wine which we requested several times.,pretty amazing.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: I'll begin with how excited I was to try this place because of all the hype!! I have tried 3 times to come here only to see a line around the building. I FINALLY get there only to be greeted by an older gentleman manager/owner? He asks how many in my party I tell him 3 he says everyone has to be there to be seated... I say ok 1 is parking and the others down the street i head outside and ask for a menu I so I can look with my friend he tells me no menus outside so I ask if he has a menu online he says yes I say thank you and head outside....NOT 2mins later a party comes with 4 Older white professionals , he shows them out just like he did me then the group tells him our friend is down the block can you seat us? This manager/ seats them! I tell him My other friend is parking now so can we be seated he says no smiling I say you just let those people be seated and their friend is down the street he looks at me and says they are ordering for their friend I say well so am I. Only then do I get seated. Tonkotsu Red I ordered food was good I will not go back because of this horrible customer service. They just want you in and out it's like don't even try to enjoy this place..Obon ramen tonkotsu is better it actually has the 64 degree egg and much nicer people!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
The place is great except the very long line of waiting. Be patient and you will get a good meal!

The best found for me is their lady Earl Grey from Maya tea.  As someone soaked in tea all day long, I like to try tea around the world.  Maya Lady Earl Grey is by far the best I've had. It has a touch of floral fragrance and a tint vanilla. The flora aroma is subtle and not overpowering the tea. 

The sweet potato hash is absolutely amazing! 

Overall, it's worth the 40 mins wait.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: My wife and I went to Charros before a concert on a Sunday night.  The service was great along with the side dishes, but the steaks were not good even after they were replaced due to being overcooked to well on MR order. text: This market is beautiful. It makes you want to buy everything. I like their precooked foods, everything I've had has been delicious. This is a great place to grab something to eat and sit outside. In the winter months there is a fire pit near the tables where you can order from the outside of the store. Also a great place to bring a date. It's casual and there are so many choices you're sure to find something delicious, even for the most picky eater. The butcher almost always has something on special. Ask and he will tell you what the best deals are. There were three items that I haven't been able to find anywhere else. Since I was in the verge of buying them online I happily snatched them up. I'll be back soon!

text: I work right next door and have been eating at this Taco Bell for years! They have the best crew very nice people and they always get my orders out in a timely manner so I can relax on my break! Always accurate to how I order it! Hands down my favorite Taco Bell location!

text: Friday night everyone waiting for the patio. We said 1st available and they sat us right away. Though much quieter than outside , empty tables in our section, waiter was harried and rushed. Our waters and drinks came in the same rushed fashion. We had ordered with our drink orders and the chicken Alfredo and chicken parmigiano came promptly after our salads. The salad was an extra on my Alfredo and the parmigiano did not come with any pasta. The food was ok but really just average and for $45 for what we got I feel very overpriced with such mediocre service.  No water refills and flybys from our waiter. I think there are a lot of restaurants in this area of town I feel your money could be better spent elsewhere.

categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
We had lunch here today and loved it.  We were seated on the patio.  The space heater was on, but it was unnecessary on such a lovely day, so I asked if it could be turned off and the obliging young man did.  The menu is extensive and enticing.  There are several breakfast offerings and several more for lunch.  It was difficult to decide and when I did make a choice I thought wistfully of roads not taken.  Though many things tempted me, I went w/ the grilled cheese sandwich and tomato bisque.  Alan ordered the tri tip slider, a house made cheddar biscuit, scrambled egg, arugula, jalapeño jam, served w/ country hash.  He ordered coffee and I ordered Lady Earl Grey tea.

The tea was served in a French press-type device.  We had whole milk on the side for both coffee and tea.  My tea cup was tall, graceful white porcelain.  The contents of the press just filled it.  The tea was very tasty.  When our dishes arrived they looked beautiful.  My sandwich contained tea smoked tomato, pulled mozzarella, brie,
parmesan rubbed bread, mint cashew pesto.  It was luscious and generous enough to share bites w/ Alan and still be too much for me to finish.  The tomato bisque was dark and subtly smokey, w/ occasional chunks of tomato.  It was my childhood comfort food grown up and elegant.  Alan gave me a taste of his biscuit and it was delicious.  He loved the dish, although he found the finely diced potatoes disappointingly bland, lacking onions, peppers or anything else to give them interest.  His expectations may have been raised by the term 'hash'.  We were taken enough w/ our lunches that we discussed returning tomorrow to explore more of the menu  Perhaps we will.

The restaurant wasn't full when we arrived shortly before 11:30, but a steady stream of people arrived in groups of two and larger and soon both indoor and outdoor tables were close to full.  Our server told us the restaurant had been open a little more than a year and that it was quite popular.  We could certainly see why.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Had breakfast here on Friday while visiting our daughter. Loved the option to get on waiting list using yelp. I don't see why anyone would even bother with Quiznos or Subway or those other chains after trying Jimmy Johns. My only gripe is that I can only get a taste when I fly into Tucson for business as there are currently no Jimmy Johns in SoCal.

text: I would rather wait for lent season and get a bigger portion for my money. Seriously not worth it. Food is not well executed. Staff is not friendly. Im going to make sure everyone reads this. text:

text: I walked in and stood at the counter for 2 minutes before even being acknowledged, manager walked by and didn't even greet me. Very poor customer service. After I ordered to eat in the restaurant and got my drink, I had a seat and waited for my food. I saw an employee walk around with a to go bag looking for who it belonged to, she went back behind the counter and then emerged with a receipt and an empty tray. She aplogized for putting it in a to go bsg and handed me the empty tray. The food was served hot and typical for the chain, but what is lacking is the human interaction and customer service. I refuse to order at a do it yourself kiosk, that is what the employees get paid to do. Without the human customer service...what do they have?

text:
PROS:
--Happy hour prices on the drinks (not food) last as long as a live band is playing. (But....see below)
--Awesome veggie tacos - but they are not on the menu, ask your server to ask the kitchen if they will make them. They officially stopped them but have made them for me when I asked.
--Nice space- has mellow outside tables and couches, fire pits, and is poolside; - has interior bar area with TV's (sports and news going at the same time on different tv's.)

CONS:
--Happy hour drinks are SUPER weak!! Maybe a splash of liquor. Better to order a shot AT the bar so you can watch it being poured.
--Live music crowd....interesting....a VERY mixed crowd of 40+ folks of all sorts. Not a classy or, um, charming crowd, sort of...um, just, be open minded and go with the flow!
--Bathrooms are freakishly far from the bar/restaurant! A waiter had to lead me down this maze of hallways. I was honestly not sure I would find my way back on the first try! Weird.

PRO or CON? YOU DECIDE!
--Live music = interesting! The couple Friday evenings I went, there was this super lounge-y group playing (Edna and Ely B-Cool) and the singer is a real character. Often she walks around singing and talking to everyone and greeting people by name, she is totally lounge-y in every way! Like an over-exaggeration or mocking of lounge singers - but this gal is 100% real. She was so real and into it that I loved her for her passion (if not her originality). Depending on how you choose to see it or on how playful you are at the time, you might see it as sad and lame, awesome and inspiring, or simply fun and hilarious!
name: Fire + Spice Tucson
categories: Mexican, Tex-Mex, Restaurants

text:

text:
Okay, I'll admit it. 
Real reason I go to local fairs is for the fry-bread. I also get really excited when I have out-of-town guests and they're interested in visiting the San Xavier Mission (fry-bread stand heaven!!!) 
Well the manna has finally fallen on the NE corner of Saint Mary's and Grande. I no longer have to eat my fry-bread standing, walking and fighting off bees (other fry-bread lovers will know what I mean). 
Located in a small, simple building formally occupied by a Mexican eatery, the current occupants have cleaned it up, repainted and are now open for business.  Other places in town do have frybread on their menus, but it seems as if they're almost an afterthought. Tucson, being so rich in Native American culture has waited long enough. We needed a place that allowed this star dish to shine. 
The recipe for fry-bread is simple, but the knowledgeable touch is not. In the wrong hands, frybread can be tough and overly greasy. 
This place gets it oh-so-right!
Hot, puffy, chewy and well...slightly greasy (but in a good way) is one way to describe the dessert fry-bread we tried first. We chose a plain one with honey (classic in my opinion). 
Later we tried the Indian taco (refried beans, lettuce, tomatoes, shredded cheese and a tasty little red salsa on the side). Mmmm!
Can't wait to go back and try the red and green chili next. And no, I didn't mind the canned sodas and paper plates. 
Hopefully this will not become too much of a habit or I'll be looking for a cardiologist soon.
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: Glad there are two specifically vegan breakfast options on the menu (waffles and pancakes). Food is good. Coffee is overpriced. Service is decent.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Sushi Nara is a little place in a small strip mall near the intersection of Speedway and Camino Seco, on the east side (across the street from Walgreens, I think it is). We've eaten there twice now and have really enjoyed it. Over the course of the two trips, we have sampled the salmon sashimi (very good), the Alaska roll (not my cup of tea--my fault, as I ordered the wrong thing), the Eskimo roll (very good), the shrimp dumplings, and the tofu age appetizer, both really good. 

I was happy that our meal came with miso soup and edamame, also quite good. One former reviewer said the edamame was slimy, but that was not the case either time for us. The miso was flavorful, unlike many similar soups elsewhere. The second time we came in, the cook remembered us and our orders--that was pretty amazing.

I'm so happy to have found this place. We will be regulars from now on.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: The absolute worst customer service ever! I had a sleeping baby in my arms as I ordered and asked (knowing the baby would be sleeping in my arms throughout lunch) for them to please chop up the spinach so I could eat with one hand. The counter person made note and said it was fine. The same girl delivered my salad and said "sorry they won't chop up the lettuce!" Why on earth would they not chop up a couple if pieces of spinach for a person unable to eat with both hands who had a valid very small request???? I will NEVER EVER go back! Besides my $9.00 salad of spinach nuts and cheese was a pile of crap! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY! Drive a block down to beyond bread where there is variety, good food, and great staff!
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Where to start?  I love the cozy feel of this place.  I love the green tea, miso soup, tonkatsu, sushi, udon, and especially the plum ice cream.  I love how they slip a little Japanese language in and give you a yogurt drink with your check.  I lived in Japan for three years and this brings back memories of living there and the small family restaurants.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: Friends in Phoenix told us in San Diego that this place in Tucson was worth the drive. We were in Tucson for New Years so we made it a point to stop in. It did not disappoint. The lunch buffet had deliciously seasoned choices that were better than many meals we had in India. Many classic dishes. A continuous supply of fresh nan. This will be a regular stop any time we get near Tucson.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Typical casino. Walked around, played some slots, we didn't win anything and we noticed no one else really was either. The place was nice though, very clean. We didn't stay in the rooms, but based on the reviews and the way the casino looked, they are probably very nice. We may go back through here again when we're in Tucson.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text:
I've had items from this bakery a few times.  The pies, while pretty on the outside, are not good when actually cut.  The cherry pie, especially, is waaaaaaaaaay too soggy.  They either need to precook the fruit, to get the water out, or add some sort of thickener, like corn starch, to the filling.  I cut into the pie and the filling just started pouring out of the pie into the empty space that the first slice had left.  Continuing like that to serve guests was actually quite a mess and pretty disappointing, given that the pie comes from a bakery.  Because of the overly wet filling, the bottom of the crust is incredibly soggy.  

A guest had brought 2 berry pies from Village Bakehouse to a dinner party I was hosting, and the same thing happened with both pies.  I thought my experience was perhaps an anomaly, but it turns out it's par for the course.

We also purchased some macarons and did a taste test of these with ones shipped from a NY bakery (and therefore were at least 2-days old).  The NY macarons won hands down with my guests--they said the Village Bakehouse ones were dry and tasted very old, and I agree.  They must be serving macarons that are at least a few days old.  Not good.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: I'm starting to see a trend in Tucson: places that have high to pretty decent reviews are actually completely mediocre. Street taco is no exception. The food is just ok. The staff members are really friendly and the drinks aren't bad, but it's nothing to write home about. Parking is also an absolute nightmare.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Excellent choice for both traditional Chinese and typical American-Chinese dishes. We loved it and will go back. Highly recommend.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text:
Omg, so good!!!  We were driving thru Tucson on our way to Sedona and stopped in here. The name was kind of misleading, it doesn't sound like a Chinese name, at least to me, but don't go by what I say, it might be a Chinese saying for all I know.

Anyway, the food was delicious and the waitress was very friendly and helpful in giving me directions to a Pier !!  We both had moo goo gai(?), highly recommend this place!!
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: Over the years its been a couple of owners but now that Marcos owns it, he and his family have taken a real passion to hot wings and put themselves on the map. Wayyyyyy better then Buffalo Wild Wings because they're not a franchise that hires people that know nothing about their products. Way better than wing stop because they're local. I highly recommend the hot mustard. Soooo goood.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
Nice little breakfast place. I had the breakfast burrito, which allows you to take any of the omelets and turn it into the burrito. The grits were also good. 

Our server, Lindsay, misunderstood the toast selection of one of my dining companions but she was sweet and apologetic and fixed it right away.  

Also, I left my wallet on the table accidentally and another employee chased me out to give it to me.  Much appreciated!
name: Jerry Bob's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional)

text: Very interesting menu and lively atmosphere.  My only reason for a 4 as opposed to a 5 was that the poached eggs on my beni were not hot.  Now how does that happen?
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: "Gluten free" is used loosely in this restaurant, there are many options, however it's all made on the same equipment, so cross contamination is a guarantee. If GF is your preference, this is a tasty place; if you're allergic or intolerant to Gluten, it's not so great.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: What a great find.  Have been here three times in last month.  Joe scordatos touches are obvious.  The vegetable rice pilaf similar to vivaces and the amazing sauces.  This place perfected cutlets.  Their chicken and pork dishes are amazing.  They will happily split a salad. Their Caesar is perfect as is the salad Italiano.  Yesterday I ordered chicken Parmesan that wasn't on the menu and it was done to perfection.   We are huge fans of vivaces, but this place is a good standby when we cant wait a week for a reservation.   They are starting pizza soon, can't wait to try them.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: When you eat their food - the flavors of "made from scratch" goodness BURST in your mouth causing all your cares to melt away, your eyes to roll back in your head, and your taste buds enter the pearly gates of heaven!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE the food and the service!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I love having breakfast at Prep & Pastry. The staff is always friendly and attentive to keeping up with drink refills and making sure their customers have everything they need. The first time I visited this restaurant I had Bananas Foster French toast and the second time around I had the Tri-tip Sandwich that included a side of hash. Both meals were very flavorful and filling. They offer wonderful brunch mimosas and the décor is unique and tasteful. Definitely check out their pastries. The maple bacon cronut is delicious and the frosting that tops it is perfect!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I have eaten street tacos all my life and although I always hope to enjoy Tacos Al Pastor I am always disappointed. Everyone knows not to even offer them to me. Well that has all changed today! I now can say that I LOVE the Al Pastor from Street Taco & Beer Co. Everything I tasted was flavorful with great service. My new favorite spot.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Not impressed.  The burger patty was very thin and over cooked.  You are mainly eating a ton of bread with their burger.  There's definitely better options for a great burger in the area
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text:
Old review is below, time for an update!  Gusto is really starting to grow on us, we have now gone maybe 8 times in 3 years and most recently a month ago. The al dente pasta at Gusto is hard to beat in Tucson, it is predictably nearly perfect every time. My wife likes the crispy eggplant parmigiana with side of angel hair pasta and I really like the bolognese sauce for some reason and have ordered it with different pastas. It is a  simple dish but very well seasoned. One of the nice things about the wait staff at Gusto is that they are happy to ask the chef to substitute any dish or cook up veal scallopini even if not offered that night. 

Five stars for Vivace but easy four stars for Gusto. The difference? Ambience is important to me. 




Went to Gusto last night after a two year gap to see if things had improved. Food was actually quite tasty and service was good. We had Ceasar salad, tasty but slightly wilted, pasta bolognese and eggplant parmigiana. The pasta was a pleasant surprise and the eggplant was tasty with a crispy crust. Overall a good experience, but wish they could do something to improve the dining ambience relative to the prices. They charge about 30% higher than the place appears it should. Personally I am ok with the prices but don't like the vibe.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: I came here to check out the Wi-Fi for a place to work out of. Not only do they have great Wi-Fi but the choice of food here is incredible. I decided to try out the all you can eat buffets. Wow talk about multitudes of choices! You have a buffet table ful of pastry, a buffet table full of breakfast staples such as scrambled eggs, pancakes, sausage, and of course the famous beacons and a whole lot more. I counted 5 hugh different buffet tables. Starbucks Just lost it's normal customer to something a little more reasonable in cost and the choices of variety of food to be had. If you haven't tried this place yet I urge you so check it out. This place just become you new place to work out of if you work from your laptop, Smartphone and tablet as I do. Plus they do have a few plug-ins something missing from a few other places. You won't regret this choice. The staff was very courtesy. I don't know about those negative review I saw I saw no such thing from my visit. I would now make this my normal place of work and its cost is so much less than Starbucks, that is if you buy the foods and drinks..
name: Kettle Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: French food is my fave. However, it is limited in Tucson. What I like about Ghinis is that it is small, cozy and unpretentious. A great french breakfast with a champagne mimosa is a great way to start the day. There is a great French bakery colocated with Ghinis. Try the chocolate croissant with a nice hot coffee. This is where I can relax and treat myself.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Woohoo, Sachiko is better than I remembered it.  I thought it was reasonably priced, I think an order of salmon was $2.80.  It seems you have to order soybeans though, they don't just give you some with sushi.  They have a big projection TV that annoyed me and kept catching my attention.  Dear restaurants, plz2bnoTVskthx.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: To bad you could not find seating for my Wife and Myself- BJ's down Broadway had no problem taking our money
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: First time here. Monday night around 7:30. Almost empty. We were greeted and seated promptly. We ordered the stuffed mushrooms. 4 in an appetizer order. They were delicious! I ordered the manicotti and my husband had the penne with sausage. Both were Just fantastic!  The portions looked small but they were filling. Very pleasantly surprised. Will be coming back again.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: I've been having a hard time finding a place that does decent al pastor tacos ever since I've moved to Tucson. So far this place has been the most satisfying. That paired with the fish taco made the experience pretty great. The size of the tacos could be larger, but I think the purpose is to remain faithful to the culture. Kudos
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I had regularly noticed the incredibly long drive-thru lines spilling out onto Speedway Boulevard and thought this place MUST be good. While passing by on my way to an appointment I was relieved to see that the line was only maybe five cars deep. So with (seemingly) time to spare I got in queue. It took TWENTY-FIVE minutes plus (this is not an exaggeration) to even get to the window. The extra wait time gave me plenty of opportunity to read the overwhelmingly negative food and service reviews online. By the time I was finally to the window I had lost my appetite and chose not to pay. I left so as not to waste my money on food that was sure to be bad (according to consumer reviews on multiple sites). I was late to my appointment as a result of what I perceive to be incompetence. Note to management: if a customer is in a drive-thru, that customer probably has some place to be.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text:
Safehouse either is or is not your thing.  If you're not a smoker, it's pretty likely that it's not gonna be your thing.  To quote fellow Yelper Brad, "Safehouse is filled with cigarette smoke, a vintage arcade game, and looks like some kind of awesome desert-ravaged, time-warped, demented 1970s ski lodge."

I would have LOOOVVEDD this place in my cigarette-hazed, overly caffeinated, Noir-seeking college days and would have given it an 11 of 10.  But even now, in my post-college, Noir-seeking days, it still gets 4 stars.
name: Safehouse
categories: Coffee & Tea, Nightlife, Restaurants, Pool Halls, Food

text: Came for brunch the French toast was AMAZING . We also had the duck confit hash was very different and delicious. This place gets crowded we went on a Monday and there was almost a wait.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Not bad in one of the less expensive places you can eat at downtown. It's basically a knockoff of but the food was very good and the quality I think was better than you get from the chains.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Don't go.
Rude staff. 
Bad food.
Not that cheap.
Ugly/No decor.
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: Great tasting fresh sushi on the east side-finally!!  Wonderful service, yummy food, and fair prices.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: Best Waffle in town. Quick, friendly service. A lot of good food for the price. Strong coffee as well. When someone comes in to town and I want to take them to breakfast, this is one of my top options.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Having once eaten at the former Wilmot location and being extremely under-whelmed with the experience, we were still willing to give Brawley's another try once they moved closer to our home. We've been back three times since.
The location on Pantano and Wrightstown is larger and less "dingy" ... the parking lot is massive in this nearly-dead strip mall, so no competing with shoppers. ;-)  The service is fast, attentive, and friendly enough. The value for the money is terribly good. Previously the only "quick and cheap" breakfast option in the general area was Viv's Cafe. While Viv's is closer to home, we needed a change. And Brawley's fits the bill nicely.
We've had their pancakes (nice and fluffy), a waffle w/eggs, omelet with fresh mushrooms and fresh spinach w/hollandaise, a chili size, corned beef hash, and the vegetarian benedict offering. My husband has also had pie and a milkshake. In every case, except the shake, we were pleasantly surprised at both the quality, speed of serving, flavor, and lack of grease (a down-side with Viv's). 
While not gourmet or trendy, this is solid, quality and flavor for the money. And light on the flat-top grease.
name: Brawley's Restaurant
categories: Food, Do-It-Yourself Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

text: Way downhill. Atmosphere is interesting, basically a big lodge. Service was poor, or easier couldn't multi-task at all. It took us an hour and a half for dinner with no wait for a table. Food was mediocre and overpriced. You can get better food elsewhere pretty easily.  First time here in 4 years and won't be back anytime soon.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Doesn't even deserve that one star! Atrocious service... took forever to get service, waitress never came back after taking orders, took ages to get someone to check us out! Just plain ridiculous, and they weren't even apologetic about the horrible service! Avoid at all costs!!!
name: Denny's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners

text: Cute little place for breakfast, healthy options and great flavors its different from the typical breakfast place that is just usually pancakes and toast. Would go again!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Food is good but not exceptional. Eggs Benedict was not made with real hollandaise and eggs were overdone. Like so many restaurants that claim "fresh," this particular meal had the taste of being assembled from prepackaged/precooked ingredients. On another occasion, the omelet was very good, but quickly cooled--another mark of reheating. Another meal offered smoked salmon: it was simply steamed and reheated salmon, not smoked. At both locations, the main negative is how loud the surroundings are. The atmosphere is not welcoming, but noisy. Service is all right but not outstanding.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I live a few blocks away and value the place.The rest of the strip mall except the convenient laundromat next door is pretty much dreck.The pastrami is great,fries too.The accusations that the clientele is on the low life side is a feature  I sort of like. I wish they would wash the front door more....
name: Famous Sam's Restaurant & Bar
categories: Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text: Nestled inside a wine shop, this spot is super intimate (as in extra cozy) with something thirty seats. The ambiance makes for a perfect date night. Peruse the the shop before dinner, but a bottle and take it to the table with you. The wine selection at the shop (also known as The Rum Runner) is impressively varied and well priced. Their Wine shop/ restaurant concept was one of the first to hit Tucson and they certainly do it well. On the food front, they're Known for their Mussels, a definite must try. We enjoyed a bowl of those tonight. With a Caesar salad, fancy salad and the salmon dish. Everything was flavorful and well portioned, but a bit on the salty side. Wine by the glass is nicely priced. I love that their keep it real with their wine prices. So many restaurants in town mark up their wines to the point of of greed and that's a major turn off. Two servers usually handle the floor an handle it well attentively. The Dish is a solid go-to for locals and visitors alike.
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text: Some of the best damn bbq I have ever tasted! The briskets was so tender it melts in your mouth. Mac and cheese, potato salad and peach cobbler are to die for. We drove from Phoenix to try this app place and I couldn't be more satisfied. I am so full I don't know if I can drive back home.
name: Two Boots BBQ Shop
categories: Barbeque, Soul Food, Restaurants

text:
This place was absolutely delightful. Saturday night after El Tour meant that they were super busy. Service was a bit confused, but we were a very large party. Great ambiance completed with a live acoustic guitar. 

I ordered the Tucson Favorite Steak. Although simple in display, the simple dish of steak, tortilla, and green onion was on point. The steak was absolutely succulent - medium rare, beautifully seasoned, not too much fat. We had also ordered the brussel sprouts, which were equally delightful. 

Great service that should be and looks proud to work there. Prices are steep for Tucson, but deserved.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
After hearing people swear up and down about this place me and a friend were stoked to head over for some great wings, a few apps and some full stomachs. 

However, as we pulled into the little dives parking lot we were concerned when the ambiance looked more like a garage, rather than a restaurant The decor was very "fighter pilot" style, which being in the service I appreciated and further impressed me.

The wings and apps though seem to have the same "good enough for government  work" sense of taste and presentation. 

Typical place for you and the guys to suck back ALOT of beer and then eat some mediocre wings.  Not recommended for sober dining.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
Mother Hubbard's... The food is good, the service is good, but the place itself is lacking. 

I've come here twice and have really enjoyed my breakfasts. I like getting their breakfast bowl because its delicious and filling! I really appreciate how they let you customize orders to your preference. Always a plus! 
Service is always good as well. I've never had to wait for a table for a check. Food and drinks always come out quickly.

My biggest dislike of this place is the interior. On the outside, you have all these cute little sugar skulls. On the street corner there is a sign advertising the place with a picture of a comforting looking breakfast. You'd expect something kind of quirky or similar inside. But instead it's all just.... Blue. Blue paint everywhere. With hardly a decoration on the wall. It just makes the eating-out experience less of an experience. Blue is certainly my favorite color but the place just feels very uninviting.

I would recommend Mother Hubbard's do a little interior decorating to give this place more of a "feel". Disregarding the interior, I'd give this place 4 stars. But I cannot overlook how depressing the inside is. The food and service are good, and the restaurant needs to reflect this!
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Solid food but weird service and high prices, probably won't go back.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
My husband and I ate here this past weekend since we were in Tucson for the weekend.  We have eaten here two or three times before.  

Their buffet is rather limited, but seems to have all the basics that Chinese buffets would have.  What needed to be warm was warm.

The sushi is good for buffet sushi, and kept cool.  The rice didn't have the hard texture.  If you are expecting high end sushi dont go to an all you can eat buffet for it.  

The place was pretty clean, and didn't have that weird smell most Chinese buffets do.

The service has always be nice, and prompt.

The price seems reasonable and inline with the buffets we have gone to in the Phoenix area.

As I said before, my husband and I have eaten here two or three times prior every 2 months or so, and everything seems to be fairly consistant.
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text: Great selection of beers! I sometimes don't know how to chose!! Food is tasty, sort of like an upscale version of finger/bar food. Atmosphere is great... especially when Caiden Brewer performs live music on the patio! Wish they would make the patio smoke free
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: Four stars. Enjoyed the steak and of course, the mud pie! Pretty much it's like a run of the mill restaurant, on the level of a Ruby Tuesday, Outback Steakhouse format. The steak was good and the mud pie was delicious.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text:
Very good food, although different than I'm used to.
Price was fair, lots of value
Chorizo and Huevos were good, the waffles are, apparently, da bomb.
The decor is "day of the dead", but plain-jane and very "industrial" like.  Pipes, conduits and cabling, just out in the open.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: I had the Bisbee Breakfast Bowl with country potatoes, cheddar, and bacon.  It didn't look like much when our server brought it, but it was actually a lot to eat.   There were four of us and everyone seemed to enjoy their choices.  We arrived around 11:20 on a Thursday and the place was almost empty.  Service was quick and friendly.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: My favorite place to meet friends for breakfast! We go there all the time since it opened . The staff is wonderful and the food is consistently fantastic. They have vegan items added to the menu so now more of my friends can come
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I'm giving Caruso's 3 stars because the service was not very good at the beginning of my dinning experience. When I arrived at Caruso's I put my name down and waited about 10 minutes for a table. I want outside to wait for my name to be called, and I guess they don't call names outside because when I came back in, they asked "are you Nina?" and proceeded to try and seat me. I had told them the first available table was ok when I put my name down. But, when I went to be sat, the hostess asked again if I wanted outside or inside. I said inside was fine, and she was really pushing me to be sat outside. She told me that people usually wait hours to be sat outside. This was my first time here, so I didn't know what their patio looked like, so I asked if the wait for outside would be longer, in which she responded "yes", so I took the inside option. I had a party of three, but only two of us where there. Or hostess sat us down in a corner with a backlight above us, so our napkins had an eerie fluorescent glow. She also put down three menus, and about 5 minutes later a busy boy came by and put three waters on the table. I started looking around for a server, and there was no one to be found. It looked like we were completely abandoned in our little fluorescent glowing corner where we were sat. Over 15 minutes later our server came by to ask if wanted anything else to drink, and if we were waiting on a third person. We said we were waiting on another but that we were ready to order for all three of us. He took our orders and was very attentive after that. Getting us garlic rolls and refilling our waters. 

I ordered the Caruso Special - spaghetti, ravioli and meatballs in marinara sauce. I was thinking about getting the Special in the garlic mushroom sauce, but when I asked the server if the garlic mushroom sauce would be good with the meatballs, he simply responded "sure." Which I found off-putting, and I decided on the marinara sauce instead. My friend's ordered the Tuesday night special - Shrimp and Scallops Alfredo, and the Grilled Salmon Delight.  All of us were happy with our meals. The portions were medium sized, not overwhelmingly huge like some italian restaurants, and the prices were fair. 

Next time, I'll come back to check out the famous patio.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
I arrived tired from the road and looking forward to a decent breakfast where I could get some business done on my laptop while I waited for my food. I was told to wait a few minutes.  I watched other folks come in and saw them get seated before me. I figure they did not have a reservation as the waiter/waitress asked how many were in their party. Maybe they were just waiting for a single table, but they should have said something instead of leaving me sitting there watching others come in and get seated quickly. 
Either way the prices are not cheap as indicated on this site and customer service could use a makeover.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: came for brunch, it was very busy but we were seated right away. The owners are amazing guys, very friendly and seems that they will do anything to make sure you have a great time (free cronut on the house! yes please!)  The staff is very casual and prettty quiet, not the friendliest bunch the day I was there, but could be because of the rush. Ordered an eggs Benedict, very fresh, light and seasonal..possibly the first time i've had a properly cooked egg at a restaurant, seriously! worth the $$ for some tasty food!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Sooooooo good. 
Their plates are so healthy and taste good too. Their service was okay till I meet my server, who was unkind and I was so uncomfortable to ask my favors to her because she doesn't smile at all ... I thought she is angry or something. Whatever, food was great tho.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The food always hits the spot and the employees are very friendly and welcoming. Even the coffee is great, and I'm a coffee snob. Just wish it was open later so I could go there after work.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text:
Street taco has kind of become our downtown tradition, the food here is excellent and prices are reasonable. I recommend the carne asada torta with just the right amount of beans and avocado, very delicious! Chip and salsa bar rock! Great Staff and very clean. 
See you soon! 

Support Local! 

Thanks!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Since writing my previous review I was contacted by management inviting me to come back and apologized for the unpleasant time, they also stated they had made a few changes with staff.  This showed me they care about their employees and made me try it again. The service was great this time around, the waitress came by regularly and was very pleasant. My friend tried the French toasts and those were delicious. I was a bit disappointed they don't have a vegan option, but was happy they provide almond milk as a milk substitute.  The vegetarian option they do offer doesn't provide a very clear description of the dish. It was a bit on the greasy side though. But the service was great and the experience was a good one.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: So delicious and so cheap! Friendly service and the donuts were so fresh. I def will be back!
name: Donut King
categories: Restaurants, Donuts, Food

text: Being from California, I'm spoiled. Below average and all the fish was mushy. Like it was frozen and the temperature wasn't low enough, or just low quality fish. It all tasted the same, which is to say no flavor, but I guess you don't come to the desert for sushi...
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: I've been a Wingstop fan for years and this store is one of the best. Incredibly polite employees and the store is impeccably clean.  Food is always hot and delicious w the BEST fries!  Give the Lemmon pepper wings a try... Delicious!
name: Wingstop
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, American (New)

text: Best Brunch in Tucson, Hands down. Great and friendly service. Also excellent accommodation by hostesses Hannah and Ivana.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I had mixed feelings in regards to this place. The burger itself was very flavorful and they gave me the choice of having sautéed onions which was super nice. The fries were like warm pillows, fluffy and melted in ur mouth. The staff worked as a team serving you and were helpful and friendly. All of that was very pleasant. What I didn't like was the portion size of the fries was small, the patty was super thin and the prices were on the more expensive side. The place is also extremely worn down and looked like something you would see in a very old castle. Overall, we probably would go back, but not anytime soon.
name: Great American Steakburger
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Bars, Steakhouses, Burgers

text: They're Monte Cristo is HEAVENLY! And potatoes cooked to perfection. Crisp, light and seasoned just right. And I can't say enough about the bar tender, he made my mom and I the absolute BEST virgin mint julep's we have ever had! They aren't on the menu, but they should be!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The establishment is clean and the employees are friendly. The prices are affordable and well worth it. I am not sure what they do to their beans but I love them and I am usually not a fan.  Their menu is not expansive but every single item is delicious.  I came for tortillas and left with more than I bargained for.  This place is great for a quick homemade lunch.
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text: We were in town and staying close to the restaut. The portions here are generous and the food was delicious. Service is a bit slow because there was only one waitress, so don't come in a rush.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: What a great concept! I've been half a dozen times and its always delicious. The food is unique and flavorful, and the prices are extremely reasonable.  Great drinks and a nice patio. The breakfast poutine is my favorite, but everything is worth trying. Truly a Tucson best!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Good, but not great.  It reminds me of a family style Italian restaurant minus the family part.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Chipotle never fails me! I can count on them for a meal that is fresh, fast, delicious and affordable! I LOVE having the option to go all out with meat, cheese, and sour cream if I want, or straight veggie style, and never feeling like I'm lacking anything. It's one of the few places in town that I can think of that always works for everyone in our family, especially If we are out and about and not wanting to spend too much, we almost always end up at Chipotle. I agree with others as well about the consistency of the food quality and taste.  It's good stuff!
name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican

text:
Love this resort!!! My wife's family lives in Tucson and just around the corner from this resort. So every time we have a chance we stay there.  Rooms are clean, roomy and with modern bathrooms. Resort has awesome customer service.  Pool has a pretty and relaxing layout.  
Casino is always fun and has many restaurants to choose from in case you get hungry. 
I definitely recommend this resort to anyone who enjoys casinos.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Great food , antipasto was tasty the fish was perfect and the meatballs were wonderful. The service was top notch and the evening was great
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: Some of the best wings I've had in a long time.  Service was friendly and professional. Without being directed by a local, I never would have found this.free standing hole-in-the-wall wing stop.  Highly recommended if you like wings
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Really, about the best wings you find here in town. Good, and crispy. This is a working-class joint. No ties here! The staff is hard-working, and the place can be very busy and hectic at times. Parking is adequate if you remember the side and rear of the building. Now, notice that I only gave 4 stars for WOB, but that's only because I think a perfect score is about impossible to achieve. The Olympics cheapened the perfect score, so I'm on a mission to put reality back into judges' scores. That being said, I highly recommend WOB if you're looking for very good wings. The price is more than fair, as well. My favorites are the Cajun and the Honey Gold.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
Bisbee Bowl was a winner for the meat lovers, but watch out for the huevos rancheros...it was disappointing in size and wasn't anything special

Overall I'm gonna come back, but if the next thing I try is like the huevos rancheros it'll probably be my last time
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: This is by far the best oriental restaurant in Tucson.  The staff is friendly and courteous. Always smiling when we arrive. Would give this place more stars if I could. The food is perfectly prepared and tastes delicious! I have been eating at this restaurant for many years and have NEVER had a bad experience.
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: We came across this restaurant while researching places to eat in Tucson and it didn't disappoint. We each got mimosas which were awesome. Our plan was to each at a few different places throughout the day so we split a stack of pancakes. It ended up being plenty when paired with eggs and sausage. It's all tasted amazing and they have unique pancakes, not your typical tasting mix. I'll definitely be back whenever I go back to Tucson. I'm sad they don't have a Phoenix location
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I reserving the 5th star for my second, full service visit.

I was in the area on a Sunday and decided to drop in and grab some pastries.  I was able to get a cronut and and a tropical scone.

First, the hostess and the women who helped behind the pastry counter were both super nice and helpful.  The restaurant itself is adorable with great seating and what looks to be a nice patio.  There was a wait for a table but everyone seemed happy.

I got the pastries home and am not ashamed to say that I ate them both.  They were fantastic.  I did that thing where I had to slow down because I didn't want eating them to end.  So I would eat a bite and savor.  

The menu looks great and I cannot wait to come back and try some of the different items on the menu.  A great breakfast edition to the area.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Best wings in Tucson!

On Tuesdays wings are 40 cents each, great deal! Totally worth it every day of the week, though.  The wings are the star here, but for sides the beer battered fries and onion rings are both awesome, and the portion sizes huge. Surprisingly for a wing place, their dinner salad is legit, big and with lots of fresh vegetables. 

Honey BBQ and Mild Buffalo are my favorite flavors since I can't handle too much spice, but they have plenty of choices to choose from!  Some of my friends really love the Cajun, Lemon Pepper, or Hot Buffalo.  The wings are big with plenty of meat on them, and they aren't dry like a lot of wings can be. 

The building itself could be better- it can be really hot during the summer and cold during the winter- but come on, with wings this good I just make sure to dress appropriately.

Expect a wait on Tuesdays!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Recently spent a few days at Casino del Sol and had a great time. I noticed a lot of the 1 & 2 star reviews complained about the staff being rude. I didn't experience that. I didn't encounter a single staff member that I would describe as rude. They were incredibly nice and helpful. I didn't encounter a single staff member that was rude. Another complaint was the casino smelled like cigarette smoke which was true. I hate to break the news to you, but every casino you will ever go to allows smoking. Have you ever seen a non smoking casino in Vegas? If smoking bothers you, you probably shouldn't go to casino's. I'm a non smoker, but I accept that casinos allow smoking, so it wasn't an issue. The buffet could of had more choices, but I had no problem finding selections I liked. The room was great and was ready 2 hours before check-in time. It was clean, the bathroom was modern, and the bed was comfortable. I have to go to Tucson again in January, and I'll be staying here again.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Excellent food and allergy friendly, gluten free friendly. Be sure to discuss any cross contamination issues if you are that sensitive. They do not have a dedicated fryer and you will need to ask for rice noodles to be boiled in fresh water. Love love love this place!!!
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: I came to Claim Jumper and got a steak that tasted kind of funny to me, so I told my waitress who's name is Brittany. They took such amazing care of me, and her manager John, made sure that everything was okay. I am so impressed with the level of customer service here, and I will be back again. If you are ever here, request Brittany as your waitress, she is phenomenal!
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: WHERE TO COME FOR SUSHI ON THE GO. I have ordered several times to go and it's always prepared quickly and made fresh. The people who work here are happy to be there nice and smiling! Great atmosphere and awesome BYoB set up.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: Their potstickers are addicting.  I order them just for myself, plus they deliver which is even more awesome.  I haven't had an entree that blew me away... But I'm pretty sure the potstickers have some addictive substance in them, as I have eaten a whole order alone twice this week.  Yummo.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text:
The food here is really good. I love the pastry case, I love the local coffee, I love the extensive menu.
The problem is the line. There are far too many excellent brunch places in our fine little city to justify waiting in line for 90 minutes or more. 
I will concede that P&P does serve Tucson's 2nd best grilled cheese sandwich. But you can eat Tucson's best grilled cheese at 47 Scott on a Saturday or Sunday morning without needing to wait in line. 
I would love it if P&P started taking reservations or opened a second location (I would be able to give them a 5-star review!). I want to love this place and its adorable mimosa menu, I just don't want to wait in line.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Tucked away in a strip mall, small joint. Been here twice, both times for lunch. Looks and feels like a family run biz. Food was very good, and plentiful portions. Not much else to say. I like these smaller joints. Usually places like this serve up more authetic fare than a big and fat chain. It's definitely a place I would stop by for a bite to eat whenever I was in the area. My only recommendation would be a bigger sign out front.

Food: 5 stars
Ambience: 3 stars
Service: 5 stars
name: Zayna Mediterranean Cafe
categories: Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Restaurants

text: Tepid dirt-water coffee and stale churro dossant/cronut.  One star to the excellent staff.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This was the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. My friend and I sat at the bar and the bartender gave us menus water and immediately left. 10 minutes later she asks what we want, we order some meals with drinks. She walks away to put our order, never bring us drinks, 10 minutes later some other lady comes out and we ask for our drinks. Then we ask her if they can change one of the TVs to the NBA game since 2 were playing shows that no one was watching. She says she can't because the "customers" will get mad, guess we weren't customers. 10 minutes later our food comes, we got wings, the food was decent but I noticed everyone but us got a plate to put their bones. We were not rude at all and even were helpful to some of the other customers in what to order. From there we didn't get helped the rest of the time there until we went to pay.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
Best. Tortillas. Ever.  I'm from Southern California, and no where locally can I get the amazing Sonoran style homemade tortillas that are made at St. Mary's!  The fresh tortillas are about the size of a large pizza and so thin you can see through them!  They are amazing by themselves, as a quesadilla, or packed as a burrito.  I cannot get enough of these!

All I can speak to are the tortillas, as this is our stop on the way out of town heading back home.  However, the delicious aromas make us want to stay and dine.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: I'm not big on Italian food so it's hard to give more than 4 stars but we've been coming here for 20 years and the food is good. It's always hot and fresh. The chicken parm is my fave.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Fantastic brunch spot! Besides free coffee (locally roasted, natch) and cold water, delicious Margaritas, Mimosas and Bloody Marys can be had while you wait for your table (totally worth your time, by the way, there's a nice patio where you can socialize). Brenden is a rockstar behind the bar, and the food is just wonderful. Hollandaise obviously made from scratch, house cured pork belly, prosciutto, duck confit and don't forget the amazing pastries! Get one to go (there's even one with Nutella!) no matter what else you had to eat.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The Saturday morning wait was worth it. Even for just a seat at the bar. Perfect for a girls' day. I ordered a half serving of French toast and loose leaf tea. Satisfying but not too much.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
We had 10 in our group for dinner on 7/14.  Everyone ordered different items from a huge selection from a large 6 page menu!!!  Unless you are a real oriental connoisseur and know you Asian foods, it is pretty hard to make a decision - thank God for "Combination Plates" - makes the guess work a lot easier!!!  I chose A-4, I can't recall exactly what was included but I can say it was delish!  I ordered a side Won Ton Soup for the extra 50 cents, it was very full of vegies, etc. but was a bit too salty.  I did have others mention that their food was saltier than they like. They say they are MSG free in their foods?

The serve staff and chefs are very accommodating and helpful.  The facility is very clean and neat.  It is located right next to the Safeway in the shopping complex on Golf Links and south west corner of Harrison.

We will be including it on our return visit list and recommend it to others!!
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text:
Prep & Pastry is hands down my favorite breakfast place in Tucson. Everything I've had here has always exceeded expectations. The food is amazing and the menu has a lot of unique options, as well as classic breakfast items. 
The wait on weekends is almost always over an hour, but it is well worth the wait!! The restaurant overall is very artsy and a fun atmosphere!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This is a total Gem here in Tucson! Amazing and unique foods, exceptional service and phenomenal atmosphere! We will be here as often as we can!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: In all honesty this place was good in the first couple years after opening. Since then it has gone steadily downhill while the prices have increased. I went there twice in the past year and both times the service was incredibly slow (45 min to get served simple dishes) and the food was not very good. Two strikes is all it takes for me, won't be wasting money there again.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Food good, service bad.  You won't have a waitress, but will have to just flag down someone you see. And don't be shy about it or else you'll never get service.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: The restaurant is very clean, the atmosphere is phenomenal and the food is to die for. Believe it or not the last time I had Indian cuisine this good was in Durban, S. Africa.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: I was on my way to the airport back to college and my mom suggested that we go out to breakfast together. I had never been to Prep and Pastry, but I was delighted when I went for the first time, as the menu was extensive in both its specialty items as well as its pastry goods. The Campbell location has an outdoor patio that is particularly lovely and well covered. Since my first dining at Prep and Pastry, I've noticed a continuous flow of people and a greater generation of popularity and publicity for he restaurant, which further is a testament to the incredible food and service that it provides. Prep and Pastry is always a great brunch go-to and never disappoints.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Good food. I love their Pastrami Sandwich with spicy mustard. Wish they had more IPA's on Tap (they only have two - Laguanitas and Sierra). Wish they'd offer a few local brewery's IPA's. The restaurant is a little dark...but in a hot day that could be refreshing in be in a dark cool restaurant.
name: Famous Sam's Restaurant & Bar
categories: Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text: For the South side of Tucson, a whole 7-8 hr drive to the nearest ocean, this place wasn't bad. We ordered 4 different rolls, and after just moving back here from ocean side living, we were pleasantly surprised. The waitress was pleasant, the atmosphere was generally enjoyable, and the prices were to be expected. I think we'll definitely be going back.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: I'm have a big issue with germs.  When I eat out, doesn't matter what the restaurant is I request plastic utensils.  I'm at this restaurant for the first time and request a plastic fork.  They refuse to give me the fork because I'm eating in.  They have plastic utensils but wont let me have one.  Luckily I found one in my car.  I will never eat here again.
name: Brawley's Restaurant
categories: Food, Do-It-Yourself Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

text: Staying at the DoubleTree Suites Hotel and went to the pub to use my "Free Drink Coupon" and ended up drinking three Kilt Lifters.  Extremely friendly staff that make you feel welcomed. Ordered room service a few times on my trip and service was fast, food good. The Flatbreads are wonderful.
name: Finnegan's Pub
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Restaurants, American (New), Bars, Irish

text:
The Dish is a little hidden gem in the desert. Its joined to a wine/spirits market (Rum Runner), and the staff is exceptional. 

The place has very limited seating so call ahead or get there early and peruse their market.

They have a steamed mussels in saffron broth dish that blows my mind (This is Tucson after all.). Their chef prepares some pretty amazing specials, they had a tenderloin with balsamic glaze and mashed sweet potatoes once, which is my wife's favorite. The ambiance is great, elegant without feeling pretentious. 

They have a winning combination there, the food is fantastic, without being overly priced, a great staff, and the location can't be beat. Right in the center of town. Makes for a great starter to a date night.
name: The Dish Bistro
