categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text: Excellent service with creative and delicious food. Drinks are on point including the selection of mimosa options. Great for breakfast, lunch, and brunch. I happily take friends and work colleagues here. Classy and fun all wrapped into one.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
It was St. Patrick's Day.  Six of us were dressed in green and hoping to find some good corned beef and cabbage.  Isn't that usually the most popular dish at Irish restaurants?  Well, we found one close and we all ended up at Finnegan's Pub which is located in the Double Tree Hotel.  We were afraid this would be a popular night and the restaurant would be full.  It wasn't.  After reading all the reviews, I discovered there weren't too many great reviews.  Oh well .... we've been there and done that now and there's little chance we would return.

Five of us ordered the corned beef and cabbage special.  We've had plenty of corned beef at many Irish restaurants in the past plus cooked our own. It's one of our favorite Irish dinners.   The corned beef has been almost always cut thicker, more on your plate, juicy and delicious. I've got to say this was absolutely the worst corned beef my husband and I have ever had.

I thought the carrots, potatoes and cabbage were very good.  However, the corned beef was skimpy, cold, over cooked, dry and nearly tasteless.   It was cut about as thick as a piece of paper.  Thus, with it being so thin, there was no flavor left in it.  However, we did ask for a couple doggie bags and our dog liked it just fine.
name: Finnegan's Pub
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Restaurants, American (New), Bars, Irish

text: Best burritos in town. Cheap prices. You do get super full off one. Our fave. Place to eat for sure.
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text: Good food with friendly staff although the service can be decidedly spotty.  Weekend brunches can be crazy busy with wait times over an hour...at that point, head elsewhere as this place is good but not that good.  Afternoon tea is fun but sort of what afternoon tea would be like if designed by a foodie with only the vaguest concept of what a high tea is like.  The patio allows dogs and is pleasant albeit incredibly buggy.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
What's with all the hype...it wasn't very good. 

After all the good reviews and word of mouth, I was expecting alot more then what we experienced.

Decor. Very quaint and romantic.  But very small. There's about 7 tables with bar seating for about 8 people. 

Service-  very friendly and professional. I had heard that they did not take reservations, so we took a chance and was seated immediately. But I guess they changed there policy and they now take reservations. 

Food- Now this is were all the problems happened. 

Our first course was the fancy salad. It was just ok, nothing special. 

My wife had the short ribs. While the beef was nicely cooked and tender.  The sauce was overly sweet and tasted of fennel, which was not listed in the menu. 

My main dish was the duck breast with beans and sausage. The beans were a little under done and crunchy and the sausage was bland. The biggest problem was the duck  breast, it was completely over cooked. 

So it differently did not live up to the hype.
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text: LOVE the flavor of the meat. I always get 2 carne & pollo asada one flour, one corn each - gringo. They must lace the meats with something because you actually crave this place! The salsa bar is good as well as the refried beans and rice (red).  Sadly not a fan of the street corn - just tasted like salt the one time I tried it. I prefer this location over the 2nd one (Park Place Mall) even though the 2nd location is closer to me - though I just read the Park Place location has street fries! uh oh...
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Very nice room and great weekend package, $149 with a $75 resort credit and a $25 gas such a great deal for very nice place..
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: We got hooked on Chopstix when they had a location on Oracle Rd. and now if we want fantastic calamari we drive on over to Marana to eat at chopstix.  They calamari is our favorite but all the food we've had was delicious, the quality is consistent, good service, nice decor, and prices are appropriate to the food.  Highly recommended!
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: You know, there is nothing worse than going back to a place you like and finding out it just sucks, I mean hoover status! Wings use to be good. My recent visit I encountered flies all over the rear of building smelled like something died! I just grossed out even still, I decided to give them a chance. Wings were soggy tasted old not fresh. A bit of my heart has been lost I guess back to the chain wings.
name: Buffalo Bell
categories: Chicken Wings, Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text: This place is delish!  Boyfriend and I treat ourselves to a visit when we can get over there.  Increases our shopping trips to The Running Shop just so we can eat there.  Love, love, love their Morning Prep breakfast.  Being a big fan of goat cheese I had to try it and now can't not order it.  Oh yummy!  Last trip there our waitress (who are always very kind and prompt, great staff) suggested a side of The Cure French toast.  Holy mackerel...I was skeptical, but it was fabulous.  My overly full boyfriend just couldn't leave it alone and had to polish it off.  The flavors of the lemon poppy and blueberry meshed so well together.  Also can't do without their flavored mimosas with my meal and bf always opts for the bloody Mary.  Says best in Tucson...hands down.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: They took extra fees other than you gave in gratuity. Not honest! We waited an hour for food. Service is bad. Check your credit balance!
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: A cut-above breakfast/brunch venue, for sure. We had the Monte Cristo french toast and the A.M. Relleno entrees and both were very savory and well-prepared. Service was perfect, attentive but not intrusive. When the check was delayed due to a register glitch, the manager came over to apologize, a nice gesture. We'll return!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I stopped in here after a hair appointment to see what all the buzz was about. While walking into my hair appointment at 11am on a Thursday, I noticed how busy the outside seating was for the time and the day as well as how generally satisfied and happy the patrons were, so I felt completed to check it out for myself. 

By the time I got out of my appointment, most of the brunchers had left and I ordered the half Harvest Tuna sandwich on Italian for lunch and the cashier insisted I try the passion iced tea. I'd have to say that the combination of fresh tuna salad, tomato, cucumber, sprouts, avocado, red onion & lettuce made it the best Tuna Sandwhich I've ever had. The iced tea however, was not very good and left me wishing I hadn't taken the recommendation and ordered the black iced tea instead. 

Based on other reviews, I will have to come back for breakfast/brunch!
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: This place is an excellent source of all things good, tasty, and expensive! You want food to be a fine art? Come here. Great selection of anything you'd find at a regular store but even better quality. You might also find things you wouldn't find at most places. I always like to stop in here when I'm walking around La Encantada to browse the desserts and pastries. They also have an excellent kitchen and sushi bar. Their vegetable pizza is delicious even after it's been sitting under the hot lamp! I have yet to try anything at their sushi bar and have only had some baklava from here. Their baklava was a little too sweet for me but I still enjoyed it. This place is really just a temptation for my taste buds as well as my wallet! If you really want to splurge, they have an array of seafood dips ranging from lobster to crazy fish you wouldn't think belonged in a dip! They usually have some sitting out for you to taste, by all means taste. Taste all. Multiple times if no one is looking ;) Take a gander and you'll wish you hadn't!
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: A bit pricey for the quality and location but they do have great lunch specials, very inexpensive.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: I have only tried their steak tacos, so i can't  attest to the rest of the menu, but the tacos were AMAZING. I am for sure becoming a regular of this place.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Been to this nice restaurant a few times. Food has always been good. Nothing to rave about but nothing wrong with it either. My mother in law ordered some pancakes which were extremely sweet tasting and that was without any sort of jam or sweeter added to them. Maybe there is to much sugar or something in the batter? My only other critic would be the tiramisu dessert. The pastry was way to thick to the portion of chocolate ganach on top. I also expected there to be a nice cream inside which there wasn't. Probably wouldn't order that dessert again. Servers are nice and very attentive and place always appears to be clean and tidy.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: One of the friendliest restaurants!  Excellent grilled tilapia and I loved the green sauce for the enchiladas.  The Mojito was sooo good, too!  The refried beans were yummy.  Definitely give this place a try!
name: El Sur Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
Drooling thinking about this place right now...

I've been here twice and have ordered 2 different items. The first time I got the egg in a basket. I thought the flavors blended really well together and didn't feel like it was too heavy of a deal. The second time I went there I had the simple breakfast and OH MY GOD THOSE POTATOES. So damn good. I honestly would go there again just for that. Everything was cooked to perfection. The dock of a star would be for the bacon my boyfriend ordered. I was super flimsy and wasn't cooked very much. We like our bacon crispy and this fell pretty short.

Their coffee was also delicious! I could've easily had 2 cups but I wouldn't recommend that since it is highly caffeinated. Can't wait to come here again!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
YES!!! 

I have found DAMN good wings in Tucson!!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Never really was a fan of Whataburger until now.  Been about 6 times now always getting the Green Chili Burger and yes I must admit it can be inconsistent at times.  Overall it is a pretty big burger and helps my green chili burger fix, worth a try! Tip - Add Bacon!!!
name: Whataburger
categories: Restaurants, American (Traditional), Fast Food, Burgers

text: Came here twice before, and both times the food and service was great! I enjoy the Parmesan chicken, while others seem to enjoy the eggplant entrees. A word of advice, don't come right at dinner time, the place is popular and will have a long wait most nights at that time!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
Claim Jumper is huge. In fact, that's what it's famous for. The restaurant itself is huge, portions (are/were) huge, the booths are huge, and the price is also upper midrange.

I used to absolutely love Claim Jumper, but I'm going to talk about why I was disappointed during my recent visit. 

Part of the experience of Claim Jumper used to be the ambiance created by the mechanically driven belt fans throughout, the knickknacks on the walls, and the pretty authentic big western US / Colorado style perpetuated by the huge wooden beams, the rock fireplaces, and gigantic booths. The Tucson location, however, really lacks a lot of that character and instead does it halfway. It feels like a big restaurant that's too open, too noisy, and full of people who are there to engorge themselves with epic quantities of food.

I used to count on it for delivering very big portions, but during a recent visit I was disgusted to find out that the recession is apparently also hitting them hard. I ordered a cup of my favorite French Onion soup, and what came was barely 50% of the size of the cup even 2 months ago. I was taken aback that Claim Jumper would shoot its most prominent marketing point (insanely huge portions) point blank in the temple with such a decision. I haven't ordered the bowl size portion yet, but I fully expect that I'd get what used to pass for cup sized. 

The rest of the food is merely meh, burgers are superb and the salads are hearty sized, steaks are also better than average, but something about it doesn't leave me wowed. I used to get that from the French Onion, but now that it's obvious they're cutting back, I feel wrong about it.

Second to last time I came, I ordered the Chocolate Motherlode Cake on a whim since it's a very, very rare treat (due to its heart-stopping 3203 calories, and somehow 2616 grams of sodium), but they told me they were out! (! again !) Disappointed, I told the server that myself and the table guests would pass on desert (since we were all bummed at learning they were out of their signature cake). But the real icing on the situation was that 5 minutes later, as I waited for the check, another server walked right by our table with a slice of what was unquestionably Motherlode cake. What the heck, Claim Jumper? Thanks for that slap in the face.

To be honest, I don't know why I keep coming back. All the menu options take years off my anticipated lifespan (if you want to ruin your appetite, flip to the back of the drinks menu and realize that most menu options are 2 or 3 times the 2200 grams of salt recommended as safe by the FDA for healthy young adult males, the most of which is the Ham and Spinach Quiche with 6952 grams. I almost want to order it and see if I can feel the death course through my veins. Mmmz I might do it). But see what I mean? The whole draw of the place is how overwhelmingly huge and over-the-top most menu items are. I somehow keep coming back because it's the worst food possible for me, but... I like it. 

If they reduce any more dish portions like they have the French Onion soup, that special niche they've carved as being the quintessential American example of food to the excess will harden, stop working, and die, just like my coronary arteries.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Great sushi, had the boat special really excellent.  Lived in Japan and Korea 10+ years...this sushi is like being there.  Excellent service, quick, and accurate. Kitin Ichiban is superb.  Highly recommended.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: They have large selection deli meats, meat and fish counter,  deserts, juices,  and coffees available. Great variety of wines, cheeses, and a sushi cafe inside.  They have awesome lunch and dinner specials as well a nice shaded patio. Also outstanding floral department with every variety of fresh flowers.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text:
After over 15 years of coming here, it is still my favorite place for breakfast.  The food is clean, fresh and deliciously amazing.  And you can tell that the owner really does care about the reviews because the service alone has improved 150%!  The staff is super positive and friendly.  This is just a wonderful restaurant with authentically french food and a great atmosphere.

And I just wanted to comment on a review left by another Yelper.... I have heard the ad on the radio and I did not find it offensive at all.  If you take a look at her staff, it is extremely ethnically diverse and its clear she cares for each and every person on her staff.  She's obviously not racist and if you take a look at all she has done in the Tucson community, you can see that she has a big heart.

(As for the "me so hungry" thing, it's actually from a song from 1990 by 2 Live Crew called "Me So Horny."   It's part of the chorus and clearly the ad was just playing on the song.)
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Simple and inexpensive. Their hours are...well, the same as an east village trance record shop, but it's a great place for a nice breakfast without having to hit the atm.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: Yummy... But the cinnamon rolls are my favorite!!! Give it a try... Sometimes it takes a while to get a table!
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
My partner and I visited Village Bakehouse with the intention to study. We arrived, and while the outdoor seating is spacious, it was chilly out, so we elected to sit inside. The inside was very crowded and cramped. We found an open table against the wall and put our things down before perusing the beautiful pastries. 

I got an almond croissant and a coffee and my partner got an egg and cheese croissant and a coffee as well. The food and coffee were very good. Be careful, though, because the coffee seemed very hot. There were so many delicious looking pastries to choose from that I will definitely go back to try. 

In the end, we didn't end up studying there. We ate and left. It wasn't really a studying kind of place.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
Was able to grab a bite with some coworkers on opening day! 

They gave free samples for their vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry milkshakes: in my opinion, vanilla was best. The chocolate was reminiscent of a Wendy's Frosty, and the strawberry just didn't taste as good as the vanilla. 

Anyways, one of my coworkers is from Albuquerque, NM (where Lotaburger originated) and he recommended getting the green chili and cheese with the burger of your choice. I ordered a Kid's Burger (comes with just bun, patty, ketchup, mustard, and pickles) with the green chili and cheese. 

Being opening day, there were a TON of people there to get their fast food on. A couple of my coworker's and I's orders ended up getting lost, but the staff was very polite and remade it. That being said, we did not check the orders before heading back to  the office and, lo and behold, the green chilis and cheese were missing from all of our orders. Sad. Day. We ended up calling Lotaburger to let them know, and they graciously offered to comp our next meal :)

All in all, it seems like a great place with great food and great staff-- I'm excited to go back to FINALLY enjoy a burger with green chilis and cheese!
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text:
The only reason I'm giving this joint two stars is the wait. I stopped on my way to work, as I had quite a bit of time to kill before I had to be in; I'd heard great things about the breakfast burros, so I thought I'd give it a try. 

10am on a weekday, I figured it wouldn't be too bad. I was wrong. 45 minutes from ordering to actually getting my burro to go. 

The burro was great. It wasn't what I ordered, but it was tasty. The chorizo is really quite good, and the beans were excellent. It's just a good thing I like chorizo and beans. The salsa was also homemade and had a nice, slight bite.

The tres leches cake that they were cutting up and packaging in the back made me wish I had ordered that.

I'll probably give them another try, on a day when I don't have to be somewhere, even if I do have an hour to kill.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: We were in town for the USC - UofA game and at the recommendation of my daughter (a student at UofA) we had breakfast (brunch) at Prep and Pastry.  Wow, what a great place.  Very eclectic menu with great choices.  I have not seen a menu like this before.  And the drink menu was equally eclectic with mimosas, wines, beers, and their Bloody Mary was awesome.  I had "The Beni" which was like an Eggs Benedict however it was prepared with pork belly and asparagus with a very tasty hollandaise sauc.  My daughter had a similar dish with smoked salmon.   This is a must go if you need a morning meal when in Tucson
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We came here on our way to El Paso from San Diego and boy are we glad we did! Such good food and very reasonably priced. We shared a corn bread waffle and huevos alysia. Both very delicious, with well balanced flavors and perfect proportions. Definitely worth stopping at!!!
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
This place, is one for the books. I was pretty nervous that it wouldn't live up to the hype, but let me assure you, it was amazing!

I had one steak taco and one veggie taco, both with rice and guacamole... I'm pretty sure part of my soul left my body. It was so good I considered going back with a friend for lunch the next day!

One of the people I was with had nachos, and got to pick exactly what he wanted on there (what kind of beans and meat and different toppings)

The other one had a quesadilla, which was also very good.

You get free chips and salsa!
Plus you don't have to pay extra for guacamole

The prices are good and the food is to die for!!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: My wife and I were downtown for a show last night and stopped in for dinner at Charro Steak. All natural, local beef was the draw- "from ranch to table". We were on the early side so got in right away. Told the server we were trying to make a show and she did a great job. We ordered the Carne Asada and tableside guacamole. The server got our order right in and it came out quick and she was making our guac right there. Usually Carne Asada is a cheaper, tougher cut but this was like butter! With fresh tortillas and homemade salsa it was awesome!  We were there as a date but there were families, groups of friends and singletons as well. They have patio seating but it was a bit chilly so we ate inside. They prolly want to consider patio heaters. I didn't see any unless i missed them.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
Super Gyros and More was one of my absolute favorite restaurants, so I'm really sad to see it close down. I guess Tucson doesn't know a good thing when it sees it. I read on their facebook page that they might be able to offer catering still, and I heartily recommend you do just that.

Thanks for introducing me to Gyros, Super Gyros and More!
name: Super Gyros & More
categories: Greek, Restaurants, American (New), Hot Dogs

text: Great Buffet for only $8.99! Better yet, the owner and staff. Personable, helpful, happy. Some of the best service we have had in years! Like a visit to grandma's Will be back!!!!!
name: Kettle Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
My husband and I have only gone in early morning for pastries! Every time we go in we leave happy! Be ready to stand in line in the mornings on weekends because everyone is wanting in right at they open! Can you understand why? Ahah!  

     All though the pastries are a little on the expensive side we only go to this restaurant on occasion. I wish we could go more but our guts will get wider and our wallets will get smaller! Every pastry is made with love! They all taste delicious! I can say this because I have in fact tried every single one of them! There is no getting tired of. Or sick of the food in this place. It's fresh! It's a great environment! The employees are friendly and helpful! They are all willing to answer open-ended questions about their pastries! 

   Anyone who hasn't tried this restaurant is definitely missing out!   Hurry and go in today while they are still open!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I ordered the duck; my husband ordered the chicken.  Although we were warned it would be a 20 minutes wait for the food, it actually came right away.  Although the flavor was good, it was not hot.  We told the waiter, but he didn't seem to care.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text:
This place is amazing!  I've been numerous times, and it never disappoints!  EVER!  In fact, it gets better and better every time.  The staff is courteous and the service is perfect. The food is delicious and the bottle service mimosas with juices are my favorite! 

We had the poppyseed french toast with blueberries...ummm just go ahead and do yourself and your friends a favor and order this for the table to start. 

I had the simple breakfast with bacon. I like basic. ;). The eggs are fresh and delicious and always hot.  The bacon is thick and crispy and really a nice addition to any of the breakfast options. I love the homemade jam with the wheat toast too!  The other people with me had the pork belly breakfast sandwich and the biscuits and gravy. The pork belly is really like the Cadillacs of bacon, so you can't go wrong there. The biscuits are fluffy and the gravy is as "down home" as it gets.  Honestly, you could not go wrong with ANY of the items on the menu.  And make sure you get some of the amazing pastries they have too (thin mint cronuts). 

Just don't forget to add some mimosas or bloody Mary's to your breakfast, it's really one of the best parts of brunch!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: If I could give zero I would. Gross, rude and awful! Table across from us found hair in soup and waiter laughed. Food came out cold. No sweet and sour sauce made for appetizer. Lo mein noodles drenched in teriyaki sauce and crunchy. Spoke to owner who just smiled and nodded. Should be closed down!
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Came back here during a trip this Christmas and so glad it was open,  definitely left happy.  My sons loves their bread and I enjoy the tacos.  Wasn't able to come during their specials but they do taco Wednesdays. always friendly staff and I believe they take apple pay now.
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: Let me just say, "AAAAMAAAZING" service was on fleek and the food was on point! Mimosas were the bomb diggity!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
(~)
- cobb salad

Had a typical not great not bad experience here. The cobb salad was ok, huge portions, tried to switch something out for corn and wasn't able to do that, lamee. It also came with a half piece of bread that had a layer of cheese on top, could have done without the cheese.

Getting sick of chain places especially since that's mostly all there is around this area.....Average Average Average
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text:
El Merendero got it's start as an A&W Restaurant in 1965, but today, it's one of the best Mexican restaurants on South 12th Avenue.  I had dinner here with the family and two of my son's friends tonight. If you happen to be in the area, El Merendero is definitely worth a visit. I had the Chile Rellenos, and they were some of the best I've ever had! Very spicy & delicious, and for $7.99- hard to beat. They come with rice and beans, and a small side of chopped lettuce. As an appetizer, we shared an order of guacamole for the table. It came with chips and a small side of pico de gallo for $4.99. Sort of pricey for a small side of guacamole, but none of us were disappointed, as the chips and salsa were free. 

The other members of our party either had rolled tacos, hard shell tacos, or soft shell tacos. You can't go wrong with any of these choices. This place is clean, casual, friendly, and overall reasonably priced. They also have numerous seafood options on the menu, including Mexican fish and shrimp cocktails, even oysters- though none of us was feeling quite so adventurous as to try one of the seafood cocktails or dishes. 

As I said, if you're in the area- this place is definitely worth trying... Be aware that for parties of 6 or more, they do add on the tip. Our check, with tax and (added on) gratuity came to $85 for a party of 6. We each had a beverage ($2.25 for horchata and $1.99 for soft drinks), and no one had dessert.  Overall, the food is very good, but in my opinion- prices are a tad high for the location. This was a totally enjoyable casual dining experience- one worth putting on your Tucson Mexican food to try list.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: best brunch place in town. would recommend to anyone visiting. they tend to get busy around noon so try to avoid going then
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Same rating but the place is way more comfy and now they have BEER....I don't mean Bud and Miller Lite. Real Good craft beers! Local stuff too. Go local in more ways than you thought.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
WOW! I am going to be very honest with my review. I had no idea what to expect from Native American cuisine, but the chef has done an outstanding job in creating an influence of Native American cuisine. Let me give you an example, we had the burger which is made with a bread traditional to the local Native American tribes. The meat has a hint of chorizo which makes it even better. 
We also had a trio of tacos that were actually made with fried bread and topped with three different toppings including calabacitas and carne con chile.
Sit close to the windows because they open them and give a great ambiance!
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text: Our first time dinning here was unfortunately our last time dinning here. The food looked good, smelled fresh and hot. Our order was accurately made. The taste just was not there. Our food was bland. The fried rice barely had any soy sauce brown color to it. No onions, carrots, peas or no egg were missing from the fried rice and it hardly looked different from the steamed white rice. The Orange chicken looked the way it was supposed to, but again didn't have any flavor of Orange chicken.  The Beef & broccoli was missing flavor and taste as well. From our experience, we are unable to recommend this restaraunt.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: I love La Bella China! The food is great! The service is exceptional; they are courteous and helpful... and the menu is affordable. Go to LA BELLA!
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
We took our family here for breakfast the other day and I thought I'd come back ad update our last review of Ghini's. I was shocked to discover that I never actually reviewed the place. What a shame. 

Ghini's is our second favorite breakfast spot in Tucson, but it is a VERY close second. 

We've tried a lot of the items, but if you've never been here before, you have to get the Eggs Provencale. As others have said, it is their signature dish and it is fantastic. 

All the baked goods are very tasty as well. 

If you are looking for a real treat, try the strawberry shortcake. I haven't seen it on the menu, but they brought us some when we were having a birthday breakfast there. Yum!
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: I had 3 carnitas tacos and they were very good, I have to say they were very generous with the meat portion so THANK YOU. The salsa very delicious and the watermelon-cucumber water was AMAZING. Now, I do have to agree that it was pricey for "street tacos" because I can go somewhere less expensive BUT, like I said before, they were generous with the meat. I'd honestly like the see the prices go down .50 cents. That may make a difference or not, but I'd still feel better about buying lots of tacos.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Never again.  This place is so poorly managed that we will never return.

We decided to try them out tonight.  They've been open a couple weeks, so they've had plenty of time to get things in order.  How hard can fast food be?  Apparantly very.  We waited over 30 minutes for our food and when it finally arrived, our order was wrong.  My husband then had to wait another 10 minutes for his sandwich.  The woman at the table next to us waited even longer and her entire order was screwed up.  Some people were waiting up to 45 minutes for FAST food.

As far as the food, it was ok but nothing special.   They have one soda fountain with one button to select your drink, so there was always a line to get a drink and it came out so foamy, it only filled half your cup and you had to wait a while to fill it the rest of the way.  I selected a vanilla diet soda and it tasted awful.  Soda shouldn't be bitter.  My husband had a regular diet soda which was also awful.  

The parking lot is a whole other problem.  There is no way to back out of several of the spaces when there are cars in the drive thru so we had to wait several minutes just to get out because of course, with the wait times, the line wasn't moving.  The parking lot is a feat in really bad engineering.  

Great job overall-said no ever of this Blake's location.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Went to Caruso's last night with my boyfriend. He was visiting from Denver and it was his last night here. We literally didn't speak for the entire meal because we were enjoying our food so much. From the garlic bread to the spaghetti sauce we were extremely impressed. I was torn between a few dishes and my server encouraged me to choose the eggplant parmesan. It was so much better than I would have ever expected. It wasn't breaded like a cheap Italian restaurant would give you. Overall I'd say you should check this place out. The staff is very friendly and intuitive. We never had to ask for a refill with our drinks but at the same time my server didn't continuously ask us if we needed anything. So, great experience. Did I mention that I'm writing this as I polish off my leftovers? :) Oh and after you stuff yourself silly go for a walk around the block. There are a lot of fun and interesting shops to see in the area. Some pretty cool graffiti too.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: I don't make it up here too often (its a bit out of my way for average grocery shopping).  That said if I want to do something  special, their butcher block always has great ready to cook meats that will knock your socks off.  Last night we had the "Mexican -Style Stuffed Chicken"  After 35  minutes we were eating a wonderful blend of chicken, chile and cheese with just the perfect amount of spice.  While looking for a nice wine to accompany it, their wine stewards were able to get me set up with a great, not too expensive bottle.  Thanks guys!  Dinner was great!
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text:
Food was awesome 
Service was great
BUT THE NOISE made it impossible to hold a conversation:( The place is too popular and too small to handle the loud noise. We ate and left and if there's a better time when it's quiet we'll try again.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This place barely gets a 2 star.  Came here the other night with my wife for dinner.   We were seated and looking around I noticed 2 large parties but a lot of staff so I was not too worried.  We waited a few min for our drink order.  The menu looked good.  We both ordered a filet one medium the other medium well.  Meals come with beans and tortillas we also ordered the fries and slaw as a side. I'll say there was only a few reasons they got even a 2 star from me.  The slaw was amazing and the fries were pretty good too. And the actual cuts of meat were good. Now to the bad. Plates brought to our table missing the beans then we cut into our steaks mine was barely medium on the verge of medium rare. My wife's medium well came out medium rare at best honestly closer to rare.  I finally got our waitress attention and told her about the cooks on the steak and the beans that were missing from both plates. She took my wife's steak that she was now giving to me since it was so underdone back for more cooking. She brought back 1 order of beans and said they would be out shortly with the steak. A few min later one of the chefs dropped the plate in my lap and said you want to check to see if this is better I glanced at it already a little and noded and said yes. My plate came back missing the tortilla and the steak was medium rare still. To say I was disappointed is a understatement.  For a place that prides itself in being a steakhouse I'm sad to see they can not even cook a steak propery.  I refuse to send food back twice in my opinion if you can't get it right first 2 times how can I think you will on the third time.  Sad thing was they had every other table in the joint full and watching everyone else you could tell that the 2 large parties were getting the better service. Our waitress was pleasant and nice however her service was par at best.  All in all this place is a disappointment in my book. Sad since I have always liked the El Charro name until now.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: I was looking for some gluten free Thai or Chinese food in Tucson and Chopstix came through! First of all, the location is an unassuming store-front in a strip mall with several other restaurants. Inside, the decor is zen and open with plenty of seating. We came on a Friday night and it wasn't too busy which is surprising for how good the food and service ended up being. Chopstix offers a nice selection of gluten free appetizers and main courses. I chose the chicken lettuce wraps and curry noodles with chicken. To say the portions were generous is an understatement -- I could have eaten the lettuce wraps alone and been satisfied. Needless to say there were leftovers. My dining companion had the pot stickers and Thai Basil special with chicken which he thoroughly enjoyed. Service was friendly and prompt and I felt like we got a ton of food for our money. I would highly recommend Chopstix for anyone who has gluten free needs or not.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: The beer garden behind Reilly's is like its own entity. You can get to it via a side entrance, so you don't have to walk through the restaurant. First thing you notice is the green and the cornhole they have set up. It has a lively ambiance, good for small groups and big. Great beer selection. A good hangout spot when meeting people downtown.
name: Beer Garden At Reilly Craft Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Beer Gardens

text: Best Ramen place in Tucson.  They are a small restaurant still as they are new, so logistics of their lines (waiting outside) and seating are still being worked out.  May be a bit of an issue during Tucson summers...however, the wait is worth it.  They do a great job with generous portions.  Staff are friendly and attentive
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
We came here a few weeks ago for the Chris Young concert. I've been hesitant to post my review as we were at a concert but have decided to do so as it was a staff member the ruined the experience for us.

I've never been here and brought my 76 year old mother who has a walker and Stage 3 Cancer to make a memory for us.

We were having slow progress to navigate the crowded, even though we were in the front of the line (almost behind the entry gates). For the most part people were nice. 

I ended up needing to get some help and approached a woman in a maroon vest as I assumed she worked for the casino rather than someone in a red shirt that said "Event Staff." The first thing I noticed was the roll of the eyes when she saw my mom. 

The girl had a lanyard on, but the lanyard was conveniently turned over and you couldn't see her name. After talking with her for about 5 minutes, I asked her name. She refused to tell me stating I didn't need her name. I can't even begin to describe the frustration with this rude woman.

I finally just gave up trying to get her to help me because she flat out turned around and walked three steps away from me to avoid speaking to me any longer. 

Once I had my mom settled, I went to purchase a bottle of water. It was about 20 minutes later. I saw the same employee (again with her lanyard turned over) being difficult to another guest. If I'd have seen her lanyard or gotten her name I'd have made a formal complaint about this woman. Obviously, there's a reason she wears her lanyard turned over.

Horrible employee and extremely disrespectful of an elderly, terminal person with a walker.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text:
Daily specials make Manna from Heaven Indian Fry Bread special every day. Tuesday $1 tacos, Wednesday $5.50 Indian taco with ground beef and a canned drink, Thursday $1 bean tostadas, Friday $1 Taco Dorado (Soo full of flavor!) and best of all... Saturday $1.50 sweet fry bread (with cinnamon/sugar, powdered sugar, or honey). 

Super friendly, super fast, super delicious.
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: I am extremely passionate about getting ramen at this spot! I am a huge ramen fan and this is one of the better options you'll find in Tucson for ramen! It's absolutely delicious and service is extremely quick when you get inside. I would recommend getting to the resteraunt early versus closer to close, I heard they close early especially when they first started due to running out of ramen. (I haven't heard of that happening recently). Totally would suggest especially if you have never had ramen before!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Very good and friendly service, loved the view of the  mountains we will definitely be coming back for more.....french toast was soooooo good
name: Brawley's Restaurant
categories: Food, Do-It-Yourself Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

text:
Let me start off with the service was 5 star quality since walking into the place. Really friendly staff. They are on top of your needs without being to aggressive. I ordered a $22.00 special and it comes with a free Margarita and since I don't drink and declined  my server said he would give me dessert in its place.

Tried Mole enchiladas for the first time and it was pretty good, thick acquired taste.

Chili relleno was huge and stuffed with delicious melted cheese. 

This place is a must Visit when traveling through Tucson. Everything was fresh down to the chips and salsa..
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
Among the bet breakfast and brunch locations in Tucson. Food sometimes takes a bit of time to come out but it is WELL worth the wait. Their food is really good and so so clean.

They have a great selection of their in-house baked goods that change occasionally.

The staff is really kind, helpful, and very patient. I've been here numerous times and will continue to come back.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great local breakfast/brunch eatery. Their menu is always fresh with new entrees and the staff is always accommodating
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Their house bloody marys weren't as good as expected, the ones at the cup on Congress are better. took half hour for the food and 45 minutes for the check. And it was a Thursday morning. Most of the food was bland. My friend got the duck, and I got the dish with eggs and chile. Maybe I have to try something else to understand why this place is all the rage. It's more for older people.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Delivery! The food has always arrived hot and as ordered. The portions are large and we can feed four with two entrees, rice, and crab puffs. The flavors were good without being overly sweet or salty. We love the Moo Shu (chicken or pork), cashew chicken, fried rice, pork egg rolls, and crab puffs.
We have only just found this place but I'm sure everything is delicious.
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: This place is awesome! Get the burritos, more bang for ur buck. The guac was really good, but u don't get very much for the price....Definitely get a churro though...BEST I've ever had!!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I arrived with three kids and was seated promptly, service was quick and friendly, food was amazing-drinks even better.  Kid friendly menu.  Def wish there was one closer to Oro Valley!  Loved it and reminded me of the types of places back home in Chicago.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Panera is something that I grew up with on the East Coast, and I loved the sandwiches and soups there when I was younger.  Nostalgia all the way.

However, having a more adult palate and just changing tastebuds, Panera is, in the world of sandwiches, just a-ok.  For the same amount of money you can buy a fresh, bigger sandwich at Baggins.  I do like that they have the you pick two combo - nowadays I typically get a salad and soup and my husband will get a sandwich and chips.  He will finish off about half my salad as I prefer to load up on the soup :)

I do enjoy their pastries, especially their cookies (peanut butter chocolate chip and snickerdoodle for the win!) 

This location is easy to get to, and the times I have been inside, clean.  I tend to go on off hours though so I would not come back if it was filthy during the slow times.

You always know exactly what you are going to receive at Panera, which is not necessarily a bad thing.  Their sandwiches and salads can be hidden calorie bombs if you are not careful!
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: I read the reviews here as our 9 year old son was craving Chinese food. This was the best General Tso's Chicken I've ever had. Both my sons loved the sweet and sour chicken, my wife her Lo Mein. Tasty egg rolls and fried wonton, everything was delicious and our service was first rate!
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text:
To be clear, I'm a huge fan of paradise bakery. I wrote a review of paradise for a different location where I was practically singing their praises. 

In fact, I'm now IN the Oracle location writing this review while savoring their delicious chicken noodle soup and really regretting not buying a chocolate chip cookie.

So why, you ask, the four star review. Well, it has nothing to do with their food and everything to do with the fact that it says Paradise Bakery on the outside but apparently is not, in fact, a Paradise Bakery. At least that's what I've come to understand from the cashier that would not take my Paradise Loyalty card. 

For all of you that may not know it, Panera Bread Company bought 51% of the outstanding stock in Paradise Bakery & Café Inc. in 2006. Panera really hadn't made any changes to Paradise Bakery until 2011. Since about May they've been making changes to the food, which I haven't really minded but this loyalty card thing really irked me.

I was at the other Paradise Bakery in Tucson just yesterday and they took my loyalty card then, so I know it's not a change in policy. It's just this location (that was opened under panera bread co.) that won't take it.

Why post the Paradise Bakery sign outside if it's really just Panera. Since there's another location equidistant from my apartment that take the Paradise Bakery loyalty card, I will not be returning to this one.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text:
Food was okay, expected more for all the hype and popularity. Burger wasn't any better than Whataburger. For the price, I'll keep going to In and Out, better burger, better price, and no waiting. Sunday afternoon we were going to stop again (already been here earlier in the week), the drive thru line wasn't out on Speedway, so thought it might be a short wait. We pulled in, only two cars in front of us. Still, ended up waiting almost 15 minutes for the two cars to go, so we finally placed our order, at 1:53pm. It took from 1:53pm until 2:16pm to get to the drive thru window to pay. Once we paid, we waited at the window for another 15 minutes! I finally got somebody's attention and asked why, after 45 minutes, they still didn't have a BBQ sandwich and a bowl of chili ready! That's all we ordered. He apologized and went to check. Came back 5 minutes later with a lukewarm BBQ sandwich (couldn't taste the BBQ), and a warm bowl of chili. No spoon, no napkins. Obviously the food was prepared when we ordered it 45 minutes prior. What's worse is that once we got our food, we still couldn't leave because there were two cars between us and Speedway still waiting for their food! The guy inside finally came out and asked them to move over to the parking lot so we could leave. We spent more than ONE HOUR in the drive thru. Believe me, the food was definitely not worth that kind of wait. If I knew I'd be spending an hour in the drive thru, I would have opted to go dine at Olive Garden. When looking inside, there were several employees walking around and talking to each other. None of which showed ANY sense of urgency. They need to seriously re-think how they want to operate their drive thru operation, not to mention the parking lot. They should reroute the drive thru so that it does NOT go out to Speedway. Makes it very difficult for people who want to park and go inside. 
Our visit earlier in the week went slightly better, still spent way too much time in the drive thru, although the BBQ sandwich tasted much better and was hot on our first visit, and had the right amount of BBQ sauce. 
After our last visit, I doubt we'll be back anytime soon. Hopefully they can figure out how to run a drive thru, and maybe establish an escape route so you're not stuck behind other cars waiting for their food. Very, very frustrating. There is no food that is worth that kind of waiting, and the food here is not even that good. Don't waste your time. Go someplace where you can get your food while it's still hot... like In and Out. I have better things to do with my time than sit in their drive thru.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text:
First of all, I'm the type of guy that will only give 5 stars when I have a dining experience that absolutely blows me away. 4 stars would be considered top notch. I"m giving 3 stars because the food was very good, but our server was terrible and really was the reason my experience was filled with frustration. 

I really like how this is a strip mall joint.  Good ones are usually 'hidden secrets'. Nothing ruins a good restaurant quicker than popularity.  I know it's counter intuitive, but as Yogi Berra said "nobody goes there anymore, it's too crowded".  Well, we arrived at 7 on a Wednesday night and the place was packed.  We were, ehem, pointed towards a table (I would say 'seated', but the employees were too busy to actually greet us and show us to the table) after about 15 minutes.  

I really love the atmosphere.  I'd call it "Traditional Indian kitsch" with its Taj Majal architectural flourishes and the paint-by-number Indian artwork.  The last time we dined there, which was a few years ago, I loved how it seemed to be run by an Indian family with the grade-school kids sitting quietly doing their homework, and a turban wearing grandfather manning the door.  This time, however, it seemed like the crew from Los Betos took over, and our particular waitress had no clue how to provide table service.  We were not greeted once we sat down.  Several minutes later a charmless lady approached us and asked if we were ready to order.  After going around the table taking our entrees, I had to point out that we would also like  to order some drinks.  The food came out pretty quickly, and then the beers, and I had to ask twice for the white rice that was supposed to accompany our dishes.  Not surprised that she messed up our order, but in a way that worked out to our advantage. She brought a random extra dish that we didn't order, but was delightful nonetheless.  We were not checked on again until about 10 minutes after we were all finished, with napkins on our plates.  

When you go out to eat it's not all about the food.  You are paying for the experience and bad service can be like a little too much salt in the curry.  In this case, again, the flavors were great, but the service left me frustrated.  She was lucky to get 15%.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
We have visited Ghini's the last 2 times we were in Tucson, both times for brunch and have thoroughly enjoyed it. This trip we had crepes, cheddar biscuits with gravy, and an I'm hungry platter.  All of us shared our dishes and everything was absolutely delicious.  

On a previous trip I had mimosas and remember them being excellent. We stuck to water and coffee this visit and the staff were awesome about keeping drinks full. 

The only thing I wish Ghini's did was offer a pastry menu along with brunch for appetizers or dessert given the attached bakery. We ended up getting a pastry to go and then eating them in the car.  The chocolate almond torte was amazing.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Delightful for lunch on Tuesdays through Fridays or for dinner (closed on Mondays), this is an authentic feeling French bistro/restaurant in a charming remodelled house near Fort Lowell and Alvernon. The restaurant specializes in fresh great food and in looking after the customers willing to pay a bit more for the pleasure of outstanding service and excellent food. Over the past several decades Le Rendezvous has been a consistently satisfying place for my guests and me to enjoy 5-star meals with close attention paid to both preparation and presentation. Today I thoroughly enjoyed a bouillabaisse lunch and the only special request I voiced to my friendly server, Vanessa, was for an extra bowl for the deposit of the empty clam shells. (I ate the clams faster than I could find room to pile the empty shells on my bread plate.) And believe me I had to really think hard to find anything to suggest as an improvement! I've never been disappointed in a meal here after at least twenty visits dating back to the early 1980s when the beloved Jean-Claude Berger was owner, chef and host. Of special note is the very special Grand Marnier soufflé dessert which should be ordered at the beginning of your meal due to preparation time. My mouth actually watered as I typed that last sentence.......yum! Few restaurants that I've encountered here in Tucson can match the track record of this fine food establishment.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text:
I liken my experience at Mother Hubbard's to being on Hawaii; good, but expect to wait. Don't expect that a party more than 4 will be seated within an hour. 
We arrived 30 minutes before the rest of our party and we waited at least an hour. We had to check our aloha spirit, for sure. 
The beau was pleased with his vermillion gravy and sage biscuits. I was ok with my Huevos Elysia...however there was no soy chorizo substitution or regular Cheerwine available. Maybe due to our visit late on Sunday....
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: One of my favorite places to get take out! The portions are always very good size and you don't have to sacrifice the quality and the taste of the food, to have it at home:)
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: As usual with Yelp I don't understand some of the reviews. This was our first time in after years of talking about going and we were very happy we went sad it took us so long. Monday night at about 5 pm door was opened as we approached we were told to sit wherever we liked it was almost empty not usually a good sign but started to fill up pretty quick. Water and bread (fabulous focacia) were brought emediatly and our wonderful waiter Max took drink orders right after that he and helpers kept filled throughout the meal and quietly checked on us often. He also took time to answer all or questions and make suggestions about choices and sizes like full size salad and entree might be to much advised house or Cesar Salad or maybe soup.  Shrimp Scampi appetizer was wonderful 5 or 6 very large shrimp in a to die for sauce, I saved it to dip bread in which were refilled often and without request they also have olive oil and fresh pepper grinder on tables a great touch for bread dipping. also had the famous Scordado Stuffed Mushrooms also very good. Tried both soups excellent and a Ceasars Salad great. Main courses of Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken, Baked Meatballs and Farfalle and Penne with Sausage were all perfect. Comments about pasta being under done are from people who eat spaghetti from a can, they were all done perfectly al dente, to the bite, I'm sure if you like soft mushy they would do it on request. Prices moderate a little high as I feel for all Italian Restaurants but the portions were huge, even I brought half home I almost always clean my plate. Deserts good and shareable too. Why not five stars?  Nobody in Tucson has 3 Michelin Stars yet.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: I will give them a second try. They had a problem with equipment and could not get me what I ordered.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: Hanging out with friends this morning at this fine eating establishment. Having the Silver Dollar Pancakes with sausage and eggs..
name: Old Times Kafe
categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Diners, American (Traditional)

text:
Awesome and friendly staff. Quality of food is always great! Atmosphere was pleasant and always seems to be busy- in a good way! If it were empty I'd feel weird. Tried the takeout option a while back, and I must say it was a little expensive once I piled my plate up BUT it was totally worth it being able to eat delicious buffet food on my couch while watching my favorite shows! 
We never leave here disappointed or anywhere near hungry.
name: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill
categories: Buffets, Restaurants, American (New), American (Traditional)

text: Food is great here but the service is way too slow. We waited at the counter for 7 min before being waited on. Then another 20 or so min to get our food and it was only a couple of burritos. They need faster service.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
Solid brunch place in Tucson. 

Let me preface this review by disclosing that my usual stomping grounds are Los Angeles and Scottsdale, the brunch capitals of the West.  And call me, #basic but I love brunch more than most things.  My friends and I came here because Prep and Pastry was way too crowded (1 hr wait, no thank you!) and Ghini's had none.  The interior is cute and French-themed with painted trellises, stained glass art, and artfully placed wine bottles, which would please any Francophile.

I ordered the carafe of Bloody Mary, which I really enjoyed!  We got it Nola style so it was spicy, and the alcohol content was on point.  For my entree I got the spinach, ham and swiss crepe.  Not mind blowing but definitely not bad. I had some of my friend's croque madame. also not bad.  The stand out of this meal was definitely the bloody mary.

They were more than happy to accommodate for all the outside requests we had.  One of my friends is notoriously picky and always customizes her order.  the servers at Ghini's took it in stride.

The best part of this cafe is that you can split the check really really easily!  I wish the brunch spots in LA would adopt this policy.  Added on a whole star for the ease of this payment scheme.  You just go to the front, tell the cashier what you ordered and you pay for it. 

There is also a bakery appended to the other side of the cafe.  They sell macarons, cookies, huge pull apart cinnamon rolls, and tarts.  The cookie I got was ok.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Oh lord, yes. Great joint for a taco and a beer. What else do you need? Nice tacos for the money. Sign me up.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Casual and upbeat atmosphere with a Contemporary country design. Staff and service was excellent. Very attentive yet welcoming and non-intrusive. We ordered chicken and toast, pork belly beni, green eggs and ham, truffles mushroom soup, and a vanilla mint Doughssant. The pork belly and the soup are both great. Every dish, although not spectacular has its own unique taste or texture that distinguishes it from other restaurants. Highly recommended. TB
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great omelette and cinnamon rolls. Very friendly service. Able to eat outside on a cool day. Lots of good bakery goodies.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Very surprised at amounts of food and great prices ! KIDS loved it! Very kid friendly! Most plates were 8-12 dollars. Appetizers were around 4-7 dollars. Next time am in town I will be back . If you By the Airport in Tucson , you should stop by.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: This "cafeteria" feeling restaurant was a nice surprise.  They pride themselves on serving Native American cuisine.  The food was tasty.  I'd go back but I wouldn't recommend it to someone coming to Tucson.  There are several other better tasting restaurants to go to.  However, if you want a change of pace...this would be a great place to go to to.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
This place is popping as the kids say. I got the chickpea scramble and was very pleased. Sweet decor and atmosphere 10/10 would recommend.

-your neighborhood yelp mom
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Really great food and free chips and salsa. Chipotle business model but food tastes much different and is very delicious.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Saw the great reviews on Yelp, so decided to check this out while in town.  Found the lemon pepper on the lemon pepper wings didn't stick to the wings because there was no butter or other sauce to make it hang on, so they didn't have much flavor. The medium buffalo wings were dry, so they weren't as flavorful as they should have been.  Bacon cheese fries were pretty good. Excellent service and friendly staff.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: The first time I was here...I got hooked on the bacon doughcent and returned within 48 hours for another dose. My only compliant is that it is a tad pricey for someone who is now a full on addict to their menu. I especially love the "recovery" bloody Mary, the chai tea on mornings I was a good girl the night before and when I've been really bad - well they are super about splitting a dish - very friendly and courteous staff.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Overall I really enjoyed my meal. My ribeye was cooked to correct temp and with the cheese and veggies on top (forget what they call it) was yummy. The Brussels sprouts were so good!  One thing my friend and I decided though was that we should have split one instead of getting one each. Towards the end of the meal we realized that our waitress never brought our tortillas. Neither of us are eating a lot of carbs so in the end it was ok.  Finally we picked this restaurant as it had two dollar signs signifying it was moderately priced. You may want to add a couple. I'll go back!
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Stopped in to try something new in the area, we hit happy hour so prices on beer and appetizers were discounted. The waitress was nice offered a sample of beer if we wanted to try. Went with the pretzels for an appetizer and they were fresh and hot served with a cheese sauce that had some spicy heat. We all enjoyed our meal i had the bucket boy and it eas great. Brother had the mushroom swiss burger and enjoyed it. Dad had the meatball platter and really liked it just enough sauce. Mom wanted the turkey sandwich but we were told they were out of turkey so she had the chicken and kale sandwich and enjoyed her meal. You get enough fries with your meal and they were seasoned amd crispy. All in all a nice place for the area, we plan to visit again soon.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text:
We had spicy miso ramen and spicy tonkotsu ramen. Both were equally spicy. The spicy miso noodles were thicker than spicy tonkotsu noodles, which looked like thin sphagetti noodles. Unfortunately, they were not quite the type of noodles I like in my ramen. Other than a few slices of pork, half an egg (semi-hard boiled), and some corn, there really isnt much else in the bowls of noodles. Pretty plain for the price. Personally, I think their prices are too high. Overall, the ramen didn't impress me. 

We also ordered octupus balls and they were ok. Nothing spectacular.

I must add their parking is not suitable for big vehicles like a toyota sequoia. Parking lot is very cram and not enough space. We ended parking along the street.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: I really wanted to like this place...it's super clean, it's close to base, and it's a really great price (Less than $10 for a lunch buffet). There is a wide variety of food: chinese, japanese, make your own hibachi (hand it to the hibachi chef to fry up for you), and sushi. However, the MASSIVE headache I got roughly an hour after lunch made me want to smack myself in the forehead for not realizing it earlier....duh...MSG. So...if you aren't sensitive then you might want to check it out, however if you have an MSG sensitivity, then I suggest you avoid it like the plague.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: Can't say enough good things about this place!! Delicious delicious food. I honestly love all Indian cuisine, but this place has a friendly staff and great prices. It can get busy which is even more telling of how good their food and service is! Never a long wait though. I could eat here every day.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Came in to try the Lotaburger with green chilies. Stephanie the cashier took my order and asked if I wanted fries to. I said no, and she totaled my order. I asked her if the fries were good she said the seasoned fries were da bomb. She rang up the fries and I was 11 cents short. I said I would run out to the car and grab some change. She said no problem, don't worry about it. She pulled a 5 out of her pocket and makes change, then hands my $2 and change back to me. She didn't just cover the 11 cents she paid for fries out of her pocket.  Wow, thanks Stephanie! Great burger and spectacular fries.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: This is my spot. Love the Louisiana Rub Bone in Wings (Well Done & Wet) as well as the Lemon Pepper. The guys (Robert & Ryan) that work here are cool and always get my order 100%. It's gotten to the point where I can just call and they know what I want and it's always on point. Plus they got a Coke Remix machine thing so that's a plus. If you're on the North side, get your wings here. They'll take care of you!
name: Wingstop
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, American (New)

text:
Two very dissapointing dining experiences at Paradise.  

First was breakfast with my boys after soccer that was mediocre at best. The presentation was not appetizing, eggs were lacking flavor - dry, overcooked, unseasoned and the toast was Terrible.  

Second time I talked my family into trying it again.  Once again, mediocre at best.  Again - the presentation is VERY unappealing. Kids meal was white bread and processed turkey on a tan plate, with a tan cookie in a tan bag with a tan napkin. How about a piece of greenery or a strawberry? Yuk.  Salad was okay - hard to mess up a ceaser, sandwiches okay, but again presentation was bland and unappealing for all 5 of us.  

Two times was it - I likely won't be back.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: Great place for going with a friend for breakfast, lunch or just coffee. Wonderful selection of baked goodies (hard to decide). Can sit inside or outside. Very friendly and helpful staff.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: The place is very dirty - the floor is disgusting.  The waitstaff wear dirty stained clothes which is very unappetizing.  Our party sat near the kitchen and it looked filthy and the cooks looked unclean and disheveled.  The food is ok but the surroundings really put me off my meal.  Surely management can clean the place and require employees to wear clean clothes and look presentable.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Outstanding food! My family used AJ's for a holiday dinner and we were beyond impressed with the food. The turkey was juicy and tender, the stuffing and gravy was well-prepared, and the apple pie was perfect! They put too many almonds on the green beans and the yams were a little too dry, They also repeatedly tried to up-sell even though they already make a lot of money since they are an expensive  grocery store. 

All in all, I believe they are worthy of 4 out of 5 stars. We shouldn't have to subject ourselves to up-selling, but the food was very good.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: Good service and good food. Plenty of TV's for all to watch all around. A bit over priced but then Tucson is in general over taxes and priced so you can't fault the staff for the ass hats the run the city!
name: Hooters
categories: Sports Bars, Food, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Chicken Wings, Restaurants

text: We get here, and it's BUSY! Get ready to wait. Based on the reviews, and how busy this place was, I was expecting some good eats. We finally get seated, and the place has a very hipster vibe to it. I ordered the chicken and toast (I guess you can say it's their version of Chicken and waffles), and my girlfriend ordered the Beni, which is a eggs benedict, and instead of Canadian bacon they use pork belly. It took a very, very long time to get our food. The staff acknowledged this by bringing us a pastry, and apologized for the long wait. Which I thought was nice, but then we get our food. The first thing I noticed was the french toast was a bit burnt, and so was the chicken. I take my first bite, and the rosemary, and french toast was a very interesting taste I've never had, and I liked it. However it still had that faint burnt taste, but still very good. The chicken on the other hand, had NO flavor. I ask my girlfriend how her food was, and I see this look of disappointment. She LOVES eggs Benedict, and she flat out said these were the worst she has ever had. I asked her to let me try it, and the hollandaise had absolutely no flavor, the pork belly was eh, but the asparagus was pretty good, though. The waiter (who stated he was one of the managers there) asked how our food was. My girlfriend told them about her food, which she only took about two bites of, let him know about the meal. We weren't expecting anything, However, he comped her order. So, to be honest the three stars are mainly due to the customer service.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Service was good this time,  wings were awesome.  No one smiled and they looked sad. Place us depressing,  wings were awesome.
name: Hooters
categories: Sports Bars, Food, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Chicken Wings, Restaurants

text:
I have always loved this place, and I have never been disappointed when I've gone.. I have to admit I always get the same thing spaghetti with the Caruso's sauce.. I know its lame to get spaghetti at an Italian restaurant since its easy to make at home, But I love it here.. Actually my family pretty much always gets the same thing, dad gets the chicken parm. and adds another breast (Never has had a problem asking for adjustments) He's only complaint is not enough sauce, but they always bring out extra when he asks.. My mother and sister both get the eggplant parm. and have never complained about it..

The only negative things about the place is that the wait can be long and the service can be spotty, but food wise I think it is excellent, However, I heard the pizza isn't worth ordering, so stick with the pastas and entrees and I don't think you could go wrong :)
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
One of the best restaurants in Tucson.

Food is steakhouse-Mexican fusion. Complimentary fire-roasted and tomatillo salsas are a nice twist on classic chips and salsa. Carne asada is the best I've had. Order it with the chiles and cheese added. Salmon and chicken are also excellent. 

Service and food quality/consistency are always good. Food is moderately priced. Check this place out if you want a good steak in a casual atmosphere.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Excellent traditional pizza. Quality ingredients, balanced flavors, and not too salty.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Good place to come and delicious fried bread , clean and friendly. Let try the next time.
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text:
Yes, 

This is THE place Rachel (ehhhh) Ray reviewed for her dinner in Tucson.

It is really super food, when it is ever open, that is!  

The Musts: 
The Pink Scallops, which are pink because they are served with anise and saffron, and the other (*note - to be honest the atmosphere is really dark, and the place is in a strip mall, but the food is sensational*) is the Ahi tuna...this is the single dish that seafood lovers with gourmet taste buds love in "dry-land" Tucson!

Your run down:
-It is Romantic
-It is Trendy (but I think they prefer patrons over 35?  Just my experience, but were never rude to moi!)
-They have no view, and it is really too dark inside (hard to read menu)
-The food is lavish and yet understated, simple meets decadence
-Call before going to be certain they are open and to make reservations, if needed.
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text:
Think upper end Trader Joes. Bristol Farms (the Albertson's upper-end chain) comes to mind as a California equivalent.

Very dark, mood setting lighting inside. Higher prices than Safeway but a larger selection of specialty or imported items.

Not too bad. Friendly staff. Wide liquor assortment.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: My wife and I had lunch here on Saturday. UA classes were finished for the semester and there was no wait. Decor is functional.
