The two ramen dishes we had were very tasty and the slice of pork was flavorful and tender. Service was friendly and quick. Most dishes are priced in the $11 to $14 range. All dishes use a pork flavored broth except one vegetarian dish and one chicken dish. The seafood selection also uses the pork broth per the wait staff. The noodles are wheat-based and was told there are no plans to offer a non-gluten alternative. One observation. The vehicle parking area is limited and the parking spaces are tight. When we left the restaurant we observed two patrons exchanging car insurance info. It's safer to park your vehicle on the adjoining side street.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Found this place on Speedway. Reasonably priced with friendly staff and delicious food! Will come again!
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: Just got back from the Claim Jumper.  So full!  One of the best Thanksgiving Dinners ever! Made reservations 3 weeks ago for 3:30. Arrived at 3:30, but we still had a 45 minute wait.  I spoke with John (one of the managers) and explained that we were with my 97 year old aunt who needed to eat to take medication.  He sat us within 2 minutes. Then I figured it would take forever to be waited on and my husband sneered and put the timer on his phone.  Well, Lance came by within a minute and took our orders.  We were eating our salads within 4 minutes of my husband starting his timer! The bread came out next, which was amazing! Then our dinners took another 10 minutes, but Lance came by and apologized for the wait and brought more bread. The dinners were wonderful, just like home cooking!  Our drinks were refilled.  John came by to check on us and tell us how much he appreciated us having our dinner there.  We only ordered 2 meals because they are so huge, but Lance came by with an extra slice of pie.  Looking forward to our leftovers. We're going to make reservations for next year!
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Oh no...What happened.  The pizza has turned terrible...tasteless,cardboard crust...blah toppings....Used to love this place.  The outdoor patio is delightful as ever.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Wings over Broadway is a hidden gem, when it comes to Food & Service!! Grade "A"!!! Keep up the Great Work!!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Great place for Chinese food.  Portions great for the price.  First time had wonton soup and chicken and broccoli.   The soup was a little bland.  Second time had wonton soup and house chow mein.  The soup had great flavor this time.  The wait staff was very attentive.
name: Mae's Chinese Restaurant
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Delicious food! Great brunch and morning cocktails. Service was good. My only critique is that it is a very small restaurant and the wait can be so long it becomes not worth it.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I'm stunned at the good reviews for this place. The General Tso Chicken was horrible. It was dry and almost inedibly chewy. It was $8.95 and only came with rice. We also got the sweet and sour pork, so we spent $20 for subpar food. It almost makes me suspect of Yelp because I cannot see how anyone gave this place more than 3 stars!
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text:
Talk about your dumb luck; we stumbled upon this place when we stopped for gas in Tucson and the kids said they were hungry.  Sometimes timing can be everything!  So after gassing up, I whip open the trusty Yelp app on my iPhone and plug in "local brunch" and up pops Mother Hubbards; good reviews and close by so off we go.  

If you don't look closely, you'll miss the place; it sits in a strip mall mixed in with other small businesses and a church if I remember correctly!  It was a little after noon on a Sunday and so most of the crowd had thinned out so we were able to sit down immediately.  Place fit's the text-book description of a dive: mixed and eclectic assortment of tables/chairs/decorations and knick-knacks but was really cool looking at all the things. 

 HUGE MENU!!  Was hard to decide to choose because everything sounded so good!  Kids stuck with pancakes and eggs while my wife and I decided to lean towards the Native American/New Mexico influence with the Breakfast Burro and the Chorizo Fundido omelet.  WOW!  Both were delicious!  The owner was so nice as well; came over and talked to us for a bit and then brought over a new dish/recipe she was trying and asked for our opinion on it.  Everything was great and I only wish we had a place here in Austin using those same types of flavors and influences. 

Recommend to anyone in the area of if looking for a reason to stop while driving across Arizona!
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
The lunch buffet is excellent.  Always being refilled by cooks who are proud of their food.  The writer has lunch there about once a week and always wants a nap in the afternoon because of the good food.

One slight word of caution - this restaurant is located in a typical Tucson mall.  To call the mall "run-down" would be a compliment.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Excellent friendly service, yummy pot stickers and amazing shrimp curry. Fresh vegetables generously served with shrimp. So easy to access, I will put on my radar for long business days in Tucson.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: Very nice place and friendly stuff! I've never tried Mexican food, so first time-great experience!
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: Delicious food, nice atmosphere, and great service!!!  We ordered the Green Chile French Toast, which was really interesting and yummy.  It's not something we would order again, but I'm glad that we tried it. The bread they use to make it is really good, and the chiles are spicy.  If you are intrigued, definitely get this!  My friend's Buona Mattina omelet, which has artichokes and tomatoes, was absolutely delicious.  Her son's kids' pancakes were fabulous!  We wish we were in town longer, to try everything on the menu!!!  The coffee was okay; it seemed a little stale, like it sat too long on the burner.  Service was super attentive especially with coffee refills.  Highly recommended!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
YUM! Worth the wait for a table. Bloody marys and specialty drinks are delicious. 
You won't be disappointed.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
This place was the best. There is inside seating as well as front patio facing parking lot.
Our server was friendly and good at what she does.  My husband had the strawberry crepes. AMAZING!!!  I had French toast and sausage patties, very good!
This is a must try place!
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: I stayed a long weekend here. Very impressed with the staff. Every single one from the cleaning crew to security check in etc. we're extremely friendly and helpful. The bed was phenomenal sheets perfect. The showerhead in the bathroom was fantastic. Lots of towels and little incidentals.  Room service was very good the food was very good and the guy that delivered it was so professional. Only negative  I could come up with was the food situation.  The only thing open really early in the morning was that place that's in the tequila factory, or Starbucks. If they had a little stand that sold English muffins or toast something simple really early in the morning without having to go to a sitdown restaurant would be good.  I can't stand Starbucks too overpriced and the food they have is microwave food. The only other negative was on the casino floor the slots are the tightest I've ever experienced. The pool area was fantastic though. I would definitely go back and I would definitely recommend this resort for a long weekend in order to relax
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text:
This was our first--and last--time at Blake's Lotaburger, for a number of reasons.

When we arrived, the place was packed. Parking was at a premium, but we wanted to eat in, so we finally found a place to park. There was a long line inside, and it was moving VERY slowly. We were on line for approximately 18 minutes before we finally made it to the counter. Once there, we placed the order we'd had plenty of time to think through. We both ordered the Lota combo. He asked for nothing on his burger except cheese and onions; when asked if they had any other sauces for the burgers, like maybe, 1000 island, they did not. I have gluten issues, and asked if they have gluten-free buns; they do not. I ordered mine bunless. The combo comes, according to the menu, with a large drink and a large fries. Their large drink is something like 30 ounces, but their large fries is smaller than a regular size at certain large chain restaurants. The price was fairly reasonable, no real complaint there.

We went off and found one table to sit down at to wait for our food. The dining room is far too small for the numbers of people wanting to check out this new restaurant (that may not be a problem for long, however). There are no salt or pepper shakers, no available napkins on the tables or in the dining room.

There was a young man running orders out to the tables, and it was at this point that I realized how backed up they really were. Our order number was 844; the runner was bringing out orders in the low 830's. People who had already found tables before we entered the restaurant were just getting their food (at this point, we'd already been in house approximately 25 minutes). It took approximately another 15 minutes to get our food. When we got it, our first disappointment was the fries. Not that they were unpleasant; they were not particularly hot, more along the line of lukewarm, and they could have used a bit more salt. When he opened his burger, there was cheese, but no onions. He had to go to the counter for it, and wound up with the equivalent of the small round of onion. The patty was thin and dry, and we were both disappointed at the fact it was only one patty. The picture next to the Lota combo clearly shows a double patty burger. When he asked about it, he was told they have had a large number of complaints about that.

Over all, the experience was far less than all the hype had led us to expect. We won't be going back. If we want a good burger, we'll go to Graze across the street.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: Went with my wife, had a great meal and great service. I don't normally like Italian food but the food here was great! The best part the prices are very reasonable!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: Finally, there service has come around.  As I stated, their food is excellent, but I gave it a two previously for their slow service.  They have cleaned up the place a little bit and they have changed their menu.  I like that they now offer breakfast all day and they are open a little later.  Ultimately, even if the service is a little slow, the food is awesome and worth the patience.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Not a huge fan of the employees. They had a snobby attitude, and the food didn't necessarily make up for it. It's a pretty basic taco shop, which sometimes is OK, too. Just was expecting a bit more, since I have heard good things about this spot.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I enjoy getting some coffee and writing up on the patio area. They have a fireplace for the winter and misters for the summer. Reasonable prices for quality coffee and a truly unique place to look over Tucson.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text:
Don't use the online ordering. I arrived 15 minutes after placing an order online and was told that they do not make online orders until the customer arrives to pick up the food (in case you don't show up). They asked me to wait 15 minutes while my food is cooked. 
Once the food was finally cooked, I was asked to pay in the store even though my payment had already been processed online (along with a tip which I wish I could take back). There seems to be a resentment toward customers who use online ordering here. Good food but poor service.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: I love this place!  One of my favorite Tucson spots.  Although their breakfast menu is a bit limited, the food is great, the service is fast, and the bloody marys are amazing!  Even when they are super busy, which is often, they are responsive and friendly.  And did I mention the food? My favorites are the prosciutto & parmesan pasta and the seared ahi salad.  I would highly recommend Ghini's for breakfast and lunch.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
I'm glad I found this place recently, it's right next to my office. They have pretty good choice of different flavors for wings, you can pick 2 and more different flavors per order, the more wings you get the more flavors you can do. I liked the prices as well. I had 12 wings for only 9.99 and I had 2 different flavors. The wings are pretty decent size, I couldn't even finish my plate! They also have some good happy hours and specials, for example 50 cent wings after some hours! 
I took my food for take out so can't say anything about the service yet, but the order was ready so quick.
The only reason why I put 4 starts is because they don't have boneless wings. 
You should definitely check this place out!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Cool lil spot downtown!! Great food, awesome staff and great location. Job well done!! For sure try a la cha cha!!!!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: My absolutely favorite Indian buffet in Tucson. They have a great selection of food and it's all delicious. The naan is great, the chicken tikka massala wonderful and doesn't just used flavorless chunks of breast meat. The rice pudding and gulab jamun is the best I have had. You can't beat the price!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
I had been so excited to try this place for brunch. I love their menu and seriously wanted to eat everything! I went yesterday morning with a party of 6. We had about a 45 minute wait which we expected. It's a shame they don't offer a call-ahead to put your name in. 

While we waited I started with a prickly pear Margarita. It was delicious and fabulously priced at $7. Getting a drink at the bar was easy and fast despite the crowd. 

When we were seated we decided to do a little sharing with our dishes since we literally wanted to try everything. We started with the maple bacon cronut. I was honestly really disappointed! I love cronuts so much and was really looking forward to this. It would have been much better if it was served warm! It was cold, dry and felt stale! I was not impressed and won't be ordering another one. We ended up also getting the smoked salmon beni, the duck confit hash and the breakfast poutine. Everything was just okay. I definitely liked it, the presentation was great and the dishes were all cooked well I just think they were lacking in flavor. The description of the duck confit hash was so fabulous and I really had high flavor expectations. I felt the dish fell flat and was really missing something. 

Regardless, we had a great brunch experience. Service was very good although it took a while to get our check. I would definitely recommend this place, especially for the drinks! I also indulged in their strawberry white sangria and it was fantastic and only $6 a glass. I would like to try other things on the menu and hopefully whatever I try will have more flavor!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Simply amazing food and wonderful service. My son hit the sweet potato mash I believe. I got the croissant with egg,prosciutto sandwich and both were amazing. Portion size is perfect. Shelby was our server and she knew her stuff regarding what each dish was and what she recommended and why. Will be back for sure.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Fish tacos are amazing! We tried the carnitas and the asada ones as well. Everything was so yummy! The chips are fresh and more of a flour than corn chip. The nachos and salsa all super yummy. Fast and affordable! Oh... and they have local, domestic, and imported beer!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I found this restaurant on yelp as I am in town for just a couple of nights. The staff is very welcoming and the menu is great not too big but just right.  The food was EXCELLENT!! Along with fast service and personable wait staff. Simply great food at a great price !!!
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: WOB seems to have gone through a few owners over the last decade.  What was a hole in the wall wing place writh very few customers here and there is now a bustling wing joint. Wings are always cooked right,  never over done,  sauces are unique and tasty and if you don't get the baked potato fries you're really missing out. The servers are generally friendly and efficient. The only down side is it can get very busy which slows down service quite a bit.  So of you're in a hurry during a rush, you might want to try to come back another time.  This is my new wing joint,  check it out. .. if you don't love it,  you have no soul.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: I don't have a single bad thing to say about this place.  The food is flawlessly delicious.  Prior to trying Le Rendez-vous, I was craving bistro501, Lafayette, IN, where I was a regular customer back when I was in school.  Le Rendex-vous' food was great but expensive which is common among good french restaurants.  If you are looking for a restaurant for a special occasion, this place is it!   Also, reservations is preferred.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: So delicious! Small and cozy. You can be seated faster at a community table. We got the miso ramen and the soyu. Both excellent and fresh. You can get extra noodles for a small charge before slurping up your soup. Fast and friendly service. So glad to have this yummy trending restaurant in the neighborhood!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
I managed to be the first in line for dinner service here recently. Once the doors opened I was quickly seated at a table for three, and they gladly accommodated my party of three when we asked to be seated at a booth instead. Overall, the service was satisfactory, albeit slightly scattered and overburdened.

I ordered the Roasted Black Garlic Tonkotsu and I quite enjoyed it. Good flavor and toppings and just the right amount of salt -- I drank the broth at the end, which is something I won't do if it's too salty. Portion size was good, as I left feeling sated, but not full.

Price wise, I don't mind paying ~$11 for a bowl of good Ramen, although I do hope they'll be able to lower the price a little in the future. I will, however, note that the drink prices are unreasonably high -- no one at my table ordered drinks because of it.

If you can get in line early or don't mind waiting, a while I'd definitely recommend trying Raijin Ramen at least once, as in my opinion it's one of the better options for Ramen in Tucson (and currently my favorite, although I still need to try others)...you might want to skip drinks in favor of a lower bill or spending the money on appetizers instead, though.

I'm glad to see a local business with good food have a successful opening. Hopefully they'll be able to expand their hours and menu (dessert options, please), as well as adjust some of their pricing after they've been open for a while.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
I think I must take the same position on this store that Corey has taken in the past. 
Food: Sub standard
Service: Snails pace
Price: Decent (check in special was not worth it)
Won't be making the rounds back to this breakfast nook anytime soon. In fact I think  a chain like IHOP would have been better.....
Not a fan  of the Potatoes! (super gross)
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: This place is just what Tucson needs. The food was great, the staff was attentive, and the drinks were surprisingly upscale cocktails at a super-reasonable price. The cocktails here would cost an extra $3-$4 anywhere else in town.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The food in the Buffett is a mix between good and bad. Most of which I wouldn't put on my plate. The stations are a good mix but the food is not very appetizing overall. I could understand if the timing was bad but we were there at 6 pm. The price is high enough at $26 each to support a good Buffett. I've been to several in Las Vegas for about the same price that were much bigger and better. The deserts were very unappetizing mostly, would have to be starved to eat one.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Flavorful asada , good in every form ie tacos burros and tortas . My husbands always getting the shredded beef . So shredded beef lovers here's the place
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Everything I've ever had at Sachiko has been awesome. This was my go to spot for sushi in Tucson. It never disappointed, had great drinks (unsweetened iced green tea!), and all of their sushi was fresh and flavorful. I could eat their eel all day and the teriyaki is pretty legit too!
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text:
I absolutely love Chipotle burritos and tacos. It's not 'authentic' Mexican food. Think of it sort of like a Subway for Mexican style food. You order up at the counter and walk down the line as the employees make your burrito (like Subway sandwiches). You get your food and pay and then grab a seat- there is no wait staff.

Yes, it's *owned* by McDonald's, but there is clearly no influence on the food from anything related to McDonald's. In fact, Chipotle should be insulted to have its name spoken in the same sentence.

The portions are HUGE. I usually get the chicken fajita burrito- get it with everything on it and it's incredibly tasty and very filling. If you want something lighter, go with the tacos or possibly a burrito bowl (burrito minus the tortilla).

They also sell chips with salsa or guacamole, and beers and margaritas (looks like some sort of pre-mixed margarita, haven't tried that myself). The chips and sides are expensive, so I just stick with a burrito and a regular drink.

For those of you sensitive to spicy foods, get the mild salsa or even no salsa at all. My wife finds it to be spicy even without salsa. I go with the hottest option myself, and ask for the corn/green chili mix as well when you get down to the salsa options.
name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican

text: Awesome Tofu dishes. I always order the dumplings as well. Delivery is only 2 dollars. Perfect spot for Chinese. I don't switch up what I eat here so I can't compare too many items, but never had anything I didn't like or any issues.
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: Good food and service.  The price points for the entrees are too high.  The $3.50 for cup of coffee is outrageous.  The brunch/breakfast environment has excessive noise.  The noise level in the restaurant is terrible. Never did understand the pastry component of the business.  No menu or discussion about pastries from waiter.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
for the price, you really can't beat this place.

they have a wide variety of great dishes. fish, chicken, beef, pork. they also have a mongolian grill and bar where you can assemble what you want on a plate and pass through a window for the chef to cook for you. 

service is alright, nothing to rave about, but they do keep your drink full and keep the table clear.

definitely bring your appetite!
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text:
This review pertains to the buffet.

Thank goodness it was comped, as we are new club members.   Would have been extremely upset to have paid $19.99 for this meal.

Food was lukewarm at best. We arrived at 5 pm, it opened at 4, and the food was already dried out.  Marinara sauce watery, Alfredo sauce had absolutely no flavor.

Actually most of the food was flavorless, bland.  Maybe the kitchen ran out of salt, seasonings.

Tri tip, turkey so dry you could hardly chew it.

The green beans and the New York cheesecake were good.

Service was excellent as was the cleanliness.

Will not return!
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text:
Here is The Truth about the ClaimTucson.

 This isnt your normal Claim Jumper, at least not anymore. I have gone there three time in the last 10 month before finally deciding no more chances. Its been black listed in our family. 

I am not sure if this particular restraunt is under new managment or if indeed the entire chain has undergone a menu change, but the results are very poor compared to years before even at the same location in the past. 

Out of the three times i have gone over the last year, I got one quality meal where I felt it was worth the price. 

The other two times were really bad, like burned ribs,  store bought box like quality mac and cheese, and some crazy appetizer. 

The appetizer was the worst. I think it called the Range Rattler. They  are breaded beyond belief with a raw like pepper layer underneath and a tastless cheese stuffing inside, somewhere they add overcooked shrimp. On top of that the appetizer came after the dinner.. maybe because it took so long in coating these monstrosities of deep fried flavorless flour. Dont believe the pic, its not what you will get, at least not at this Claim Jumper. 


Let The Truth be told
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text:
Absolutely stunning, visually. This place is gorgeous, inside & out. Reasonable on gambling, great staff, AWESOME drinks at Prema. The buffet was great both nights with different styles of food. I didn't go to the pool, but I had a view of it from my room and it was beautiful. Speaking of the room, I booked a sky level queen and it was fantastic. Comfy as hell beds, crisp TV, the whole sha bang. 

Verdict: STAY HERE!!!
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Worse chorizo and eggs ever!! Showed up walked up to counter and asked if I could pick up my order that I called in 20 min before and when I asked the lady behind counter a ? She completely ignored me and walked away took them so long to finally get my order ...and when I tasted it it was  bland no taste wat so ever even with all the unwanted tomatoes and onions and wat ever else was in the chorizo that's not supposed to be ther couldn't  even add any taste . Tasteless completely will never return .im sure they make other good food they were packed after all but don't order chorizo and eggs

text:
We came here on a home U of A football gameday and it was not that crowded. We did not have to wait in line and it was easy to find a table. There is a bar area with TVs that is close to the restaurant seating area, it is all one big room really. As the name suggests, they serve street style tacos and you can watch them make it, Chipotle style.

I had some carne asada and al pastor tacos. The amount of meat is pretty good and it was seasoned well. My favorite part was probably the self serve chips and salsa bar. The chips were warm and the selection of salsas really completed the experience. If you want good tacos in a clean place, this is it!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
I have never not liked anything at Prep and Pastry! You have to get toast, because you HAVE to try the homemade jam! Delicious! 

We love being able to put our name down, and get texted when the table is ready. It's a welcome addition to the up and coming Tucson food scene. We go there most Sunday mornings, we just make sure to get up early to keep the wait from growing too long.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This review is just for the pastries- we ordered a bunch to go. Mainly went here to try the doughsant but thought it was only ok. It was pretty heavy, although must admit the bacon topping was quite tasty. The scones however were AMAZING!!! First of all they are humongous. When you bite into it, it just melts into your mouth like happiness, yum! We had the earl gray which was my favorite as well as the one drizzled in chocolate which was also good although I liked the earl gray one the best. Overall cute decor, would love to come back and try the kitchen food sometime!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Pretty empty at 8ish on a Saturday but from what I can tell Tucson is a pretty quiet place. Anyway, came in with the husband and our sons. Was open seating so we settled down and not even minutes later someone was bringing us menus, high chairs and taking drink orders. They bought out menus and crayons for my boys and were hanging around talking to my sons (people tend to do this often, they are really cute boys). Ordered BBQ wings, the standard burger, my husband got the Tucson burger and I got sliders and corn dogs for my boys. All food was cooked very well, had great flavor. The wings were very good and not too messy, I hate messy wings. The burger was cooked medium well just like I asked. We like all the tables were brought out warm chips and salsa both were very, good. And I'm not a salsa fan but I'm pretty sure I could eat this by the truckload. The manager was very sweet and kind, and honestly people just kept checking on us the whole time and again , she said she was missing her grand babies so she gave my littles a lot of attention but not in a creepy way. Lol. Anyway my kid won't sleep without a cup of milk and this and our hotel is pretty far away so I was dreading driving all over to find milk. We asked the manager and she bought out not one, not two, but three containers of school milk for my son and didn't charge us a bit. They bought out my check without delay and boxes and bags and we had the best experience dining with two kids (especially my 'active' 2 year old) we've ever had. He's never this behaved I may ask the manager to move in with us since she obviously is a toddler whisperer. If in the area, come here I don't think you'll regret it. It's not Ruth Cris but it's good service, good food and a good price point and you can't beat the convenience if you stay in the area. It's connected to the Doubletree btw.
name: Finnegan's Pub
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Restaurants, American (New), Bars, Irish

text:
Let me start by saying that a single experience does not represent the whole so.... I try to be fair and try places out a couple of times before writing a review. 

This said, where do I start? 
Ok I am going to start with the dining enviorment. The old location was more representative of the Paradise Branding and had a traffic flow that made sense. Order , walk down the counter and pay at the end. Condiments were located in eye view and were convienient. There was space for customers to walk by and etc. 

The new location is just well..... awkward! The entire counter is at the front. You cannot see how your food is prepared as it is prepared back in a kitchen area and then brought to you. This leads me to the next piece so ... you pay, you have your drink cup in hand and you have to look for the soda fountain because the only beverage station that is obvious is the coffee self serve. Not new customer friendly on this aspect. Once you find the station which is located behind the seating area it is small and crowded and the traffic flow is terrible with you standing there right in the servers path as they come out of the kitchen trying to deliver orders to tables. 

Next you must find a seat. seating arragement is awkward probably due to the location being in a space that is awkward shaped. This might be prime realestate due to the store having street side view for cars passing by but this killed the interior ambiance and seating arragements as well as traffic and work flow for both patrons and employees. 
This is a segway into the delivery of the food to your table. As a person who dines out regularly and is also a manager what I could not help but notice that waiters came out of a kitchen into a dinning area had particians on the backs of some of the booths, this makes it difficult for them to locate patrons or see numbers on the tables. This also leads to wait staff going around in circles confused as they try to find where the orders should be placed. I felt bad for them.

Lastly quality of the food. As far as being consistent with consumer expectations and meeting the brand expectations I give it a ( F) I visit Paradise Cafes all over the state and the one thing I can usually say is while service might be a bit inconsistent, food is generally meeting or exceeding standards. Lettace was ok and not packaged but..... toppings to a rather pricy salad were sparce as was the dressing. It honestly was like eating a bed of lettace without much in the way of topings or taste. I was hoping that the sandwhich I got would be better. The same sandwhich I ordered at the Chandler AZ location was very tasty and so I was looking forward to what I was about to eat and I did have an expectation it would taste the same. Not the case. The chicken again was sparse and the avadaco was fresh but it wasn't ripe, not even close. The Avacado was hard and tasteless. The bread also seemed a bit chewy even for sourdough and to be honest had the same texture on the crust as rawhide which was the analogy I provdided to the person I was dinning with. 

Lastly Customer Experience.....
I understand that Pannera has purchased some if not all Paradise Cafe locations. I use my catering card and rewards card currently at nearly all other locations in the phoenix area. I have dinned at Pannera in Las Vegas and I have their loyalty card also. The Tucson location is the ONLY location that tells me that since the buy out occured and the owners cannot make up their minds on how to merge the two corporations that they currently are not accepting any loyalty cards. 
If this is the case ok, but for the love of GOD can we be consistent? Again no other location has expressed this to me. If this is the case due to being a franchise then it should also be said as this makes the entire Paradise Brand look bad and patrons might have the same impression of non franchise locations. Pannera in LV also seems to be accepting their own loyalty card and again this location accepts neither. 

This is my third experience at this location and as another reviewer stated they did not fail to disappoint again in many aspects. I won't be returning to this location while in Tucson.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: Love this place! I have been going here since a little girl, and will continue to go there. Best Chinese food in Tucson.  The owners Billy and Ellie are personable, and they remember who you are.  Staff is wonderful, everything on the menu is delicious.  Definitely a great place to go :)
name: China Dragon Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
My husband and I went to Tucson to visit a friend and he took us to this amazing cafe.  The prices were great, the atmosphere was very inviting and not stuffy at all.  You think French and you think stuffy and highfalutin, but it's not that - its the perfect little cafe for normal people.  We showed up early for lunch - at 11:00 and by noon the place was packed.  I'd say get a table early, but there is plenty of seating inside and out.  The food was so good that my husband and I had to take turns driving home to Mesa to take naps.  It is one of those places where a diet goes out the window and you completely finish your plate.  They also have the real deal for coffee - much better than Starbucks.
I got two eclairs and a caramel nut pull apart to go - which were awesome.  The fact that all the bread, cakes, cookies and pastries are home made right there makes me wishing we lived closer.  Every time we come to Tucson I'll be stopping there to pick something up! My husband has talked about it nonstop since we visited!
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Everything is excellent!  Come hungry, the portions are big, service is pretty good...can't go wrong!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: I  was really disappointed with my dinner. The escargots were served with what I assume were canned artichoke hearts and parmesan. That unusual combination masked the delicate flavor of the escargots and made the dish way too salty. Next, I got the $20 Beef Bourguignon that tasted just like the pot roast at Denny's ( except that Denny's is cheaper and comes with mashed potatoes.) It was served with two pieces of bread not on the side but on the edge of the plate. That would have been OK until I found hidden under the bread one of those rectangles of butter wrapped in foil. As the butter melted, it began to slide into my dish. (Kind of funny actually.) Oh, yeah, the bourguignon also contained little pieces of undercooked potatoes, something I pointed out to the waitress. My daughter had "Mussels Marinieres" that were not too bad but with the addition of basil, they didn't taste anything like French "Moules marinieres, at least not the ones I've had in France. On the positive side, the desserts du jour were good and our server very pleasant. I won't go back though...
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
Oh, this place has potential. 

The baked goods are delicious, the service is not excellent, and the business owners don't seem interested in improving what they are providing. 

After confusion about who to give my order to, I reached the register. I told the young man at the register that I would like whichever of the soups was vegetarian. He rang me up. When my food was delivered at the table, I specifically asked if the soup was vegetarian. Two women who delivered the food said it was.

It was not. They served a vegetarian chicken soup even after being specifically asked about it. 

I sent the soup back, and then had my meal interrupted an additional 2-3 times by their employees. Because their mistake necessitates them interrupting my meal to unpleasantly pseudo-apologize.

Some excuses given:
"We have a lot of new girls working here." (I gave my order to a man.) (Also, you told me the soup was vegetarian when you delivered it)
"We ran out of the soup so we substituted another."  At this point I replied that I would have understood it if the cashier had told me that they were out of the vegetarian soup. 

I understand mistakes happen in food service, but the buck needs to stop somewhere. It's not okay to serve people food they have been specifically asked not to. I would not recommend trusting this restaurant with a food allergy or sensitivity problem. 

I hope this bakery can step up to the plate.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
Total fail. 

People smoking on patio while I am trying to eat. This place is a joke and I suggest you eat at Panera's which are non-smoking...or those that enforce such rules.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text:
Stayed here with my son for the Tucson Holiday Tip Off Tournament. 

We absolutely loved it. It's a gorgeous hotel which reminds me of Vegas. Part of the hotel also looks like the Venetian. Plenty of food options even for picky eaters like my 13 year old. There is a Starbucks inside the hotel for Starbucks lovers. 

Rooms were also beautiful. No complaints. We even got complimentary chocolates. Yummy. 

We got a view of the pool which is beautiful as well. Wish we could have enjoyed it but we came on a cold gloomy day.

I would have given 5 stars but the smell of cigarettes isn't my cup of tea.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: This might just be my favorite Eegee's in town.  It is uber clean and the service is always fantastic and friendly, even during the crazy rush for lunch.  It *is* Eegee's so we all know they do a great job at pushing out a solid sandwich - my favorite is the veggie grinder.  I also happen to be addicted to their ranch fries.  This month's flavor Cherry Cider is great blended with my absolute fave -  piña colada.  If you are from out of town and reading this, try Eegee's it is an AZ jewel.
name: eegee's
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text: Phenomenal service and steak last night. We came in an hour before closing and were still treated like VIPs (Chris was knowledgeable and very funny!). As we were celebrating, we chose to split the Chef's Cut, green chile mac, and las papas de la casa. Everything was exquisite, but the real showstopper was that tomahawk steak. We both agreed it was easily the best steak we have ever had (and that's including our favorite Sonoran steakhouses in MX). We followed it up with the peanut butter tres leches cake, which was decadent but not overwhelmingly so. Like others have mentioned, you'll drop a pretty penny here - but for the quality of what you're enjoying, it is totally worth it. We'll definitely be back here for our next celebratory dinner!
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: I notice the little things and enjoy amazing customer service.  We received both. From opening the doors to being attended to promptly at the pool. An example of great guest care is when my daughter and I were sitting in the spa and another guest was speaking with a pool employee about the temperature. The employee asked me how it felt and I said it was fine but he offered to call someone to adjust the heat. The other guest and myself said it wasn't necessary.The employee said okay and started to walk away,stopped and came back to ask if we needed anything else. I was so impressed by this . He did not need to turn back and ask us . Amazing customer service experience that has prompted this review. Little things that I enjoy so small but I find enjoyable :Fresh flowers on the room service tray, little bottles of Fiji water and chocolate mints( this is new ) , check in very easy , valet is very fast, rooms are very clean and updated. If I had to say one thing that I found disappointing it would be the lack of variety of card games .  Otherwise perfect for staycations!
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text:
Love this place, Staff is professional!
Highly recommend this place for breakfast or lunch. The food is great and I love their Bloody Mary's!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Killer bloody Mary's, the morning prep omelette cannot be beat, until you make the mistake of ordering "the cure" French toast.  Bliss.  So much for Paleo diet, the cure is what I hunt down to devour.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Upon arriving in Tucson, I was told by a friend that this is the best place for brunch...that's a pretty tall order, but I was not disappointed.

SERVICE: They are notorious for their wait time on weekends as I'm sure other yelpers can attest to, but after enjoying a delicious meal here, I can see why! My group of 7 arrived around 11 and were told there was a 2 hour wait!! WHAT?! The place is rather small. It ended up being a little over an hour since some groups before us didn't want to wait. They do have some outside seating as well, and I recommend sitting at the bar if you're only 2 people. It's probably best to come with a group of max 4 people.

The two owners came by our table to say hello and thank us for coming by  and chat for a bit -- that doesn't happen every day! They were genuine and I could tell that they really put their heart into great service, atmosphere and excellent food. 

DRINKS: The mimosas are a must try! Great way to get your brunch time going and get happy :) I had the fuzzy naval and the other girls tried the blueberry one and Madras (guava).  I couldn't really taste much peach flavor in mine, but peach is a mild flavor anyway. I liked it either way - very tasty! 

FOOD: The menu is small but sufficient to find something interesting. After we ordered, one of the owners brought us a sample of their newest brioche french toast to get our opinion on it (see photo). It's not even on the menu yet!! It was a bit tart and not overly sweet.

The ONLY thing I didn't like about the menu is that since I never eat meat in the mornings, that cut out a lot of the options on the menu, as many items have duck, sausage or ham/pork. I had the omelette, which changes every day by the way. Today it had carrot purre, leeks, spinach, tomato slices and cheese, with springs of sprouts on top. It came with hashbrowns on the side. When I first saw the plate I thought it was very small, but it fills you up.  Everyone was speechless when the food arrived -- that's when you know the food is gooood :) Overall the meals were fairly healthy and satisfying for everyone. 

Delicious, I will be back! I'd like to try them out for lunch too.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Eegees on East Broadway has the greatest subs in town. Fresh, clean and quality ingredients. lYou won"t be disappointed.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I had been avoiding this place for a while, but now I regret it! Don't know why but I had a misconception. Went here before a Roadrunners game at the TCC and had great food and great beer. Quick service was great, considering it was pretty busy! And the free chips and salsa (with warmed chips!) were a nice touch.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Came back and tried again... hoping the new batch of dumplings would be less salty this time around. The boyfriend ordered zhajiangmian and it came out promising, but it is salty and it had chili oil in it. It would have been fine, except it wasn't mentioned on the menu and the boyfriend cannot touch any spiciness. It was a very unpleasant experience for him and I Opeth l offered him my dumplings which came out a lot later than his noodles. It was over seasoned with cooking wine and it was very very salty AGAIN. It sucks when you have to dine elsewhere after dining at a restaurant already. Boyfriend will probably never return again and I well probably not either considering the food is disappointing and the waitress scraped her arm on my straw and just said oops and walked away without an apology not offered to replace it.
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text:
Kind of a cumbersome set-up, food was not that good, but drink menu is great. 

The place is itself is a nice place to hang-out with a good vibe. The annoying thing is you order your food at the counter, chipotle style, but if you want to look at the full drink menu, you have to go to the bar and ask for that menu, or press the button on your table to get the drinks-- either way you have to pay two separate bills for being in one place.. silly set-up.
The beer menu is great though, with tons of local options. They have a few margarita choices that all sounded interesting and I loved mine. 
However, the food was just not good, especially for what you can get in this town for Mexican food. The tacos and burrito both just tasted dry, to the extent that we didn't even finish the burrito despite being voracious eaters normally. Free chips & salsa bar were good though-- in fact I mainly just ate the chips and salsa since they were better than the food. 

Come check it out for drinks, but I'd go elsewhere for better mexican food
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
u-like? I don't. 

what really annoys me to no end is when a restaurant establishment treats their loyal returning customers like crap. I go to this place 2-3 times a week dine in or take out after working out next door because of their convenient location. I tip very well and bring them easy business even though I've never really gotten any stellar service from this place.   

their take out policy is that they will make you get rice/ noodles/rice noodles in a separate container which is weighted so they'll charge you at least half a pound on just carbs, which is pretty $hady but okay I'll deal with it. 

so I kindly asked the lady today to put in a little chow mein with my rice noodles container (which is still weighted and doesn't make a difference to them either way other than to go out of their way to take away the satisfaction I might get from having both rice noodles and chow mein) and she refused. are you kidding me??????? what have you possibly got to lose from doing that??? i'm not substituting, not asking for extra, not asking to customize.    

a little business tip for you, or at least for that girl who was so unhelpful:  going out of you way a little to accommodate the customer goes a long way. funny just this morning I gave a speech to my office about good service and how a simple smile or gesture of care can really take a company far by building a strong returning client base. when I go during weekdays the restaurant is pretty dead and with all the competition in the area which all have a much wider selection of food it's hard to imagine why they would go out of their way to piss off their customers. The food I will add is decent, but I'm definitely NOT ever returning here. and at the end I asked the manager if I can have mixed the two and he says YES. way to go.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: This is a pretty good place on the east side for a gyro. I have been several times. The owner and employees are very friendly. The gyro sandwich is slightly inconsistent. Sometimes the pita is better than other times. The meat is good, not the best I've had, but good. They should put a little more of it the sandwich. The tzatziki sauce needs work. It lacks flavor and is too bland.  Over all it is a decent sandwich. They offer buffalo ranch fries which are krinkle fries with ranch and buffalo sauce. They are delicious if the fries are fresh and hot. They have a big TV which usually features a loud movie- not my thing, but maybe some people like it. I find it annoying, and would prefer a baseball game or some quiet sports event. I hope this place will improve slightly and last!
name: Super Gyros & More
categories: Greek, Restaurants, American (New), Hot Dogs

text:
Why 5 stars?  In short, the food was tasty, the service was friendly and professional, and the atmosphere was fun. 

We ordered a bunch of different things, this being our first time here. He got chef's cut steak. I got carne asada. And we got a bunch of sides (sonoran slaw, chiles mixta, charro beans, a taste of the esquites, and a side of the prickly pear bbq sauce). I'd happily order every single thing again. The steaks were perfectly cooked, quality cuts of meat. The sides were all super flavorful; so it's hard to pick just one favorite (but get some bbq sauce on the side). 

Our server was very knowledgeable about the ingredients and when seeing we were on the fence about ordering a 3rd side (the esquites) offered to bring us a small taste of it. That way we were able to try a bunch of different things. He did his job professionally, but in a genuinely friendly way. 

The atmosphere was fun and clearly hip (by the decor). The energy level was simmering (even on a Sunday night). My only complaint would be the TV in the bar is visible in the dining room and can be distracting from the dinner. 

Prices were very reasonable for the quality and quantity of food you get along with the professional service. Would definitely come back!
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Great breakfast spot. I saw this listed as one of the 10 best breakfast spots in Tucson and the green corn waffles sounded good. The green chile is excellent and the concept and decor was fun.

text: One of the things I miss most from my time living in AZ (aside from the sun) are street tacos. On this trip we sought out the best street tacos in Tucson ... and I think we found them. Fresh, fast, and all on point. I had the Al Pastor and Asada, street and gringo style to try them both ways. So good! I was very impressed. The chips are free with an order of $5 or more, complete with salsa bar. This was my husband's first time with street tacos and he was a fan. We will be back!

categories: Restaurants, American (New)

text:
Yesterday a close friend had an outpatient surgery. I got up very early to take her to the hospital and although I had coffee, I hadn't eaten all day and was hungry. She is very particular about her food and loves their broccoli cheese soup. I am gluten free and if I eat here, I usually get a salad. So after she was released the hospital suggested she eat soup so I decided to run into Panama and get a take out order. She was very groggy and stayed in the car and I wanted to do it quickly. 
Anyway she was very hungry so I ordered a bowl (as opposed to a cup) of the soup and she's very particular about her order. I ordered her a sandwich to eat later that day. She like ham and Swiss cheese on a croissant with no mayo or mustard, just lettuce and onion. I asked for a quick recommendation for a gluten free salad, and the cashier recommended the green goddess salad. 
The order came out quickly (I would say maybe five minutes) which was great. They said everything like utensils etc were in the bag (which they were). I didn't look in the bag I just grabbed it and went out. The cashier had asked me if I wanted a large salad and I was so hungry, I said yes.
The total cost was $25.27 and there were no drinks. So $25.27 for soup, salad and a sandwich. 
So then I get her home, bring her in, bring the food and her purse and her hospital bag in and I get her ready to eat. I put her sandwich in the refrigerator and gave her soup to her and a spoon. I had told her I got her the bowl because she was so hungry but it was clearly a cup of soup. Then I took my salad out and it was SO tiny. I was convinced they gave me the smaller version because I've eaten salads there before and this was soo tiny, and was $9.89.
The salad was okay. I eat a lot of salads. It wasn't great but other than the size I have no complaints about it but certainly wouldn't pay $9.89 for it. 
I decided to call the manager. I also checked her sandwich first, which was exactly as she had ordered it. 
I decided to call the manager, John. I felt we had been given a cup of soup, instead of a bowl and I felt like we had gotten the smaller version of salad. Anyway, he was polite, looked up my ticket and asked me questions. I do think the soup was the wrong size but what was sad was the salad WAS the 'new size' of the large container, which is small. He was interested in making it right and asked me to ask for him next time we are there and he said he would make it right. I appreciate that but I personally won't pay $10 for that salad again. I would add the salad was fresh and other than the size, looked appetizing.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: It's been 14 years since I've eatten at La Parrilla Suiza having fond memories of past expectations, cravings, and authentic Mexican cuisine!! Boy is it gonna be another 14 years till I grace this restaurant with my presents... despite the numerous healthy food violations I witness well keep this short and sweet on the count of service and food. And when I mean service I'm referring to lack there of. Now after nearly a 20 minute wait on our simple ice teas which i could have walked to Circle K for faster, it took nearly 2x that for our food order. The food then came out faster then the drinks we ordered???. Lastly when it came to a refill of tea I would have had a better chance refilling it from behind the bar or hostess stand then at my table. The food was average nothing to go home to tell your auntie about and I could have found more flavor in a late night carne asada burrito from Los betos then this place... I'm just glad they had the Diamondbacks game on to distract me from what I was eating. I'll be sticking to my west side go tos from now on #MosaicCafe #1
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Great service, love the grinder and staff.  Keep up the good work

text: I love this place! Great ambiance (especially if you sit outside on Thursdays when they have live music) and even better food. I was super impressed with the mussels and stuffed jalapenos. The service is always fantastic and I love that this awesome place is just right down the street from my house!!

text:
I always have to be literal when I don't care for a place. Sadly, this hooters was a disappointment. They felt quite sterile and NOT a place to make your regular haunt. text:
Wow!  We have lived in Tucson for years and never even heard of this place!  
We wanted to try something new for breakfast today so naturally I used Yelp!   
We live on the far west side, so this is not a resturant we would normally pass.  It is tucked behind the Gaslight Theater - probably why we never saw it before.
It is hard to know where to start, but here goes:

The outside:  very Americana, very quaint! 

The inside:  more Americana, very patriotic (we are both vets so we love it)!

The coffee:  I am very pickey about coffee.  I usually don't order it unless I know it is good.  My husband ordered a cup & assured me of it's quality, so I got a cup.  Great!  Not too strong & no "burnt" taste.  They also had the little flavored creamers!

The food :  My husband ordered the pancake breakfast with bacon & eggs.  He ordered his eggs over medium & he tells me they were perfectly cooked.  The bacon was good - not over or under cooked.

I ordered the Tucson scramble with home fries & biscuits & gravy.  Whoa....the scramble was a HUGE portion!  You could definitely share this - I took more than half home!  The eggs were seasoned & quite tasty.  The ham chunks were good.....not the "sandwich"  ham slices that you get at some places.  The cheese was generous & evenly distributed.  
The biscuit & gravy was tasty.  You get a cup of gravy & one biscuit.....so here is my biggest issue (albeit not a big one).....you only get 1 biscuit.  I wasted half my gravy!  Did I mention it was tasty?  I hated to waste it!  I will admit I broke off pieces if the biscuit and "dunked it" into the gravy - maybe had I poured the gravy over the biscuit not that much would have been left.

Now...on to the best part... the home fries.  I usually can take 'em or leave 'em.  My husband doesn't like 'em at all.  We actually BOTH loved them.  Piping hot and really crispy on the outside.   The inside was a dream!  They were almost "creamy" on the inside.  That is the best way I can describe them.  There was a seasoning on them, too.  Hands down the best home fries I have EVER  had!

The service:  Wonderful.  Our cups never got to below half!  

We can't wait to try it again!
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: This is the only sushi place close to my house and it also happens to be my favorite! The food is always good. If you come in around lunch expect to wait a while. I would recommend it to anyone though!

text:

text:
This is an amazing restaurant! 

What really impressed me with the restaurant is that they dedicated it to God just like Chick-Fil-A and In-Out-Burger and I believe this business will have the same success as they do. 

When you walk into the place you can feel such a peace and tranquility inside and on the patio.

Here are the wonderful meals that I have eaten so far that were awesome!

Red/Green Chili Fry Bread
Honey/Cinnamon Fry Bread
Taco's deep fried with the ground beef in the shell
Menudo
Salsa
Bean Tostadas

The restaurant has specials such as on Tuesdays and Thursdays $1 Tacos, which are just as good as the non-special days.

Everything is so very fresh and made daily.

If you want a clean environment, good/quick service, courteous staff, reduced prices, amazing and hearty food, and a business that caters to your needs even when a mistake has been made, this is the restaurant to go too. 

The taste of the food never changes and is consistent every time you order your food.

I speak blessings and peace on the success of this business from now until future years to come.
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: I don't know why this place doesn't have more stars at this point! This was my first time trying Blake's and I decided to try their carne adovado burrito with cheese. Let me just say that I AM ADDICTED!!! The meat is phenomenal and full of flavor. I got the red and green chili on the side so I could try both, but just get A LOT of the green chili! I'll definitely be going back and dragging other people with me.

text: I have not eaten much Indian food, but my sister took me here while we were in Tucson.  She did the ordering, so don't ask what we ate, but it was all really good and now I am looking for a good Indian restaurant near where I live.  It was a great place, food and service very good and the prices quite reasonable.  Can't wait to get back to Tucson to eat here again!!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
Green Alfredo and Imitation Crab Chunks?? 

First mistake was that we sat inside, unfortunately it was raining outside so we missed out on what is supposedly a great patio.

The dingy and antiquated interior lighting was apparently installed the same time their famous "copper marinara pot" was; nearly 100 years ago.  

The waiter had been on the job for two days, clearly did not intend to make a career out of working at Carusos, and spilled red wine on the poor woman sitting next to us.  We opted for beer in bottles...

While reading the menu we noticed that the seafood Alfredo featured "a mix of seafood"... right away that sounded fishy... however the staff identified this dish as one of their favorites, so I gave it a try and my wife braved the shrimp in Alfredo.

The entrees arrived in about 20 minutes and after we killed half a basket of what we believe was garlic butter with a side of bread we thanked the staff and surveyed the odd dishes placed in front of us.

The Alfredo sauce was green in color when it arrived... on both plates, which in some way gave me comfort as perhaps it was intended to be that way. Nevertheless, we gave it a try and found that both plates contained little crunchy shells from poorly cleaned and prepared shrimp.

Unfortunately I could go no further once the mushy imitation crab meat that dominated the "mixed seafood" dish slithered off my fork.  Now I've had great seafood linguine in the past but have never found a restaurant brave enough to tarnish their reputation by offering patrons soggy, slimy fake crab chunks in green Alfredo sauce...  

Good luck, maybe try the lasagna on the patio if you dare and let us know what you think!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
Definitely the best ramen joint in Tucson at the moment, at least if you prefer Tonkotsu ramen. The service is brisk and friendly, and the ramen comes out pretty quick after you order it. They have the basic varieties of ramen, along with some non-traditional options, such as veggie and chicken. The broth for the Tonkotsu is flavorful and taste similar to the style you would find at ramen restaurants outside of Tucson. Most of the other restaurants in Tucson that serve ramen are not able to replicate the Tonkotsu flavor accurately. The ramen toppings were also great besides for the sliced pork (chashu), which is on the smaller side and is very plainly seasoned. 

I also had issues with the portion size. The bowl is a lot smaller than what you find at other ramen places, and there is no option for a larger size or even to order extra broth. Spice levels for the ramen is also lacking, so you're stuck with adding mild red pepper seasoning if you like your ramen spicy.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Fast delivery, the restaurant very clean!!! Polite friendly staff from the cashier to the delivery!!!
name: Pizza Hut
categories: Restaurants, Chicken Wings, Pizza, Italian, Fast Food

text: I've eaten here a few times, never been disappointed. The food is bomb. Fresh ingredients, it's own style. Very unique flavors, very original. The staff is always spot on and very friendly  too. Fresh salsa to go with your meal, what gluten free foods too, if that's your taste. Matter of fact, I need to stop in again soon.

text:
This is like the best hole in the wall breakfast place!  The atmosphere is a bit lack luster as I desperately wish they'd change their lighting and put some art work up but it's not really that kind of a place.  Their food is FANTASTIC!  They also have drinkable coffee which I find to be really difficult to find in Tucson.  I had their green chili waffle with carnitas and it was absolutely amazing.  

I was also really impressed with the waitress.  She was never not doing something and kept checking on us through-out the meal.  It's a cute little place with amazing breakfast/brunch you have to check it out!
name: Mother Hubbard's Café

text: My boyfriend and I were visiting from Seattle and found this place through yelp. We both agree that this was the best breakfast we've ever had. I had the suck confi. It was amazing. Very rich so if you are on a diet you may not want to choose it. I absolutely loved this place. Service was excellent and if we ever go to Tuscon again, we will be sure to visit again.

text:
This restaurant is amazing!  I'm not a fan of breakfast & if I could eat breakfast here daily, I would!  The Fuzzy Naval Mimosa was a perfect blend of peach & orange - neither overpowered the other!  The biscuits and gravy was hearty and flavorful!

Matt @ the bar was by far the best server I have ever had!  He was extremely efficient and attentive - all while bartending for multiple servers.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great dishes and an abundance of gluten free options. Very reasonably prices signature cocktails. Staff is alert and accommodating. text: I normally love Wendy's, it's one of my favorite fast food spots BUT this Wendy's is the worst. Both times I've gone the service and food is horrible. The 1st time I was handled a watered down Dr Pepper and like 10 fries in a large fry box  I thought they were having an off day so I gave them another shot 2 days ago and once again just horrible. Happy to say they will not make any more money off of me :)

text: This one is just as good as any other Chipotle, but the rice at this one seems consistently dry. It's not a big deal, but if that's your favorite part or menu item, you might be a little let down. Other than that, the outside looks different than nearly every Chipotle I've been to. We've been here a few times and we'll most likely come back. Three stars!

text: I'm going to give this place four stars because some of the reviews on here are just inane. It's a pretty decent buffet, they've got Mongolian BBQ and sushi too. The green beans were delicious, the service was adequate and for the price tag of $9.99 I'd say it's a good value for the money

text: I had a terrible experience with a to go order. The fries were really really burned. The worst was that I found long piece of hair on the wings. Terrible terrible experience... I am very disappointed.
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
I'm so happy I chose this place, minus the fact that it was on opening day of The Rack, so parking was an absolute nightmare!!

I got there early to meet a friend, so I started with an iced chai tea latte to start while I took advantage of the wireless internet and did some work. The tea was good, not spectacular. I'm more fond of the spicy chai's and this one was not.

When my lunch date arrived, I ordered the French Onion soup with the Asian Sesame Chicken. They plate came with a warm bun which I didn't eat because I try to stay away from bread, which is ironic since I'm at a BAKERY!!

Both the soup and salad were excellent, especially the French Onion soup. Great flavor, but could have used some more stringy cheese! The staff was very helpful and friendly and continued to check on us. I really loved the outdoor patio seating area which I'll take advantage of once the weather cools off a bit! I can't wait to come back!
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text:
The duck confit hash was incredible.
Best breakfast out in quite some time.
Everything was perfectly done.

My dad ordered a cinnamon roll to share, was a huge amount of icing, but it was a perfect cream cheese icing, barely sweet, roll had a perfect caramelized top. 

And the service was spot on.   My tea was replaced twice with a new single serving plunge brewer before my current cup was half empty, without asking.

Barely had a spoonful left in my skillet when done, and they still asked if I was done, but only after my utensils were down.

We didn't feel rushed even though the place was super busy and there was a line.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Love the all you can eat buffet! After 8pm it was two for $20! The rooms are gorgeous, pool is clean and warm and tons of restaurants and bars to choose from. Really great atmosphere! I definitely choose the right place to get away for my birthday!
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: Started with some garlic naan and tried their mango lassi drink. The drink was delicious came out cold, (not cold like a milkshake) thick and smooth. Tasted like I was drinking a mango. They have the BESt chicken tikka masala i have ever tried. We come here alot and while their naan is tasty they tend to burn it :( but their tikka masala makes up for it. I'd definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

text: Raijin Ramen is going to be a regular visit for us.  The service was fast and friendly.  More importantly, the Ramen, man-o-man!  The broth was super tasty, noodles perfectly cooked and thinner which I like. Chris had the black garlic broth and I had the spicy red.  Fantastic new place that just opened!

text: Great service! I liked the pastries better than their breakfast plate entrees. They also provide free coffee while you are waiting to be seated. Their coffee is local and organic! I loved their coffee. My sister in law found a dead fly in her soup. They apologized and didn't charge her for her entree. Also they gave her two free pastries. One of the owners was so apologetic about the mishap. We would come back here again!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Excellent Pizza! The ranch flavoring is top notch!

I did have a couple issues in the past with the amount of flavor crust. I always ask for the most they offer but when the pizzas came there was barely any flavoring. I called them and they rushed out replacements ASAP with extra flavor :)

They go out of their way to resolve issues and please the customer. This is the ONLY place I order delivery from for my family!
name: Hungry Howie's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Food Delivery Services, Food, Pizza

text:
I ate here very recently with my friend Lucy.
 I am happy to say I loved everything we ate and drank. For some reason the water even looked more refreshing that normal.
  I am often disappointed with restaurants here in Tucson. Having travelled a bit and worked in the industry for most of my life. I continually pay for food that is over priced and is just a whisper of what it could be.  The Duck hash was perfect. A little crispy and smooth to the bite. Just salty enough to call it's self  confit of duck. The Grilled Cheese and tomato soup was like eating a bowl of my childhood.  I will be back and loved the atmosphere as well  as the service.
Unique.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: My sis & I came for lunch on a Saturday. Their customer service is awesome & the food is delicious!

text: Cook didn't pay any attention to the specifics of our orders. Waitress was sweet though. Just a traveler passing through for the night getting dinner.
name: Denny's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Diners

text: Great resort all around. We came for the Tucson mariachi conference and just to hang out. Everyone was so friendly and nice when we came in. Check in was super fast, and our room was a regular king and it was spacious for a regular room, it was very nice and contemporatry. Their amphitheater is gorgeous and intimate. Next day I got a workout in their gym, it's nothing special but if you know what your doing you can make it work. We spent all day out by the pool the next day. It was crowded because of the festival. The waitresses got us drinks and we never saw them again. The bars are friendly but seem to be consitantly slow with drinks... The neighbors had a party and we ended up complaining around 230 am. Security came up But they carried on with their party till 330. Front desk told us we should have continued complaining. I guess rowdy loud guests get 5 warning (modern america).... We check out today but they will hold your bags of you want to enjoy the pool before you leave which is nice. We are already making plans to return next year.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: As usual the food was amazing. This place always delivers big time on taste. Maybe my favorite breakfast spot ever. Apart from the deliciousness, service is also a shinning point. Today was extra special. The atmosphere was warm and inviting from the moment we walked in the door. We were lucky to have Hannah C. as our server as she took great care of us from start to finish. With genuinely nice service like we had today, it takes the experience to another level. Great job!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I love this place! They have a nice variety of options for breakfast, as well as baked goods. 

You place your own order at the counter, take a number and they'll bring your order to your table. We've never experienced anything but great customer service here...and we've eaten here several times. It's a nice place to stop when taking a ride on the bicycle; grab a coffee, a cinnamon roll, or whatever looks good in their baked goods display.

It's a nice casual and comfortable setting. They have indoor and outdoor seating. It's nice to have an extra person with you to snag a table because the available tables seem to be a hot commodity :)

We'll be back...I'm sure of it!
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: I was there to celebrate my niece's bachelorette party. The food was okay. The service was horrible, I wouldn't blame it all the on the waitress, but definitely their chefs. Grant it we were a party of 16 but to have 3 plates come out and then another 15 minutes for the other plates to come out one at a time isn't acceptable. Also while I was going to the restroom on the other side of the restaurant, smaller parties were waiting for their food as well. I do not recommend this place unless you have patience to wait that long for their food.
name: Barrio Cuisine
