categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text:
I love that they always have big portions, but certain things transpire to make me sad about the direction this establishment is heading. 

They don't make chili anymore.  How was that ever even a consideration to be in the cards. That's like Burger King nixing the whopper.  

Our waitress got a few things wrong on the first go around, but she was pretty quick to rectify the mistakes. 

At least there was no wait compared to the 40 minute line at cheddars...

Update: Delicious cake. Yum cake.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: This restaurant was extremely uncomfortably hot and upon complaining to the manager, she told us because they had a lot of windows.  Then when one person from our party was unhappy with their food, the same lady told us that's how they make it on the reservation......what? This place is completely overpriced for how bad the service is at this place.  A new restaurant should try a little harder with all the restaurants closing downtown.  We went down to thunder canyon for good service and it was cool and comfy!!
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text:
I had this place bookmarked to try since the Hubs and I love a good steak.  I was pleasantly surprised by the clean edgy cool decor.  It is like rustic cowboy ranch meets semi posh meets wide open spaces.  High ceilings, not super cluttered and very casual yet classy feel.  We had made a reservation on Yelp but did not need it.  They have a lot of tables.  The parking could probably be an issue depending on when you came but we lucked out and found parking right away given it was 5 on a Friday.

The hostess was sweet and seated us at a table by the window and we were facing the bar as well as kitchen down near the end of the restaurant.  The reason I even call this out is that we had a great view of the entire restaurant which was not busy but there was a TON of staff, likely ready for a start of the weekend dinner rush.  Our server came right away and told us the specials and took our drink order.  He recommended the "El Maestro" cocktail.  I went for it, actually went for two of them.  SUPER tasty and spicy with tequila, sweet and sour, some OJ and jalapenos and fruit.  My only gripe is having 2 inside of an hour, I didn't even have a little buzz (low tolerance) which tells me they pour super light.  Annoying if you are throwing down 12 bucks for a drink.  

The Hubs ordered the Porterhouse, I ordered the Filet.  We got a few sides that you order separately and are not included  -- Mac & Cheese, House Potatoes, Calabasitas.  They bring you Charro Beans that are included along with warm tortillas.  So the steaks were great, super tender and tasty.  I did expect more from that Chile Verde Mac & Cheese (really dry), it was "okay" but the house potatoes was like their version of the scalloped potato and was seriously hardcore delicious.  We ended with the PB & Choco Tres Leches... different and it had chocolate and peanut butter, I can't ever say anything negative about that combo.

The service was odd -- the server who shall remain unnamed, even though I remember his name -- was friendly/nice but seemed awkward.  Maybe he was new, I have no idea but if you are working for a restaurant that has a semi pricey menu, you best be on the top of your game.  After he brought us our drinks initially, he stood over at the bar... like the whole time.  Someone else brought our food and got us situated with that... my El Maestro had been empty for at least 10 minutes, and he never once asked me if I wanted another.  My Hubs had to ask for refills on his Iced Tea, twice from people other than our server.  My steak needed a little more time on the grill, and if the Hubs had not waved him over he probably would have just walked back to the bar to hang out over there.  It was not until he brought my steak back that I was able to ask for another cocktail, 30ish minutes after the first one had been sucked dry. The server was not intuitive with his guests, period.  My guess is total inexperience, and this guy would be slaughtered in the server world in a bigger city.  The place was not busy at all, particularly being so well staffed, so give this dude some extra training?

I struggled between the 3 and 4 stars, and 3 stars won out based on the lack of service.  When I think about ratings, I have to put it in the context of the type of restaurant, price, etc.  If I am going to pay these prices, service HAS to be on point.  This is a nice Steakhouse with a Mexican flare and I am really glad I tried it, I am on the fence if I will go back.  It is definitely unique and the food was good -- if you are from Tucson, at least give it a go once.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
I love this store.  It is the one grocery store that I have ever been to that actually puts me in a better mood (as much as I love food I usually hate grocery shopping).  When I go there I feel the urge to buy everything.  I go for the meat, the produce and the cheese and can usually be tempted by the wine as well.  It is a place full of marvels and wonder.  I take in all the sites and smells.  I love that I can get a variety of mushrooms, that all carrots are not the same, that they have gooseberries when they are in season (gooseberry cobbler is one of my favorite desserts).  I love that a lot of their produce is seasonal and fresh.  

I think I have said I love way too many times and I don't think it adequately expresses the joy that I feel as I walk in and take a deep breath.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: I guess this is a case where I just don't get it. The restaurant is wildly popular but I think it's just average. I've been there 3 times. The first time I had the chili relleno which was simply scrambled eggs in an uncooked green pepper with a few tortilla strips on it. The waiter highly recommended the hash browns which came cold and slightly greasy. The next time I had the bacon donut which was tasty but rather tough and a little dry. The third time I had a confection of mascarpone on top of a croissant. But the crossaint wasn't flaky it was tough and the mascarpone didn't quite go. Service was good but the coffee was always lukewarm. So I guess this is a case of more style over substance.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Best Indian buffet in Tucson so far. Came in after hot yoga, on a hot day for some hot Indian food. Oh yeah! We were not disappointed after reading the reviews. 

The buffet station consists of: 2 meat curries (chicken and lamb I think), saag paneer, cauliflower and potato curry (to die for), tandoori chicken, basmati rice, samosas, naan, chickpea curry, 2 salads and freshly made side dips of green chiles and tamarind sauce. 

Didn't manage to try the dessert...was too stuffed.

Will definitely be back once the craving for Indian food comes....which is pretty often :)
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Berry compote french toast is a guilty pleasure. This restaurant stands out in Tucson, the hip vibe is reminiscent of a San Franciscan spot. Service has been great each visit.    My favorite breakfast/brunch spot in Tucson!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Worse than one of the cheap national chains. The extra large 16" pizza had a 3 inch crust (leaving very little room for actual ingredients), it was over cooked, it was cold, the driver was late and it was bland. Don't let their image and prices fool you. It is not gourmet, or even mediocre for that matter.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: This review is based on the staff and customer service. I give the hotel rooms and amenities five stars. I booked our trip as a last-minute getaway online, pricey but the rooms are nice and we like this casino so money is not an object. Casino Del Sol is about 2 hours from our home in Gilbert, when we arrived I was asked for my driver's license and credit card that I used to book the room, they could not find our reservation,claiming we did not have one. I could not find my confirmation email. Rene was our customer service representative and said we did not have a reservation and they were booked for the night. I told him I was sure that I had a confirmation but I needed to find it, it took me about a half an hour but I did find it. I came back up to the desk and showed him, the other girl next to him  showed him the reservation after I again gave them my credit card, apparently he did not know how to look up reservations, lucky me. In the meantime my husband found a hotel nearby to book the room thinking we did not have one so now we had to cancel that one,  no apology from Renee until I said don't you think you should apologize for screwing this all up? he was shocked and apologized but no feeling or acknowledgement that he did something wrong, making excuses the whole time. Thank God I was persistent in looking for my confirmation had we left and gone to another hotel I would have been charged for this room not even knowing that I do indeed have a reservation, scary! This did not start off our weekend Excursion with a good feel, bar service was slow and the measuring of the alcohol is ridiculous, don't give me a drip more than a shot you might not make any money on your liquor at a casino. As the casino got busier throughout the night it was almost impossible to get any kind of drink, lines down the hallway to get to the bar. Ridiculous, bartenders not really caring if they gave good customer service or any customer service at all as if they would never see us again, keep it up you won't see us again! We used to come to Casino Del Sol a lot a couple of years ago, we stopped and I didn't really remember why, maybe this is why, bad customer service. To the management, you really need a better program to encourage great customer service, all the employees seem like this is just a job and are not connected to the reasons why they should be friendly to the people who keep them employed. Everything seems like a hassle. Too bad Casino Del Sol you have the potential to be great. My husband also mentioned about how dirty and disgusting the bathrooms were, no one was keeping up the cleanliness, cigarette butts, pee on the floor, garbage everywhere, garbage cans overflowing. Keep in mind this is from my husband who really doesn't pay attention to these things that's how noticeable it was. I would love to come back here based on the Great variety of games and the potential this casino has to be great but unless I get an acknowledgement from the management on this review we will not return.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: The food was delicious and the staff friendly. Casual clean atmosphere, we have a new go-to Ramen place, yay!
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: Tried this restaurant one morning while looking for some good pastries, we sat at the countertop and ordered coffee, a scone, and a cronut.  Fabulous!   The decor and atmosphere was fun.  I'd recommend getting there early as it was packed within a half hour of opening
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Ok, the oblivious, smarmy, and outright weird staff at the pastry and deli counters have finally scared me away.

I'm done. I've reached the breaking point. Finito. Throwing in the towel. 

I've been glared at, ignored, and skipped over too many times. The middle aged lady with the glasses - well, she's in my top 3 "most annoying" category and for the life of me can't figure out why she actually has a job here... Oh...And what's with the overly friendly side conversations when I'm in a hurry? Blah blah blah.

By the way, Hey deli staff - could you please not have your backs turned constantly and be attentive to the flow of customers? I really don't like having to say "excuse me."

Good grief.. Is it that difficult?
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: I'm eating vegetarian for navratri, and I figure what's a good place for vegetarian.. Indian!   How can it go wrong.  I ordered vegetarian biryani-- it was not good.  Greasy and bland.  I also got paneer tikka pakodas-- tasted like paneer nuggets.  Also bland.   Eh.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: We had the daily chef special. The sunny side up was the best fried egg I've ever had. It's the perfect combination of delicious food with sun flower seeds and olive oil and other ingredients. The pastry was very good too. Not too sweet just the perfect amount of sugar. Everything was great.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Hashbrowns mushy, eggs uncooked I thought I was eating the Rocky Balboa breakfast. Bacon was good! I think I'll skip this place from now on.
name: Jerry Bob's
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional)

text:
Visiting Tucson from out of town and someone suggested this place. I came here on a Monday evening and there were a handful of other diners in the restaurant. The staff was friendly and service was prompt. 

I ordered a bean burrito and the waiter recommended I have it "enchilada style", which features a cheese and red or green sauce topping. The food was horrifically bland. Were it not for the dousing of enchilada sauce, the burrito would not have had any flavor at all. The re-fried beans had the consistency (and taste) of mop water. The side of rice was dry and hardened with age. The "salad" was a couple leaves of shriveled lettuce sprinkled with diced tomato. 

To top off the experience, I paid cash and the waiter short-changed me (only by a dollar, but still...) and I'm writing this review from the floor of the hotel bathroom because this meal is coming right back up.  I see from other reviews that getting ill from this place isn't a unique experience -- I wish I had consulted Yelp before eating here!
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Ok so the only reason there is even a one star rating on here is because I had to in order to put this comment on here so that being said here are my reasons for disliking this place and its staff.First things first one of the grossest things that I acquired while here was witnessing one of the kitchen staff members "cleaning" up the buffets by scraping the food that had fallen off peoples plates and onto the buffet back into the food trays. . The woman did this right in front of me so if that is the kind of thing they are doing in front of people who knows what is going on when people are not watching.  Also something else that is quite nasty is their restrooms, have they never seen a bottle of cleaner?  The restrooms are just disgusting. Not to mention the staff is rude and seemed bothered anytime someone asks for something that should already be done without question, like refilling ones drink for instance. I'm not sure how they always seem so busy. I will never return to U-Like again nor will anyone I know.
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: We eat here regularly. I ordered takeout for the first time last night. I wasn't sure how takeout would compare to dining in. Silly, but I've had bad experiences elsewhere. Order was correct and just as good as dining in. The location is sketchy, but I say this is hands down the best Indian food in Tucson. The staff/owners are super friendly and very accommodating. Masala is phenomenal!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Las Vegas roll was awesome. Yakisoba was alright. Tempura is good. Quick service.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: They take pride in what they do and you can see it with the product(jelly/creme donuts are incredible), I am glad I do not have to travel far to get a good snack, I have tasted their coffee and it also taste great.  My advice is get there early!!
name: Donut King
categories: Restaurants, Donuts, Food

text: I am so thankful that they are just down the street, cause I would be spending a lot of gas to go for pickups. ALL of their food is delish EVERY SINGLE TIME.
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text:
Yucky people hang around there cause I guess they do sports betting.  Not my type of atmosphere.

I went to this place because it was where I needed to meet a friend.  I had a burger and fries lunch special.  The burger was cold.  I am guessing it was precooked frozen meat maybe.  I was there to talk so I didn't even bother telling the waitress.  The fries were plentiful and good.

The waitress was excellent.  I just can't give it more then one star due to the clientele and my cold burger.  I will not go to this place ever again.  I doubt I will try another location either.
name: Famous Sam's Restaurant & Bar
categories: Burgers, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

text: I've only been there once so all I know at this point is that the Dan Dan Noodle and potstickers are OUTSTANDING. The noodles are to die for. I am definitely going back and trying some other things!
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text:
I've heard tons of good things about Prep & Pastry, so when my fiance and I drove by last Sunday morning, I suggested we stop for brunch.

When we walked in, the hostess said it would be about a 45 minute wait, but she wasn't sure since some people had left without telling her. Looking around the restaurant, there were quiet a few empty tables, and there didn't seem to be too many people waiting, so I was slightly confused. But since we weren't in a rush or grungry (the anger of being overly hungry), we decided to wait.

Luckily, we had only been sitting outside for about 15 minutes when our name was called. The interior is super cute! I really liked the high ceilings and how bright the restaurant was. It was definitely the perfect atmosphere for a lazy Sunday brunch.

After much deliberation, we finally made our decisions and ordered.  I ordered the breakfast poutine and my fiance had the chx + toast (fried chicken strips, rosemary brioche french toast, and a blueberry syrup). My poutine was just okay. It was a solid portion, but kind of bland, and I definitely didn't see any cheese curds. On the other hand, my fiance loved his dish! I thought the different components sounded weird on paper, but once I had a bite, I was sold! The chicken was flavorful, and the rosemary french toast was the perfect savory accompaniment, but I do wish it was a little less soggy. However, I did think the chicken was on the dry side.

Although we didn't have room to sample their pastries, they all looked amazing. I will definitely be trying one on my next visit.

I think overall, I would give Prep & Pastry 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding it up to 4 since I think I would be happier if I got a different dish next time. Also, I don't think the wait would be so bad on most weekends, but the Sunday we went was super windy, so I don't think many people wanted to sit outside.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I've been here 3 times since it opened and it is wonderful.  Best Italian food in Tucson!  Service is great and staff very friendly.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: It is what it is. The staff is friendly and the food is plentiful. is it gourmet? No, but it is home style cooked food. You know the kind that sticks to your ribs. Chicken fried steak, biscuits and gravy etc. It is nothing special, which is what i love about it. They are very patriotic as the owner is retired Air Force I think. I've never had a bad experience and sometimes there is a wait because there is literally no open tables (which i take as a good sign at a restaurant).
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: 5 stars, for quality of food, consistency and lively and cool ambiance. Only been disappointed by the food once (sandwich meat tasted dry and was tough) but otherwise the food has been stellar. The have one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches in town, made with brie and pesto, but they excel at even simple breakfast items or the lox option. Their dossants are delicious, every flavor I've had has been YUMMY. Took photos but see there are a million photos of their food already -the presentation of their plates is always excellent. Waiters have to be on their toes to keep up but  are friendly and prompt. It's like a younger, more hip version of Blue Willow. Atmosphere is upbeat, casual, busy. Wish they stayed open longer (especially on weekends) and had more room/tables, the wait times can be very ridiculous at 1 hour to 2 hours for breakfast / brunch on a weekend.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Best wings in Tucson, hands down. No one else can compare to their amazingness. Their beer battered fries are to die for and I love the medium wings, which aren't too hot and so flavorful :) I'm drooling just thinking about it. Always my go to spot :) 
The only downside is sometimes their waitresses can be a little snappy, she sat us at a high rise table pressed up against a wall, was uncomfortable sitting in a chair with no back, no where to put my purse, and smushed up in a tight area. When she came back to ask for our drinks we asked to move, only to be told there were no available tables at the moment but when one clears we can move. There were literally 7 tables open on the other side of the restaurant. We just asked the other waitress that came by a minute later, and were moved immediately. Guess it's just who you get that day. But that won't detract from my 5 star rating because the food is incredible!!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: I love meat, but decided to try a vegetarian dish and am so glad I did! The bengan burthu (creamy eggplant with peas) was incredible. Nice texture, mellow flavor, nicely spiced. The restaurant was packed, so while the staff was friendly,I was neglected for awhile in the corner. I ordered two dishes, rice, and a samosa appetizer and have plenty to take home! Looks like tables are set up for two to four, though did see a larger group of six seated. By 7pm, things calmed down. Will return here soon with appetite and friends.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
Only one word to describe the food here: amazing.  No make it two: absolutely amazing!

After my horrible fiasco the night before at Yoshimatsu I needed something that would absolutely blow my mind away and Ghini's didn't disappoint at all.  The waitresses were really attentive, my coffee cup and water glasses were never less than half-full.  The Eggs Provencal and Strawberry Crepes were simply delicious.  Especially the Eggs Provencal- perfectly fried onion hash browns, buttered toast, sliced tomatoes and two eggs topped with herb seasoning.  I had the whole DONE before my girlfriend finished her hash browns.  Mother would've been proud cause I even ate the orange slice they garnish the plate with and cleaned the crumbs!  With all that good stuff I really thought they would scrimp on the coffee but nope, the drip coffee was bold and rivaled Starbucks drip which was surprising.  

All in all, breakfast at Ghini's was perfect and will more than likely be a weekly affair.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: I teach at a school nearby, so I often get lunch here. The food is excellent, but presentation by the kitchen staff can be, shall I say, unpredictable. Dining in is the way to go with Merendero. I have often brought visitors to Tucson here to get a real taste of Sonoran style Mexican food. There is a lot of competition in Tucson and I think they are in my top five for sure.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: Today my sister and I received excellent customer service, or rather excellent customer care. Brian, the Store Manager and his crew were genuinely the BEST I've ever experienced in my 53 years. He said "I just want to treat people the way I want to be treated". Well, stop in at the 7250 North LaCholla location and see what it's really like to receive excellent customer service. Thank you Brian!
name: Papa Murphy's
categories: Pizza, Restaurants

text:
Let me start by saying that I wish an AJ's would open on the east side of Tucson!  We absolutely love this store!  They stock items and brands that you just can't find anywhere else in town.  They have lots of specialty, high quality foods.  Want to cook like a real chef?  Shop at AJ's for the finest of ingredients!  They have all kinds of produce to choose from, and it is always fresh.  The meats always look fantastic.  

Their prepared foods are also phenomenal.  Their pizza is a huge slice, that is delicious and fresh, and one of the best slices I've found in Tucson.  The bagels are decent, and they use whipped cream cheese, which is awesome!  Their desserts are what we usually stop in for.  They have so much to choose from.  I love the cheesecakes, and my husband likes the cupcakes and other small bite items.  Their scones and chocolate croissants are also yummy.  I've also purchased the pre-packaged cookies of various flavors, and they've always been soft and yummy.

Their flower department is beautiful, with species of flowers that I haven't seen at a grocery store before.  I love picking up flowers here!

The store is always very clean.  The employees are kind and helpful.  I love AJ's, and my only complaint is that there are none closer to my house!
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: I have eaten here several times, and every meal from appetizers to deserts has been excellent. This is my new favorite Italian restaurant in Tucson, especially on the east side. The ambiance is warm and friendly, the service has been professional, the food and wine excellent, and there's even quiet outdoor seating.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: Our first of many more visits to this breakfast/brunch restaurant. From the owner to the servers....staff is friendly, knowledgeable and extremely attentive. We enjoyed the poppy seed bread French toast infused with blueberries, lox and an omelette. Everything was simply delicious and paired well with the specialty mimosas. .
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Quick and tasty sushi, no complaints here.  I ordered a few salmon rolls and everything was tasty with great service.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: Not the best ! Was expecting better ! The  corn tortillas are store bought and the salsas are old . The rice is so bad tasting no flavor in the white and the Spanish rice tastes from a box . The fish was fishy. Waste of time would not recommend Calle tepa is 10000 steps above this place !
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Very nice breakfast. Fruit is fresh. Whole wheat bread actually is. Homemade food. Note that you order in line and then sit. Service may not be super fast but food is worth the wait.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: I LOVE this place. The food is unique, and really good! It's kind of a hipster atmosphere which really isn't my thing, and it's kind of small, but the food is worth it! AND you get free coffee while you wait for a table! And it's good coffee!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Hired their food truck for a party I hosted. I have set the bar so high for my other parties now. The churros were INCREDIBLE!! I am still thinking about them and my party was two weeks ago. Great customer service and really tasty churros. I love the story behind their business. The use the recipe that their grandfather created and took over the churro making business once he was too old to work. Grandpa knew what he was doing. It is perfection!
name: Just Churros
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Food, Mexican, Spanish, Desserts

text: Have to pick up an Apple pie for my relatives in Flagstaff before visiting. Some of the special things from Tucson that people dream about.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: A diamond in the rough....I've ordered take out a few times recently and each time has been fantastic. Ingredients are hot, fresh and fast. Love it. Price is right. Can't go wrong!
name: Wei Asian Cafe
categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text: The best Indian Fry Bread! My son even loved this place. Order the Taco if it is your first time it will be plenty!
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: We had a very disappointing meal here  the hummus was flavorless and overly thick. The lemon soup was overpowered with lemon flavor. Gyro meat was dry, and the pita bread is not homemade. Finally the tabouleh was made of large pieces of tomato and cucumber. It was lazy preparation. Lastly, the meal is far from moderately priced.
name: Sunrise Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Greek, Coffee & Tea

text: I am obsessed with the Les Tomates/Garlic Lovers  sandwich and the seasonal Lavender Lemonade. I would buy it by the gallon!!! It's soooo delicious. They also have a terrific dog-friendly outdoor patio. My French Mastiff loves to eat at Ghini's as much as I do :) Probably because he gets spoiled with treats whenever I bring him.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
I thought it was good. Our server was especially attentive - a dirty plate never sat on our table for more than 2 minutes and our water glasses never went empty. I enjoyed the freshness of the food and selection. 

Price was fair and everyone in my family left full :)
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text: Enjoyed everything about this place. Friendly service, great food.  I had the chicken mole and very pleased with flavor.  Their blueberry mojito was light, refreshing and delicious.
name: El Sur Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
Food: The food here is amazing. Their food is fresh and get as much of their ingredients as they can from local farmers. They have unique dishes for the adventurous and a fresh take on basics for those who like to stay in their comfort zone. Have too many favorites here that I can't pick just one. 

Oh and did I mention the build your own mimosa bar that they offer!


Service: The service here was impeccable! Warm greeters, great service. They were continually checking back with us to make sure we had all we needed and that all tasted good. Very friendly and personable people. 

Atmosphere: The inside of this restaurant is open, welcoming, clean, and contemporary. The outside patio is awesome! Perfect for breakfast and brunch!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I was born and raised in Tucson so in 34 years of life I can still say that Caruso's is one of my favorite restaurants to eat at.  I was a shocked to see that it only averaged 3 stars on yelp and even more so read some of the other reviews.  One person started the review by attacking Tucsonans for accepting mediocrity for food.  I think that said more about the reviewer than Tucson or Caruso's.  

Caruso's is located on 4th Ave. so it's in an active environment that is fun.  They have indoor or outdoor seating available and both are enjoyable.  The Caruso special is always a delicious dinner (spaghetti, ravioli and meatballs).  Clams and Shrimp Adriatic is awesome with white sauce.  The lasagna is incredible.  There is a full wine menu and the complimentary bread is better than bread I've paid for at other Italian restaurants.  If you want to go out and have a good time, it is to be had here.  As some of the other reviewers mentioned, from time to time, I have experienced bad service but I would not let that make me forget about all the times I have received wonderful service there.  I still love the food and atmosphere here.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: I didn't have a pleasant experience at all! First I check and she tells me my card is declined so I proceed to figure out why and call my bank and the room had already been charged twice amd went through. Then the lady at the front desk wrote down the wrong room number so I had to return to the front desk to tell her my keys didnt work. So after over an hour I am finally in my room. Very disappointed with no apologies from any staff.  To top matters off when I returned from dinner (which was fantastic) I noticed someone had been in my room and rearranged some things on the bed and the slippers were out. Total violation of privacy I feel. Short story NEVER RETURNING!!!
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: For a standalone casino, this was a pretty nice place. We found a good amount of choices for food and drink, servers came around to the slots regularly and alcohol was a fair price. There is a decent selection of slots, though none of the really newer, grand ones (ex. Game of Thrones). We experienced good payouts and left winners.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: We love AJ's! My husband and I visit Tuscan at least 6 times a year and stop at AJ's at least once during evey trip. We love their iced coffee, beautiful pastries, sandwiches and sushi! If the weather is good we enjoy sitting on the patio next to the fire. If you are looking for a gourmet grocery store or for a coffee while you shop at La Encantada,  I highly recommend a stop here first:).
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: Excellent food we go there every time we're in Tucson. Nothing changes poor slow service long wait times and lines. Even when you order in advance you still have a long wait.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Best Indian food in Tucson when you can't be in India itself.  Very good curry and butter chicken.  Atmosphere in restaurant is okay but it's really the food that I go for.  Prices are reasonable.  Solid place.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Wow! Can't wait to go back. The yummy champaign flight is a fun way to try different mixers.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Just wow! I am an out-of-towner and wanted a good breakfast. We found this place and were pleased from the beginning. We loved the check in feature so we could drive and be in line. The staff was very welcoming and observant. I, for instance, have certain food restrictions and they were more than willing to accommodate. My mother, also has food restrictions (although different from mine), and they customized her order to make it suitable for her.  The food came promptly and.....IT WAS DELICIOUS! Everything, down to the last berry, was perfect. Lastly, we asked about the pastries and they were beautiful. The chefs make what they want each day so there isn't a menu, but embrace the surprise!!!! If/when I come back, I will definitely visit this establishment again!!!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Got some take out from Fresco Pizza.  The pizza was yummy.  Great crust.  Also had a veggie filled calzone that was really great.  Just the right amount of cheese and veggies in a crisp crust.  Got a coupon for checking in on Yelp as well!  Good Sunday Pizza Stop!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: Poor service and long wait (over 30 min.).  My wife's dish was good but mine was cold and bland.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: I tried some of "The Bakehouse's" zucchini bread at A.J.'s, and I could almost not stop eating the samples.  I am not a big fan of zucchini and usually not of pumpkin/banana/zucchini bread either.  But there is something amazing about The Village Bakehouse drinks and sweets.  I would definitely recommend their "artisan" drinks.  They are usually creative (something like apple pie caramel latte and the like).
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: Liked everything about this restaurant, very clean, decorated nice, waiters second day on the job and  doing quite well he was very friendly, food arrived fast and the Mongolian pork was excellent. A bit of an expensive lunch by my standards but worth it.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text:
I don't know about all these negative reviews. I've been here several times and had nothing short of a great time. I was here a couple of Sunday's ago for a football game with a friend and I had amazing service. 

I only had the chili cheese fries, and they were awesome! Our server, I think her name is Sandra, was nice and sweet and she recommended many things for us to try, it was awesome. My only issue is that it does get a bit loud when there is a major game on, or when they blast the music. Though, the food is great and so is the atmosphere.

I will definitely be back here.
name: Famous Sam's
categories: Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife, American (Traditional), Sports Bars

text:
Caruso's is the Italian food I grew up with - it's my standard and I fully admit my bias. 

That said, I love the atmosphere with the dark lighting, black lights, and separate rooms. On a nice fall or spring evening, the outdoor garden is simply beautiful. As for the food, I've loved everything I've had: the eggplant, the manicotti, the lasagna al forno (meat), the antipasta, the garlic bread - I coudl go on and on. The waitstaff is very friendly and the bus boys keep your water full. 

It can get super crowded on the weekends but if you have good company, it's worth the wait.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: We tried Growler's for the first time today. I love the decor and the TVs were in good spots and not too loud. The food was fabulous. We had the burger special which involved a delicious mustard sauce, and the pulled pork sliders which were served with cole slaw on the sandwich, which was perfect. We had a Moscow mule that was made perfectly. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. 4 stars only for the very limited menu and slow-ish service from the kitchen. We'll be back to taste some beer.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text:
My family and I frequent this location because it's conveniently located near our house, but time and time again we are disappointed and ask ourselves WHY!?!? we continue to go there. From sandwich buns that taste like cigarette smoke, to forgotten items (several times), over charging, food poorly made, or just a completely wrong order altogether. They offer to replace items or give a cookie but when this happens repeatedly it seems as though there is poor management and poor food quality control. I do not recommend this location!

Today they forgot an item that we ordered and we didn't notice the missing item until we got home. We called and went back to pick it up get home and it was ice cold... REALLY!!!! They couldn't make us a fresh one?? Smh. I called back to express my disappointment they offered to replace it again... If I came back AGAIN? Um, no thank you! My appetite was ruined at this point.
name: eegee's
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text: Seriously some of the most delicious steak I have ever had. Juicy and tender. Cooked rare with bone in. It's a bit pricey but worth it for that quality steak. The only side we ordered as the mac and cheese and it was solid, but the guacamole was out of this world! Spicy, hot, and full of guac goodness
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Down from Phoenix for parents weekend and had to re-visit and second time was just as good. Big menu, good portions and fast service.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: The Florentine croque madame AMAZING!! The creamy taste of the gruyere and bechamel, ooh la la! Next time I come I need the family with me to try a variety of things on the menu. Happy hour looks appealing. I need to move closer. Thank you Dee for the excellent service.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Great variety of very tasty tacos. Carne asada was my favorite followed by the shredded beef. Aguas frescas are also really good. Lastly they have free chips and salsa. All delicious. I lived in Mexico for 2 years so I don't like fake tacos. These are great.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: I went to the Blake's on River and Craycroft which recently opened. I ordered a cheeseburger and fries with a milkshake, it was okay. Nothing great. We also ordered the chicken finger boat which is supposed to come with 4 chicken fingers, but instead we got two regular sized chicken tenders and two popcorn chicken looking nuggets with no chicken all breading. It also took about 15 minutes total with two cars ahead of us. I'm not gonna bother going back, take the drive to In-N-Out or Culver's.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: We have been here AT LEAST a couple dozen times (probably a lot more haha) and keep coming back! We LOVE this place! All the guys here are awesome but Victor is our favorite! This place is always busy but Victor treats you like you're the only one here. Great service, friendly and genuine! He's always smiling and having fun! The staff works so hard and you will never have to wait long! The food is always amazing! I tried all the tacos but the al pastor is my favorite! I always get the al pastor tacos, the Mexican rice and the watermelon-cucumber drink.. sooo good! If you haven't been here, you gotta come check it out! You won't be disappointed!!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
This place is fantastic. Imagine a high end steakhouse fused with a good Mexican restaurant. 

I got the bone in ribeye which was amazing. I asked them to grill some jalapeños to go with it which was the perfect compliment. They serve it with their flavor of pinto beans which are really good. 

Lastly, we got the brussel sprouts which were also really good. 

Can't wait to get hungry and go back.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: I was rather excited to try this taco bar, but I have to say, I left disappointment in with some stomach distress to say the least. First off, you go up to a counter to order, and the boy there didn't seem to understand what I was ordering. Then you move to the next person (like at chipotle) and they ask what you're ordering again... Because there's no communication between the team. (That be a great opportunity to upgrade without paying!) The result was, we ended up not getting some of our side orders. But you do pay at the end of the counter. Then we went to sit down and the tables were all dirty, so I grabbed napkins and some water to wipe off our own table quickly since it was the only one available. Then my partner went to grab some salsas. After she set her plate down, I went to grab some salsa and lime and napkins. The salsa bar was messy and in need of cleaning. And I should've heeded the warning of hot taco salsa, cuz the spicy one was so hot my mouth burned for 20 minutes, which surprised me cuz I like hot hot salsa. I had immediate heartburn too... Which I rarely get from spice. The tacos were OK I guess, I make better at home - - nothing to rave about and yes, they were SMALL street tacos. The black beans had a strange spice like rosemary or thyme and were underdone & not very edible. To top all this off, The interior atmosphere was loud crowded and noisy, I can't even tell you if they were playing music because I can barely hear my sweetie sitting across from me. Oh and it was lunchtime, not happy hour. When I got up to get my final refill of water and dump my tray, I finally saw a young man coming around cleaning with a cloth. He left the dirty cloth sitting by the edge of the salsa bar the whole time I was refilling my drink and my partners'. Then I saw him return to pick something up off the floor, and return to grabbing the cloth and wiping around the salsa bar. Later that day when I got home, both my partner and I both had stomach distress. I won't add anything else except I don't think I'm returning to this taco bar, especially because I agree with another review here: we live in a town with way too many good tacos to return to this mediocre taco bar.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Had a meeting with 11 people and went to Fresco. Everyone was starving so, I was concerned that food might take a while to come out considering, I ordered for the whole group at once. I was really surprised when the salads came barely 10 minutes after I sat back down and the rest of the food followed shortly after. They brought everything we needed in terms of plates/napkins and came back often to clear plates without interrupting our meeting. The staff was very friendly and Raven who helped take the order was very helpful in offering suggestions to make sure we had enough food for the group. Great experience and the food was delicious!!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
6 of us drove down from Las Vegas this past weekend for a concert at the AVA Amphitheater.  We stayed at Casino del Sol.  The rooms were very nice, and well appointed, and we enjoyed the pool area.  We ate at the buffet Saturday morning for breakfast, and it was decent for the price ($9, but we had a dining credit for signing up  for the player's card).  Nice selection of table games and slots, as well.  Our only complaint would be late-night dining.  There are only 2 options, a diner (45 minute wait), or a take-out window at a Mexican place.  The wait was VERY long, although there were only 2 people in front of me when I ordered.  A huge group of drunks came in after my order, and all received their food before I did.  My order was not complex - nachos and a burro.  Unacceptable.

The staff was very friendly, although quite confused about splitting payment for 2 rooms between 6 people.  They relied on the "our system doesn't allow partial payments".  In 2014, they should have a better system.

Overall, nice stay.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: It's been our favorite Chinese restaurant for 18+ years. Cashew Chicken and Chicken Chow Mein Crispy are both outstanding. The Lemon Chicken and Orange Chicken (ask for the sauces on-the-side) are both very, very good. On any of their spicy dishes you can ask them to spice it to your heat preference/tolerance, so you everyone can enjoy their meal.
name: China Dragon Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: The food was great. I like to grill skirt steak at home  meaning I already had high expectations when I ordered. Was not disappointed, steak was perfecrly good and sode of beans and rice was good. Definitely a restaurant I will come back to.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
The Maple Bacon Cronut is little too sweet side can't taste the saltiness of bacons
The Cubano is excellent!
The fresh whole milk is very good
The Pork Belly Benedict is good, but the bread a little too hard to cut through.
The Server is great
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Chips are delicious!! Salsa is fresh and out of this world!!!  I'm officially addicted.  I am usually not a big meat eater but the shredded beef here is very delicious, moist, and flavorful.  The tortillas are authentic! And to boot all the employees are friendly and provide great customer service.  Only been during lunch and there is usually a line almost out the door.  I hope this one lasts!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
AJs to the rescue!

I'm not a big fan of resort food, so wee decided to have breakfast here.  I was looking for the omelette bar like they have in Phoenix, but no dice.  We had the breakfast chorizo burrito ($3.99) and small cup of coffees for my hubby and me.  My cutie pie wanted the cherry turnovers ($1.99) and coconut water.  I've never been a big fan of cherry pastries and he loves them.  Weird.

We also bought some bread, snacks, beer, juice and wine to take back to The Westin.  

We're a big fan of their boulangeries-pâtisseries!!!
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: Pretty good sushi at a reasonably fair price.  Had tuna, yellow tail and the Mexican roll.  All were really good.  The only thing keeping them from 5 stars is the lack of menu choices for sushi.  I would definitely recommend.  Especially if your staying at the hilton Garden inn and like sushi.
name: Sachiko Sushi
categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars

text: Really love the green chile burger and SUPER happy Blake's came to Tucson.  While I do live on the southeast side, I have no problem driving thirty minutes to get one of their burgers.  The drive through is pretty busy, but they move people through fast.  Welcome to Tucson Blake's!
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: The Real Deal!  This the only Place I want to Eat!  Period!   Home Cooking at a reasonable price!  Keep up the good Work!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This place is amazing! I've heard about this restaurant through the owners mother! When I was in the hospital I was placed next to a wonderful elderly lady that told me her son owns this restaurant and recommended it to me of course! I was her roommate for several days and will never forget your mother. Hope she is doing ok and got home safely. :)! You have my vote on best Italian around.
name: Gusto Osteria
categories: Restaurants, Italian

text: I've been to plenty of Jerry Bob's in town. This meal was adequate,  but the time from ordering and being served was over an hour. Yes, I said OVER AN HOUR. It got to the point where the waitress would come by, apologize for the delay several times, yet no food. Adjacent tables were finishing their meals, and joking with us about why we hadn't been served. I'm a patient guy, however.  When we finally got served, the waitress came by and said she would discount our check. She took of the price of two coffees! We asked to speak to the manager, Juan. Instead a female worker appeared, listened to us, went to the kitchen and talked to Juan. She returned, and this time discounted us one of the entrees.  We remarked that we had a coupon that woukd have netted us the same result, and asked to have the entire check comped. She returned to Juan, discussed this with him again, and ended up comping our entire bill. Hijole! Customer service should be obvious, but not to these folks! Don't plan on returning to this location any time soon....
name: Jerry Bobs
categories: Restaurants, American (New)

text: Hadn't been to the Dish for some time ( since the remodel) and was worried it would loose it's charm and intimate atmosphere and fantastic menu No problem. It's still very tiny and the food continues to be amazing. We didn't get reservations in time for a table but ate at the bar which was just as good. Wine was excellent and he sweet breads were too. Don't be afraid to try them here!! Wish I could eat here more often and will keep it high on my list of places to eat in Tucson next time I'm in town.
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text:
The three and a half stars this place has right now is about right. 

I can't say it's a three, because it has some menu items that are tasty and different than other breakfast/brunch restaurants and is not a diner. I also can't say they've sold me on a four, and it's for sure not the "Best Breakfast in Town." 

I'm giving this place a four because the Bloody Mary I had was delicious and my server was extremely friendly and helpful. I also thoroughly enjoyed the toasted mini baguette that came with my corned beef hash in place of the English Muffin. The corned beef hash was decent, but not the best, and while I ordered my eggs over medium because I dislike having any runny white part, one of my eggs was not runny in the yellow part either, which I would have loved to sop up with my yummy baguette. 

This place is BUSY on the weekend. We went pretty late brunch, around 11, and still had to wait around 5-10 minutes to get a decent table. They attempted to sit us at a table awkwardly positioned next to where both servers pass by and the patrons stand to pay. We opted out of that one and waited a little longer for them to clean off a table in the side dinning area. The patio was packed and loud, and about half way through our meal a group of loud college boys were sat near us, which sped us through the second half of our meal.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
Found some new favorites at Prep & Pasty!  

The pork belly sandwich is fantastic, and the fried chicken with rosemary french toast and blueberries is something I'm still thinking about 4 days later.

Loved them.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Pizza was delicious. Had the margherita and loved it. Also got free bread sticks for checking in. The service was good, although the guy at the counter seemed a little unhappy to be there. Overall, good experience.
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text:
I am a longtime fan of Claim Jumper but a recent expierence has left me sour !

On my 04/29/12 visit on a Sunday afternoon the atmosphere was nice, the service was great but my fish was incredibly bad.

I ordered the Tilapia Biance and with the first bite I knew it was off.  It tasted like it had been cooked in dirty coppery pasta water.  I ate the shrimp and the side portions but didn't touch the two pieces of fish.

When my waiter, who was very friendly and attentive, took the plate away he commented that I didn't touch the fish, and I said something to the effect of "Ya, the fish was a little off today".  I didn't make a fuss because I was with a party of friends.  I was suprised that he didn't offer an accomodation, as I clearly hadn't eatan a bite of the core portion of my $20.00 Entree.

When I got home in the evening I wrote the Manager and the Claim Jumper guest relations department of my problem and inputted my ticket number and server number, and contact information.

It has been a week now and no one has contacted me to respond to my concern.

I was relatively certain that someone would promptly respond and at the very least provide a gift certificate for a future visit or something.

I will avoid Claim Jumper for the next year or so, there are plenty of other Restaurants in Tucson where I can go on a Sunday afternoon and not be concerned about the quality of the food.

Maybe my expectations are too high ...
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Four of us had dinner here last evening. It was perfect! Everything from food to service was excellent. Two of us had the short ribs, which were prepared to perfection and served with scalloped potatoes and grilled brussel sprouts. We had a made at the table guacamole for four, and I had equites as a side. One guest had salmon and one had the porterhouse steak. Too full for dessert, but we would all return in a heartbeat! Great find.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Sheri Punjab is deliciano. Tandoori chicken is good so is  the aloo matar. Since we were kids, we ate there off and on. The waiters always fill your beverages really quickly. The food was ready quickly and delicious. I would highly recommend Sheri Punjab to all who like this type of cuisine.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: I had been wanting to check this place out and finally got a chance once the opening-week lines died down.  It is very much a fast-food experience, above the typical chains, but also not a fancy restaurant.  The staff was very helpful, and the manager came out to make sure everything was good with my meal.  I find myself craving the burgers and keep going back.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: One of the best restaurants in all of Tucson. Prices are great and the food is amazing. Extremely fresh ingredients and great atmosphere. Great place for lunch and dinner. You'll love it.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
This one's a "I'm glad it's around, but it's not my thing."  After all, the world needs places that counter that sterile, safe, manufactured feel that Starbucks has standardized.  

Safehouse is filled with cigarette smoke, a vintage arcade game, and looks like some kind of awesome desert-ravaged, time-warped, demented 1970s ski lodge.  Ah, yes, that evens things out nicely.

That said, the smoke is just too much for this non-smoker.  The coffee is comparable to other places.  This place is overflowing with atmosphere, though.  If you smoke -- or maybe are shooting a noir film -- I'd definitely recommend it.
name: Safehouse
categories: Coffee & Tea, Nightlife, Restaurants, Pool Halls, Food

text:
The reviews are so glowing here I was excited to come.
What I got was more Tucson Mexican mediocrity and somehow ridiculous pricing. None of the food has standout flavor, only standout prices.
Come here if you can't be asked to go outside of Congress to eat and have a hole in your wallet.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Hmm. I've been on a quest to find a good Italian restaurant. I have yet to do so. Caruso's is however a step in the right direction. Caruso's is not a fancy Italian joint, which is a good thing. I find all fancy Italian restaurants to be duplicates of each other. Caruso's is best described as a superior flavored Buca Di Beppo or C&O.  Sad thing is I only went there on my last night in Tucson after 4 years. I'd love to go back, its got fantastic outside seating. Especially on those fantastic Tucson nights. I can't quite recall what I ordered, but I remember enjoying the bread, the side sausages(a lot!), and the prices!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
One of my favorite brunch places in Tucson (and that's pretty stiff competition)

The staff is friendly, the restaurant is set up well and the menu is routinely updated and top notch. Besides, brunch without alcohol really is a sad, late breakfast!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Best hamburger I have had since coming to Tucson in 2006. The food here is great! They also have an extensive tea collection to choose from. I was there for brunch with a group of 4 and did not have an issue getting a table. The staff is very friendly and the service was excellent. Now I will have to try the breakfast!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I love a good breakfast place and Prep & Pastry is definitely one of those "hip" places. I usually prefer more diner style breakfast joints but I gave this a try. I'm very picky with eggs when it comes to restaurants and the best eggs for me personally are from here. The thing I don't enjoy is the fact that I feel as if they try to reinvent foods. The biscuits and gravy are made with duck fat gravy? NEVER do I turn down biscuits and gravy but just saying it has duck fat really throws me off. The food is great, hands down. All of the workers are very laid back which adds a nice touch to the atmosphere. This restaurant is definitely something worth to try if you want something a little different. I'd rather have some down home breakfast but this is good as well.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Maybe I just came on a weird day, but I didn't find it worth the hype. The menu seemed pretty varied and my mimosa was quite tasty, but the pork belly sandwich was really hard to eat and just...not impressive. The service was great though and I would probably come back to try some other things.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Ex boyfriend's favorite place, his friend is the manager or owner, not sure which one, but the atmosphere is the best. I love sitting outside, and I love the adobe, part modern style. food is fantastic. Go there if you haven't, get there early int he morning, wait is long but so worth it!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Pretty amazing! Not much curb appeal so..., was hesitate about going in. Glad I did! The food was fresh and authentic. The grill guy and cashier did an overall good job at customer service: friendly and helpful. The place is clean and all food prep areas were immaculate.The only issue I had was with the watermelon aqua fresca: too sweet and was really awful! Otherwise, I will be back.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
It is a little surprising that the two Golden Corral locations in Tucson are vastly different. This one is the older location, and it goes without saying to avoid this place at all cost. As an avid buffeter (yes I just made up the word), I came to this place a lot. Now that I've matured and actually want quality buffet (and other quality food served at sit-downs), this place was not of the first to get the axe of places to go.

If you are looking for a quiet meal, don't step inside this place. Kids run around screaming everywhere. Parents are loud and obnoxious (and sometimes borderline abusive to their kids), and many people are rude when trying to get the food on their plates.

When it comes to healthy food, I'm convinced all of Golden Corral is bad. I've observed, specifically at this location, items like the coleslaw, tuna salad, and potato salad coming out a can, the lettuce and spinach is never kept at a cool temperature, and the hot veggies (ie the carrots, the broccoli) taste like they came out a microwave. But that desert bar seems constantly well-maintained and every fried food available cooked fresh. In other words, the they successfully make healthy food taste so bad that that you get so angry and thus has to devour yourself in all it's high-calorie, heart-disease diabetic-causing food.

Customer service was not this location's specialty. I only had one good waiter who has been with the Golden Corral franchise since they had a location at 1st Ave and Wetmore. I always have an eye and an ear open on the employees. They have little interest in ensuring the customers are happy. Then again, some of the customers there are not worth giving good service to. I say this with the mindset that one of the problems in this country is that parents (and many individuals for that matter), don't care about what foods we are feeding ourselves and our children. Sorry for going off-topic.

To summarize, eating at this location is terrible. The new location on Thornydale has much better customer service and has a bigger selection of foods, including healthy options (still not the best, but better). In fact, i was at the other one recently and enjoyed it. This location just doesn't have quality food and the customer service that makes it worth going to.
name: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill
categories: Buffets, Restaurants, American (New), American (Traditional)

text: Food was good for a buffet good service too  mostly everything tasted great satisfied customer. Also nice and clean
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: Best Indian you can get in Tucson and for a good price but there isn't a dinner buffet, which really is the shinning piece of places like this .
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
I went to AJ's the day before Thanksgiving to get all my goodies for a nice meat/cheese tray to snack on before the big meal. 

The service here is phenomenal. The lady behind the deli counter was super helpful, let me try pieces of meat before deciding and had great suggestions. They were so busy and she didn't get annoyed with me needing variety of 1/4lb thinly sliced meats. 

The selection is great for the deli meats and assorted artisan cheeses, and the service cannot be beat.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: Overpriced and not worth the hype. The food is okay, but nothing I couldn't cook at home. I don't enjoy spending 15 dollars on a meal if I don't leave full and I'm not wowed by it.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I can only speak for the pastries because I didn't get a chance to stay and eat but I am definitely coming back!  The dossants are the truth - maybe not cronuts, but definitely worth the trip.  I ordered several for one of my clients and took a couple home myself. I won't waste time covering old ground but needless to say, I agree with the other reviewers about the quality of their work.  And it wouldn't be a proper review without me commenting on the excellent customer service!  The young lady that helped me also doubled as the hostess but that didn't stop her from immediately taking my order and assembling it herself.  I love service with a sense of urgency.  I got a glance of the Pork Belly dish walking by and almost tackled the waiter, but I showed some restraint. As the Terminator said, "I'll be back".
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I loved the fish tacos and the salsa bar! Very nice staff and very helpful since I was there on my own with my baby. They carried my things to the table and helped me with the high chair. I will definitely be back!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
My review is heavily biased by the fact that I'm a French bread snob.  It is extremely difficult to find authentic French baguette in the US, and for me, if it's not close to authentic, it's not really worth eating.  Ghini's bread is much closer to the American supermarket 'baguette' than anything you'd find in a French-speaking country.  Actually, very little of the menu strikes me as French.  

I went here for a weekday lunch.  It was packed with people.  The service was a bit slow and seemed to forget about us--they were friendly though, so it didn't bother me too much.  The menu is extensive--tons of good sandwich options.  I ordered one of the vegetarian sandwiches, and it was ok, but not swoon-worthy.  It was served on their somewhat dry, bland baguette, which didn't help.

Overall, I wish I could love this place, but I found it a bit disappointing.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: The steak I had was perfectly cooked, but it was the priciest steak ever and it came with just a side of beans. Two small margaritas full of ice and one steak came to a staggering 61 dollars. In a town where most places are a breeding joint for e coli, this is a safe bet. But I like to say that from now on I ll cook my own steaks at home for a fourth of the price and I will make my own huge margaritas to go with it! The server ought to learn to serve people better at those prices.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Homemade horchata and all you can eat chips and salsa bar... (maybe the chips weren't all you can eat, but we didn't see a sign saying otherwise) but yeah, need I say more?! Authentic tacos and Mexican food fare. The meat in the tacos we ordered was melt in your mouth, and torta was well assembled. We were salivating for our food that we didn't even stop for a picture. Parking around the area is scarce but if you find a spot far away, it's worth the walk.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: Amazing food!! The servers were attentive and the food came out fast. Definitely recommend. We tried the S'mores French toast, grilled cheese (a must have!!!!) and the "all hail the omelette." I tried the mimosa with blueberries (not sure of the name), but so good!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I am truly in love the The Dish.  Went there for my second time in a month.  The QUIET atmosphere, friendly service and delicious food hard to beat.  The spinach salad was outstanding as was the potato soup for starters.  My husband & I had the chicken and I don't know how they do it - moist, flavorful, perfect temperature and the mashed potatoes and vegetables just as perfect.

One of our friends had the tuna and another the lobster.  There was not a bite left on their plates.  For dessert we split a creme brulee and a chocolate cake with a cherry sauce.  No bites left on either of those plates either.  

Over all experience simply delightful.  What a great way to celebrate my birthday.  Can't wait to return.
name: The Dish Bistro
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, Restaurants, American (New), Food

text:
Traditional Native American flatbread smothered in Mexican ingredients. It's delicious and just off the culinary beaten path to warrant a stop on a road trip but also completely crowd pleasing for finicky eaters.

Also, the lady who served us was incredibly sweet. Like crazy kindly. 

It's very much a little hole in the wall but the back patio is a pleasant spot to chill. No beer unfortunately.
name: Indian Frybread-Manna From Heaven
categories: Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional), Indian, Food

text: food is great, although the wait can be long and they wont accept to-go orders over the phone. still worth the effort.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: We are Friday regulars at the first location on 22nd but that one is wildly popular and always packed so we tried the new location. LOVE! This is truly a gem. My favorite AUTHENTIC Mexican joint here! And don't get me started with the price. We leave this place spending 30 bucks for myself and my man with a big full belly and a buzz! Go here! Do it!  That are both consistently amazing but this one is bigger and the ambiance is nicer!
name: El Sur Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
In reality 4.5 stars

I was pleasantly surprised when I came here for brunch. First, the staff takes their Jobs as seriously as a heart surgeon takes performing open heart surgery. And they keep the coffee coming. As does the eater with the glass quart milk bottle left on the table and real sized water glasses.
Interesting dishes and pastries and a liberal use of Duck and gravy in the menu. The strawberry preserves are ethereal  but only 1 slice of bread for side order of toast. The chicken and Toast was great as was the omelette . The pouting was too much.  The thing that brought down the score was the 2 pieces of bacon for a side dish. We like to share an order for the table but since there were more than 2 people......

I love the roadie cup of coffee available and that there is breakfast drinks available sparkling wine is good for weekend. 

And they concentrate on breakfast and lunch
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: OVERPRICED SUBPAR chain restaurant food. Lunch prices are too high and there is no happy hour my beer was almost $6. My order was messed up, I ordered the tri-tip not tenderloin, when they finally brought my tri-tip out it was beyond rare which I ordered medium. My mom's soup was $7 in a small bowl. Go to Olive Garden (endless soup salad pasta) or BJ's great lunch and happy hour prices ($3.50 for their own housemade beer) and food is so much tastier at BJ'S. Will never eat at Claim Jumper again.
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: We went to Le Rendez-vouz for happy hour. Wine choices were wonderful. Food yummy, especially the pate and the mussels.
name: Le Rendez-vous
categories: Restaurants, French, Tapas/Small Plates

text: Best wings I've ever had in my life!! By far my favorite restaurant in town. My boyfriend and I order 1-2 times a week and can't get enough. They even know who I am when I call to order, which I get a real kick out of. I've dined in before and always had a great experience. The vibe is much more casual and laid back, but still courteous of course. Personally, I prefer wait service that is more relaxed and casual than what you might get at some uppity fancy place, so this place is perfect for me. The wings are always fat as f*ck and the beer battered fries are awesome. Try the sandwiches too, they're enormous and you won't be disappointed. This place is local and there's only the one location in town, so it's nice to go here to support local businesses, and plus why would you eat at some sh*thole like Wingstop when you've got trusty old WOB? Seriously, try them out, they're even saved as a Favorite in my contacts. You won't be disappointed!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text: Always enjoy dinner here! Its one of my favorite places to go. Cute, local, affordable.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
Sourdough bread soup bowl.  Go.  Fill with broccoli cheese soup.  Eat. Enjoy carbohydrate bliss.

I've enjoyed everything I've had during my various visits.  Sandwiches and soups are both good.  The staff is super friendly and quick.  Most of the time I'm barely finding a table when they come out with my food. Then there are the cookies.  Soooo good. You get a nice big fat one when you order a sandwich combo.  Perfect ending to the meal or a yummy snack back at the office later.  Of course you can always pick up some extras. The box of chippers is a good bet for a plethora of samples. Yum!

There is one thing I would like to see....the bread for the sandwiches is always just a little cold.  I realize they may be refrigerating it for preservation purposes, but I really want it to be room temperature when it hits my table. 

If you are a tomato soup fan you need to know that their soup has a decidedly southwestern flare to it.  It's not really my thing.  I'm more of a traditional Italian with basil kind of gal.

Overall I'm pleased with the food, atmosphere and service.  I'll continue to visit often.
name: Panera Bread
categories: Sandwiches, Bakeries, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Cafes, Food

text: I have been going to this restaurant regularly since 1973. The food is excellent, the value is good but the place is very popular; if you show up on a Friday or Saturday night be prepared to wait for a while, but it's worth it. I think they only take reservations for large parties.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text:
Just went there for lunch buffet,and i can say i am pretty impressed:)
They had around 6 varieties of pizza,2 varieties of salad ,2 kinds of breadsticks,macaroni with cheese and meat and apple pie
And everytime they brought fresh pizzas.
My kids loved it.
