And prices are good,6.29 for adults,3.99 for kids and under 3 is Free.
Also staff is very nice and friendly.
I definitely will come back.
name: Pizza Hut
categories: Restaurants, Chicken Wings, Pizza, Italian, Fast Food

text:
A little while away from Austin,  but what can I say?

I am noticing a downward trend in Chipotle.  Perhaps I have bad luck, but they are becoming skimpier and skimpier on their portions.  Tonight, my Dad's burrito bowl barely had any meat in it and when we asked for more, the girl gave a little snarl behind the counter and tossed about 2 more tiny chunks of meat into the bowl.  I generally order the vegetarian burrito bowl (not because I am a vegetarian, but for some reason this is the yummiest option to me).  It used to be that when I ordered a vegetarian, they piled on the beans, however tonight was another example of their cutting back on portions.  I asked for some more beans and again, the snarl and curt small plop of beans in my bowl.  

When it came time for the cheese (one of my favorite parts) it was merely a sprinkle.  I remember the good old days when the cheese was piled high, in a beautiful mountain of cheesy deliciousness.  Not anymore though :(  however, I maybe should thank them for saving me the calories!

Finally, I requested my guac on the side -- no problem there until I went to pay.  He tried to charge me for the guac... very un-dude.   I nicely inquired/informed that it was included with my vegetarian bowl.  He removed the charge, but he didn't look too happy about it.  He almost made me feel as though I was stealing from them.
I really enjoy Chipotle and I know I will continue to eat here.  But I am becoming more disappointed with their skimpy portions.  

I want my college-days Chipotle back!
name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican

text: Excellent excellent excellent. I had the tomato soup with grilled cheese along with the bacon donut. All I can say is the food is perfection, the staff is friendly and quick. The location is great and it's a great laid back environment. I would recommend this place to anyone I know, and will be going back in the future.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I have to eat here every time I am in Tucson. Anything on the menu is scrumptious, but my favorite is the birria. I love their gigantic Sonoran flour tortillas. Ask to have your burritos double-wrapped since they are usually bursting with all that yummy goodness!
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: I was really looking forward to this place, and was super excited to go and try it out; so when friends of ours where in town to celebrate their anniversary I was so stoked to bring them here. The restaurant itself is really nice, and ambiance is tasteful, the hostess was very courteous and greeted us with a beautiful smile, she first said there was a 20 minute wait time, so she said we could walk around downtown and she would text us when our table was ready; we thought that was awesome! we love walking around downtown! As we where walking out she came to get us and told us there was a cancelation and a table had opened up for us; we were thrilled! they walked us to a beautiful round table in front of a mezquite wall, and an impressive star chandelier above us; we loved it! We started looking over the menu, and a server came by to offer drinks; my husband and I got a beer each, my friend ordered the tequila flight "special" tablas style... whatever that meant; just translated to an overpriced shot of tequila, since the server explained that between the 1/3 shots it would only equal 1 full shot, for $22!!!! mind you, a bottle of patron silver at total wine is around $19... He didn't even explain the flight and the presentation; so, that was just bad. Then he came back and started explaining the specials, it was hard to hear him; the place was so noisy, so he had to explain once to them and then again to us. He offered a dinner for two special with a ribeye steak and black truffle french fries with some sort of a green chile bechamel, so my husband asks about the price he said $79 so we figured there would be big enough portions for the both of us; when the plate was served we were each given our own plate with a charbroiled green onion and a tortilla wrapped in tin foil. Lol. after that they put a plate in front of us with a single ribeye over the french fries and a fried egg on top. (I grew up in a steak house in the north of Mexico, and love a good steak) This steak was sub-par; nothing special and full of gristle... the fries were really soggy and I was so excited about the truffle because I love the flavor, unfortunately there was no truffle flavor to be found in the fries. At the end of the night food was edible, nothing impressive; what did impress me was the check; we paid $97 for a single steak french fries and a fried egg and a couple of beers! Disappointed to say the least; I was expecting so much more and really wanted to like this place because my husband and I are regular visitors to downtown Tucson. There is no justification for this exuberant price tag... Service was ok.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
Prep and pastry does everything right. Right from ambiance and decor to the amount of thought put into crafting the menu, the only bad part is that you will have to fight people to get in to eat there.

Every dish is succulent and will leave you wanting more . . . they somehow even manage to turn a simple dish such as an omelette into an unforgettable meal. 

The bloody mary's are a perfect mix of spice and sauce, while their mimosas are refreshing and tangy. This is by far my favorite breakfast trip in Tucson.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: It's ALWAYS busy but always worth the wait. Amazing service, delicious ramen. The owner is fab and they do the best ramen in town. The miso ramen and black garlic are things I dream about.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text:
Everything here is amazing!
Ask for Bo, he is by far the best server I have ever had the pleasure of meeting.
Seriously, his section is worth the wait.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I really like Sher-e Punjab.  Their dinner is better than the buffet, but the buffet is a great deal!  My only complaint is that the buffet is a little americanized - creamy and mild dishes being the predominant offerings - but what can you expect?  Tucson is predominantly white people without a tongue for spice.  

I've sat in and ordered take-out several times and have always had a pleasant experience.  All of the naan is good, I've had several dishes that I liked and when I've asked for it spicy (8/10), it comes with a good kick.  Once I was adventurous enough to order it as spicy as it came and it cleared my sinuses out.  Score! 

All in all, I would recommend this place and I definitely consider myself a regular.  I tried to branch out and try another place in town and was so disappointed... Sher-e Punjab sets the standard in Tucson!  Just do yourself a favor and get dinner there before trying the buffet.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Great burgers, solid apps, great service! Very consistent. I have yet to have a poor experience.
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: These 3 people made our visit one of the best brunch experience ever! Dana offered great service and her Fuzzy Naval Mimosas were out of this world! Mat Pena was so Profesional at explaining wedding venues! Kevin the manager was totally gracious in accommodating  us while we waited to be seated. We highly recommend this this wonderful place.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Stopped for lunch.  Sign said seat yourself, so I did.  Sat there for at least 10 minutes thirsty and hungry, was not acknowledged in any way.  Walked across the street to WENDY'S  and got served right away. Ghinis food is good but the service is lacking.
.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: We ordered from both lunch and breakfast options: Chicken salad with sweet potato fries and regular fries along with the Lumberjack (pancakes, sausage biscuits and gravy, hash browns, bacon, and eggs). All the food was very, very good for the value. I gave four stars instead of five simply because of the atmosphere. The décor was great and had that southern, country charm, however, it seemed quite understaffed for Saturday brunch hours and because of that the staff seemed tense. Being from the south I am used to outstanding hospitality, smiles, and hellos as soon as you walk in. This was the complete opposite here. We stood at the door for five minutes before anyone even glanced at us and the staff did not create a warm atmosphere. They were not unfriendly, just not outgoing and warm that expect from a country based café. Overall, a great place to try out!
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: This is the best Indian buffet in Tucson. The Offerings are limited in number, but large in taste. It draws a multicultural crowd, including many who speak Hindi, all of whom has made a conscious choice to go here.  I usually go in early when I have the time, as the restaurant can get crowded during lunchtime but owing to quick turnover the wait is never long. Since it is owned and operated by Sikhs there is always Tandoori chicken, curried beef and either Butter chicken or Chicken Tikka Masala. Always they have a creamed, but not with cheese, spinach dish which is great, oftentimes a chickpea dish, recently a coconut flavored green bean-plus other stuff (amazing) dish and a rotating vegetable dish. They always have basmati rice and naan bread, seasoned salad, rice pudding with fruit and a melon ball. I've gone here for years.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Not worthy of one star! Husband and I worked all day. Decided to order 50 wings we picked them up came home. 30 of the wings were raw!  Upset our stomach from the sight of raw chicken. We will never go back!
name: Hooters
categories: Sports Bars, Food, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Chicken Wings, Restaurants

text:
It was a surprise to see they managed to get smoking indoors approved. So the goth/punk/biker smoker crowd is back. I had grown out of my habit and the atmosphere years ago, but last night I decided to try the espresso one last time. Place has not changed.

I think I am too healthy for this place. (LOL) Of course the coffee was crazy strong which they would be proud of. Perhaps my drink had a different flavor when I smoked a pack a day those many years ago, so it wasn't the same. 

Currently I am still suffering the strong side effects of my mega strong espresso (only had a few hours sleep) and the second hand smoke shock to my lungs. Time for me to move on.

Overall, you might enjoy the place if you:

A) Are a indoor and outdoor smoker.
B) Love really really strong espresso.
C) Enjoy Punk, Goth, Metal, Alternative Music.
D) Like a rebellious (sometimes dodgy) crowd.
E) Need Wifi, since you share a blood supply with your computer.
name: Safehouse
categories: Coffee & Tea, Nightlife, Restaurants, Pool Halls, Food

text:
Service is great, quick, and the staff is very friendly.

I don't know if they have happy hour or anything like that because when I went they didn't. I usually order 4-5 dishes of sushi rolls, so I thought the prices were a little high. 

Other than that, I would come back.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: We had the Mango Lassa, Garlic Naan, Chicken Vindaloo and Chicken Tikka Masala. I wished that I had ordered several more of the mango drinks and more naan. It was all excellent. They have aggressive beggars that follow you in front of the restaurant, so be aware of your surroundings.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text:
Some of the best wings i have had in Tucson! No grease like others have complained of and even the bacon ranch fries were bomb! We tried to work our way through 48 wings in 3 flavors! For the price this is unbeatable! They even offered dippers of their other sauces, I got the no mercy!!! Not bad at all and packed a bunch of flavor.

The place was busy but we had no issues keeping the drinks full and table free of a mess!! This place rocks!
name: Wings Over Broadway
categories: Chicken Wings, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Burgers

text:
It is what it is .......
Safe, clean food.
Easy access.
I just really needed a protein burst.
$4 for a belly full with FREE water. I was off and on my way.
name: Burger King
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Food, Burgers

text: I had brunch here with a friend after my morning run at Sabino Canyon.  I think I was so hungry I would have eaten the tablecloth.  She had a nice little breakfast plate and I ordered a salad.  It was almost 11am but I am pretty sure my gyro chicken on my salad was just reheated in the microwave from the day before.  If I'm going to eat Greek food, I think I am going to stick to "My Big Fat Greek Restaurants."
name: Sunrise Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Greek, Coffee & Tea

text:
My fiance and I visited Barrio Cuisine tonight. This was the first trip for both of us. It's a normal Saturday evening, and we arrived around 7pm - prime date night dinner time.

The ambience is very nice, and the food was outstanding, if a little pricey. But for a local place, I won't take points away for the cost.

I was going to give Barrio four stars after our server told us the first item we ordered (the Totoi) was not available. It went to three stars when we found out a few minutes later that the beef spare rib was also not available. I think two stars is too low (I try to give benefit of the doubt), but I would put it at 2.5 stars after my fiance told me the women's restroom was out of toilet paper and hand soap. Plus, our server told us they were out of to-go boxes. How does that happen? Aren't those ordered by the hundreds (or at least dozens)? It was almost like the person who handle all the ordering of food and supplies had been out for the past couple weeks.

Our server was clearly busting her rear to handle the load, and it seemed like they were under-staffed for a weekend evening. A woman stopped by as we were getting ready to leave. We assume she was the manager or owner, but she didn't introduce herself. She just asked how things were. When my fiance explained that our first two dinner choices were not available, the woman brushed it off by saying they were a "scratch-based" restaurant. We're not sure what that means, but we assume it means they make meals from scratch. That's great, but it's not really an excuse. If there's such a strong chance you won't have two of the seven entrees on your menu, maybe you should make guests aware of that. No other effort was made to make up for this, and no serious apology came for this strange situation.

At some point the host staff appeared to be forewarning guests who came in the door that they advertised menu wasn't completely available. And definitely a few people walked back out. 

Ultimately, I would probably come back, but I might call ahead to ask what's actually available from the menu. There are too many good restaurants in Tucson to face disappointment.
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text:
So after reading previous reviews, I knew this place was going to look exactly like Chipotle but more awesome. Let me tell ya that this place is dangerous becasue I work two blocks away. So its take away with the street menu on the wall, but you know what?? They have alcohol, good looking people, and all the food truck awesomeness you want in a resturant! 
Went there for lunch today and if you want to beat the crowd get there before 11:30am. So many awesome authentic choices of meat and toppings. The prices are pretty average, but when it comes to the add-ons they cant be beat! You can get street corn, churros, and bean sides for $3. Did I mention the churros are fresh and huge! Street cred yo. They also have a full bar with a service button for more at each table. I could not partake during work hours, but I will be back. Speaking of bars, they have a chip and salsa bar, yum! Even raosted peppers to add on for free.
The drink assortment made me smile as I have cravings for pineapple fanta. They carry agua frescas and bottled mexican sodas (or pop where I am from).
Truly a stable, sit down awesome food truck experience in a resturant locale downtown. Make sure to check out all the street food for a pretty fair price. 

Faves: Al Pastor, churros, medium green salsa
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: This place was amazing! The service was great and the food was worth every star. I love how they were so informative  and answered all our questions. The pancakes were the best both of us have ever had. The whip cream was even perfect. The basic breakfast is a great combo to get when you just feel like having a basic breakfast. The bacon was cooked to perfection along with some homemade jam. They gave everything we wanted on the side. I love the feel with the seating arrangements and music that was playing. We had an amazing experience and will be back again. Thanks for reading.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great tacos. way better than chipotle! it's authentic and clean. love this place! would recommend to anyone in tucson.
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: We've been several times for lunch and dinner.  Good food,  clean , hot, attentive staff . More like 4.5 stars compared to what is out there.
name: New Town Buffet
categories: Buffets, Restaurants

text:
Food was good, very tasty. Had maple bacon cronut which was not too sweet and not too bacon-y either. Also had the daily dip sandwich which was tasty it had a balsamic pesto which gave good flavor. 
My H remarked the interior of the place was dirty and there is quite a lot of obviously dusty places when you look around and the water pitcher needed a good scrubbing (like grimy or mineralized ) but the food was good.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Tucson 5/1/15
Not much from the outside BUT inside is clean and charming. 
Prices reasonable
Service good
Biscuits & Gravy quite good.
VERY generous servings.
Cute waitress
name: Ajo Cafe
categories: Diners, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

text: We had the breakfast sandwich on a baguette with ham, it was delicious! Hot chocolate is great, hot chai not too sweet so if you like it a little bland then it's a great cup!
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
Stopped by there after an afternoon at Mt. Lemmon. Very tasty Mediterranean fare. Nothing was over seasoned. 
The Zayna fries, "fresh-cut half moon shaped fried potato, seasoned with Aleppo pepper and finished with lemon garlic dressing" were great.
The feta on a pita was "seasoned with oil and Za'tar herb mix" was light and yummy. 
My falafel sandwich with hummus was good and had pickles which to my surprise fit perfectly. My dining mates enjoyed their gyro and lamb sandwiches. 
The baklava was really tasty and quite different than Greek versions as it was made from pastaschios and a lot drier.
Very affordable. 
A new go to spot.
name: Zayna Mediterranean Cafe
categories: Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Restaurants

text: Eh. This place really isn't too special. The food good enough, priced a little high for what it is. The wait is normally pretty long, but today was extreme. There were no vehicles except myself, one customer inside, and it looked like 4 or more employees. It took significantly longer than most times I've gone. Not somewhere I'd go out of my way for, but if you're near, hungry, and have time to kill, give it a try and see what you think.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text:
This place was great. It was very Japanese in style. The restaurant felt as though it was relocated straight from Japan. The ramen was amazing. The gyoza was probably one of the best plates of gyoza I have ever had. The price was a bit steep, but very reasonable considering the exceptional service, food quality, portion size, and all around atmosphere. The food came out very quickly as well. If you would like to speak Japanese, the staff here are very friendly and all whom we interacted with were Japanese. The one and only complaint I have with this place is the parking is very tight and fills up very fast. I would suggest to customers to come early as well. We came shortly after it opened to a near empty restaurant. When we left, there was a wait line. All in all, I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back!!

日本人がここすごいすきとも。食べ物がすごいうまい。たくさん日本人がここ仕事する。
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: I made my first trip to Growlers based on a review that said it was not kid friendly. That is definitely my kind of place! The beer was great! The menu is limited but we had the French bread pizza which was very good and paired nicely with the beer. I'm definitely going back!
name: Growler's Taphouse
categories: Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Bars, Sports Bars, American (New), Food, Beer Bar, Music Venues, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

text: Great atmosphere, good live entertainment, loved the food and service.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: I love it here.... This is a step up from a bagel shop for sure... Breakfasts are very good and the new patio is awesome... We used to have to fight for a table but the seating has at least doubled now... The coffee is delicious there as well.... Never a complaint
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
I'm not a huge fan of going out to breakfast when you're justing getting eggs and bacon type of food. It never really tastes better than I can make at home. But we tried this place because our friends love it.

The menu says it's Native American food, though the theme to many dishes seems pretty Mexican food like to me. But I don't care how they describe it because its so good.

Sure they have your normal eggs/pancakes/waffles diner type breakfasts, but then they also have a bunch of spicey interesting additions. My new favorite thing is the Green Corn Waffle, it's so good. It's a waffle with green corn, red and green chiles all in the batter. Then they top it with some cheese. Amazing.


Don't let the exterior fool you, it's in a shady rundown strip mall, but it's great.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text:
Do. Not. Go.

Awful service.  Awful food.  Not worth the price. 

We had a party of 6 on a Saturday night. 

We had some tapas apps (which were meh) and ordered 2 chickens,  1 baby back rib, 1 spare rib, 1 enchilada  and 1 steak for entrees.  

After waiting an hour for our entrees, the waitress came back to tell us that they were out of the spare ribs. Ok, so we added another chicken request.  

And continued waiting........ Next, after another 30 minutes, the waitress came back to tell us that they were out of chicken and only had one order left!   Who runs out of chicken!  And, we needed 3 ... We should have left then.  But no... We subbed out for another steak and the tacos and stuck it out to the brutal end. Only to have cold food  and baby back ribs that tasted like boiled water. 

Bar service was even slower the entire evening  with us having to actually get up and go to the bar to get drinks ourselves because our waitress was MIA on refilling the cocktails.  Drinks were too small, too sweet and overpriced.

Only guy in the place working hard was the guy filling the water glasses.  Kudos to him. 

The owner was the biggest disappointment - at the end, she walks up and says " we comped your bill for the baby back ribs because you didn't like them, right?"  No apology, no accountability, no nothing. 

This place won't be around long at this rate and we won't be going back.
name: Barrio Cuisine
categories: Tapas/Small Plates, American (Traditional), Latin American, Restaurants

text:
I had tried several,times to get inside LotaBurger, sure glad I didn't wait any longer, this was the WORST BURGER I have ever had, the burger was so DRY I couldn't even squid any juice out of the burger, it was all burned around the outside of the burger, I had ask what they put in them, the lady taking my order told me, I chose not to have pickles lettuce, well that was right, but she didn't tell me that they put mustard, I hate mustard. So this whole experance was in the toilet for me, I won't go back and sure won't tell my friends to go there either, 
you go a long way to go to a better burger
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: A buddy of mine and I eat here every week. The staff recognizes us and even remembers our orders and preferences. Can't ask much more than that.
name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
categories: Restaurants, Fast Food, Mexican

text:
My absolute favorite location for brunch (and I have a lot of favorites). The food, drinks, and aethstetic deserve 5 stars, but the wait... Often around 45 minutes during much of their open times with no reservations accepted, drops the star by 1. They've started taking efforts to reduce this (opening a second location), but it doesn't seem to have helped much. 
Worth the wait! But bring a book or good company.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Perhaps because I didn't visit Sher-E-Punjab on a truly sad day, I had a really wonderful dinner there. Great samosas. Solid chicken tikka and saag paneer. The attentive staff and warm decor made me forget for an hour or so that I was in a strip mall on Grant.

text: Like the location and the food. I live in the downtown area so it's a nice option for lunch or a casual dinner. Great tacos!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.

text: Dont know how folks are giving this place high reviews. I was a regular until they served me raw chicken in my biryani. On calling on the owner he said, "that how they like it here". He refused to even change or redo my dish.  I paid my entire bill and left. Never heard or had this kind of experience.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: I was one of the first to get an early peak at Charro Steak and it was a terrific experience! It stays true to a authentic Mexican steak house, the food was amazing. I had had both the roasted chicken and the Carna Asada steak both were delicious! The marinating made both dishes tender and flavorful, and the portions are generous. The prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food, All restaurants seems to have a few bugs to work out when they first open, but I had no issues at all. The staff was so friendly and made some great recommendations and the service was great. The interior Decor is warm and authentic, it's casual and not pretentious. From the amazing margaritas, to the desert it was all great. I like the fact that all the meats are sourced through grass fed farms, I look forward to going back.
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: My go-to place for chinese lunch when I used to work nearby. The lunch prices are extremely reasonable and you get a generous portion of food. The ambiance was fine and the staff have always been friendly. The food is great, too. Highly recommended!
name: La Bella China Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: The details here are nice- three kinds of butter for the bread, jalepeno and prickly pear show some southwest treats you wont find elsewhere!  I had the shrimp and beef medallion.  The portions looked small, but I was stuffed when I finished.  I would have taken some home, but were so delicious I just kept eating.  The atmosphere is quiet and the wait staff attentive.  I will be back!
name: Fire + Spice Tucson
categories: Mexican, Tex-Mex, Restaurants

text:
I have been visiting this restaurant since it's opening and had fell in love from the beginning, but after going more and more it has just come to me wanting to be honest. I had previously left a 5 star review exclaiming my love, but now after all the hype has died, I now feel the need to be honest. I could have totally gone on an off day today, but I feel a need to state my experience and my previous experiences that I've been ignoring.
Service was still tremendous as always, never a complaint there. They checked up regularly, which is always welcomed.
Atmosphere is always the lovely hipster, warm, country feel. Welcomed as well.
The food however, is where I've just got to be honest. I'm forever in love with their poutine which I found they only serve on weekends, so I was totally bummed today. Instead, I ordered The Bacon Lucy. While a great idea, I found the bun to be too dense. It had wonderful crisp edges, but was way too thick to enjoy a burger. The taste was okay. A little on the salty side, wouldn't recommend it to someone who has to watch their BP. Also, it kept falling apart and was hard to handle. The fries that accompanied were okay, limp, meh.
My husband ordered The Dip. We tried this the very first time we visited which was only a week or two after opening. We complained it was way too salty to eat and we were compted and given a free pastry. The situation was handled lovely. But unfortunately it was still salty and we won't be ordering it again. My husband still ate it all though because he was too hungry to complain. Plus, they really skimped on the meat. The first time we had it, it was full of meat and cheese but now it was pretty much all bread again like my burger and what meat was in there was salty as well as the au jus. I'm particular about my au jus and this is way too salty to dip in.
I ordered a mimosa for the first time today. A fuzzy navel. Our waiter fixed it and unfortunately did not know how to mix a mimosa. It was 98% champagne and barely any OJ and peach flavor. They threw in a little orange peel in the champagne too... Nice touch I guess.
To go we ordered our favorite maple bacon cronuts which have always blown us away and we were left with solid cronuts. No fluff, no flake, equivalent to a stress ball. We were totally sad.
I'm just really sad about my visit and we will continue to visit but with stretches of time in between.
One thing I want to comment on as well is that, I know that perfection takes time, but with the food we got and how long we waited, they really need to step that up. It wasn't even packed today and we still waited some good time. In the past, they've always given us free pastries for waiting so long (30-40min). No complaint there, lovely service like I've said. I will always wait for my poutine too, but "prep" still needs improvement.
I guess I'll have to settle for the super packed weekends and wait to have my delicious poutine.
Please don't drop in quality because you're super loved by all, there's a reason you are!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
We experienced poor service which overshadowed the excellent tasting meal.  

Somebody please train the staff about being friendly, attentive, and professional - starting with the manager and all the waitstaff.

I love the food!  The taste and presentation of the meal is excellent.
name: La Parrilla Suiza
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text: Fresco has been remodeled. There is plenty of room to sit and enjoy a meal now. The place looks terrific and the pizza is still great!
name: Fresco Pizzeria

text: I don't actual spend money here as most everything is stupidly overpriced. What I like to do though, if I'm in the area, is eat as many free samples as possible. I recommend the free seafood dips, and if they have it out, the meats at the meat counter. Usually sausages with peppers. You can also sample the soups as they provide small (very small) sample cups. Don't be shy! Just keep filling them up until you've had enough. As for the staff. They tend to be pleasant. The patrons on the other hand are typically snotty. They think they booty hole don't stank.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: This is a small place and gets filled pretty quick. But the pastry here is awesome!!!  They have the best monster sized cinnamon rolls I have ever tasted. Every bite melts in your mouth. The breakfast food is good as well.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
So the easiest way to do this is break it into two reviews- one for brunch, and one for dinner.

Brunch- 3.5 stars.  I've been to brunch here maybe a dozen times.  The food itself is great.  My husband loves the Latin Poor Man's Omelette, and I adore the Pilgrim sandwich.  The bread is delicious and all the brunch food I've had has been great.  The service, however, is lacking.  Things are usually very slow and occasionally come out wrong.  The servers always act as if they are panicked and slammed even if there are few people there.

Dinner- 1 star.  They only serve dinner on Fridays.  After being there for brunch so many times, I was really excited to try their dinner menu.  We went on January 16th, 2015.  Unfortunately, it was perhaps the worst dining experience of my life.  I won't bore you with too many details, just the lowlights:
- Service was unbelievably slow.  The meal took 2.5 hours (this was just with appetizers and entrees).
- 15 minutes after my husband ordered his meal the waiter told him they were out, so he ordered something else.  His meal therefore showed up 10 minutes after everyone elses.
- One of the appetizers had grapes and many of the grapes had visible mold on them.  This was really unacceptable.
- The mussels I ordered were so cold I had to send them back.
I really hope it was just a bad night for the restaurant.  It was clear that every table was experiencing similar issues.  I've never seen so many tables of angry people.  The waiter did take the moldy appetizer off the bill, and offered us free dessert, but after such a terrible meal and being there for far longer than we planned, we passed.

I haven't been back since that disastrous dinner, not even for brunch.  Maybe I will someday, but for now I'd rather give my business to a restaurant that works hard to give their customers a pleasant experience.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Great place for breakfast in Tucson. Love their breakfast menu and drink menu, I haven't been disappointed by any thing that I've ordered. Prices are reasonable and no matter how busy it looks they always seat me in a timely fashion and the wait isn't long at all. Fresh and delicious food, also love the atmosphere of the restaurant, definitely try this place if you haven't already!
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The food was incredible. Definitely the best steak I've had in a long time and the salmon was perfectly cooked. The sides were pretty good too. We ate well beyond the point where our stomachs told us to stop because it was so good! The food coma was absolutely worth it. :)
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text: Ambiance is minimal, but the food is very good.  We will be back.  Bring your own spirits as they don't serve alcohol.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: I drive a good distance to lunch here or get produce and chorizo. They have the best chorizo and it's the only chorizo I cook with. The grab and go sandwiches and curry chicken are delicious and we love their pastries and desserts. They have a fun boutique near the produce for gift items. Great ambiance. Highly recommend.
name: AJ's Fine Foods
categories: Delis, Bakeries, Food, Grocery, Restaurants

text: Excellent food, great service and a good time. Avoid it during the 4th ave street fair though due to no close or free parking.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: I went here a couple of months ago for breakfast.  Had the Huevos Elysia which is an original dish.  Eggs benedict over a masa patty, with chorizo.  I was given some yellow-green salsa as well.  Absolutely delicioso.  Spicy but not overly so.  The eggs were done just right, and the masa patty (which the spell checker wants to change to pasty but no, it wouldn't work as a pasty) was good as well as different. The salsa was outstanding!  Recent reviews suggest they are drawing a crowd and I'm not surprised.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: The best red menudo and best carne asada chimichanga I have ever had.  High praise from a Tucson native.  White menudo and fish tacos weren't half bad either.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text:
I have mixed feelings about Ghini's.  Go to Ghini's enough times and you will find out what's good, what's really good, and what is so-so.  I honestly would be disappointed if I drove from far away and expected Ghini's to be like France.

First of all, French coffee is one of the best things on this earth.  I ordered a coffee here one morning and it was $3 worth of grossness.  On the other hand, their "herbal" iced tea is fantastic - it is a hibiscus tea that tastes like a passion tea.

Their pastries from their in-house bakery are alright.  The creme brulee is pretty good, the breads are pretty good, and the tarts are good.  Overall, things are good but not the "culinary ecstasy" or "piece of France" that their web site suggests.

Sometimes their service is off, but they try hard.  I frequently get the wrong amount of change back after I pay at the cashiers.  I bike by sometimes and there are still diners lingering an hour after the restaurant is closed - really, people?  

Ghini's was one of the first restaurants I wanted to try when I first moved to Tucson.  I think what makes Ghini's unique is their infusion of spices like basil, thyme, and lavender.  However, this is not very hard to make at home - I just don't think it is worth $20 for a meal at Ghini's.  If you want to go to Ghini's, I would go with someone who is a die-hard fan and order what they order.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: Excellent service! The dining room is always very clean. The food quality seems to be great! I wish more Sushi Resteraunt's were like this one.
name: Sushi Nara
categories: Sushi Bars, Japanese, Restaurants

text: Horrible service not only in the wait time for the server to show up but in the delivery of food ordered... In short either the waiter was not listening to what was ordered or the cooks didn't pay attention to the order... Food in itself was good... One meal was comped but because this wasn't the first time in ordering the food and getting it right will not visit Claim Jumper located on Broadway in Tucson again..
name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

text: Pizza, pasta, salads, all great!!  I always get an extra side of house dressing to dip the garlic bread in.  It is even awesome on the pizzas.  Come to this place for a family old fashioned Italian eatery.  I have been to little Italy in New York and this Italian food rivals the food in NY.  It's a great place for true Italian taste!!!
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: One of my favorite go-to places in Tucson! Service is good and the food is consistently delicious. My all-time favorites are the BLT, grilled cheese, lemon bars and cinnamon roll (with icing, of course). You really can't go wrong with this place.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text:
After being so disappointed in my foodie outings lately, I come back to Fresco.  I have ordered from here many times and they never disappoint. 
Way to go Fresco, great prices, super fresh and yummy food. The customer service is awesome too, plus they give free pesto strip when you check in and they have a new rewards program!  
If I didn't get sick of eating pizza and pasta every time I  ordered out, I'd order here exclusively!  At least my reviews would always be nice and tasty! 
Enjoy fellow Yelpers!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants

text: We tried this restaurant based on the Other reviews. My carne asada burrito had meat so over cooked, it actually crunched. I thought at first there was some crispy bacon mixed in, but no, it was all meat. Side of beans was very watery.
name: El Merendero
categories: Mexican, Restaurants

text: Loved this place. Came here with the hubby such a fun little spot to be at.  Definitely lots of smoking but that's what they go for.  My breve was delish and the hubby enjoyed his mocha as well.  Looking forward to hanging out there again.
name: Safehouse
categories: Coffee & Tea, Nightlife, Restaurants, Pool Halls, Food

text:
First time here.  Most had steak - though each had different kinds.  Had the evenings special which was a bone in rib eye.  ( with shrimp). Terrific.  Think the big hit was the filets!

Appetizers we had both the meatballs and the mushrooms. Enjoyed both but mushrooms especially.  

Don't live in Tucson so not sure when we will be back but can honestly say if we did live here, would be a place we would love to come back!
name: Charro Steak & Del Rey
categories: Diners, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Mexican

text:
I agree with all the other 4 star reviews. 
Very nice people. You'll probably end up waiting 15 minutes or more. It's worth it. Food is good. Near downtown. Enough parking. Very informal seating but enough. Clean.
name: St Mary's Mexican Food
categories: Restaurants, Mexican

text:
I've been here twice now. I prefer this location than the grant one. The Grant loc has an Ihop feel to it. The Campbell location has a great patio and more of a comfy feeling. 

My first time, I had ordered the salmon beni. It was fab. This time, I had the Beni. So the main ingredient to differ this one from the other beni is the pork belly. I expected it to be great. I didn't expect it to be a very thinly sliced over cooked pork chop. I had to pull it out and eat it like beef jerky.  it could have been wonderful. The idea is wonderful. The outcome was not. And because it was so overcooked (or old. It seems it sat for a while) it had shrinkage. Major shrinkage.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Best lunch buffet in Tucson, hands down!!
I was first introduced to this restaurant by my roommate (of Pakistani heritage) in grad school. The buffet is reasonably priced, and it's easy to stuff yourself full of spicy goodness if you've been living on ramen for a few days.
The buffet has a nice variety of dishes, including several without meat, at any given time. There's plenty of warm naan to soak up your leftover sauce, and when something runs out, the staff is quick to bring in more food. You may be a bit disappointed if you like things spicy, since they tend to prepare the buffet food on the milder side, but everything is still very good.
There's nothing fancy about the decor, but the food is more than enough to make it; there's a good reason the place is usually packed in the afternoons! Give it a chance, even if you've never had Indian food before; you'll come away full and happy!
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Will never go back. First, the menu clearly designates gluten free items, but everything is cooked on the same surface.  This is NOT gluten free.  And, our waitress told us she didn't even know what gluten was despite the menu designations. As I have Celiac Disease, I couldn't eat a thing.  So, I watched the children eat. Second, the only one who liked the food was the 4 year old who ate eggs and sausage covered in ketchup.  According to my 17 year old, even the tea was watered down and lacked flavor.  I've never seen diners dump so much salt, pepper and other condiments on food. It was so bad, the 17 year old is posting his own review.
name: Mother Hubbard's Café
categories: Diners, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Waffles, Cafes

text: I. Love. Street. Taco. I worked downtown and would always go there for lunch. The lines get long around 12, but it goes by really fast. I've eaten there so many times and it never fails to disappoint! My go-tos are definitely the shredded beef and chicken tacos! Reasonably priced as well, especially with the endless chips and salsa that they provide! The staff is also super friendly. Great place!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text: My Girlfriend and I walked in and the guy behind the counter was rude when we walked up and said hi.  Then he dropped the paper on the ground before placing it into our food basket to set our tacos in and seem frustrated so another guy took over. The new guy was very nice and apologized for the other guy. The tacos, chips, and salsa was very good. Everything would have been great other than the guy who started our order. Otherwise it was a good experience..
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
We had the best meal in Tucson so far. Original dishes with a twist. The wait was excessive but more than worth the wait. 1.5 to 2 hrs... (parents weekend at UofA)  we went shopping at Trader Joe's & then to the pumpkin patch. 
The drinks are epic. I wanted the sampler flight of all the choices. We did Bloody Mary & Honeymoon. Two very good choices. BM was one of the best & HM was a perfect refreshing choice for brunch (old fashion w/ a twist) 
Chicken & toast was my husbands choice. Very good with a great spicy kick. The chicken was cooked perfect & the sweet blueberry french toast was the perfect match. My daughter ate the Sammie & it was fantastic. The right balance of ingredients with a hefty slice of bacon. I got the biscuit & duck fat  gravy. Seriously filling but worth every bite!! It's a must try. Not only was the food amazing the service was beyond perfect. Don't skip this place even if there's a wait.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Really wanted this place to be as good as the one in New Mexico.  I simply asked for a lettuce wrapped lota burger, instead I got a Styrofoam box with a dry patty on top of some shredded lettuce, two tomato slices and some pickles. I could've went to McDonald's for cheaper and more consistency. I called the manager, she was the only thing that would make me try it again. Her customer service was great, that's why I give it one star. Don't waste your time. It's a bunch of young kids working there that don't get that people are paying for the stuff they make.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: So I went back one rainy Sunday morning when le toute Tucson decided to go out for breakfast. They were packed but I got seated quickly at the bar. I found that many of the previous defects have been corrected. The tiny cold hash browns have been replaced by smashed pan browned new potatoes. My omelette was quite good and my stuffed croissant was delicious. The coffee was hot and the service was prompt. So I'm raising them to four stars. I still haven't tried an alcoholic beverage which I hear is their Forte.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Very clean and I love how the lobby is open 24/7. You have to try the limited time root beer float, so good. By far top of my top 5 favorite fast food joints.
name: Whataburger
categories: Restaurants, American (Traditional), Fast Food, Burgers

text:
I've been to Prep and Pastry several times and have enjoyed it every time. The ambiance is great; it's bright and airy, and has this country chic vibe. 

I've ordered the veggie hash and corned beef hash and had some bites of the huevos rancheros, tomato bisque, and granola. Their pastries are phenomenal. They make a maple-bacon cronut that is sweet, salty, and just plain perfect. 

Sometimes the service is iffy and the wait to get a table can be long, but overall, I love the place.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Great authentic taste!! Loved their Carnitas tacos and tortas.  Their beans, rice and chips were all amazing.  Would recommend to family and friends!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
This place has below average ramen overall but one of the best in Tucson AZ. if i do not consider the fact that this establishment is in Tucson... i would give 2 stars

Additionally, I would give more stars if ramen wasn't so expensive and if they used proper technique to drain the water from the noodles. If you feel that first bite feels a bit watered down and as you go deeper into the bowl you feel more flavor... this is the by product of poor water draining technique.
name: Raijin Ramen
categories: Noodles, Japanese, Diners, Restaurants, Ramen

text: These people are paying attention! This is our second time here. Actions speak louder than words, these people all act like they want to be in the restaurant business. We will be back.
name: Chopstix Asian Dining
categories: Thai, Bars, Chinese, Food, Pubs, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Nightlife

text: Love their veggie samosas, chicken curry and lamb korma. Just an FYI, one plate of rice was not enough between two people for two entrees.
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: Very nice selection of food. I don't usually feel like I've over eaten when I leave here. I usually go for lunch and I've tried many items and have never had a back meal yet. Atmosphere is welcoming as well.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I've been wanting to go here but my wife had already "just gone." I had lunch and had the trip tip dip. The coffee was fantastic. The sandwich was great. Literally just perfect. I asked for garlic aioli with the fries and no problem. Everyone else's food looked great too. It seems like everything on the menu is solid. Can't wait to go back
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Bar none, this the Best Eastern Indian food in and around Tucson.
Curries and spices are great. Ingredients are fresh.
Ate Indian in London. These guys have it nailed........
name: Sher-e-Punjab
categories: Restaurants, Salad, Pakistani, Indian, Cocktail Bars, Food, Food Delivery Services, Soup, Halal, Bars, Nightlife

text: This is our go-to place for breakfast. The crepes are delicious. The J'ai faim (I'm Hungry) is way too much food, but sometimes I can't resist it. I ask them to serve half the order and bring the other half in a takeout box. Ala carte menu gives you the chance to put together exactly what you want from numerous items. And the poached eggs are perfect. We also really enjoy the mussels on Friday evenings. Martinis are prepared well, too. The delightful faux painting decor gives the feel of an escape to a Left Bank cafe.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text:
I shuddered upon seeing the name of this place for the first time and we sort of ended up going there on a bit of a dare.  Despite the name (and all the images it conjures), I sucked up my preconceived notions and biases and found the place overall to be solidly middle in every conceivable way.  One noteworthy exception is an almost classy Chinese-restaurant-feeling burbling waterfall that you encounter upon entering.  After some admiration of the falls, you are led into a somewhat awkwardly arranged but not unpleasant dining area, flanked by the classic food troughs found in most buffet settings.

The food -- let's put this succinctly: nothing terrible, nothing spectacular -- unsurprisingly, most of the food fell squarely in the mediocre range.  What do you expect?  The "sushi" wasn't bad and they even had a pho station, something that I have not seen at a buffet like this, although the pho itself was definitely meh -- perhaps mostly because one gets the impression that despite its novelty, it is not that popular.  The dessert area was also notable, with some additions outside of the predictable drab Asian-buffet fare, but with also mediocre flavors and textures.  

The best part of the place was actually our bus boy/server, who was extremely attentive and was all about refilling drinks, bringing napkins and condiments.  He basically preempted all of our requests and needs, bringing the required items from more water to the check and was both friendly and professional.  We left him a fat tip -- thanks dude!
name: U-Like Asian Buffet
categories: Asian Fusion, Buffets, Restaurants

text: The place could use a makeover but when the seats are full because they are putting good food out, which they are, its hard to close to do so. Summer 4th of July weekend might be a good time.
name: Ghini's French Caffe
categories: Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, French, Bakeries, Salad

text: The place isn't open very often and when it is it's always packed. It can be very loud and crowded. The service is ok and the food is pretty good if you got the cash to spend on breakfast. Definitely on an occasion place i wouldn't want to put up with all the people and noise very often just for a good (yet pricy) breakfast. .
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
El "Dragon Chino" o "China Dragon" es un pequeño restaurante con gran sabor.
Siendo un restaurante de familia, "China Dragon" ha estado presente por 24 años, (como nos mencionó el dueño) ayer en la tarde que buscábamos comida China de calidad, el lugar es cálido y los empleados son amables, atentos y rápidos.

Ahora, a la comida; es bastante difícil encontrar comida china que no sea muy grasosa, salada o parezca que haya estado en un contenedor todo el día, en China Dragon ordenamos una orden de arroz frito con vegetales, 2 rollitos fritos y una orden de carne estilo mongol, con esto recibimos gratis una orden de frituras con cangrejo y arroz blanco (noto que esto fué para llevar).

En resumen, la comida es muy recomendable, y volvería a "China Dragon" cualquier dia si hay antojo de comida China a buen precio y gran atmósfera.


"Chinese Dragon" is a small restaurant with great food. Being a family-owned restaurant for 24 years (as the owner mentioned) we checked it out yesterday night for some fast Chinese food, however we noticed as soon we got there that the place was cozy and employees are nice, attentive and fast.

Now for food; it is difficult to find food in a Chinese restaurant that is not super greasy, salty or looks like it's been sitting in a container all day. At China Dragon, we ordered fried rice, 2 vegetable rolls and Mongolian style beef (It was very very good). With the order we also received a side of white rice, and crab puffs. (Note we took this order to go).

To summarize, I recommend the food and I would go back to "China Dragon" any time for great Chinese food at a good price and awesome atmosphere!
name: China Dragon Restaurant
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: Rooms were clean. Casino reeks of cigarettes and the food at Ume and Moby's so-so. Quite disappointed that the pool side bar was never open and there was only one little bar near the pool that seemed to be out of many of the bar liquors/flavorings. The staff seem like they find requests a bother. We were not given any towels and they seemed irritated that we wanted three sets (there were three of us).  Toilet paper grudgingly doled out. Biggest issue?  The television did not work. It kept turning itself on and off and changing channels. We called three separate occasions, but it was never fixed- so for two days, no TV. I'm not into the gambling scene- maybe it's good for that, but I did not enjoy my stay.
name: Casino Del Sol
categories: Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Casinos, Diners, Restaurants, Mexican, Resorts

text: During a recent visit to Tucson this place was highly recommended. I was at the end of a long business and pleasure weekend. I was in the mood for a great cup of coffee and some non-supermarket tasty baked pastry or cake. The Village Bakehouse  was not far off my route back to the highway. Was I in for a surprise! Was this so-called bakery and coffee house that did not serve milk as a condiment for coffee or tea real? This is one of the first times I asked for my money back. I did it for two reasons. The first is obvious. The second one is at the cashier waitress had no idea what I was talking about and I actually lied a little telling me that they did have milk. What I didn't want was the  watered down stuff. I wanted regular milk. Some call it whole milk. Others seem to have coined the phrase of vitamin D milk. They just didn't have it. Amazing! It really ruined my stop. No, that's not all. The so-called bakery had a nice aroma to it. I spotted a cinnamon stick and ordered it. Sure, it smelled great. But would you enjoy the nibbling on a cinnamon flavored piece of wood?  I don't think so. What they served seemed like it was in the case for two weeks and dried out. Oh...what a horrible experience this place was for me. Avoid it, at least for coffee and cake. Am I glad there was a Dunkin' Donuts not far away.
name: Village Bakehouse
categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

text: This is a place to take the family for great food, service and a well decorated family restaurant.
name: Biscuits Country Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), Cafes

text: Used to frequent this restaurant quite a bit. Haven't been there in quite a while. So I thought we would try it again. The food used to be really good but we were disappointed this time around. The service was good. But the pasta And the sauce just did not taste the same. Very tasteless food. We ordered a glass of wine which was very small but the price was high. Don't think that we will go back again.
name: Caruso's
categories: Restaurants, Italian, Pizza

text: May not in the best location with not many parking options without taking a walk. But their food is great!! Great tacos!! I liked their nachos better than tacos I think. When I'm near downtown Tucson and want something to eat, I'd come here again for sure!
name: Street- Taco and Beer Co.
categories: Mexican, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

text:
Chile rellenos in the Tucson Area rated according to the Homeland Security Advisory System with three word descriptors.

El Merendero: very good cholesterol. Orange

See photos.
name: El Merendero

text: This is a legit Chinese joint.  When I walk inside the first thing I see is a room full of Chinese people speaking Chinese and enjoying their food.  We ordered the dumplings and boy were they good.  They have a picture menu for those curious what the dish is.  Everything was delicious with big portions.  We had to take the leftovers back and I actually ate the leftovers which I almost never do.  I'm visiting from out of town and this was my second time here.  Great place!
name: Kung Fu Noodle
categories: Restaurants, Dim Sum, Chinese, Cantonese, Noodles, Taiwanese, Szechuan

text: Getting ready to make my Christmas tamales. this is the best place to buy masa! You can call in your order ahead of time and pick it up on the date you need it tamales are just too easy to make. If you need a recipe just message me!
name: La Mesa Tortillas
categories: Specialty Food, Food, Local Flavor, Restaurants, Mexican, Ethnic Food

text: Blake's "a'ight" burger.  Bun was soggy and they forgot the dipping sauce for our chicken strips. I wonder is the staff there eats chicken strips with no sauce. I really doubt it. Careless service especially for a new restaurant in town.
name: Blake's Lotaburger
categories: Hot Dogs, Burgers, Restaurants, Fast Food

text: I found the place to be a bit noisy and the tables to close for my taste. As for the food ..I ordered the Monte Cristo. I guess it was just ok. The potatoes where just flat out dry. I literally just picked at it. The menu description of food and sleek website had me expecting something more exciting and intimate than an IHOP without booths.
name: Prep & Pastry
categories: Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Comfort Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Fresco is great! I order catering from there for our office at least a couple of times a month and it's always phenomenal. They have a large selection of food, it's very decently priced, and it's all completely delicious. If I could give more stars, I would!
name: Fresco Pizzeria
categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Salad, Italian, Pizza, Restaurants
